abstracts: We introduce theoretical and practical limits on the accuracy of an optical wireless positioning system for indoor applications that uses fingerprints based on features of the channel impulse response for localization. We present analytical bounds for different numbers of PDs and features. Simulation results show a positioning limit of less than 1 cm, and a realistic accuracy of 5 cm for a typical indoor room at high SNR.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical transmitters', 'Visible light communication', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical pulses', 'Optical signal processing', 'Fingerprint recognition']
author_keywords: ['Visible light communication (VLC)', 'Cramer-Rao lower bound (CRLB)', 'indoor localization', 'visible light positioning', 'multipath reflections']

abstracts: We propose a novel phase interrogation method for diaphragm-based fiber acoustic sensor based on wavelength-scanned spectral coding. A phase interrogation algorithm is also described, which utilized two synchronized channels with 120° phase difference to avoid phase ambiguity. This technique performs good stability under random environmental factors, while the referenced results of Q point demodulation show fluctuation of more than 10 dB in sound pressure calibration under same circumstances.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical interferometry', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fibers', 'Acoustics', 'Encoding']

abstracts: We proposed a new, fully-integrated LED driver chip to increase the modulation bandwidth of VLC system. The -3dB bandwidth of phosphorescent white LED transmitters can be extended from 3MHz to 80MHz by our chip. The data-rate of our VLC link is 112Mbit/s. To the best of our knowledge, this is the highest data rate ever achieved by phosphorescent white LED and integrated circuit based VLC systems at common indoor distance.
ieee_keywords: ['Relays', 'Visible light communication', 'Network coding', 'OFDM', 'Throughput', 'Media Access Protocol', 'Phase shift keying']
author_keywords: ['Visible light communication (VLC)', 'physical-layer network coding (PNC)', 'phase alignment', 'power ratio']

abstracts: The manuscript presents a dual-band dual-chirp microwave waveforms generation and transmission scheme with elimination of power fading. The key novelty of this work is the generation of dual-chirp microwave signals with flexible center frequencies and compensation of power fading effect introduced by chromatic dispersion. Dual-band dual-chirp waveforms with tunable bandwidth are successfully generated in the experiment, which can be used for modern dual-band radar systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'Microwave theory and techniques', 'Dual band', 'Microwave oscillators', 'Frequency modulation', 'Chirp', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: Frequency quadrupling operation decreases the frequency requirement of the input LO signal. The carrier frequency of the generated binary and quaternary phase-coded waveforms can be tuned in a large range. If a commercial 100-GHz photodiode is used, the frequency of microwave waveforms can reach 88 GHz. In addition, the proposed scheme also features effective generation, easy implementation, and low cost and is promising to find applications in broadband radar systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Microwave filters', 'Encoding', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: A variety of applications have utilized electron-spin polarization for precise measurements.The spin polarization is generally derived by employing additional modulations, in which way an extra perturbation will be introduced and thus affect the normal operation of the sensors. Here we demonstrate the feasibility of extracting the polarization from the intensity of the pump beam. This scheme can detect real-time polarization without disturbing the normal operation of the sensor.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Pump lasers', 'Optical pumping', 'Atom optics', 'Optical polarization', 'Measurement by laser beam']

abstracts: A thermally tunable Bragg grating device has been fabricated in a silica-on-silicon integrated optical chip, incorporating a suspended microbeam improving power efficiency. A waveguide and Bragg grating are defined through the middle of the microbeam via direct ultraviolet writing. A tuning range of 0.4 nm (50 GHz) is demonstrated at the telecommunication wavelength of 1550 nm. Power consumption during wavelength tuning is measured at 45 pm/mW, which is a factor of 90 better than reported values for similar bulk thermally tuned silica-on-silicon planar devices. The response time to a step change in heating is longer by a similar factor, as expected for a highly power-efficient device. The fabrication procedure involves a deep micromilling process, as well as wet etching and metal deposition. With this response, the device would be suitable for trimming applications and wherever low modulation frequencies are acceptable. A four-point-probe-based temperature measurement was also done to ascertain the temperature reached during tuning and found an average volume temperature of 48 °C, corresponding to 0.4 nm of tuning. The role of stress-induced buckling in device fabrication is included.
ieee_keywords: ['Tuning', 'Bragg gratings', 'Optical waveguides', 'Stress', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical reflection', 'Silicon']

abstracts: The novelty of the paper lies in the presentation of a systematic study of the plasmon coupling of different sizes and shapes of AuNP, quantification of the QY, and probing the effect of tip geometry of AuNP using FDTD simulation, which could be used in bio-imaging, sensing, cell signalling, and biological therapeutic intervention.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Time-domain analysis', 'Nanobioscience', 'Finite difference methods', 'Gold', 'Couplings', 'Shape']
author_keywords: ['Gold nanoparticle scattering', 'Mie theory', 'Gans theory', 'nanoparticle plasmon coupling', 'quantum yield and FDTD simulation.']

abstracts: We describe an experimental study of a first integrated tunable laser realized in anticolliding pulse passive mode-locking configuration. We demonstrate a record spectral tuning range of 9 nm. We also show that tuning of the optical spectrum toward shorter wavelength leads to a decrease of RF linewidth and pulsewidth down to the Fourier limit. We assume that this improvement is attributed to the increase of the absorption and shorter recovery time.
ieee_keywords: ['Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Cavity resonators', 'Semiconductor optical amplifiers', 'Absorption', 'Optical pulses', 'Radio frequency']

abstracts: We demonstrate that the quasi-parametric chirped-pulse amplification (QPCPA) scheme, proposed by our group, is robust against thermal dephasing effect and hence may break the current 100-W average-power limit of ultrafast intense lasers. Two QPCPA systems with 3-TW peak-power at 5 kHz and 13.5-PW peak-power at 1 Hz respectively have been numerically demonstrated in this paper, both of which have average power of more than 150 W. The presented results are crucial to QPCPA and its applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Crystals', 'Absorption', 'Laser theory', 'Power lasers', 'Laser excitation', 'Thermal lensing', 'Chirp']

abstracts: We propose and demonstrate an approach to realizing high speed and high sensitivity frequency interrogation of the RI and temperature sensing system, which is implemented by an OEO incorporating an special FP-FBG. Compared with conventional schemes implemented using an optical spectra analyzer, mapping the measurand to the frequency of microwave signal generated by the OEO using an electrical spectrum analyzer can drastically improve the interrogation speed and resolution of the sensing system.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber gratings', 'Microwave filters', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Microwave photonics', 'Optical filters']

abstracts: This study improves measurement setup and conditions so that a) the photo-degradation problem in SERS measurement of serum can be avoided and b) serum solution composition is optimized; then this study proposes a standardized measurement condition for intense and consistent SERS measurement of serum.
ieee_keywords: ['Measurement by laser beam', 'Substrates', 'Power lasers', 'Laser applications', 'Blood', 'Density measurement', 'Surface emitting lasers']
author_keywords: ['Raman spectroscopy', 'blood monitoring', 'optical diagnostics for medicine', 'optical standards and testing.']

abstracts: This paper presents a secrecy performance analysis of a parallel free-space optical/millimeter-wave (mm-wave) communication system with a selection-combining receiver over a unified Fisher-Snedecor \mathcal{F} -distribution channel. The \mathcal{F} -distribution model, with the proper parameters, may be used to describe both the mm-wave and optical channels. The security performance is specifically evaluated by deriving closed-form expressions for the average secrecy capacity, secrecy outage probability, and strictly positive secrecy capacity. We examine the three following distinct security scenarios: 1) An FSO-link eavesdropping attack, 2) mm-wave-link eavesdropping attacks, and 3) eavesdropping attacks on FSO and mm-wave links at the same time. Furthermore, to better understand the influence of various system and channel parameters, asymptotic analysis is performed at high signal-to-noise ratio values. Our developed analytical expressions provide an efficient tool for examining the influence of various system and channel parameters on the secrecy performance, including the atmospheric turbulence severity, pointing errors of the FSO link, fading severity, the shadowing parameters, as well as the number of diversity branches of the mm-wave links. Monte-Carlo simulations are used to verify the correctness of the numerical findings.
ieee_keywords: ['Receivers', 'Eavesdropping', 'Radio frequency', 'Atmospheric modeling', 'Fading channels', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical receivers']
author_keywords: ['Parallel FSO/mm-wave system', '$\\mathcal{F}$ -distribution', 'average secrecy capacity (ASC)', 'secrecy outage probability (SOP)', 'strictly positive secrecy capacity (SPSC)', 'selection-combining receiver']

abstracts: In this paper, based on the conventional analytical method on wiretap channel model, the physical-layer security of QAM quantum-noise randomized cipher system is investigated quantitatively under the metric of secrecy rate. The general expressions of secrecy rates of the data and key are derived separately. Furthermore, the maximum reachable secrecy rate of a QAM-QNRC system is put forward. The detailed simulation results can provide effective guidance for QAM-QNRC system configuration.
ieee_keywords: ['Quadrature amplitude modulation', 'Protocols', 'Channel models', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Ciphers']
author_keywords: ['Quantum secure communication', 'quantum-noise randomized cipher', 'secrecy rate', 'physical-layer security']

abstracts: After the successful report of DRPE, much effort has been made to develop new optical cryptosystems. Many advanced optical encryption schemes have been introduced; however, only a few works have been done to analyze the security of traditional optical encryption schemes. In this study, we present a detailed security analysis on the PTFT and G-S algorithm-based scheme. The silhouette problem which makes the system vulnerable is first reported in this special attack free scheme.
ieee_keywords: ['Encryption', 'Optical imaging', 'Authentication', 'Holography', 'Holographic optical components']
author_keywords: ['Optical image encryption and authentication', 'security analysis', 'silhouette problem']

abstracts: Recent progress in the field of semiconductor nanolasers is discussed. New designs have emerged that eliminate the need for a conventional Fabry-Perot cavity, bringing down the physical dimensions of the lasers below the diffraction limit. Semiconductor nanolasers are critical components for nanophotonics and offer possible integration with Si nanoelectronics.

A method of helical long period fiber gratingin single-mode fiber is designed and verified through experiment. Experimental results demonstrate axial strain sensitivities of 3.3 pm/ and 6.4 pm/ in the range of 0 to 450 or temperature sensitivities of 35.3 pm/ oC and 49.5 pm/ oC in the range of 20 to 70 oC, respectively. Moreover, it is found that the fabricated HLPFG can measure axial strain and temperature concurrently.
ieee_keywords: ['Sensitivity', 'Strain', 'Optical fibers', 'Temperature sensors', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber sensors']
author_keywords: ['Helical long period fiber grating', 'axial strain', 'temperature', 'simultaneous measurement']

abstracts: The photonic generation of electrical orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (OFDM) modulated wireless signals in the 75-110 GHz band is experimentally demonstrated employing in-phase/quadrature electrooptical modulation and optical heterodyn upconversion. The wireless transmission of 16-quadrature-amplitude-modulation OFDM signals is demonstrated with a bit error rate performance within the forward error correction limits. Signals of 19.1 Gb/s in 6.3-GHz bandwidth are transmitted over up to 1.3-m wireless distance. Optical comb generation is further employed to support different channels, allowing the cost and energy efficiency of the system to be increased and supporting different users in the system. Four channels at 9.6 Gb/s/ch in 14.4-GHz bandwidth are generated and transmitted over up to 1.3-m wireless distance. The transmission of a 9.6-Gb/s single-channel signal occupying 3.2-GHz bandwidth over 22.8 km of standard single-mode fiber and 0.6 m of wireless distance is also demonstrated in the multiband system.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Wireless communication', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical receivers']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics signal processing', 'frequency combs', 'heterodyning', 'fiber optics systems', 'orthogonal frequency division multiplexing']

abstracts: Solid-state nanopores are structures that can be fabricated using the electron beam of a transmission electron microscope (TEM). Nanopores can be used to electrically detect individual DNA molecules, and they have the potential to be applied to genomic sequencing. Current nanofabrication methods are manual and time-consuming, and thus, they do not allow for the fabrication of large-scale nanopore arrays. One of the requirements in the development of an efficient fabrication process is the automated recognition and measurement of nanopore dimension in real time. Here, we present a method for nanopore edge detection that uses Shannon entropy to identify nanopores in electron microscopy images. The nanostructure edges are determined by applying a Shannon entropy filter. This entropy image is segmented, and the texture-defined edges are determined. The diameters of nanopores as small as 3 nm are directly measured.
ieee_keywords: ['Entropy', 'Pixel', 'Image edge detection', 'Biomembranes', 'Fabrication', 'Histograms', 'Image segmentation']

abstracts: High bit rate and high sensitivity gain have always been major challenges in short reach systems. Many schemes about revised PAM4 modulation formats are proposed from the perspective of sensitivity gain. In this letter, 2D-PAM8-TCM is proposed to address these problems from perspectives of both sensitivity gain and spectral efficiency. Compared to conventional PAM4, 2D-PAM8-TCM not only achieves ~0.5 dB sensitivity gain but also transmits extra 0.5 bits per symbol.
ieee_keywords: ['Convolution', 'Convolutional codes', 'Decoding', 'Modulation', 'Optical receivers', 'Encoding', 'Optical transmitters']

abstracts: A Stokes space modulation format identification (MFI) method using probabilistic neural network (PNN) is proposed for coherent optical receivers. The training process of the proposed method is simpler than the existing MFI methods based on other neural networks such as deep neural network (DNN) and convolution neural network (CNN). On the other hand, compared to Ref. [17] in the manuscript, our proposed MFI method has lower requirements on the OSNR and number of symbols.
ieee_keywords: ['Modulation', 'Feature extraction', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical noise', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Neural networks']
author_keywords: ['Modulation format identification', 'coherent optical communications', 'probabilistic neural network.']

abstracts: For the first time, we present an experimental study of pulse formation and propagation in a short, long and ultralong mode-locked EDFL hybridly mode-locked by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) monolayer graphene onto D-shaped optical fiber and NPR mechanisms. In contrast to previous reported works, we investigated in detail the dynamics of pulse formation and propagation in a managed dispersive EDFL severely operating at fundamental repetition rate in all cavity lengths.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Laser mode locking', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical pulse generation', 'Absorption']
author_keywords: ['CVD monolayer graphene', 'Mode-locked Erbium doped fiber laser', 'D-shaped optical fiber', 'short-long-ultralong cavities']

abstracts: A first-order Lyot-type fiber comb filter was fabricated by incorporating a polarization-diversity loop structure composed of a polarization beam splitter, two half-wave plates (HWPs), and two polarization-maintaining fiber (PMF) segments. One of the two PMF segments was two times longer than the other, and they were concatenated with a 60 ^{\circ} offset between their principal axes. The transmission spectra and output polarization characteristics of the filter were theoretically predicted and experimentally verified. By proper control of the two HWPs, first-order transmission spectra could be obtained, including flat-top and lossy flat-top band modes, and the interleaving operation of the respective spectrum could be also achieved. This flat-top band mode spectrum showed a higher attenuation rate at the cutoff level, in comparison with that of the Solc-type filter. In particular, it was revealed that the output state of polarization of the filter was a periodical function of wavelength and that the evolution period was different, according to transmission band modes. With the help of a linear output polarizer, the specific portion of a passband could be passed or rejected by controlling input polarization. It was also theoretically predicted that the fine tuning of the passband center was possible within a specific wavelength range.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber filters', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Propagation losses', 'Information filters']

abstracts: Orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (OFDM) has been widely studied and adopted in visible-light communication (VLC) systems because of its high spectral efficiency and low-complexity implementation. However, OFDM-based VLC systems suffer from a high peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR), along with the nonlinear transfer characteristics of light-emitting diodes (LEDs). In this paper, a subcarrier grouping scheme for an OFDM-based VLC system is proposed. This scheme exploits the property that one LED lamp usually contains multiple independent LED chips. In the proposed scheme, all OFDM signal subcarriers are divided into groups, and each group is transmitted by an individual LED chip while the same receiver structure is maintained. The PAPR is reduced significantly because only some of the subcarriers are located on each LED chip. Hence, the achievable input power can be increased, leading to a higher signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) and a lower bit error rate (BER). Simulated and experimental results demonstrate that the BER performance can be improved by over two orders of magnitude. Moreover, an adaptive switching mechanism is also proposed in this paper, in which a subcarrier grouping scheme is employed adaptively when the required input power is high. Simulation results validate that the proposed mechanism can enhance system robustness significantly.
ieee_keywords: ['Peak to average power ratio', 'Optical transmitters', 'LED lamps', 'Noise', 'Wireless communication']

abstracts: The hydrofluoric acid droplet-based etching of optical fibers allows simple and cost-effective fabrication of low-loss tapered fibers. We show that such chemical etching can be used to fabricate 2x2 twisted fiber-optic directional couplers, and the etching process can be monitored in real-time by measuring the transmitted optical powers. The fabricated coupler shows wavelength-insensitive operation within the telecommunication C-band with an excess insertion loss of less than 0.5 dB.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Etching', 'Optical scattering', 'Optical fiber devices']

abstracts: (1)This design overcomes many challenges of THz reconfigurable metasurface as described in Introduction section. (2)The non-diffractive OAM beam with different topological charge, radius, deflection angle and operating frequency can be generated based on the single metasurface. (3)The multiple reconfigurability can be simply achieved by switching the state of the VO2 without physically changing the structure.
ieee_keywords: ['Permittivity', 'Conductivity', 'Orbits', 'Vanadium', 'Wireless communication', 'Microwave communication']
author_keywords: ['Terahertz (THz)', 'reconfigurable metasurface', 'vanadium dioxide ( $\\text{VO}_{2}$ )', 'orbital angular momentum (OAM)', 'topological charge (TC)', 'non-diffractive beam', 'deflection angle']

abstracts: In this paper, we study the secrecy performance of mixed radio-frequency (RF) - free space optical (FSO) systems by considering both RF and FSO eavesdropper attacks. More precisely, we shed light into the design of secure mixed RF-FSO relay networks by questioning two critical design problems: 1) What are the main parameters in the design of secure RF-FSO relay networks? 2) How can we improve the confidentiality of the optical information? To do so, we derive the secrecy outage probability and the probability of positive secrecy capacity performance for mixed RF-FSO relaying schemes under RF and FSO eavesdropper attacks, respectively. To justify the problem, we consider two general fading models, Nakagami- m at the RF side and exponentiated Weibull distribution at the FSO side. The results, which are validated with the Monte-Carlo simulations, show that both the location and the size of the photo-aperture is very important in the design of RF-FSO relay networks to enhance the secrecy performance of the overall system.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Eavesdropping', 'Wireless communication', 'Relay networks (telecommunication)', 'Security', 'Physical layer security', 'Apertures']
author_keywords: ['Physical layer security', 'mixed RF-FSO relaying', 'RF and FSO eavesdropping']

abstracts: In this investigation, we theoretically present our numerical simulation studies on a 4.3 μm all-fiber laser based on Dy3+ ions doped Ge-Ga-Sb-S chalcogenide glass fiber. The theoretical work is expected to guide the experimental research of mid-infared fiber lasers in future.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber lasers', 'Pump lasers', 'Laser excitation', 'Quantum cascade lasers', 'Laser theory', 'Laser modes', 'Ions']

abstracts: An integrated and thermo-optically tunable sphere WGM resonator is demonstrated. The WGM resonator with quality factor of 5.9 × 104 is fabricated by inserting a PMMA sphere into an etched microstructured fiber with tapered core. A temperature tuning rate of 460 pm/K is achieved, and the quality factor is almost unchanged during the whole tuning range of 1.93 nm.
ieee_keywords: ['Photonic crystal fibers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Tuning', 'Refractive index', 'Q-factor', 'Optical resonators', 'Optical fiber dispersion']

abstracts: We introduce DFT-spread technique in the DMT signal transmission with direct-detection. This technique can be used to suppress PAPR of DMT signal and overcome bandwidth limitation induced ISI at the same time. In the OBTB test, this technique is proved be be even more effective compared to pre-equalization technique. In the fiber transmission, TOF enabled VSB-DMT signal is generated to resist fiber chromatic dispersion induced frequency fading. We successfully transmit 100 Gbit/s VSB DFT-spread 32QAM-DMT signal in 20-km LEAF and the BER of signal is still under HD-FEC limitation after fiber transmission.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Peak to average power ratio', 'Bit error rate', 'Adaptive optics']

abstracts: Tunable terahertz (THz) angular/frequency filters in the modified Kretschmann-Raether configuration with the insertion of single-layer graphene have been numerically demonstrated. Due to the excitation of the transverse magnetic (TM) polarized surface plasmons at the interface of two dielectrics with the insertion of the graphene sheet, the transmission resonance occurs at some range incident angles and frequencies in the THz frequency range, which can be adopted for designing the angular/frequency filters. It is shown that the resonant angle and the resonant wavelength can be tuned by varying the Fermi energy of the graphene sheets via electrostatic biasing. Moreover, we show that the resonant behaviors can be engineered by changing the gap thickness or the incident angle.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Dielectrics', 'Resonant frequency', 'Optical surface waves', 'Plasmons', 'Conductivity', 'Optical bistability']

abstracts: In this paper, we reported a method to combine photonic hooks and twin photonic jets. Compared to the traditional photonic hooks, these twin photonic hooks have a good tunability. The key difference relative to the traditional twin photonic jets is that the two branches are totally identical. These twin photonic hooks have great potential in complex nanoscale manipulation with multiple particles, and its identical branches also have particular use in super resolution imaging.
ieee_keywords: ['Photonics', 'Acoustic beams', 'Particle beams', 'Licenses', 'Nanoscale devices', 'Optical diffraction', 'Optical imaging']

abstracts: In this work, we have demonstrated a novel ultra-wideband terahertz absorber using a unique new structure - dielectric circular truncated cones. The absorber has an ultra-wideband absorption bandwidth from 0.34 to more than 10 THz with an average absorbance of 95.88% and the corresponding relative bandwidth reaches 186%, which is the highest value to the best of our knowledge. It also possesses absolute polarization independence under normal incidence and large angular stability up to 60°.
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Ultra wideband technology', 'Bandwidth', 'Graphene', 'Gold', 'Dielectrics', 'Silicon']

abstracts: Combining synthetic aperture imaging with polarization imaging, we propose an object radiation inversion method based on multi-viewpoint image polarization and backscattering intensity, which can effectively obtain the true polarization distribution and backscattering intensity distribution in the scene. In addition, the method can simultaneously acquire 4D light field information and polarization information, and effectively improve the information dimension obtained by single imaging.
ieee_keywords: ['Backscatter', 'Light fields', 'Image restoration', 'Cameras', 'Apertures', 'Image quality']

abstracts: A silicon waveguide consisting of passive parity-time (PT) symmetry optical potentials connected with a distributed Bragg reflector (DBR)-based resonator is proposed to achieve nonreciprocal waveguide transmission. The unidirectional reflectionless waveguide implementing PT symmetry is discussed by consistent coupling mode theory and finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) simulation results. Due to the high field confinement in the DBR cavity, transmission of a light pulse through the device is analyzed in the nonlinear optical regime using FDTD simulations. The combination of the nonlinear DBR cavity and the passive PT symmetric grating results in unidirectional transmission in the silicon waveguide, while still keeping the reflection minimum in the desired direction. The numerical simulation shows an extinction ratio of about 20 dB at the telecom wavelength of around 1550 nm.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Silicon', 'Cavity resonators', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Optical resonators', 'Modulation', 'Nonlinear optics']
author_keywords: ['Silicon waveguide', 'unidirectional reflectionless parity-time (PT) grating', 'nonlinear distributed Bragg reflector (DBR) cavity']

abstracts: We report on the pulse dynamics of single DSR pulse evolution with respect to the pump power in an all-normal dispersion fiber laser with a nonlinear fiber loop mirror.We experimentally demonstrate the narrowing of the pulse with the increase in the pump power for the very first time. Under appropriate operating conditions, the original DSR pulse can evolve into a new DSR pulse with a different center wavelength or to a multi-pulse state or a Harmonic mode-locked state.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber dispersion', 'Fiber lasers', 'Pump lasers', 'Optical pumping', 'Optical pulses', 'Optical fiber couplers']

abstracts: The proposed converter can replace the vertical taper, which is widely used in integrated optics for spot-size conversion to reduce the complexity of the fabrication process. More importantly, it can serve as a basic element for mode conversion between waveguides with different cross sections in both the horizontal and vertical directions, which offer a good universal solution in integrated optics. The two examples are good solutions for mode conversion in the two waveguide platforms.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Couplings', 'Waveguide lasers', 'Optical losses', 'Refractive index', 'Wideband', 'Diode lasers']
author_keywords: ['Integrated optics devices', 'Components', 'Photonic integrated circuits', 'Guided wave applications']

abstracts: There are three critical elements in the visible light positioning (VLP) system: Positioning accuracy, real-time ability and robustness.However, few existing VLP studies consider these three critical elements at the same time. We propose a novel VLP method using inproved Camshift-Kalman algorithm. It also also introduces the Bhattacharyya coefficient innovatively. Experimental results showed that It could realize high positioning accuracy, good robustness and good real-time ability.
ieee_keywords: ['Robustness', 'Real-time systems', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Target tracking', 'Image sensors', 'Kalman filters']
author_keywords: ['Visible light positioning (VLP)', 'real-time ability', 'robustness', 'image sensor (IS)', 'Camshift algorithm', 'Kalman filter', 'Bhattacharyya coefficient']

abstracts: We propose a design of high-performance wavelength-independent optical polarizer for ultraviolet/visible to terahertz (THz) spectral region based on metallic nanowire (NW) arrays on ultrathin substrates, which can reduce the influence of the substrate material. This NW-based polarizer is anticipated to have far-reaching impact on numerous existing devices including polarimetric imagers in the mid-infrared and THz domains, complementary metal-oxide semiconductor (CMOS) imagers, and DVD/CD players.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical polarization', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical films', 'Optical filters', 'Coordinate measuring machines', 'Substrates']

abstracts: We propose an efficient channel estimation method for coherent optical orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (CO-OFDM) based on weighted inter-frame averaging (WIFA), in which the channel estimation results of the adjacent frames are averaged to increase the estimation accuracy. The principle of the proposed WIFA method is theoretically analyzed, and the benefit is demonstrated by a polarization-division-multiplexed CO-OFDM transmission experiment. The channel magnitude and phase differences among adjacent frames are investigated. The effectiveness of WIFA method, combined with conventional least square method, time-domain averaging method, and intra-symbol frequency-domain averaging method, respectively, is demonstrated through 240-km standard single-mode fiber transmission with different launched power values. The experimental results show that the WIFA method can significantly enhance transmission performance.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Estimation', 'Channel estimation', 'Accuracy', 'Adaptive optics', 'Frequency-domain analysis', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Channel estimation', 'coherent optical orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (CO-OFDM)', 'inter-frame averaging']

abstracts: A novel subband access scheme for multiband high-speed orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) passive optical network (PON) is proposed, where the granularity of the bandwidth allocation is as small as the bandwidth of just one subcarrier and the ONUs only receives the desired subcarriers according to the bandwidth allocation strategy from the whole downstream OFDM signal without band limitation. Since the ONUs do not have to receive a complete OFDM band, low-bandwidth and low-speed devices can be used to reduce ONU cost. The algorithm used in the scheme is also explained in detail, and a 1-Tb/s experimental system is successfully established to prove the feasibility of the proposed scheme.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Optical network units', 'Bandwidth', 'Channel allocation', 'Baseband', 'Passive optical networks', 'High speed optical techniques']
author_keywords: ['Optical communications', 'orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) passive optical network (PON)', 'multiplexing']

abstracts: In this paper, 128 Gbit/s FSO transmission performance based on polarization multiplexing QPSK is demonstrated in closely emulated outdoor weak atmospheric turbulence conditions in laboratory. It is the first time that the transmission performance of high speed space laser in a tunable atmospheric channel is studied. The received sensitivity is -37.3 dBm at the FEC limit (BER = 10-3). The proposed approach can be an effective solution for information transmission between backbone links in space.
ieee_keywords: ['Atmospheric modeling', 'Temperature measurement', 'Atmospheric measurements', 'Modulation', 'Heating systems', 'Detectors', 'Optical fiber communication']

abstracts: The paper propose the application of a novel advanced modulation format named Baudrate-Pilot-Aided-QPSK modulation for super-channel transmission employing optical frequency comb source extracted from quantum well passive mode-locked laser. The proposed system would be a cost effective solution, suitable for short reach optical interconnect applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical noise', 'Modulation', 'Phase noise', 'Optical sensors', 'Optical coupling', 'Optical losses', 'Optical interconnections']

abstracts: In this paper, we demonstrated a system of 50-Gb/s PAM4 signal transmission over 50 km optical fiber by using 10G-class optical devices. We proposed and simplified a 3-order Volterra-DFE algorithm, compared with the traditional FFE/DFE and Volterra filters, the complexity can be reduced by 70%. Furthermore, by changing the PIN-TIA to a 10G APD-ROSA with a 3-dB bandwidth of 6.5 GHz for detection, the sensitivity can be improved from −14 dBm to −17 dBm.
ieee_keywords: ['Decision feedback equalizers', 'Maximum likelihood estimation', 'Optical filters', 'Kernel', 'Bandwidth', 'Complexity theory']

abstracts: In this work, we, for the first time, realize a Faraday laser with two modes output simultaneously, which is called dual-frequency Faraday laser. The frequencies of two modes rely on the hyperfine energy interval of Cs ground state. Such a dual-frequency Faraday laser makes important steps towards practical applications in atomic physics, such as sub-Doppler spectroscopy and CPT atomic clocks. We believe that this manuscript will be of substantial interest to IEEE Photonics Journal.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser modes', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Laser theory', 'Laser transitions', 'Laser stability', 'Optical feedback', 'Diode lasers']
author_keywords: ['Faraday anomalous dispersion optical filter (FADOF)', 'diode laser', 'faraday laser', 'dual-frequency laser']

abstracts: A new composite spiral scanning approach for beaconless acquisition is introduced, which consists of two procedures: spiral searching in sub-regions with fine pointing assembly, and coarse pointing assembly spiral skip scanning. The modeling and parameters matching results have been presented. An experiment was conducted to investigate dynamic tracking with different laser fluctuations, the tracking data analysis has been presented to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed scheme.
ieee_keywords: ['Spirals', 'Laser beams', 'Target tracking', 'Uncertainty', 'Heuristic algorithms', 'Actuators', 'Laser modes']
author_keywords: ['Optical communication', 'beaconless spatial acquisition', 'composite spiral scanning', 'dynamic tracking assembly', 'multiple-axis control']

abstracts: A novel high linearity microwave photonic link is proposed. In this link, two different optical wavelengths are modulated by a phase modulator in opposite directions. Next, the optical spectrum between the wavelengths is removed by a fiber Bragg grating. Because of the natural \pi phase difference between the up and low optical sidebands, the distortion components can be counteracted by subtly designing the optical power and modulation depth relationships between the wavelengths.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical distortion', 'Optical modulation', 'Phase modulation', 'Microwave photonics', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: A logic device with novel method is presented in this paper. The Boolean value of the input signal is represented by the position of the slider. This manipulation method can obtain a stable output signal compared to previous logic devices based on linear interference. In addition, in order to further improve the calculation speed and integration, the proposed logic device can simultaneously implement three logic operations (AND, XOR and NOR).
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Plasmons', 'Logic gates', 'Cavity resonators', 'Dielectrics']

abstracts: A stray current sensor based on an all-side cylindrical spiral fiber is proposed. The Jones matrix of sensor head is derived based on geometric rotation effect. The genetic algorithm is applied to optimize the characteristic parameters in the range of the temperature-induced linear birefringence from 0 deg to 1000 deg. The test results indicate that the measurement error of the proposed sensor is smaller than 0.4%, which is suit for the stray current measurement in an urban rail transit system.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Spirals', 'Pipelines', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber couplers']

abstracts: IEEE Plagiarism Policy
ieee_keywords: ['Resonator filters', 'Resonant frequency', 'Microwave filters', 'Metamaterials', 'Information filters', 'Dual band', 'Magnetic materials']

abstracts: We present a simple and highly efficient approach to directly generate tunable Airy beams and quadrate Airy beams. As opposed to conventional Airy beams, the quadrate Airy beams exhibit distinctly symmetric intensity profiles, autofocusing, a thin needle-like structure. Their properities may provide further possibilities for optical manipulation. This advantage of tunability also facilitates such non-diffracting beams to avoid obstacles and transport particles to a desired location.

We demonstrate alternate wavelength switching in a widely tunable, dual-wavelength Tm 3+ -doped fiber laser operating at 1900 nm. A comb filter based on a Sagnac loop incorporating a length of high-birefringence fiber is used to define the lasing wavelengths. By simple variation of a polarization controller within the laser cavity, alternate and sequential switching between single- and dual-wavelength output, as well as tunable operation over a range of 70 nm, is obtained.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Fiber lasers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Sagnac interferometers', 'Tuning']

abstracts: In this paper, a novel scene-based nonuniformity correction (SBNUC) method using statistics between adjacent detectors for infrared focal-plane array (IRFPA) is proposed. Differential operation is designed as a decorrelation process to minimize the scene information remained into the nonuniformity parameters updating. Then, a global transfer matrix is established to construct the nonuniformity compensation matrix for the entire image. The adjacent differential statistics are demonstrated to be more effective and sufficient to estimate the nonuniformity when temporal variation is lacking. In addition, the proposed method exhibits the more superior capability of converging and does better in correcting all spatial components of nonuniformity. Application in simulated imagery and real infrared image shows the proposed method's excellent performance in convergence and elimination of ghosting artifacts.
ieee_keywords: ['Detectors', 'Robustness', 'Least squares approximations', 'Imaging', 'Convergence', 'Filtering algorithms', 'Arrays']

abstracts: With a DML and an envelope detector, a simple and cost-efficient W-band mm-wave wireless transmission system is demonstrated. This paper is the first time to use Volterra nonlinear equalizer in a W-band mm-wave system to improve the transmission performance. Our experimental result shows that the Volterra nonlinear equalizer can improve the system performance.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical coupling', 'Baseband', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Envelope detectors', 'Wireless communication']

abstracts: Assessment of tumor invasion depth prior to making therapeutic decisions in colorectal carcinoma is crucial for both the patient and the physician. In this paper, multiphoton microscopy (MPM) was used to simultaneously label freely image loose areolar connective tissue in the submucosa and intramuscular septa in the muscularis propria to perform assessment of colorectal carcinoma invasion depth. The results indicated that MPM can accurately exhibit whether colorectal carcinoma invades into the submucosa or the muscularis propria. Collagen content alteration and the presence of dirty necrosis can be extracted to serve as quantitatively intrinsic biomarkers for reflecting collagen degradation, the occurrence of desmoplastic reaction, and breakdown of cancer cells, which are tightly related to the prognosis of colorectal carcinoma. With the development and clinical applications of the multiphoton endoscope, in vivo histological-like diagnosis of tumor invasion depth may become its main application in the field of colorectal carcinoma and lead to faster and improved therapeutic decision making in the clinics.
ieee_keywords: ['Cancer', 'Tumors', 'Microscopy', 'Muscles', 'Medical diagnostic imaging', 'Pathology']
author_keywords: ['multiphoton microscopy', 'invasion depth of colorectal carcinoma', 'submucosa', 'muscularis propria']

abstracts: We demonstrate a 3-m bi-directional signal remodulated VCSEL-based visible light communication (VLC) system. By using the pre-distortion, the upstream remodulated data-rate is significantly enhanced. We also analyze how the pre-distorted signal can enhance the transmission data rate by mitigating the inter-symbol interference (ISI) introduced by the bandwidth limitation of modulator.
ieee_keywords: ['Modulation', 'OFDM', 'Optical filters', 'Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Bandwidth', 'Adaptive optics', 'Optical variables measurement']

abstracts: A proposal for an all-optical memory based on a bistability of single-mode states in a dual-mode diode laser with time-delayed optical feedback is presented. The system is modeled using a multimode extension of the Lang-Kobayashi equations with injected optical pulses. We uncover the bifurcation structure by deriving analytical expressions for the boundaries of the bistable region and demonstrate how the delay time in the external cavity determines an optimal pulse duration for efficient switching of the memory element. We also show the relevant role played by gain saturation and by the dual-mode solutions of the Lang-Kobayashi equations for the existence of the bistable regions. Our results demonstrate that feedback-induced bistability can lead to significant performance improvements when compared to memory elements based on the injection locking bistability in dual-mode devices.
ieee_keywords: ['Bifurcation', 'Cavity resonators', 'Electronic countermeasures', 'Mathematical model', 'Optical feedback', 'Optical pulses']
author_keywords: ['Dual-mode diode lasers', 'all-optical memory', 'external optical feedback', 'bistability', 'Lambert function']

abstracts: We present an overview of the recent developments in nonlinear silicon photonics. There were significant advances in devices exploiting the χ (2) and χ (3) nonlinearities. Here, we discuss parametric amplification, wavelength conversion, super-continuum generation, parametric oscillation, and frequency comb generation in silicon-based devices.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Optical waveguides', 'Photonics', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Dispersion', 'Optical wavelength conversion', 'Resonant frequency']

abstracts: This paper presents an overview of recent developments in terahertz science and technology. Important advances have occurred in higher power terahertz sources and in other devices. They are described along with some notable applications.

We report a broadband 1× N microwave photonic splitter (MPS) with arbitrary amplitude ratio and phase shift. The key devices used in the MPS are a polarization modulator (PolM), an optical bandpass filter (OBPF), polarization controllers (PCs), and polarizers (Pols). The cascaded PolM and OBPF generate an orthogonally polarized single-sideband modulated optical signal. The phase difference between the two orthogonal components and the state of polarization of the optical signal can be adjusted by the PC independently. After the polarization-to-intensity modulation conversion by the Pol, the microwave is recovered in the PD. The amplitude and phase of the microwave signal can be independently tuned by adjusting the three plates of the PC. The proposed MPS is theoretically analyzed and experimentally verified. Broadband MPS with bandwidth from 8 to 40 GHz is successfully achieved. In addition, we apply the proposed MPS to a two-tap microwave photonic filter (MPF). The notch position and depth of the MPF are tunable by adjusting the phase shift and amplitude ratio between the two optical branches, respectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave filters', 'Optical polarization', 'Microwave photonics', 'Microwave amplifiers', 'Optical filters', 'Optical modulation']

abstracts: A silicon PSR is proposed to solve the problem of polarization sensitive for silicon photonic devices. Compared with other PSRs in the literature,our devices have excellent performance in terms of operating bandwidth.What's more, an 8-channel WDM receiver is further demonstrated to verify the application of PSR.The test results show that the system has polarization insensitive properties,giving a promissing solution to solve the high polarization dependence in photonic integrated circuits.
ieee_keywords: ['Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Silicon', 'Receivers', 'Couplers', 'Optical waveguides', 'Fabrication', 'Crosstalk']

abstracts: In this paper, we propose a novel whispering-gallery-mode microresonator which is composed of two partially overlapped microbottle resonators, and analyze the distribution property of mode intensity and the variation characteristic of quality factors both theoretically and experimentally. Additionally, a stable add-drop filter based on the coupled microbottle resonator is demonstrated, and the effective excitation properties of the modes in the microresonator are discussed.
ieee_keywords: ['Microcavities', 'Turning', 'Q-factor', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Resonator filters', 'Kinetic energy']

abstracts: Raman scattering spectra of Both a-cut and c-cut Nd:YVO4 crystal was studied. Then, cascaded self-Raman laser emitting around 1.2–1.3 μm based on a c-cut crystal with the Raman shifts of 259 and 890 cm-1 was studied for the first time. 1.02 W output was achieved with three intensity lines at 1215, 1255 and 1316 nm. The results show that the Nd:YVO4 cascaded self-Raman with mixed Raman shifts could output the new wavelength around 1.2μm, which was seldom reported by other solid state laser.
ieee_keywords: ['Crystals', 'Pump lasers', 'Quantum cascade lasers', 'Laser excitation', 'Power generation', 'Stimulated emission']

abstracts: A chaotic secure communication system based on single feedback phase modulation with Quaternary random sequences have been proposed and numerically designed. The advantages of this chaotic secure communication system lie in two kinds: 1) chaotic signal time delay signature is effectively eliminated. And 2) system key space is exponentially increased. Therefore, security of chaotic secure communication is strongly guaranteed.
ieee_keywords: ['Chaotic communication', 'Phase modulation', 'Delays', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical feedback', 'Synchronization']

abstracts: In this paper, turn-on time delay characteristics of a fiber grating Fabry-Perot (FGFP) laser are numerically investigated by considering all the carrier recombination rate (CRR) R(N) coefficients (nonradiative, A nr ; radiative, B; and Auger coefficient, C). The results show that the turn-on time delay significantly reduces by increasing the injection current (I inj ) and/or the initial value of carrier density (N i ). Meanwhile, the turn-on time delay increases by increasing the CRR coefficients. However, its effect can be minimized by increasing I inj and/or N i . In addition, the turn-on time delay can be reduced by increasing the external optical feedback (OFB) level. Moreover, it is shown that the optimum external-cavity length (L ext ) is 3.1 cm. Furthermore, an antireflection (AR) coating reflectivity value of 1 × 10 -2 is sufficient for the laser to operate at good turn-on time delay and low fabrication complexity. The obtained results can provide an important idea for the practical fabrication of the FGFP laser used in the dense wavelength-division multiplexing (DWDM) systems and optical access networks.
ieee_keywords: ['Delay effects', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Fiber lasers', 'Mathematical model', 'Charge carrier density', 'Wavelength division multiplexing']
author_keywords: ['External-cavity semiconductor lasers', 'fiber Bragg grating (FBG)', 'turn-on time delay']

abstracts: We propose a novel chirp compensation scheme for directly modulated three-section distributed Bragg reflector (3s-DBR) lasers in applications of the time- and wavelength-division multiplexed passive optical network systems. The frequency chirp of 3s-DBR lasers induced by direct modulation is investigated through extensive numerical simulations based on the time-domain travel-wave model. To overcome the signal distortions resulting from the frequency chirp due to direct modulation, we extend on our novel idea of frequency chirp compensation technology with inherent characteristics of DBR-type tunable lasers. Q factors and extinction ratio for different system transmission lengths are analyzed and compared. Large dispersion tolerance of the system is achieved by using the chirp compensation scheme.
ieee_keywords: ['Chirp', 'Laser tuning', 'Erbium', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Laser noise']

abstracts: A temperature-insensitive fiber-optic displacement sensing scheme by cascading the fiber up taper and Bragg grating is experimentally demonstrated. The strength-robust up taper, which is fabricated by excessively splicing the Bragg grating to the interrogation fiber, functions as the bridge between the core mode and the cladding modes. This cascading structure realizes the cladding-mode backward recoupling, and displacement information can be directly read out by measuring the power of the highly bending sensitive recoupled cladding modes. Two sensing configurations that respectively utilize the normal fiber Bragg grating (FBG) and the uniform chirped FBG (CFBG) for the cladding-mode backward recoupling have been studied contrastively, in which the tunability of the up taper is fully validated to support a better dynamic range of the measurement. Aiming to improve the low reflection power and enhance the sensing sensitivity, the CFBG is used, and the reflection power is increased by more than 200 times and reaches 176 μW, which lowers the precision requirement for the optical power meter and potentially reduces the cost of the sensing system.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber gratings', 'Couplings', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Temperature sensors', 'Gratings']

abstracts: For traditional OAM multiplexing system, the communication distance and system performance are limited for the OAM de-multiplexing technology based on direct separation. In this paper, a novel coherent separation detection technology for OAM multiplexing is proposed. This coherent detection can extract the desirable signals carried by OAM beam through optical interference and differential coherence. This technology support longer distance and have a better anti-noise performance.
ieee_keywords: ['Spirals', 'Multiplexing', 'Gratings', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Interference', 'Licenses', 'Phase distortion']

abstracts: We show that, by allying optical generation of periodic sinc pulses and electrical pulse shaping, the roll-off factor of the OTDM modulated spectrum can be reduced, independently of the number of optical comb lines used to generate the train of sinc pulses, enabling the generation of Nyquist-modulated channels at symbol rates > 100 GBd, without the use of any bandpass optical filter for sidelobe suppression.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical pulse shaping', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical transmitters', 'Time division multiplexing', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical receivers']

abstracts: To exploit the potential of a dual-comb absolute distance ranging system outside a well-controlled laboratory, a compact dual-comb structure is proposed. A beat frequency generated by the repetition rates of two frequency combs serves as an electric reference, which is easily built and maintains a long range and high resolution compared with traditional dual-comb systems. The performance of the proposed method is compared with that of a heterodyne interferometer. The residuals range within -116.6 to 117.2 nm, the standard deviations vary from 46.3 to 137.9 nm, and the non-ambiguity range extension remains reliable throughout a 10-m test. Compared with Michelson-type dual-comb interferometers, this compact dual-comb system omits the redundant optical reference arm, promising practical applications of distance ranging.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical interferometry', 'Distance measurement', 'Frequency measurement', 'Electric variables measurement', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Harmonic analysis', 'Optical harmonic generation']

abstracts: Unmanned-aerial-vehicle (UAV)-based communications are expected to play an important role in the future generation wireless communication networks. It is a promising solution to enhance the wireless connectivity of devices without infrastructure. As compared to the terrestrial communications, UAVs offer various advantages such as line-of-sight (LoS) connectivity, dynamic deployment and flexible reconfiguration. Further, free space optics (FSO) communication is considered as a possible solution to enable UAV-based communication links due to its cost effective and high bandwidth nature. However, despite offering large bandwidth, UAV-based FSO links are marred by atmospheric path loss, atmospheric turbulence, non-zero boresight pointing errors, and angle-of-arrival (AoA) fluctuations. In this paper, the performance of a hovering UAV-based FSO communication system is investigated. The closed-form expressions for outage probability, average symbol error rate (SER), and ergodic capacity are derived taking into account both heterodyne (HD) and direct detection (DD) techniques for ground-to-UAV (G2U), UAV-to-UAV (U2U), and UAV-to-ground (U2G) links over the generalized Málaga distribution. Moreover, the asymptotic expressions for the above performance metrics are also derived to get the diversity gain of the system.
ieee_keywords: ['Atmospheric modeling', 'Probability', 'Power system reliability', 'Capacity planning', 'Performance analysis', 'Analytical models', 'Fading channels']
author_keywords: ['Angle-of-arrival (AoA) fluctuations', 'free space optics (FSO)', 'Málaga distribution', 'non-zero boresight pointing errors', 'performance analysis', 'unmanned-aerial-vehicles (UAVs)']

abstracts: We propose a hybrid solution to exploit the capabilities of the optical orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (OFDM) for passive optical network applications implemented by the electronic generation of the OFDM signal at the transmitter and by the all-optical demultiplexing of the OFDM subcarriers at the remote node by means of a passive element, such as suitable arrayed waveguide grating, performing the fast Fourier transform (FFT) in the optical domain. Drastic simplicity at the optical network unit is achieved with neither coherent detection nor any high-speed electronics, allowing an effective exploitation of all the available transmission spectra. By means of simulations and preliminary experimentation, we demonstrate 4 \times 10-Gb/s transmission over more than 40-km standard single-mode fiber, the main limitation to the number of subcarriers being the employed device's actual electronic bandwidth.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Optical transmitters', 'Passive optical networks', 'Optical receivers', 'Bandwidth', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical network units']

abstracts: IEEE Plagiarism Policy

abstracts: We have experimentally demonstrated an X-band real-time OFDM radio-over-fiber system using directly modulated lasers for the first time. A Reed-Solomon code with symbol interleaving is also applied to the software reconfigurable 4/16/64-QAM-encoded OFDM transceiver to enhance the BER performance; a post-FEC BER below 1e-8 can be successfully achieved when the pre-FEC BER is around 1e-3.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Optical attenuators', 'Real-time systems', 'Optical fibers', 'Bit error rate', 'Clocks']
author_keywords: ['Radio over fiber (RoF)', 'orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (OFDM)', 'X-band', 'digital signal processing (DSP)', 'forward error correction (FEC)', 'Reed-Solomon codes', 'software reconfigurable']

abstracts: Three kinds of highly compact 2 \times 2 couplers based on silicon nanowire are designed and optimized for the array waveguide grating (AWG) demodulation integration microsystem in this paper. These couplers are directional (X) coupler, cross gap coupler (CGC), and multimode interface (MMI) coupler. The couplers are simulated using the beam propagation method. The distance between the input/output waveguides is set to 10 \mu\hbox{m} considering the test of a single device in the following work. The total footprint of X coupler is 10 \ \mu\hbox{m} \times 300 \ \mu\hbox{m} . The length of parallel film waveguide is 1 \mu\hbox{m} . After optimization, the minimum excess loss is 0.73 dB. CGC has a footprint of 10 \ \mu\hbox{m} \times 300 \ \mu\hbox{m} , a coupling region length of 24 \mu\hbox{m} , and a minimum excess loss of 0.6 dB. Taper waveguides are used as input/output waveguides for MMI coupler. The footprint of MMI region is only 6 \ \mu\hbox{m} \times 57 \ \mu\hbox{m} . The excess loss is 0.46 dB after optimization. Uniformity is 0.06 dB with transverse electric polarization when the center wavelength is 1.55 \mu\hbox{m} . The maximum excess loss is 1.55 dB in the range of 1.49 \mu\hbox{m} to 1.59 \mu\hbox{m} . The simulation results show that a small 2 \times 2 MMI coupler exhibits lower excess loss, wider bandwidth, and better uniformity than X coupler and CGC. MMI coupler is suitable for the requirements of optoelectronic integration.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplers', 'Couplings', 'Optical devices', 'Arrayed waveguide gratings', 'Optical coupling', 'Optical films']

abstracts: Firstly, the filter designed in this paper can work in the fiber communication bands of 1 .31 and 1.55 \mum which are very widely used bands. Secondly,the resonance wavelength can be adjusted very accurately by adjusting ellipticity. In addition, there are some breakthroughs have been made in the performance of polarization filters. For example, we have obtained the maximum distance between the resonance peaks of the X-polarization and Y- polarization than previous reported.
ieee_keywords: ['Wires', 'Optical fiber filters', 'Gold', 'Surface waves', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Plasmons']
author_keywords: ['Photonic crystal fibers', 'polarization filter', 'plasmon resonance', 'finite element method (FEM)']

abstracts: In recent years, the metamaterial has become a popular and powerful tool in the electromagnetic polarization conversion design. In this paper, a flexible and transparent broadband cross-polarization-converter (CPC) was designed, fabricated and tested. ANSYS HFSS was used for the cross-polarization-converter simulation, and the Floquet port and master-slave boundary condition were set in the software. The multi-layer split-ring-resonator (SRR) structure was used to form the metamaterial for the CPC. As a result, >77% polarization conversion ratio (PCR) was achieved in the range of (7.8-18.2) GHz, with little change within 45° incident angle. The experimental results were consistent with the simulation data.
ieee_keywords: ['Reflection', 'Indium tin oxide', 'Metamaterials', 'Backplanes', 'Broadband communication', 'Bandwidth', 'Antenna measurements']

abstracts: 1.Graphene-on-silicon slot waveguide is adopted in EO modulator design. 2.The f3-dB is estimated to be 117 GHz at a low power consumption of 212 fJ/bit.The extinction ratio of 28 dB and insertion loss of 1.28 dB can be obtained for a 120 μm-long graphene modulating length. 3.The optical bandwidth can be as large as 600 nm. 4.More realistic factors, such as waveguide dimensions, quantum capacitance, sidewall roughness, and carrier mobility on performance of the modulator are considered.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Electrooptical waveguides', 'Optical attenuators', 'Electrooptic modulators', 'Silicon']

abstracts: A plasmonic vortex lens (PVL), which enables to focus the spin or orbital angular momentum to a specific spatial position in the form of a plasmonic vortex, has been widely studied. Here, we present a specific PVL structure to focus the surface plasmon polariton wave on an arbitrary spatial position. Both analytical and numerical analyses are presented. The plasmonic field of our PVL is an approximate Bessel beam. In particular, the PVL can focus the input beam into a zeroth-order Bessel beam with a central peak. Based on this principle, multiple focuses by combining multiple different PVLs are designed. We can freely control the focuses just by changing the input modes. Owing to the tuning ability of the focuses, these findings can motivate the applications for optical trapping, optical data, and digital display on chip.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Lenses', 'Optical vortices', 'Focusing', 'Geometry', 'Optical films']

abstracts: We studied the effects of mobility on the performance of a broad-beam laser-based underwater communication system. The beam encoded with pulse-position modulated signals enables a reliable mobile to fixed nodes communication in a diffused-line-of-sight manner. The approach is found to be superior compared to that of on-off keying or orthogonal-frequency division multiplexing counterparts in the presence of complex and dynamic underwater channels
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Modulation', 'Optical transmitters', 'Ultraviolet sources', 'Imaging', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Bandwidth']
author_keywords: ['Underwater wireless optical communication', 'mobile underwater communication', 'mobility', 'pulse-position modulation', 'remote-operated vehicles']

abstracts: The key contribution in this manuscript is the use of an energy efficient, highly compact device-semiconductor optical amplifier (SOA), as the nonlinear medium for optical phase conjugation. This is the first experimental demonstration of simultaneous nonlinear and chromatic dispersion compensation using phase conjugation in SOA for higher order modulation formats. We strongly believe that this work provides the pathway for practically deployable phase conjugators.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical distortion', 'Dispersion', 'Optical noise', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Semiconductor optical amplifiers', 'Optical signal processing', 'Optical receivers']

abstracts: We report a high optical-quality double-layer silicon (Si) material platform with a thin interface oxide using a low-temperature wafer bonding technique. To assess the quality of the platform, resonators with different radii are fabricated, and their quality factors (Q) are measured. Q's of 25 k and 350 k are demonstrated in 2-μm- and 20-μm-radius microring resonators, respectively. The former is the most compact high-Q resonator demonstrated in any type of double-layer Si platform, and the latter is the highest Q demonstrated in a double-layer Si platform to date. This material platform enables a new set of integrated optical devices for a wide range of applications, including high-speed modulators, tunable filters, and low-power switches.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Optical resonators', 'Optical waveguides', 'Photonics', 'Bonding', 'Waveguide discontinuities']

abstracts: A dual-frequency absorber with periodic double-layer graphene ring arrays is proposed and analyzed by the coupled-mode theory to predict the perfect absorption response in the terahertz region. Numerical simulations confirm this effect and give the underlying physical origin. Benefiting from chemical potential can be controlled by external bias voltage, the proposed structure can be used as a dynamically tunable absorber.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Absorption', 'Resonant frequency', 'Coupled mode analysis', 'Dielectrics', 'Finite difference methods']

abstracts: We report a comparative experimental analysis of the dynamics yielded in lasers embedded in photonic integrated circuits (PICs). We show that within the short cavity regime, the laser can exhibit dynamics in totally different proportions when small changes in the feedback delay are operated. We unveil that apparently very small changes in the feedback delay can induce very different sequences of bifurcations, bringing a crucial understanding of the rich dynamical behaviors offered by PICs.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Laser feedback', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Delays', 'Distributed feedback devices', 'Chaos', 'Optical waveguides']

abstracts: We present bifunctional nanostructured (NS) coverglasses with enhanced transmittance and self-cleaning function for improving the efficiency of a photovoltaic (PV) module with an InGaP/GaAs/Ge triple-junction solar cell. Prior to the fabrication of NS coverglasses, theoretical investigations were carried out using a rigorous coupled-wave analysis method to determine the desirable glass nanostructures that can effectively enhance the light absorption of the PV module. The transmission properties of the fabricated NS coverglasses with different glass nanostructures were systematically analyzed by considering the absorption spectrum of three subcells of the solar cell in order to find the most effective NS coverglass for enhancing the photocurrent of the PV module and thereby improving the conversion efficiency. The PV module with the most effective NS coverglass showed 4.2% enhanced short-circuit current density and 4.3% enhanced efficiency compared with the PV module with a bare coverglass measured under one sun of the air mass 1.5 global, showing the necessity of integrating a finely designed NS coverglass to effectively improve the efficiency of various PV systems with multijunction solar cells.
ieee_keywords: ['Glass', 'Photovoltaic cells', 'Absorption', 'Ink', 'Gallium arsenide', 'Nanostructures', 'Photoconductivity']
author_keywords: ['Nanostructured coverglass', 'III-V triple-junction solar cell', 'self-cleaning', 'rigorous coupled-wave analysis (RCWA) method']

abstracts: The proposed and optimized plasmonic bowtie notch (PBN) not only is with compact footprint of 200 nm × 220 nm, but also shows an ultralow threshold excitation intensity of 0.64 mW/μm2 for stable trapping a 100 nm particle. The trapping force provided by PBN is 2.55 times stronger than that by the commonly used plasmonic bowtie aperture. The great trapping capability of PBN is owing to the addition of a bottom metal film, causing the resonance mode to be much enhanced and accessible by particle.
ieee_keywords: ['Force', 'Optical films', 'Optical surface waves', 'Gold', 'Plasmons', 'Biomedical optical imaging', 'Optical device fabrication']

abstracts: Carbon monoxide poisoning is a worldwide public health problem. Laser emissions at about 1.07 \mu\text{m} have important application in detecting carbon monoxide poisoning by frequency doubled to about 538 nm. At present, single-wavelength laser at 1073 nm has been power limited to only 0.26 W for Nd:YAG and no diode-pumped 1078 nm laser has been reported. In this work, a power scaling of the 1073 nm Nd:YAG laser to 5.58 W can be realized. Moreover, the first diode-pumped Nd:YAG laser at 1078 nm can also be generated.
ieee_keywords: ['Power generation', 'Crystals', 'Laser excitation', 'Cavity resonators', 'Couplers', 'Semiconductor diodes', 'Semiconductor lasers']

abstracts: We generated 100-mJ-class IR fs laser with excellent energy-scaling ability using a dual-chirped optical parametric amplification (DC-OPA) scheme, which was the highest energy in the IR region with shorter than 40 fs pulse duration. Based on DC-OPA, we proposed to generate mJ-class THz pulses, whose pulse energy was limited to micro-joule-level in ever reported work. An indirect phase control method was proposed, which will be very helpful for precisely compressing the intense THz pulses.
ieee_keywords: ['Ultrafast optics', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical pulses', 'Chirp', 'Crystals', 'Optical pumping']

abstracts: A subwavelength slit with metal-dielectric-metal (MDM) composite surface gratings is proposed and numerically investigated using finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) method. Compared with conventional monometal-grating based structures, focusing properties of the proposed MDM structure can be enhanced based on multiple scattering and coupling of surface plasmon polaritons (SPPs) along the metal/dielectric multilayer films, especially the focal length can be varied from ~ 2.6 to 5.82 μm by adjusting the dielectric thickness.
ieee_keywords: ['Dielectrics', 'Metals', 'Gratings', 'Focusing', 'Films', 'Surface waves']

abstracts: In this paper, we propose a novel flip-chip AlGaN nanowire LED with top photonic crystals. This LED has several advantages. (1) The flip-chip design can effectively avoid the absorption of light by p-metal contact. (2) Nanowire arrays can be designed to inhibit the guided mode and promote light extraction from top surface. (3) Our simulation shows that this LED can further promote vertical light extraction with the addition of top AlN photonic crystal. A high LEE up to 79.4% can be achieved.
ieee_keywords: ['Aluminum gallium nitride', 'Wide band gap semiconductors', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Aluminum nitride', 'III-V semiconductor materials', 'Photonic crystals']
author_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'ultraviolet', 'AlGaN nanowire', 'light extraction', 'vertical emission', 'photonic crystal']

abstracts: In this paper, a novel integrated scheme of intrusion discrimination based on DMZI vibration system is proposed. Experiments demonstrate that the proposed scheme can accurately classify two common intrusions (i.e., fence climb and knock the cable). The pipeline structure of the filter bank also brings the merits of high flexibility, great rapidity, and low cost, which is suitable for field applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Feature extraction', 'Attenuation', 'Vibrations', 'Optical interferometry', 'Optical sensors', 'Couplers']

abstracts: The amplified feedback structure of this laser, which can avoid the butt-joint re-growth process, can enhance the performance of modulation response of a directly modulated semiconductor laser (DML) by taking advantage of photon-photon resonance effects. The sophisticated gratings in laser cavity can be formed by conventional holographic exposure combining with a conventional photolithography. Hence, this work provides a novel low-cost solution to realizing high-performance DMLs.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser feedback', 'Gratings', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Optical feedback', 'Bandwidth']

abstracts: Ghost imaging (GI) is applied to many fields. However, the key issues of traditional GI are poor quality and long measurement time. To address it, many methods, which include differential GI, compressive GI and so on, have been proposed. In our paper, we propose an iterative pseudo-inverse ghost imaging technique. Compared the method mentioned, the technique does't depend on the prior information and has a shorter measurement time. We verify that the technique yields a better performance.
ieee_keywords: ['Imaging', 'Image reconstruction', 'Speckle', 'Iterative methods', 'Noise reduction', 'Laser beams', 'Correlation']

abstracts: We demonstrate a wavelength-tunable all-optical flip-flop (AOFF) based on a multimode-interference (MMI) bistable laser diode (BLD) with distributed Bragg reflectors (DBRs). The wavelength tuning can be achieved by the band-filling effect and the free-carrier plasma effect with carrier injections to the DBRs. The tuning range of 3.1 nm will enable flexible and reconfigurable design of future photonic integrated circuits (PICs). Since the DBR-MMI-BLD does not require cleaved facets for its operation, multiple AOFFs can be monolithically integrated on a single PIC. In addition, the device has a large operable bandwidth of wider than 34 nm, even when we tune the lasing wavelength. A dynamic flip-flop operation is also demonstrated with rising and falling times of faster than 280 and 228 ps, respectively. No waveform distortion is observed, even when we tune the lasing wavelength.
ieee_keywords: ['Flip-flops', 'Diode lasers', 'Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Distributed feedback devices', 'Photonics', 'Laser tuning', 'Surface emitting lasers', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Circuit optimization']
author_keywords: ['Fabrication and characterization', 'integrated photonic system', 'semiconductor lasers', 'waveguide device']

abstracts: A band-stop nanofilter in double sector or sectorial-ring stub resonator coupled to MDM plasmonic waveguide is proposed. An ultra-broad stopband phenomenon is found in the two novel systems. A tunable stopband is realized by adjusting the geometric parameters of the stub. The difference and relation between the stopbands in the two systems are discussed. The proposed structures realize asymmetrical single stub, form no-distance double stub and obtain the filtering function by tuning stopband.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Plasmons', 'Optical resonators', 'Magnetic fields', 'Filtering', 'Finite difference methods']

abstracts: This paper proposes a new receiver based on frequency-domain diversity combining (FDDC) for an asymmetrically clipped optical orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (ACO-OFDM) system. Compared with its time-domain diversity combining (TDDC) counterpart, the FDDC receiver is capable of more effectively exploiting the frequency selectivity of the channel to further improve the detection performance, which is proved by postcombining signal-to-noise-ratio (SNR) analysis. An enhanced version of the FDDC receiver, which is called eFDDC, is also proposed subsequently. It allows for optimal selection among multiple sets of candidate symbol vectors based on signum matrix estimation. Simulation results show that the proposed FDDC and eFDDC receivers outperform the TDDC receiver. With a sufficient number of candidate symbol vector sets, the eFDDC receiver even outperforms a kind of iterative receiver, which is known to have superior performance in current literature, yet the complexity of eFDDC is lower due to the avoidance of matrix inversion. Those facts suggest that the FDDC and eFDDC receivers are strong receiver candidates for the ACO-OFDM system.
ieee_keywords: ['Diversity reception', 'Frequency-domain analysis', 'OFDM', 'Time-domain analysis', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical receivers', 'Computational comlexity']

abstracts: This paper investigates the generation and transmission of high-symbol-rate single-carrier signals based on the electronic time-division multiplexing (ETDM) method. We have achieved an impressive baud rate, and the electrical eye diagrams of data up to 138.4 GBaud are presented. To the best of our knowledge, 138.4 GBaud is the highest symbol rate of all-ETDM-based optical coherent system reported so far. Both back-to-back and transmission results are presented.
ieee_keywords: ['Phase shift keying', 'Optical noise', 'Bit error rate', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical fibers', 'Bandwidth']

abstracts: We experimentally demonstrate a simple scheme for broadband generation of OAM beams using asymmetric fiber-to-fiber butt coupling. The proposed simple, low-cost, controllable, and broadband fiber-based OAM beam converter may have a number of potential applications in fields, such as optical communications, optical manipulation, sensing and imaging.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber devices', 'Laser beams', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Couplings']

abstracts: Graphene, which is a single layer of carbon atoms assembled in a honeycomb lattice, has recently attracted significant attention, primarily due to its extraordinary electronic properties. In fact, its photonic properties are not less exciting. Graphene interacts with light strongly from ultraviolet to far infrared, and such interaction is tunable by electric field. Moreover, although graphene itself is gapless, a direct, tunable bandgap can be created by breaking its intrinsic crystallographic symmetry. These unique properties make graphene a promising candidate for various light detection, manipulation, and generation applications in an ultra-wide operational wavelength range. In this paper, we first discuss a few possible photonic applications based on the exceptional photonic properties of graphene, followed by detailed presentation on graphene photodetectors. Finally, two major future directions on graphene nanophotonic research will be covered.
ieee_keywords: ['Carbon', 'Nanophotonics', 'Photonic band gap', 'Atomic layer deposition', 'Photonics', 'Photodetectors', 'Lattices']

abstracts: We report on the development of a 940-nm diode laser bar based on epitaxially stacked active regions by employing a tunnel junction structure.
