The observed dynamic range and resultant error vector magnitude of a 16-ary quadrature amplitude modulation signal compliant with the IEEE 802.11ad Standard, designated for a wireless local access network at 60 GHz, can be within the limit set by the standard.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Optical modulation', 'Bandwidth', 'Optical signal processing']

abstracts: We reported and presented an 20/400 Yb-APS fiber with low PD and high TMI threshold, presenting 3.03 kW laser power at 1080.13 nm with a slope efficiency of 76.6% and excellent laser stability with power fluctuation of 1.09% for over 500 minutes. In addition, 3 kW-level all-fiber laser based on standard 20/400 fiber is rarely reported and easy to miniaturize fiber laser integration for real industry application.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Laser stability', 'Power lasers', 'Laser beams', 'Measurement by laser beam']
author_keywords: ['Fiber design and fabrication', 'lasers', 'fiber', 'fiber optics amplifiers and oscillators.']

abstracts: In this work, a reach-through SACM APD based on hole initiated ionization is fabricated. The gain slope of the APD is reduced by combining the advantages of reduced multiplication layer electric field sensitivity on overbias and lower sensitivity of hole impact ionization coefficient on electric field. Meanwhile, by optimization of top-electrode of the APD with branch-shaped patterns, photo-current at avalanche regime and PCR increase, suggesting 2-4 times increase of effective fill factor.
ieee_keywords: ['Avalanche photodiodes', 'Electric fields', 'Absorption', 'Photonics', 'Silicon carbide', 'Ionization', 'Doping']
author_keywords: ['4H-SiC', 'separated absorption charge and multiplication', 'ultraviolet avalanche photodiode', 'gain slope', 'top-electrode pattern', 'fill factor.']

abstracts: A novel scheme based on multiple vector modes division multiplexing (VMDM) has been proposed to implement the high-speed direct-detection optical orthogonal-frequency-division-multiplexing (DD-OFDM) signal transmission. The most novelty of this scheme is the flexible and cost-effective vector mode conversion based on q-plate and conventional half-waveplate where the polarization property of the VM is fully utilized.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical interconnections', 'Optical polarization', 'Laser beams', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical fibers', 'Multiplexing']
author_keywords: ['Fiber optics and optical communications', 'vector mode', 'mode-division-multiplexing (MDM)', 'direct detection orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (DD-OFDM)', 'optical interconnect', 'polarization.']

abstracts: In this paper, we have applied circuit concepts to model plasmonic nanoparticle. We show that the previous circuit representations based on quasi-static approximations often result in large errors. To remedy, we take all time-dependent fields of a dipole and introduced the concept of radiation impedance. The derived extended model is accurate and gives a fresh perspective to scientists and engineers for studying and using nanoparticle for various applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Integrated circuit modeling', 'Impedance', 'Nanoparticles', 'Mathematical model', 'Surface impedance', 'Plasmons', 'Electric potential']

abstracts: A fast image segmentation algorithm combining the saliency map with NS theory is proposed to obtain a more accurate image segmentation. Our proposed algorithm can overcome their defects of under-segmentation and over-segmentation. Moreover, the SMNS model has a robust ability of de-noising to obtain better segmentation results of noise image fastly.
ieee_keywords: ['Image segmentation', 'Entropy', 'Filtering algorithms', 'Filtering theory', 'Clustering algorithms', 'Image edge detection', 'Image color analysis']
author_keywords: ['Imaging system', 'image segmentation', 'neutrosophic set theory', 'saliency map', 'the method of threshold']

abstracts: A fiber nonlinearity compensation scheme based on a complex-valued dimension-reduced neural network is proposed. The proposed scheme performs all calculations in complex values and employs a dimension-reduced triplet feature vector to reduce the size of the input layer. Simulation and experiment results show that the proposed neural network needed only 20% of computational complexity to reach the saturated performance gain of the real-valued triplet-input neural network, and had a similar saturated gain to the one-step-per-span digital backpropagation. In addition, the proposed scheme was 1.7 dB more robust to the noise from training data and required less bit precision for quantizing trained weights, compared with the real-valued triplet-input neural network.
ieee_keywords: ['Training', 'Erbium-doped fiber amplifiers', 'Artificial neural networks', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical receivers', 'Q-factor', 'Computational modeling']

abstracts: We present a geometrical description of Modulation Instability (MI) gain in optical fibers. We demonstrate that the MI gain, all relevant effects considered, obeys a simple formulation closely tied to the dispersion profile of the medium. Such an approach contributes a valuable analysis and design tool for applications where the role of MI in the initial-stage dynamics is most relevant (e.g., supercontinuum generation and parametric amplification.)
ieee_keywords: ['Dispersion', 'Optical modulation', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical solitons', 'Optical pumping', 'Geometrical optics']

abstracts: A heterodyne optical fiber current sensor based on a nanowire-grid (NWG) in-line polarizer is proposed. The NWG is a one-dimension Au grating fabricated on a fiber tip by focused ion beam machining. Because the grating pitch is far smaller than the wavelength of the incident light, it works like an in-line transflective fiber polarizer with both the transmission and reflection light power being measured simultaneously. Based on this unique feature, an all-fiber optical current sensor is demonstrated. The heterodyne measurement makes it withstand light power variations showing good sensing stability. As an all-fiber sensor, discrete and bulky optical components are saved, making it more reliable in practical applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Reflection', 'Gratings']

abstracts: We present a sensitive optical sensor design by integrating a circular-hole defect with an etched diffraction grating (EDG) spectrometer based on amorphous-silicon photonic platforms. The circular-hole defect obtained from the outdiffusion of the hydrogen in the annealing process can induce strong resonant scattering loss at some special wavelengths. The positions of resonant peaks will linearly shift with the refractive index change of the detected sample (the sensitivity is \sim 9200 nm/RIU). In addition, the influences of the defect on the sensing characteristics are numerically analyzed based on a scalar diffraction method and a Green tensor technology.

In this paper, the authors propose and demonstrate a joint optical signal-to-noise ratio (OSNR) and nonlinear distortions estimation method. The OSNR is calculated by considering either the link parameters or the correlation operations of the training symbols. And, the nonlinear distortions are extracted from the difference between these two methods. This nonlinear distortion estimation method introduces few complexities and no extra overhead.
ieee_keywords: ['Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical noise', 'Nonlinear distortion', 'Estimation', 'Optical distortion', 'Erbium-doped fiber amplifiers']

abstracts: The inherent system loss of fiber loop ring-down spectroscopy (FLRDS) always varies across environments and is difficult to monitor in real time. We propose a method for real-time monitoring of the inherent system loss to improve the accuracy of FLRDS-based gas sensors. A dual-wavelength tuning of the laser diode can be achieved to acquire the inherent system loss value quickly and conveniently.
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Loss measurement', 'Real-time systems', 'Optical losses', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber amplifiers']
author_keywords: ['Fiber loop ring-down spectroscopy (FLRDS)', 'gas sensors', 'inherent system loss', 'dual-wavelength tuning']

abstracts: A microwave photonic mixer using a frequency doubled local oscillator (LO) is proposed. The +1/−1st-order radio frequency and the +2nd-order LO single sidebands are generated by a dual-polarization dual-parallel Mach-Zehnder modulator, an electrical 90° hybrid coupler and an optical bandpass filter. The output electrical spectrum is quite pure, and the frequency demand of LO signal is reduced. The up and downconversion can be switched to each other by adjusting a DC bias.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Frequency modulation', 'Mixers', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical filters']
author_keywords: ['Fiber optics links and subsystems', 'radio frequency photonics', 'analog optical signal processing.']

abstracts: In this paper, we design, fabricate, and test a PVAc-based benzophenone-8 (PVAcB-8) emission filter to monitor calcium changes in live neurons. We loaded neurons with fura-2 AM, a calcium-sensitive fluorescent dye, which has dual excitation wavelengths at 340 nm, 380 nm with ratiometric emission at 510 nm. To attenuate excitation wavelengths in the UV region and transmit emission light at 510 nm, benzophenone-8 absorption dye was selected as it exhibits high attenuation across 300 to 400 nm. Measurements on the PVAcB-8 filter revealed an attenuation of approximately two and a half orders of magnitude, which is sufficient to collect fluorescence signal from fura-2 AM loaded neurons. The PVAcB-8 filter was compared with a commercially available dichroic filter and proven more efficient in fluorescent imaging.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Fluorescence', 'Imaging', 'Calcium', 'Neurons', 'Absorption', 'Fabrication']

abstracts: We consider an industrial internet of things environment, where involves multiple production factors, such as automatic guided vehicles (AGVs), people, container, etc. A deep learning model is presented for multi-target recognition, where the training data is shadow image formed by the nonuniform illumination of LED lighting source. Three shadow models of typical shapes are constructed to describe the shadows at different positions. The performance of the optimal VGG-16-based Faster-RCNN model is analyzed in view of the recognition accuracy and speed, and it is proved that recognizing three, four, and five types of objects, the mean average precision is 93%, 94.8%, and 92.6%, respectively. To enhance the generalization performance, the optimal Faster-RCNN is combined with the motion state of objects and the corresponding threshold. Simulation results show that the proposed deep learning model obtains significant performance gains to reduce missed and false detection.
ieee_keywords: ['Target recognition', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Industrial Internet of Things', 'Optical transmitters', 'Lighting', 'Shape', 'Deep learning']
author_keywords: ['Visible light', 'deep learning', 'supervised learning', 'industrial internet of things', 'moving objects']

abstracts: We propose and experimentally demonstrate a reflective semiconductor optical amplifier (RSOA)-based Mach-Zehnder interferometer structure for generating high-order ultrawideband (UWB) signals. First, low-order UWB signals are generated by controlling the bias current of the RSOA. To convert the generated low-order UWB signals to high-order UWB signals, the polarization overlaying technique is used in an interferometer structure. The generated high-order UWB signals well satisfy Federal Communications Commission spectral regulations, and the interference with GPS band at 1.57542 GHz is suppressed.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave filters', 'Optical attenuators', 'Photonics', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber filters', 'Optical pulses']

abstracts: A rigorous circuit model for the simulation of large-scale photonic integrated circuit (PIC) is proposed and validated. Different from the conventional circuit theory, both guided and radiation fields are taken into consideration in the circuit model. A PIC of arbitrary size and complexity is partitioned into a collection of basic circuit elements interconnected via physical and virtual ports. The model parameters describing the terminal properties of the circuit elements are extracted by numerical techniques for photonic device simulation such as FDTD method. The performance of the entire PIC can be simulated by conventional circuit simulation algorithms based on the complex scattering matrix formalism. In contrast with the existing numerical simulation techniques, the circuit model and the simulation methodology are more flexible, efficient, and scalable for the analysis of large-scale PICs.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Integrated circuit modeling', 'Photonic integrated circuits', 'Transmission line matrix methods', 'Optical scattering', 'Optical resonators']

abstracts: We propose an “equispaced thickness method” (ETM) to consider the effect of the incoherent thick substrate on the absorption characteristics of thin-film solar cells. We demonstrate that ETM gives the acceptable accuracy without long computation time and facilitates the design of thin-film solar cells, considering the effect of the incoherent thick glass substrate with various light trapping structures.
ieee_keywords: ['Photovoltaic cells', 'Substrates', 'Optical reflection', 'Numerical models', 'Nonhomogeneous media', 'Finite element analysis', 'Computational modeling']

abstracts: A 24-GHz MMW-RoF system based on a direct modulation scheme is proposed. 6 Gbps 64-QAM signal can be transmitted over 20-km fiber and 1-m wireless link under the specific FEC threshold, as well as it can be delivered over 50-km fiber and 1-m wireless transmission. For 100-km long reach, 5 Gbps 32-QAM transmission can be achieved. The experimental results show the MMW signals can be supported via the proposed system with simplified and cost-effective architecture for metro and rural areas.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical transmitters', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Optical fiber networks']

abstracts: 1. Combined the optical single sideband (OSSB) modulation and the integrated tunable dual ring coupled Mach-Zehnder interferometer (DR-MZI) filter, a stopband and passband switchable. microwave photonic filter (MPF) was achieved. 2. We clarified the mechanism of DR-MZI filter and investigated its performances. 3. The bandwidths of MPF can be tuned from 4.54GHz~9.72GHz for the passband MPF and 3.65GHz~6.35GHz for the stopband MPF. And, the filtering frequency can be tuned from 4GHz to 25GHz.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Band-pass filters', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Optical switches', 'Microwave filters', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: This manuscript focus on the wavelength range with a lower imbalance, a 1 × 8 and 1 × 2 splitter with a lower imbalance are reported, which will be always desirable for the application of an optical splitter.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical attenuators', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical waveguides', 'Biomedical optical imaging', 'Optical imaging', 'Wavelength measurement']
author_keywords: ['A 1 × 8 optical power splitter', 'wider wavelength range', 'silicon-on-insulator technology']

abstracts: In this paper, an adaptive control system is employed in a novel implementation technique of the feed forward linearization system for optical analog communication systems' laser transmitter. The adaptive control system applies the Newton trust-region dogleg algorithm, which is a numerical optimization algorithm, to automatically tune the adjustment parameters in the feedforward loops to optimize the feed forward system performance and adapt to process variations. At the end of this paper, significant reductions of over 20 dBm in the third-order inter modulation distortion products have been achieved for operating frequencies from 5.0 to 5.8 GHz.
ieee_keywords: ['Feedforward neural networks', 'Mathematical model', 'Equations', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Diode lasers', 'Linear programming', 'Adaptive control']
author_keywords: ['Adaptive control system', 'feedforward linearization', 'laser transmitter', 'numerical optimization', 'Newton trust-region dogleg']

abstracts: According to the characteristics of the target surface, our method (adaptive depth imaging method) is capable of adaptively changing the dwell time in each pixel. Meanwhile, our method successfully deals with the problem of under-sampling or long acquisition time in the maximum-likelihood based depth estimate and is capable of adaptively taking a clear 3-D image of target in a short acquisition time, which is useful in rapid or power-limited active optical imaging.
ieee_keywords: ['Photonics', 'Imaging', 'Estimation', 'Detectors', 'Reflectivity', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Laser radar']
author_keywords: ['Adaptive depth imaging', 'temporal correlations', 'single-photon detectors', 'photon-counting light detection and ranging system (LIDAR).']

abstracts: 1 A bidirectional ultrafast mode-locked fiber laser at 2 m is established with the output repetition rate more than 100 MHz. 2 It is creatively demonstrated that the spectral purity of pulses in both directions can be simultaneously improved by dispersion management. 3 By adjusting the pump power, the bidirectional repetition frequency difference can be easily and conveniently changed. 4 The stability of the laser is proved to be steady for a long time (>9 h)
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber optics', 'Lasers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Thulium']
author_keywords: ['Ultrafast lasers', 'fiber optics and oscillators', 'thulium-doped fiber', 'infrared and far-infrared lasers.']

abstracts: The presented all-fiber SAs overcome the challenges of high-integration and high-energy for traditional SAs. The implementation of m-scale laser, combining compact structure and multimode cavity, makes on-chip multimode-based mode-locking lasers been focus of attention. The review will provide a valuable reference for researchers in the fields of nonlinear optics, integrated photonics, and optoelectronics. And, it will be exciting to implement intelligent lasers based on NLMMI in the future.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber theory', 'Fiber lasers', 'Laser theory', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Absorption', 'Laser modes', 'Optical fiber polarization']
author_keywords: ['Ultrafast fiber laser', 'saturable absorber', 'nonlinear multimode interference effect', 'high-energy pulse generation', 'optical rogue wave.']

abstracts: A novel all-optical address decoder (AOAD) using an external-cavity-based single-mode Fabry–Pérot laser diode (SMFP-LD) is proposed and demonstrated. The proposed AOAD is the combination of logic gates that are cascaded together to give specific functions of the decoder. The working principles of all logic gates are based on the single- and multi-input injection-locking properties of SMFP-LD. The outputs of the proposed AOAD have contrast ratios of above 27 dB in the spectrum domain, clear waveforms, and clear eyes diagrams with good BER at the data rate of 10 Gb/s. The proposed AOAD has several advantages such as a simple and cascadable structure, low cost, and low bias current (below 19 mA) compared with other optical technologies.
ieee_keywords: ['Fabry-Perot', 'Logic gates', 'Decoding', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical filters', 'Bit error rate']
author_keywords: ['All-optical address decoder (AOAD)', 'injection locking', 'single-mode Fabry–Pérot laser diode (SMFP-LD)', 'optical processing']

abstracts: We developed an alternative configuration of simplified Brillouin optical correlation-domain reflectometry, which can overcome the drawbacks of the original configuration. This system uses, as reference light, the light that is Fresnel reflected at a partial reflection point artificially produced near an optical circulator. We show that the influence of the zeroth correlation peak fixed at the partial reflection point can be suppressed by replacing the nearby fibers with other fibers having different Brillouin frequency shift values (here, multimode fibers are used). Finally, we demonstrate a distributed measurement for detecting a 1.46-m-long strained section with a high signal-to-noise (SN) ratio.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Scattering', 'Optical reflection', 'Correlation', 'Spatial resolution']
author_keywords: ['Brillouin scattering', 'distributed measurement', 'optical fiber sensors', 'strain sensing', 'temperature sensing']

abstracts: An equivalent-asymmetric coupling coefficient (EACC) distributed feedback laser (DFB) semiconductor laser with equivalent-half apodization grating (EHAG) structure is proposed and experimentally demonstrated for the first time; the EHAG profile is equivalently realized by linearly changing the duty cycle of a sampled Bragg grating along the one half cavity, while that of the other half cavity is kept uniform. Compared with the equivalent-symmetric coupling coefficient DFB laser, the simulated intensity distribution of the EACC DFB laser shows that the light power is concentrated not only on near the phase-shift region and that the power at the front end is enlarged. Therefore, the longitudinal spatial hole burning may be reduced; the output efficiency and the single-mode stability may be improved. The experimental results show that the output power ratio between the front and rear facets is about 2.17 and the side-mode suppression ratios are over 50 dB when the injection current is in the range from 60 to 200 mA.
ieee_keywords: ['Distributed feedback devices', 'Semiconductor lasers']
author_keywords: ['Asymmetric coupling coefficient', 'semiconductor laser', 'distributed feedback laser', 'single longitudinal mode operation']

abstracts: A new optical fiber twist sensor with temperature compensation mechanism is designed . The main structure of this twist sensor is a torsion perturbation point cascaded with SMS fiber structure. Theresults show that the twist sensor has ability to distinguish the twist direction with sensitivities of 9.5 pm/o and 34.7 pm/oin the range from -100o (CCW) to 140o (CW). Temperature sensitivities of 71.8 pm/oC and 65.2 pm/oC can be obtained at the same dips in the range from 20 oC to 75 oC.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Temperature sensors', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Sensitivity', 'Temperature measurement', 'Interference']

abstracts: The analytical study reveals a sensitivity limit of 1176 nm/RIU and a maximum figure of merit of 5070 for nanobeam cavity based biosensors due to the absorption of light near 1550 nm wavelength. It is possible to design biosensors with DL of 4 × 10-6 RIU, insertion loss of -30 dB, and length less than 40 periods for both air mode and dielectric mode. These results would be conducive to clarification of the confusion on the priority of air mode and dielectric mode in designing these sensors.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Sensors', 'Absorption', 'Q-factor', 'Photonic crystals', 'Sensitivity', 'Refractive index']

abstracts: 270/290/330 nm AlGaN-based deep UV LEDs have been fabricated to investigate the phyical mechanisms in the UV LEDs with high Al conten, and 2-D numerical simulate is employed to study the optoelectronic properties of the deep UV LEDs.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Aluminum gallium nitride', 'Wide band gap semiconductors', 'Quantum well devices', 'Mathematical model', 'Power generation', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: We demonstrate experimentally a simple technique to measure the wavelength-dependent effective refractive index of a waveguide utilizing integrated Bragg grating structures. A broadband measurement of the Bragg wavelengths yields the effective index of the waveguide and, thus, an accurate total dispersion relationship. An empirical calculation of the waveguide component of the dispersion yields both the waveguide and material dispersion components of the measured total dispersion. The technique allows direct measurement of the effective index of the waveguide and yields a zero dispersion wavelength at 1220.5 nm in our silica-on-silicon platform. Importantly, inclusion of second-order Bragg reflections improves the accuracy of modal refractive index for near-visible wavelengths.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Dispersion', 'Wavelength measurement', 'Indexes', 'Bragg gratings', 'Gratings', 'Materials']

abstracts: We designed a magnetic field sensor based on a Sagnac interferometer using a magnetic fluid-filled birefringent photonic crystal fiber (MF-BPCF). The following are the highlights of this paper. 1.As the magnetic field was perpendicular to the BF-BPCF, the magnetic fluid was anisotropic. 2.Both the intensity and direction of the magnetic field could be detected. 3.The measuring sensitivity could be further promoted by making the dip wavelength close to λBg=0.
ieee_keywords: ['Perpendicular magnetic anisotropy', 'Saturation magnetization', 'Sagnac interferometers', 'Magnetic cores', 'Magnetic particles', 'Permittivity']
author_keywords: ['Magnetic field sensor', 'Photonic crystal fiber', 'Magnetic fluid', 'Sagnac interferometer.']

abstracts: We study the small-signal modulation response of symmetry-breaking phase-locked states of twin coupled semiconductor lasers. We show that the extended stability and the varying asymmetry of these modes allow for a rich set of interesting modulation response features, such as sharp resonances and anti-resonances as well as efficient modulation at very high frequencies exceeding the free running relaxation frequencies by orders of magnitude.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplings', 'Phase modulation', 'Frequency modulation', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Laser stability', 'Photonics']
author_keywords: ['Diode lasers', 'semiconductor lasers', 'injection locked lasers', 'ultrafast lasers', 'microwave photonics signal processing']

abstracts: This work presents a novel approach in designing high-throughput, apertureless NSOM probes with enhanced nanofocusing. To our knowledge, this is the first example in the literature of NSOM plasmonic probes capable of exploiting graphene plasmons. Compared to our previous work with silver plasmonic, over three orders of magnitude electric field enhancement is achieved.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Plasmons', 'Probes', 'Optical surface waves', 'Permittivity', 'Surface waves', 'Biomedical optical imaging']

abstracts: We propose an all silicon asymmetric dimer micro-antenna array used as meta-grating to achieve large bending angle and high efficiency for both P- and S- polarized incident wave at 0.3 THz. The geometric structure of the dimer consisting of one solid and one hollow pillar was meticulously optimized to realize a large bending angle of 70.2 with the diffraction efficiency of 73.1% and 37.8% for the P- and S- polarizations, used in flat lenses with high numerical aperture or other photonic devices
ieee_keywords: ['Diffraction', 'Silicon', 'Reflection', 'Photonics', 'Substrates', 'Lenses', 'Dielectrics']

abstracts: We propose a new scheme named asymmetrically reconstructed optical OFDM, by making full use of the two positions in each asymmetric signal pair, which makes it possible for reaping diversity gains, as well as better PAPR characteristics. Both the optimal and an efficient linear detection scheme are developed with almost the same performance. The proposed scheme achieves a noticeable gain in terms of both PAPR and BER under various test scenarios.
ieee_keywords: ['Peak to average power ratio', 'Optical pulses', 'Time-domain analysis', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical modulation', 'Bit error rate']
author_keywords: ['Visible light communications (VLC)', 'orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM)', 'pulse amplitude modulated discrete multitone (PAM-DMT)', 'asymmetrically clipped optical OFDM (ACO-OFDM)', 'peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR) reduction']

abstracts: The design of “stretcher–compressor” using aperiodic multilayers (aMLs) for attosecond pulses in the extreme ultraviolet (EUV) region is presented. We use a single-objective temporal optimization method based on a genetic algorithm (GA) to maximize pulse reflection efficiency for a single mirror. Employing this method, we studied the relationships of optimal number of layers, achievable energy reflectivity, and pulse duration. We then apply the findings to a design of an attosecond “stretcher–compressor” configuration with much improved overall throughput for a near-transform-limited attosecond pulse in a multimirror system.
ieee_keywords: ['Chirp', 'Pulse compression methods', 'Reflection', 'Genetic algorithms', 'Reflectivity', 'Ultraviolet sources', 'Pulse shaping methods']

abstracts: We propose a wavelength division multiplexing-carrier-less amplitude/phase modulation-passive optical network (WDM-CAP-PON) downstream with enhanced bandwidth efficiency using low-cost digital Hilbert single-sideband modulation. For each optical subcarrier, there are as many as four 10-Gb/s digital channels carried by a Nyquist subcarrier multiplexing scheme, which can be efficiently generated only using one push-pull Mach-Zehnder modulator (MZM). Compared with the conventional systems with independent optical transmitters and a double-sideband modulation format, the proposed system requires at least four times fewer downlink optical transmitters at the optical line terminal (OLT), which can be translated into savings in cost, power consumption, and footprint, as well as significant mitigation of the power fading effect in fiber transmission.
ieee_keywords: ['Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Optical filters', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: This work reports on the analysis of optoelectronic oscillators (OEO) realized with various kinds of microstructured optical fibers (MOF) as delay lines. More precisely, the thermal dependence of the group delay is measured through the analysis of the thermal variation of the frequency of the OEO and compared with a theoretical model that includes the effect of temperature on refractive index, strains, and deformation. It is shown that, whereas the presence of air in air/silica fibers guiding via modified total internal reflection (M-TIR) has only little interest, it allows a net decrease of the thermal variation of the group delay in the case of hollow core photonic bandgap (HC-PBG) fiber. In addition to the effect of material, we show that this decrease is related to the PBG mechanism itself, which is a property also exploited in a solid-core photonic bandgap (SC-PBG) fiber.
ieee_keywords: ['Delay', 'Silicon compounds', 'Indexes', 'Thermal expansion', 'Thermal stability', 'Refractive index', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: We propose a simple, OSNR-tolerant modulation format identification method for coherent optical fiber communication systems. For different modulation formats, the differential phase and amplitude ratio between adjacent symbols are distributed differently. A monitoring factor R, the product of differential phase distribution ratio and average of amplitude ratio, is defined to distinguish different modulation format. The advantage of using adjacent symbols is that phase noise can be tolerant.
ieee_keywords: ['Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical noise', 'Phase shift keying', 'Phase noise', 'Receivers', 'Histograms']
author_keywords: ['Modulation format identification', 'differential phase distribution ratio', 'amplitude ratio', 'coherent optical communications']

abstracts: With the advanced formulation of new phosphors and latest progress in packaging design, technologies to obtain the higher color quality and healthier white LEDs are investigated. Five characteristics of CRI, color fidelity Rf, color fidelity Rg, continuity of spectrum Cs and blue light hazard ratio Br are combined to better evaluate the high quality LEDs.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Phosphors', 'Color', 'Hazards', 'Standards', 'Packaging']
author_keywords: ['White LEDs', 'high CRI', 'IES TM-30-15', 'blue light hazard', 'circadian rhythm.']

abstracts: Photoacoustic tomography (PAT) is one of the fastest growing biomedical imaging modalities in the last decade. Building on its high scalability and complementary imaging contrast to other mainstream modalities, PAT has gained substantial momentum in both preclinical and clinical studies. In 2013, PAT has grown markedly in both its technological capabilities and biomedical applications. In particular, breakthroughs have been made in super-resolution imaging, deep blood flow measurement, small animal resting state brain mapping, video rate functional human imaging, and human breast imaging. These breakthroughs have either successfully solved long-standing technical issues in PAT or significantly enhanced its imaging capability. This review will summarize state-of-the-art developments in PAT and highlight a few representative achievements of the year 2013.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical imaging', 'Optical sensors', 'Image resolution', 'Optical diffraction', 'Biomedical optical imaging', 'Nonlinear optics']
author_keywords: ['Photoacoustic tomography', 'optical absorption contrast', 'super-resolution', 'blood flow', 'functional human imaging', 'breast imaging', 'small animal imaging']

abstracts: A broadband dispersion compensation scheme based on a 2-Ch phase modulator (2-Ch PM) is proposed and experimentally demonstrated in the long-haul analog optical link. Benefiting from the complementary power fading function for the phase and intensity modulated link, which are simultaneously obtained by using the 2-Ch PM, the broadband and long-reach dispersion compensation is implemented. The experimental results show that the dispersion-induced power fading is greatly mitigated for the radio frequency (RF) signal with a bandwidth up to 18 GHz over 24.45-km single-mode fiber (SMF) transmission. Meanwhile, the system spurious-free dynamic range (SFDR) is improved with a maximum value of 24 at the frequency of 17.5 GHz; the vector signal transmission performance has also been improved.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber communication', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Phase modulation']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'dispersion compensation', 'analog optical link', 'spurious-free dynamic range (SFDR)']

abstracts: Extraordinary optical transmission (EOT) of metallic film perforated by a periodic array of subwavelength holes is significant in photoelectric devices. In this paper, a multilayer structure with periodic nanoslit arrays is proposed to achieve broadband EOT in infrared. The optical transmission properties of such structure are simulated through the finite-element method. Greatly enhanced transmissions over a broad spectral range are observed in near-infrared wavelengths, and many enhanced electric fields occur in the narrower slit. In addition, the effects of structural parameters on transmission properties are also investigated. All these findings could guide the design of devices with broadband-enhanced transmission and high electric-field concentration.
ieee_keywords: ['Arrays', 'Films', 'Electric fields', 'Gold', 'Magnetic resonance', 'Broadband communication']

abstracts: This work proposes a wireless nanolink with broadband characteristics. The transmitter and receiver are composed by broadband dipole-loop linear antennas, which are simpler to design and fabricate than other antennas with complex geometries. This kind of nanolink could be used as a simple and practical solution to realize efficient broadband wireless nanolink. One application of this nanolink, for example, is in wireless interconnection between photonics devices in a nanophotonic circuit.
ieee_keywords: ['Dipole antennas', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical receivers', 'Transmitting antennas', 'Wireless communication', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical diffraction']
author_keywords: ['Wireless optical nanolink', 'plasmonic nanoantennas', 'broadband dipole-loop antennas', 'method of moments']

abstracts: In cellular communications, the feasibility to employ FSO technology in order to carry signals used in wireless standards, e.g. CDMA, takes on a special importance in case fiber installation is prohibited. In the open technical literature there appeared some works on CDMA FSO signals but they mainly focused on the uplink direction. Here, we investigate the performance of CDMA FSO systems for first time including both directions. Atmospheric turbulence and pointing error effects are considered.
ieee_keywords: ['Multiaccess communication', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical receivers', 'Adaptive optics', 'Optical propagation']
author_keywords: ['Radio on FSO (RoFSO)', 'code division multiple access (CDMA)', 'atmospheric turbulence', 'nonzero boresight pointing errors (PEs).']

abstracts: In this paper, we propose a novel ultrafast laser with nanostructure CH 3 NH 3 PbI 3 nanorods, yielding a higher modulation depth and lower optical loss. Our experiment is performed through nanopatterned CH 3 NH 3 PbI 3 rods and an all-solid-state passive mode-locked laser system. The prepared nanoarray CH 3 NH 3 PbI 3 perovskite exhibits a modulation depth of 8.1% under a saturation intensity of 9.53 MW/cm 2 . By applying the CH 3 NH 3 PbI 3 nanoarray as a saturable absorber in the ultrafast 1064-nm laser system, a mode-locked pulse with a 30-ps pulse width and an 87.3-MHz repetition rate is achieved. A maximum output power of 542 mW was measured, under an absorption pump power of 5.4 W. With the new structured CH 3 NH 3 PbI 3 , our experiment verifies a new method in ultrafast lasers with low light loss, which potentially uncovers an avenue to develop ultrafast lasers.
ieee_keywords: ['Perovskites', 'Optical films', 'Optical saturation', 'Absorption', 'Optical reflection', 'Optical pulses', 'Laser mode locking']

abstracts: The amount of scientific data to be transmitted from deep-space probes is very limited due to radio-frequency (RF) communications constraints. Free-space optical communication can alleviate this bottleneck, increasing data rate while reducing weight, mass, and power of communication onboard equipment. Nevertheless, optimizing the power delivery from the spacecraft to Earth is needed. In RF communications, the strategy has been to increase the aperture of ground terminals. Free-space optical communications can also follow it, as they share the limitation of low power received on Earth. As the cost of big telescopes increases exponentially with aperture, new ideas are required to maximize the aperture-to-cost ratio. This paper explores the feasibility of using the telescopes of the future Cherenkov Telescope Array as optical communication ground stations. Ground-based gamma-ray astronomy has the same power limitation; hence, Cherenkov telescopes are designed to maximize the receiver's aperture with minimum cost and some relaxed requirements. Both the critical issues of the reutilization and possible adaptations of the telescopes to optimize them for communications, as well as telescope simulations and numerical computations of several link budgets applied to worst-case scenarios, are discussed, concluding that the proposal is technically feasible and would bring important cost reductions and performance improvements compared with current designs for deep-space optical ground stations.
ieee_keywords: ['Telescopes', 'Optical imaging', 'Mirrors', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Optical receivers', 'Reflectivity', 'Optical reflection']

abstracts: Single-mode operation of Fabry-Perot quantum cascade (QC) lasers is achieved through the systematic shortening of the cavity length from 764 to 110 μm. The increased mirror loss is mitigated using highly reflective (HR) metallic facet coatings (R >; 95%). Ultrashort cavity QC lasers operate single mode with the best device having a mode-hop free current tuning range of 3.44 cm -1 . Using combined heat-sink temperature and current tuning, the largest single-mode tuning range attained was 8.56 cm -1 . The heat dissipation of a 110-μm ultrashort cavity QC laser is 0.23 W at 80 K and 0.43 W at 150 K. With a 500-μm cavity and both facets HR coated with reflectivities of ~95% and 75%, room-temperature continuous wave operation is realized with heat dissipation of 1.2-1.7 W.
ieee_keywords: ['Quantum cascade lasers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Laser modes', 'Doping', 'Gain', 'Tuning', 'Waveguide lasers']

abstracts: We characterize the frequency response of channel-interleaved photonic analog-to-digital converters (CI-PADCs) theoretically and experimentally. The CI-PADC is composed of a photonic frontend for photonic sampling and an electronic backend for quantization. The photonic frontend includes a photonic sampling pulse generator for directly high-speed sampling and an optical time-division demultiplexer (OTDM) for channel demultiplexing. It is found that the frequency response of the CI-PADC is influenced by both the photonic sampling pulses and the OTDM, of which the combined impact can be characterized through demultiplexed pulse trains. First, the frequency response can be divided into multiple frequency intervals and the range of the frequency interval equals the repetition rate of demultiplexed pulse trains. Second, the analog bandwidth of the CI-PADC is determined by the optical spectral bandwidth of demultiplexed pulse trains which is broadened in the OTDM. Further, the effect of the OTDM is essential for enlarging the analog bandwidth of the CI-PADC employing the photonic sampling pulses with limited optical spectral bandwidth.
ieee_keywords: ['Bandwidth', 'Frequency response', 'Optical pulses', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Microwave photonics', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical signal processing']

abstracts: We present a novel approach for real-time chromatic-dispersion (CD) monitoring using a Kerr phase-interrogator. CD induces a differential phase shift between two sinusoidal signals carried by two different wavelengths. A Kerr phase-interrogator converts the differential phase shift into power variation, and CD monitoring is achieved by measurement of the power variation in real time. A CD monitor with a resolution of 0.196 ps/nm is experimentally demonstrated. The high sensitivity and fast response of this CD monitoring approach opens the way for novel sensing applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Monitoring', 'Optical polarization', 'Power measurement', 'Time measurement', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical modulation', 'Real-time systems']
author_keywords: ['Nonlinear', 'Kerr effect', 'Fiber non-linear optics', 'Microwave photonics', 'Microwave photonics signal processing']

abstracts: We examine the influence of the optoelectronic feedback on the collinear acousto-optic (AO) filtration characteristics in this paper. It is shown that choosing the feedback parameters it is possible to enhance significantly the AO collinear filter spectral resolution and contrast. The difference of this paper from the previous ones devoted to the examination of the similar systems is that here we examine how feedback affects exactly the AO filtration characteristics
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Optical feedback', 'Optical polarization', 'Laser beams', 'Crystals', 'Polarization', 'Optical beams']
author_keywords: ['Acousto-optic interaction', 'collinear acousto-optic filtration', 'optoelectronic feedback', 'transmission function', 'diffraction efficiency.']

abstracts: The authors Wang Xin, et al., (IEEE Photonics Journal Vol. 9, N0. 3, 2017; https://doi.org/10.1109/JPHOT.2017.2700056) have proposed an Ultrabroadband Metamaterial Microwave Absorber. The designed structure is polarazation converter because (1) anisotropic geometry, (2) high cross polarization reflection
ieee_keywords: ['Metamaterials', 'Microwave photonics', 'Absorption', 'Geometry', 'Resonant frequency', 'Broadband communication']

abstracts: An ultra-compact and broadband silicon nitride edge-coupler that enables high coupling efficiency has been proposed and demonstrated by concatenating short tapers in four stages. Each taper was determined by exploring the taper angle, leading to a small footprint as well as a high coupling efficiency. It attained a coupling efficiency of 92% at a wavelength of 1550 nm and >90% over the C and L bands. The proposed coupler is anticipated to facilitate high-density integration on Si3N4 platform.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber couplers', 'Couplers', 'Silicon nitride', 'Optical fiber devices', 'Integrated optics']

abstracts: In this paper, we experimentally demonstrate a CMOS-compatible polarization beam splitter. The work is motivated by a need for a (i) broadband PBS that is (ii) compact yet (iii) fabrication tolerant. We have been able to achieve these goals in our design through a unique combination of an angled MMI with wedges and tapers. We also characterized its response to 72 variations in parameter dimensions and confirmed its fabrication tolerance. The extinction ratio was over 11dB in the C-band.
ieee_keywords: ['Interference', 'Fabrication', 'Silicon', 'Optical waveguides', 'Geometry', 'Performance evaluation', 'Indexes']

abstracts: We present an investigation of the effect of pumping wavelength on the threshold of transverse mode instability (TMI) in high-power ytterbium-doped fiber laser. By using a fiber laser amplifier with a bi-directional pumping structure, we obtain the TMI thresholds under wavelength-stabilized and non-wavelength-stabilized 976 nm laser diodes (LDs) pumping scheme. The results show that the non-wavelength-stabilized LD pump has a higher TMI threshold compared to the wavelength-stabilized LD pump. By optimizing the operating current of the non-wavelength-stabilized 976 nm LD, a ∼4kW output laser with near single-mode beam quality (M 2 ∼1.3) is achieved, with a slope efficiency of ∼84.4%. The analysis yields that when the pumping wavelength deviates from the 976 nm peak, the TMI threshold can be increased. This reveals that optimizing pump source wavelength has great potential for suppressing TMI effect in the power scaling of fiber lasers.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser excitation', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Fiber lasers', 'Pump lasers', 'Laser beams', 'Power lasers', 'Power generation']

abstracts: Signal depletion is currently the limiting factor for imaging depth at the 1700-nm window in MPM. Thus, efficient signal detection is an effective means to further boost imaging depth. GaAsP and GaAs PMTs are commonly used for signal detection. Here, we demonstrate a comparison investigation of signal detection of a GaAsP and a GaAs PMT for several modalities of MPM at the 1700 nm. Our results clearly indicate which PMT should be used for which imaging modality.
ieee_keywords: ['Gallium arsenide', 'Microscopy', 'Signal detection', 'Optical microscopy', 'Mice', 'Voltage control']

abstracts: This paper proposes a dimming control scheme based on constant weight space-time codes (CWSTC) for MIMO-VLC systems and provides a detection algorithm with low complexity. We also derive and analyze the minimum Euclidean distance of the received signal and the run length. The simulation results indicate that the CWSTC scheme has better error performance, higher spectral efficiency, and lower normalized power requirement on the basis of realizing the dimming target.
ieee_keywords: ['Space-time codes', 'Spectral efficiency', 'Simulation', 'Lighting', 'Performance analysis', 'Detection algorithms', 'Visible light communication', 'MIMO communication']
author_keywords: ['Visible light communication (VLC)', 'dimming control', 'multi-input multi-output (MIMO)', 'constant weight space-time codes (CWSTC)']

abstracts: Our continuously tunable and bandwidth variable optical notch and band-pass filters are using cholesteric liquid crystal cells without extra optical components. The band wavelength is spatially tuned from 470 nm to 1000 nm. These tunable filter strategies could make a paved road to wavelength tunable spectroscopic instruments applications in the VIS and NIR spectral range.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Optical polarization', 'Bandwidth', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Optical signal processing', 'Integrated optics']
author_keywords: ['Optical devices', 'optical filter', 'liquid crystal devices', 'photonic crystal filter']

abstracts: RGBN cameras are new-type multispectral imaging devices that can capture visible light and NIR light simultaneously. They produce better image quality in low-light-level conditions but introduce extra color bias. We propose a data generation method for training a CNN for RGBN camera color restoration task.The results show that the CNN model trained with the generated data can achieve better performance with different RGBN sensors than state-of-the-art RGBN color restoration methods.
ieee_keywords: ['Image color analysis', 'Cameras', 'Image restoration', 'Training', 'Sensors', 'Task analysis', 'Open Access']
author_keywords: ['Color restoration', 'near-infrared', 'RGB-NIR camera', 'convolutional neural networks', 'image generation', 'color bias model']

abstracts: We proposed a cost-effective curvature sensor with the advantages of simple fabrication process, low fabrication cost, good repeatability, ultra-high sensitivity (885.62 nm/m-1) and low temperature crosstalk (29 pm/°C). It is simply based on two arc-discharge-induced micro-collapses in silica capillary (inner diameter 5 μm) that is spliced between single mode fibers. Its curvature sensitivity value is almost one order of magnitude higher than that of most reported curvature sensors.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon compounds', 'Splicing', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Interference', 'Sensitivity', 'Fabrication']

abstracts: Compared with 8-QAM and 16-QAM, 12-QAM brings a better compromise between effectiveness and reliability performance. We have experimentally demonstrated 70 Gb/s PDM-12QAM single carrier signal transmission in a MIMO radio-over-fiber system, BER can be achieved as 3.5-10-3 at 10Gbaud which is smaller than hard decision-FEC (HD-FEC) threshold.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical polarization', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical mixing', 'Stimulated emission', 'Wireless communication']
author_keywords: ['12 quadrature amplitude modulation (12-QAM)', 'millimeter wave', 'radio-over-fiber (RoF)', 'multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO)', 'polarization division multiplexing (PDM)', 'optical wireless integration.']

abstracts: We report a novel polarimeter for complete polarization imaging, which is composed of a piece encoded birefringent crystal and a micro-polarizer array. Different with previous, the new design takes advantage of different retardances with different thickness and derives the state of polarization. With the advantages of simple, compact, stable and simultaneous, the presented technique is expected to be used in polarization imaging of moving objects and dynamic process.
ieee_keywords: ['Cameras', 'Liquid crystals', 'Fabrication', 'Polarization', 'Image resolution']

abstracts: We report on the design, modeling, and characterization of apodized comb filters in the silicon-on-insulator platform. These devices are based on sampled gratings, wherein the comb response is generated by a convolution of a regular grating by a predetermined periodic sampling function. We show that dual and complementary apodization of the etch depth in the marks and spaces ensures a near-zero dc index change over the length of the device and avoids the unwanted sidelobes obtained in a single apodized device. Comb filters with a 40-dB side-mode suppression ratio, a 92-GHz clear bandwidth, 200-GHz channel spacing, and a 120-dB/dec rolloff have been theoretically proposed. An experimental demonstration of the fabricated devices is also presented, and the performance is compared with the numerical simulations.
ieee_keywords: ['Gratings', 'Bandwidth', 'Reflectivity', 'Indexes', 'Optical filters', 'Silicon', 'Bragg gratings']

abstracts: In the design of reconfigurable intelligent surfaces (RISs)-aided visible light communication (VLC) systems, most studies have focused on the deployment of mirror arrays and metasurfaces on walls to influence signal propagation and enhance communication performance. This paper provides a new research direction in the design and performance optimization of RIS-aided VLC systems whereby voltage-controlled tunable liquid crystals (LCs) are deployed as part of the VLC receiver. The purpose of the LC RIS is to provide incident light steering and intensity amplification in order to improve the received signal strength and the corresponding achievable data rate. More specifically, an LC RIS-based VLC receiver design is proposed and its operating principles and the channel model for a VLC system with such a receiver are provided. Since the refractive index of the LC RIS plays a critical role in the wave-guiding and light amplification capabilities of this novel receiver, a rate maximization problem is considered to achieve the optimal refractive index and the required voltage to obtain the best light amplification and data rate performances. This communication design problem is a non-convex optimization problem for which a metaheuristic approach is developed based on the sine-cosine algorithm. Simulation results are used to confirm the considerable data rate improvement by the proposed LC RIS-based VLC receiver and optimization algorithm when compared to a VLC receiver without the LC RIS and a baseline scheme, respectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Receivers', 'Visible light communication', 'Refractive index', 'Optical filters', 'Optical variables control', 'Optical refraction', 'Channel models']
author_keywords: ['Reconfigurable intelligent surface', 'visible light communication', 'liquid crystals', 'light amplification', 'metaheuristic']

abstracts: In this paper, we present the design and analysis of an integrated optofluidic ring resonator based on liquid-core hybrid polymer-silicon antiresonant reflecting optical waveguide (h-ARROW). We perform a modal analysis of h-ARROW using the finite-difference method, in order to find the optimized optical configuration, which accomplishes single-mode operation and reduced attenuation losses. An accurate investigation of the bend sections is performed to preserve the single-mode behavior with reduced propagation losses. A hybrid liquid-core multimode interference (MMI) device is used as a coupling element in the ring layout, and three possible MMI configurations are simulated and compared. By properly designing and optimizing each optical element, we demonstrate, by simulations, the possibility to achieve a quality factor up to 4 × 10 4 with the extinction ratio of about 31 dB. Bulk and surface sensing performances of the device are also simulated and discussed.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Optical ring resonators', 'Holography', 'Holographic optical components', 'Optical imaging', 'Attenuation', 'Optical losses']

abstracts: A novel single-polarization photonic crystal fiber wavelength splitter based on hybrid-surface plasmon resonance is proposed. A full-vector finite-element method is applied to analyze the guiding properties. Numerical simulations show that the proposed splitter, which is only several hundred microns in length, gives single polarization in the 1.31- \mu\hbox{m} and 1.55- \mu\hbox{m} bands. The loss of the unwanted polarized mode is 102.6 and 245.0 dB/cm in the two aforementioned communication windows, respectively, and the corresponding insertion loss is as low as 3.5 and 1.7 dB/cm, respectively. Moreover, the dependence of the bandwidth on the fiber length is given, and according to that function, the bandwidth can reach 40 nm (1.31- \mu\hbox{m} band) and 100 nm (1.55- \mu\hbox{m} band) when the fiber length is up to 1 mm. Additionally, the tolerances for a realistic fabrication are analyzed. In the last part, we discuss other methods to deal with an anticrossing phenomenon in detail.
ieee_keywords: ['Gold', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Wires', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber devices']

abstracts: We propose a structure of a superconducting nanowire single photon detector (SNSPD) with a composite cavity. The device exhibits a property of high efficiency and dual broadband. Based on the transmission line theory, a design method has been proposed. Taking A=1310 nm and A=1550 nm as an example, the design method is verified by commercial software FDTD Solutions. The simulation results show that peak values are all larger than 97.5% at both wavelengths.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Impedance', 'Nanowires', 'Structural engineering', 'Broadband communication', 'Transmission line theory', 'Absorption']
author_keywords: ['Superconducting nanowire single photon detector', 'high efficiency', 'dual broadband']

abstracts: We are presenting a novel structure which allows coupling the light from a hybrid vertical-cavity silicon integrated laser (VCSIL) in a SiN waveguide. The presented design provides double functionality of in-plane output coupling and pinning the polarization state of the light generated by the VCSIL. We believe this design can be a game changer for integrated waveguide circuits for life science applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Gratings', 'Optical waveguides', 'Silicon compounds', 'Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Waveguide lasers', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Couplings']

abstracts: The paper is concerned with the development of vibration sensors usable in ultra-high temperature environment. We designed and fabricated a 6H-SiC sapphire-fiber optic vibration sensor in which the Fabry-Perot resonant cavity was constructed employing a 6H-SiC vibration-sensitive element and a sapphire fiber. Desirable performances of the sensor for the measurement of vibration frequency and acceleration from room temperature up to 1200°C were experimentally demonstrated.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature sensors', 'Vibrations', 'Temperature measurement', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical interferometry', 'Optical sensors']
author_keywords: ['6H-SiC', 'ultra-high temperature', 'sapphire fiber vibration sensor', 'Fabry-Perot interferometer', 'laser processing.']

abstracts: This paper proposed a differential intensity modulation refractive index (RI) sensor based on single-mode-no-core-single-mode (SNS) structure cascaded with two fiber Bragg gratings (FBGs). Compared with traditional SNS-FBG structure, this sensor can increase RI sensitivity and effectively diminishes the influence of the input light fluctuation. It also can accomplish temperature self-compensation. Therefore, this sensor is suitable for the actual demand of the RI measurement.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber gratings', 'Band-pass filters', 'Temperature measurement', 'Reflection', 'Optical fiber sensors']
author_keywords: ['Refractive index measurement', 'intensity modulation', 'fiber Bragg grating (FBG)', 'no-core fiber.']

abstracts: We report on the diode-pumped continuous-wave laser operation of a c-cut Nd:YAlO 3 (YAP) laser crystal at various low gain emission wavelengths around 1.1 μm by using a simple and compact linear cavity and a glass etalon. Inserting and tilting the etalon in a particular position, single-wavelength operation at 1099 nm is achieved first, at low pump power, with a maximum output power value of 0.15 W. Then, increasing the pump power leads to dual-wavelength operation at 1079 and 1099 nm with a maximum output power value of 2.28 W and a laser slope efficiency value of about 20%. Further tilting the etalon, dual- and single-wavelength laser operations could be achieved, for the first time to our knowledge, at 1090 and 1106 nm. Single-wavelength laser operations at 1106 and 1090 nm are obtained with maximum output power values of 0.25 and 1.44 W, respectively, and simultaneous dual-wavelength lasing could be obtained with a maximum output power value of 1.89 W and a laser slope efficiency value of nearly 18%.
ieee_keywords: ['Crystals', 'Power generation', 'Laser excitation', 'Cavity resonators', 'Photonic crystals', 'Glass']

abstracts: In this paper, a new method is used to direct generate Ince-Gaussian (IG) modes from a pulsed solid-state microchip laser. By moving a circular aperture horizontally, the gain size in the laser medium is adjusted, and different IG laser modes are obtained successively. The output laser possesses a stable pulse duration of 500-600 ps; at the same time, the repetition frequency varies between 7 and 16 kHz. To our knowledge, this is the first time that IG modes are obtained in the subnanosecond laser domain, which will be helpful for making large-energy high-peak-power devices.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser excitation', 'Laser modes', 'Microchip lasers', 'Pump lasers', 'Power lasers', 'Laser beams', 'Semiconductor lasers']

abstracts: We propose and experimentally demonstrate that, contrary to what was thought up to now, an efficient BB84 operation is feasible using the double phase modulator (PM-PM) configuration in frequency-coded quantum key distribution systems without dispersion compensation. This is achieved by exploiting the chromatic dispersion provided by the fiber linking Alice and Bob. Thus, we refer to this system as dispersion supported or as the DS BB84 PM-PM configuration.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical filters', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Phase modulation']

abstracts: We present a SESAM based dual-operation regime TDFL, including fundamental mode-locking and noise-like pulse regimes. Then a typical two-stage power amplifier is utilized to boost the output power of the TDFL. The amplified signals are utilized to pump a segment of UHNA fiber. In the same system, to the best of our knowledge, cascaded Raman light and supercontinuum generation are realized, respectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber devices', 'Power generation', 'Power amplifiers']

abstracts: The paper builds a foundation for future multimodal optical imaging and integration with CT-based surgical navigation. It has the potential to impact how biophotonics is used for surgical navigation. Real-time dynamic multimodal surgical navigation using optical technologies can be therefore enabled.
ieee_keywords: ['Imaging', 'Surgery', 'Fluorescence', 'Navigation', 'Real-time systems', 'Surfaces', 'Prototypes']

abstracts: We proposed a new approach that generate effective second-order nonlinearity in a silicon waveguide by applying an external static electric field across it. The wavelengths for the phase-matched fundamental wave and the second-harmonic wave are pump-power dependent due to the induced Kerr effect. Our method may enable great flexibility in controlling SHG, and open a door to promising applications in the mid-infrared region, such as electro-optic modulation and low-noise detection.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Silicon', 'Electric fields', 'Optical frequency conversion', 'Optical harmonic generation', 'Nonlinear optics']

abstracts: This work is very important and useful for exploring and developing the novel metal-based reflector, particularly the Ag-based reflector approach, thus facilitating its application in device assembly and incorporation and making it interesting to general readers of the IEEE Photonics Journal.
ieee_keywords: ['Reflectivity', 'Conductivity', 'Substrates', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Fabrication', 'Gallium nitride', 'Electrodes']
author_keywords: ['GaN', 'vertical light-emitting diodes (VLEDs)', 'electroless silver plating (ESP)', 'electron beam (EB) deposition']

abstracts: Fiber Bragg grating based sensors are the most matured field of fiber sensors, normally core mode of the fiber is being used for measurement of strain, temperature and change in refractive index of the surrounding medium. In this paper, we have shown higher order cladding modes can be used for selective chemical and biological sensing applications. A detail numerical investigation is accomplished to study the behavior of higher order cladding modes.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber gratings', 'Sensitivity', 'Optical surface waves', 'Mathematical model', 'Fabrication', 'Gratings']
author_keywords: ['Fiber Bragg grating', 'cladding mode', 'mode transition', 'surface refractive index sensitivity.']

abstracts: In this paper, the numerical simulations and experimental investigations on the evolution of soliton rain in Tm-doped fiber laser were carried out, based on the nonlinear polarization rotation technique. By carefully adjusting the polarization controller in the cavity, the soliton rain phenomenon was observed. The numerical simulation was in consistent with the experi. Our present research work was very meaningful to further investigate the nonlinear dynamics mechanisms of ultrafast fiber laser.
ieee_keywords: ['Solitons', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Cavity resonators', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Laser mode locking', 'Pump lasers']

abstracts: For chip-scale integrated photonics, significant footprint reduction is possible by exploiting the quartic dispersion of a degenerate band edge with quality factors that scale to the fifth power of the number of periods. Here, we report an experimental demonstration of quality factor scaling to the fifth power in a degenerate band edge resonator. Band diagrams with quartic dispersion are extracted from transmission measurements of fabricated devices realized in silicon photonics.
ieee_keywords: ['Dispersion', 'Electric fields', 'Silicon', 'Optical waveguides', 'Q-factor', 'Cavity resonators', 'Photonic band gap']

abstracts: A hybrid baseband, microwave band, and millimeter-wave band optical fiber transport system is proposed and experimentally demonstrated. By properly utilizing the polarization characteristic of a phase-remodulated and polarization-remodulated optical lightwave, the central carrier of the lightwave can be employed to transmit the baseband signal and its first-order and second-order sidebands can be colorlessly transmitted and separated for optical double-frequency and quadruple-frequency RoF applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical polarization', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Passive optical networks', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical filters']
author_keywords: ['Radio over fiber (RoF)', 'phase modulation', 'polarization modulation', 'polarization beam splitter']

abstracts: we propose and experimentally demonstrate a scheme to generate fast physical random bits (PRBs) based on a weak-resonant-cavity Fabry-Perot laser diode (WRC-FPLD) subject to filtered feedback. The high-quality chaotic entropy source with an effective bandwidth over 20 GHz originated from the filtered feedback WRC-FPLD can be obtained, and 240 Gbits/s PRBs, which can pass all the 15 NIST tests and meet the strict criteria of mainstream information-theoretic assessment, have been generated.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Optical feedback', 'Entropy', 'Bandwidth', 'Optical attenuators', 'Chaotic communication', 'Optical polarization']
author_keywords: ['Physical random bit (PRB)', 'weak-resonant-cavity Fabry-Perot laser diode (WRC-FPLD)', 'filtered feedback', 'broadband chaotic entropy source.']

abstracts: Dissipative Kerr solitons (DKS)s offer an integrated platform for broad spectrum coverage, which is suitable for the high sensitivity spectroscopy. However, the large linespacing of the soliton comb limits the spectroscopy detection resolution. We overcome this limitation by modulating the soliton comb lines through an external EOM with a tunable RF source. By locking the pump laser to a reference cavity, the linewidth of the pump laser was compressed from 1.13\:\mathrm{MHz} to 72\:\mathrm{kHz} , leading to the silimar linewidth of comb lines and showing a frequency resolution of hundreds of kHz . Based on the scanned microcomb, we measured the absorption spectra of a gas cell and the high-Q optical modes in the microcavity, with a fast scanning speed of \mathrm{16\,\,\mathrm{GHz/\mu s}} . The scanning comb allows the spectroscopy measurement to cover the whole comb mode spectrum over THz bandwidth. Our setup holds great potential for simple, robust spectroscopy measurement.
ieee_keywords: ['Pump lasers', 'Spectroscopy', 'Optical pumping', 'Microcavities', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Optical solitons', 'RF signals']

abstracts: A femtosecond laser ablated polymer SERS fiber probe with photoreduced deposition of silver nanoparticles is presented. The experiment shows that the Raman signal could be further improved if the fiber end surface is etched with a surface grating structure instead of an ordinarily roughened one. This optimized method may also be useful to construct SERS probes or chips with silica fiber and silicon wafer.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber lasers', 'Surface emitting lasers', 'Surface treatment', 'Rough surfaces', 'Surface roughness', 'Probes', 'Polymers']
author_keywords: ['Femtosecond laser', 'polymer fiber', 'silver nanoparticle', 'surface enhanced Raman scattering (SERS).']

abstracts: Not applicable: This submission does not include, human, or animal research.
ieee_keywords: ['Substrates', 'Surface morphology', 'Lasers', 'Three-dimensional displays', 'Surface treatment', 'Surface roughness', 'Rough surfaces']

abstracts: The disordered structures of Nd,La:SrF2 enable it to possess the unique characteristic of the femtosecond (156-fs pulse) operation and the dual-wavelength picosecond operation (1050.8 and 1059.0 nm) which will be widely used in the coherent THz generation, pump probe experiment, and ultrafast spectroscopy. Importantlyr, the dual operating modes in one laser can be extended to other disordered crystal lasers, which will promote the applications and development of disordered crystals.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser mode locking', 'Crystals', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Tuning', 'Laser excitation', 'Chemical lasers']

abstracts: Fiber-wireless and fiber-IVLLC convergence based on MZM-OEO-BLS to deliver downstream 10-Gb/s/30-GHz MW, 15-Gb/s/50-GHz MMW, 20-Gb/s/60-GHz MMW, and 25-Gb/s/100-GHz MMW data signals and upstream 25-Gb/s BB data stream is proposed. It is the first one that employs MZM-OEO-based BLS to demonstrate a bidirectional fiber-wireless and fiber-IVLLC transmission system. This proposed fiber-wireless and fiber-IVLLC convergence has great potential to provide broadband services.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Optical filters', 'Optical attenuators', 'Amplitude modulation']

abstracts: An amorphous GeSn flexible photodetector with metal-semiconductor-metal structure has been demonstrated for the first time. The amorphous structure provides an abundant choice of fabrication techniques including fabrication at relatively low temperatures. Moreover, it brings the advantages of simple and time efficient fabrication to very low cost, when compared with the fabrication of single crystalline thin films.
ieee_keywords: ['Substrates', 'Photodetectors', 'Metals', 'Fabrication', 'Electrodes', 'Photonics', 'Fingers']

abstracts: 1. Aim at the spectrum fragmentation problem caused by mixed line rate request provision in elastic optical networks; 2. Propose a novel spectrum partition policy by considering the size and arrival rate of requests; 3. Propose a joint first-last-fit spectrum assignment policy; 4. Design a partition selection formulation during the last-fit spectrum assignment; 5. Propose a reconfiguration mechanism of spectrum interference avoidance.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber networks', 'Interference', 'Partitioning algorithms', 'Bandwidth', 'Licenses', 'Frequency selective surfaces', 'Telecommunications']

abstracts: We implement a compact optical frequency standard at the wavelength of 852 nm by the modulation transfer spectroscopy (MTS) technique, using a Faraday laser as the local oscillator and a double-layer cesium vapor cell to provide frequency reference. The vacuum space between the two quartz glass layers of the double-layer atomic vapor cell can effectively suppress the temperature fluctuations inside the internal atomic vapor cell. The influences of probe and pump laser powers, modulation frequency, and vapor cell temperature on the slope of the MTS error signal are measured. Utilizing the self-estimation method, we evaluate the frequency stability of the laser system, which can be up to5.8×10−15/τ−−√at short term, dropping to2.0×10−15at 50 s. This result is obviously superior to that using single-layer vapor cell as the frequency reference. Such an ultrastable laser source can be widely used in the fields of optical metrology and precision measurement.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser stability', 'Frequency modulation', 'Atom lasers', 'Laser transitions', 'Pump lasers', 'Atomic beams', 'Thermal stability']
author_keywords: ['Frequency standard', 'Faraday laser', 'modulation transfer spectroscopy', 'double-layer vapor cell']

abstracts: The combination of polarization-multiplexing (pol-mux) high-order quadrature-amplitude-modulation (QAM) format and non-data-aided (NDA) channel equalization largely enhances the spectral efficiency of the coherent optical systems. In this paper, we present a two-stage frequency-domain equalization method for long-haul coherent pol-mux NDA system with 16-QAM modulation format. Chromatic dispersion (CD) is blindly estimated and compensated in the first stage of the equalizer, while multimodulus-algorithm-assisted decision-directed multimodulus algorithm (MMA-DDMA) is designed for the second stage to further enhance the equalization performance. The proposed algorithms are experimentally demonstrated in a 80-Gb/s coherent 16-QAM system over 800-km fiber transmission and 30-ps mean differential group delay to achieve wide-range precise CD estimation and better equalization performance compared with conventional adaptive algorithms.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical receivers', 'Blind equalizers', 'Optical filters']

abstracts: We report an 18-core multicore photonic crystal fiber (PCF) amplification system delivering about 110-W laser pulses of sub-100-fs duration. We obtain high average power and sub-100-fs pulses simultaneously in this experiment only by one-stage nonlinear amplification. This is the first time the mode instability in multicore fibers is observed. Different from the mode instability in the single-core large-mode-area PCF, the 18-core multicore fiber has its own manifestation.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Multicore processing', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Oscillators', 'Chirp', 'Power generation']

abstracts: We consider an optical pulse propagating in a tapered photonic crystal fiber (PCF) wherein dispersion as well as nonlinearity varies along the propagation direction. The generalized nonlinear Schrödinger equation aptly models the pulse propagation in such a PCF. The design of the tapered PCF is based on the analytical results, which demand that the dispersion decrease exponentially and the nonlinearity increase exponentially. In this paper, we adopt the generalized projection operator method for deriving the pulse-parameter equations of the Lagrangian variation method and the collective variable method. Besides, we consider another pulse profile called raised cosine (RC), which is aimed at replacing the conventional hyperbolic secant pulse. From the detailed results, we infer that the initial RC pulse evolves into a hyperbolic secant pulse. Further, in order to minimize the input power requirement, we employ the idea of replacing the solid core in the PCF with chloroform. In addition to the single pulse compression, we also investigate the possibility of multisoliton pulse compression. Here, we consider eight chirped hyperbolic secant pulses as input and generate a train of ultrashort pulses at 850 nm based on the chirped multisoliton pulse compression. In a similar way, we extend this pulse compression with eight RC pulses.
ieee_keywords: ['Dispersion', 'Chirp', 'Solitons', 'Equations', 'Optical pulse generation', 'Educational institutions', 'Photonic crystal fibers']

abstracts: Optical channel decorrelation is a key aspect in designing a multi-user visible light communication system. As light-emitting diodes (LEDs) are commonly used for illumination and data transmission in such a system simultaneously, the interference between them is a major problem for suitable modulation schemes. We have proposed to position liquid-crystal (LC) matrix elements in front of the receivers in order to block unwanted light – so effectively acting as filter and reducing the interference. To do so, the appropriate pixels of the LC filter are switched either to a transmissive state or to an opaque state. The selection of the correct pixel patterns is a high-order optimization problem, which makes it challenging for classic algorithms. In this paper, we suggest applying a genetic optimization to find suitable pixel patterns. We combine this kind of receiver-side optimization with conventional convex precoding at the transmitter side in an iterative manner. The overall optimization goal is to maximize the sum rate over all users. To prove the effectiveness, we use a numeric ray-tracing simulation with different settings. Also we analyze the impact of the main parameters for the genetic algorithm.
ieee_keywords: ['Optimization', 'Precoding', 'Receivers', 'Genetics', 'Lighting', 'Reflection', 'Light sources']
author_keywords: ['Visible light communication', 'optical communication', 'free-space optical communication', 'multiple-input multiple-output']

abstracts: Direct integration of mid-infrared III-V materials on silicon (Si) is of great scientific interest. The research community has struggled to achieve this due to the difficulties in growing high quality III-Vs on Si. This paper reports on the successful direct integration of an InAsSb infrared light emitting diode on Si by molecular beam epitaxy. The work presents detailed discussion of epitaxial growth and device characterisation, impacting the next generation of Si-integrated photonic systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Substrates', 'Temperature measurement', 'Photonics', 'Lattices', 'Strain']

abstracts: We propose a dual Fabry-Perot interferometric fiber-optic acoustic sensor based on sandwich-structure composite diaphragm whose phase sensitivity is as high as −121.11dB re 1 rad/250 Hz and whose sensitivity fluctuation is below 0.8dB between 2-250Hz. By combining the dual FP interferometric structure with EF-DCM algorithm, the whole acoustic measurement system achieves large dynamic range, good linearity, wide frequency band and high stability at rather low cost and simple system.
ieee_keywords: ['Demodulation', 'Sensitivity', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Acoustic sensors', 'Titanium', 'Resonant frequency', 'Optical interferometry']
author_keywords: ['Fiber optic acoustic sensor', 'dual Fabry-Perot interferometers', 'sandwich-structure composite diaphragm']

abstracts: Development of mid-IR lasers is essential, since there is a high demand and lack of reliable devices in that spectral region.
