The search for laser materials for ∼2.7 μm laser operation is significant as the severely thermal effects hinder power scaling and high repetition rate operating of the conventional laser materials. This paper provides a promising laser material and for the first time ∼7 kW of peak power in nanosecond's time scale is demonstrated.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser excitation', 'Pump lasers', 'Ceramics', 'Power lasers', 'Power generation', 'Doping']

abstracts: Yb-doped hybrid fiber has been utilized for generation of high intensity femtosecond pulses near 1 μm in all-fiber format. The fiber has anomalous dispersion of 70-400 ps/(nm km) and can operates in the single mode regime. A high Yb-concentration in the core and a relatively large hybrid mode field diameter of 8 μm allowed us to generate 90 fs pulses with peak power of about 10 kW, which is a record for all-fiber (i.e. without external bulk compressors) systems operating near 1 μm.
ieee_keywords: ['Dispersion', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Hybrid power systems', 'Splicing', 'Wavelength measurement', 'Pulse generation', 'Gain']

abstracts: Based on chemical vapor deposition method and a new-designed glass-material-glass sandwich structure, MoS2 saturable absorber with a damage threshold of higher than 0.26 J/cm2 was fabricated. Based on the high damage threshold MoS2 SA, Stable mode-locked Er-doped fiber laser with a maximum output power of 122.77 mW and a largest pulse energy of 130.49 nJ were successively achieved. Our results show remarkable breakthroughs.
ieee_keywords: ['Molybdenum', 'Sulfur', 'Fiber lasers', 'Laser mode locking', 'Absorption', 'Substrates', 'Cavity resonators']
author_keywords: ['Chemical vapor deposition', 'new-designed glass-material-glass sandwich structure', 'high-power mode-locked fiber laser.']

abstracts: We propose a new type of terahertz (THz) photonic crystal fiber (PCF) with high birefringence, low loss, and nearly zero flat dispersion. A comprehensive comparison with previous works has achieved certain advantages. We believe that the proposed PCF structure has potential application value and guiding significance in applications such as terahertz polarization maintaining, communication, and sensing.
ieee_keywords: ['Bending', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Refractive index', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Lattices', 'Finite element analysis', 'Optical losses']

abstracts: We demonstrate image plane holographic microscopy in the soft X-ray (SXR) spectral region, combining the coherent output from a 46.9-nm wavelength table-top SXR laser and two Fresnel zone plates. Phase and amplitude maps of the object are simultaneously obtained from holograms created at the image plane by the superposition of a reference and object beam originating from the zero and first diffraction order of the zone plates. We have used the microscope to record holograms of nanometer-scale periodic Si elbow patterns with 30% absorption contrast at the laser wavelength. The measured phase shift of 2.3 rad accurately predicts the Si dense line step height of 100 nm. The scheme is scalable to shorter wavelengths and allows for simultaneous high spatial and temporal resolution.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Silicon', 'Microscopy', 'Ultraviolet sources', 'Elbow', 'Diffraction']

abstracts: We report the implementation of a full optically-powered 5G new radio (5G NR) fiber-wireless (FiWi) system based on power-over-fiber (PoF) and radio-over-fiber (RoF) technologies. Our approach enables the simultaneous transmission of a 5G NR signal at 3.5 GHz with bandwidth up to 100 MHz and a 2.2-W optical power signal employing dedicated fiber-optics links. The optical-wireless data link consists of a 12.5-km single-mode fiber (SMF) optical fronthaul followed by a 10-m wireless propagation environment, which is the longest wireless reach reported in literature up to now, regarding optically-powered FiWi systems. The proposed PoF system is able to deliver stable electrical power up to 475 mW, by means of using a 100-m multimode fiber (MMF) link, with the purpose of optically powering a 5G NR remote antenna unit (RAU). An overall power transmission efficiency (PTE) of 23.5% is experimentally demonstrated in a real 5G NR system. Furthermore, the FiWi system performance is investigated in accordance with the3rdgeneration partnership project (3GPP) Release 15 requirements, in terms of root mean square error vector magnitude (EVMRMS). The proposed optically-powered 5G NR FiWi system provides 500 Mbit/s throughput withEVMRMSas low as 3.9%, employing 64-quadrature amplitude modulation (QAM) without using optical amplification.
ieee_keywords: ['5G mobile communication', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical network units', 'Adaptive optics', 'Radio frequency', 'Optical signal processing', 'Optical fiber amplifiers']

abstracts: We report improved light transparency over a broad bandwidth in a metal-layered structure with two film-coupled subwavelength non-close-packed plasmonic arrays. Through the introduction of dual ultrathin dielectric spacing layers between the metal layer and the double plasmonic disk arrays, coupling of the input and output effects of light is efficiently enhanced through strong near-field localized plasmon resonances between adjacent plasmonic disks and the near-field plasmon cavity mode in the gap between the double plasmonic arrays and the metal layer. A broad bandwidth of 300 nm with near-unity light transmittance (above 90%) in the optical regime is achieved through the localized plasmon resonances and the symmetrical structure used here. The transparency of this structure is polarization independent and incident angle insensitive, and can be tuned by varying the structure parameters and the dielectric environment. In addition, the period of the plasmonic arrays and the thickness of the nanometer-separated plasmonic structure are less than λ /20 and λ/8, respectively. These values suggest that the proposed structure may have potential applications in deep subwavelength optoelectronic devices, including broadband optically transparent electrodes, highly integrated light input and output components, and plasmonic filters.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Metals', 'Couplings', 'Optical films', 'Bandwidth', 'Optical polarization']
author_keywords: ['Surface plasmon', 'plasmonic array', 'subwavelength metal structure', 'optical transparency', 'hybridization mode']

abstracts: We have presented an improved three-intensity decoy-state MDI-QKD method with uncharacterized sources by employing WCS. We demonstrate that our present method can exhibit significant enhanced performance in both the final key generation rate and the secure transmission distance than the former work. Present work requires less assumption on experimental conditions, which, however, can still present very good performance and can be realized with current technology.
ieee_keywords: ['Encoding', 'Protocols', 'Phase modulation', 'Error analysis', 'Manganese', 'Security', 'Numerical simulation']

abstracts: AlGaN-based deep ultraviolet light emitting diodes (DUV LEDs) have more and more potential application while limited its low external quantum efficiency. By simulations, we proposed the novel LED structure for optimizing the internal quantum efficiency and investigated the underlying mechanism. The super-lattice structure last barrier can replace the common LB to achieved the effect of relieve the electron leakage and improve the hole injection, then enhance the performance of DUV LED.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Charge carrier processes', 'Radiative recombination', 'Aluminum gallium nitride', 'Wide band gap semiconductors', 'Aluminum nitride', 'III-V semiconductor materials']
author_keywords: ['Super-lattice last barrier', 'ultraviolet light-emitting diode', 'efficiency droop alleviation.']

abstracts: This work is the first to develop an optical model of side-polished fiber surface topography and could play an important role in guiding the design and manufacture of SPF SPR sensors.
ieee_keywords: ['Surface topography', 'Optical surface waves', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Rough surfaces', 'Surface roughness', 'Surface waves', 'Abrasives']

abstracts: The initial pointing unit of the line of sight (LOS) operating in the open-loop mode is an important part of the space laser communication system. This paper proposes to apply the EKF technology to the LOS initial pointing system, and completes the modeling. In the demonstration experiment of the dynamic laser communication (airship to ship, aircraft to aircraft), the performance of the LOS initial pointing system is verified, and the unfiltered and filtered results are compared and analyzed.
ieee_keywords: ['Lasers', 'Communication systems', 'Testing', 'Kalman filters', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Real-time systems', 'Global Positioning System']
author_keywords: ['Dynamic laser communication system', 'line of sight', 'initial pointing', 'filed of uncertainty', 'extended Kalman filter.']

abstracts: In this paper, we use injection locking with negative wavelength detuning in SMFP-LD for demonstrating our innovation on (1) generating millimeter wave, simultaneous microwave and millimeter wave, and microwave using SMFP-LD with a single external beam injection, (2) analyzing the effect of negative wavelength detuning, injected beam power, wavelength detuning in different side modes for generating RF signals, and (3) multi-spectrum frequency hopping.
ieee_keywords: ['Particle beam injection', 'Laser beams', 'Injection-locked oscillators', 'Masers', 'Microwave photonics', 'RF signals', 'Semiconductor lasers']

abstracts: WDM passive optical networks (PON) are the ultimate form of next-generation PON (NG-PON) in response the rise of internet demand. To that end, confined semiconductor lasers, i.e. mode-locked quantum dash/dot (QD), are attractive as single sources, but limited to the C-band. One outlook for NG-PON is extending the bandwidth from C- to the L-band. We demonstrate the first WDM transmission in the L-band using a single source, and first WDM demonstration over a QD laser in the L-band at 192 Gbits/s
ieee_keywords: ['Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Optical fibers', 'L-band', 'Optical attenuators', 'Stimulated emission', 'Optical amplifiers']

abstracts: In this paper, we investigate the linear and nonlinear photoabsorption processes in the conduction-band-confined levels of a singly charged ZnO quantum dot (QD) surrounded by HfO 2 and AlN matrices. We also investigate the photoelectric process in which the conduction band electron ejects from the dot to the vacuum. We use the effective mass approximation with a finite barrier height at the dot-matrix interface. We consider the self-energy of the electron in the dot and the local field effect. The electromagnetic interaction of the incident radiation with the electron in the dot is considered in the electric dipole plus quadrupole approximation. Results for the photoabsorption coefficient and the photoelectric process are presented for different dot sizes and different intensities of incident radiation. It is found that the inclusion of the quadrupole effect reveals new photoabsorption peaks in the absorption spectra. Both the photoabsorption and photoelectric processes significantly depend on the dot size and the surrounding matrix. The change in the intensity of the incident radiation significantly influences the nonlinear photoabsorption. The photoabsorption coefficient and the photoelectric cross sections are found to be relatively higher for the ZnO QD embedded in the high-dielectric constant matrix HfO 2 as compared with the lower-dielectric constant AlN matrix.
ieee_keywords: ['Zinc oxide', 'Hafnium compounds', 'III-V semiconductor materials', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Transmission line matrix methods', 'Optical polarization']
author_keywords: ['Light-material interactions', 'quantum dots', 'nanostructures', 'nonlinear optical effects in semiconductors']

abstracts: The effects of axial strain on beating frequency from a short cavity polarization-maintaining erbium-doped fiber (PM-EDF) based distributed Bragg reflector (DBR) laser were investigated theoretically and experimentally for the first time. This type of single-mode DBR fiber laser based ultrasensitive sensor has been extensively developed for measuring kinds of measurands, but the cross-sensitivity of axial strain was usually ignored. A DBR fiber laser with an effective cavity length of \sim1 cm formed by a pair of FBGs written on a PM-EDF was fabricated for demonstration. This laser operated in dual-polarization single-longitudinal mode stably. The frequency of the beating signal generated by two orthogonal polarizations was found to be proportional to the axial strain applied on the cavity. A linear strain sensitivity of 0.640 \hbox{GHz/m}\varepsilonwas obtained, with a fiber birefringence of around 8.65e-5. For the fiber with larger birefringence, the sensitivity to the axial strain will be increased. So the effects of axial strain should be considered when the structure is utilized as a high-resolution sensor, especially for a polarization-maintaining system. The single-mode DBR laser made of high birefringent fibers also has a potential application in frequency tunable microwave generation.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Strain', 'Cavity resonators', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors']
author_keywords: ['Fiber lasers', 'fiber gratings', 'sensors', 'microwave generation', 'distributed Bragg reflector (DBR)', 'polarization-maintaining erbium-doped fiber (PM-EDF)']

abstracts: The proposed microwave image reject mixer has large operating bandwidth and high conversion efficiency. It also owns good image rejection ratio (IRR). Its operating bandwidth ranges from 5 GHz to 40 GHz and the image rejection ratio (IRR) of the system can reach 40 dB. The conversion efficiency of the system is -9 dB which has an improvement of 19 dB compared with the conventional photonic microwave mixer. The system is desirable for future wideband receiver systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical polarization', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Photonics', 'Microwave imaging']
author_keywords: ['Image rejection mixer (IRM)', 'Polarization-division multiplexing Mach–Zehnder modulator (PDM-MZM)', 'photonic microwave phase shifter', 'high conversion efficiency.']

abstracts: Cascaded Brillouin random fiber lasers (BRFLs) with laser linewidth compression were theoretically and experimentally demonstrated. Thanks to photon-phonon coupled interplay as well as randomly distributed feedback along silica fibers, the coherent time of cascading BRFL radiation is significantly prolonged whilst the phase noise is further suppressed, albeit with a quantum-noise-induced linewidth narrowing limit. To validate it, the linewidth narrowing ratio in BRFLs, defined as the ratio of the Brillouin pump and its sequent order of Stokes linewidth, was carried out and exhibited a dependence on the Brillouin pump linewidth, which is in good agreement with theoretical predictions. Furthermore, the relative intensity noises of cascading BRFLs were also investigated and discussed.
ieee_keywords: ['Pump lasers', 'Scattering', 'Laser feedback', 'Laser theory', 'Distributed feedback devices', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical pumping']

abstracts: Alternate routing is currently used for routing dynamic traffic in optical networks. However, it greedily allocates routes and contributes in higher network blocking. Adaptive routing can significantly reduce congestion but it is more time consuming and is not suitable for dynamic network operation. We have proposed link congestion aware routing which computes routes offline with an objective to divert paths to the underutilized links. This significantly reduces congestion for dynamic traffic.
ieee_keywords: ['Routing', 'Heuristic algorithms', 'Resource management', 'Bandwidth', 'Signal detection', 'Optical modulation', 'Measurement']
author_keywords: ['Bandwidth blocking probability', 'contiguity constraint', 'continuity constraint', 'elastic optical networks', 'link congestion', 'routing and spectrum allocation']

abstracts: In order to display high-bit resolution images on low-bit resolution displays, bit resolution needs to be reduced. This problem is vital especially for low-cost or small (mobile) devices. To untangle the bit reduction problem, special color quantization algorithms, called dithering, are employed on high-bit resolution images. The dithering process helps to remedy the problem, but it does not help much in terms of storage and transmission of images. To reduce storage needs and lower data transmission, numerous special compression techniques have been proposed in the last several decades. While the well-known compression algorithms, such as gzip, help lower image file sizes, usually, they are not adequate. To improve the compression gain, special compression techniques that take into account structure of image data must be developed. In this paper, we show that, when the pseudo-distance technique (PDT) is used for dithered images, it yields better compression results than GIF and PNG.
ieee_keywords: ['Image coding', 'Image color analysis', 'Indexes', 'Quantization (signal)', 'Optical losses', 'Color', 'Decoding']

abstracts: The experimental detail of a random lasing action from dye-doped nematic liquid crystals (LCs) inside single-core capillaries with a core diameter below 50 μm was investigated. The resonant characteristics, including the number of emission spikes, the full width at half maximum (FWHM), and the estimated Q-factor, were shown to depend on the core diameter of a capillary. In contrast with a capillary with a larger core diameter and having various emission spikes, only three emission spikes were excited from a capillary with a 10-μm core diameter, owing to the smaller effective area of the pump beam. However, the decrease in the amplitude of emission spikes and the broadening of the linewidth accompanying the higher lasing threshold from a capillary with a 50-μm core diameter are attributed to the decrease in the pump fluence and the increase in the scattering loss, respectively. In this paper, a random laser (RL) with the shortest FWHM emission peak of about 0.47 nm and the highest Q-factor of about 1268 was generated from the capillary with a 20-μm core diameter. By means of temperature adjustment, the emission spectra of the RL that is related to the birefringence and alignment ordering of the LC molecules inside a capillary with a 20-μm core diameter can be effectively altered. Our experiments show that the RL, revealing adjustable output emission spectra, can be a promising device in using remote sensing applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser excitation', 'Laser beams', 'Liquid crystals', 'Q-factor', 'Light scattering']
author_keywords: ['Random lasing', 'dye-doped liquid crystals', 'single core capillary', 'recurrent multiple light scattering']

abstracts: Device architecture and design scheme of an N × N scalable electrooptic (EO) routing switch array (RSA) are proposed using electric-field-induced EO polymeric microrings. The basic 2 × 2 /cross/bar EO switching element is optimized under 1550-nm wavelength, and the ring radius is only 13.76 μm with <; 10 -4 dB/cm bending loss. The basic element reveals a free spectral range (FSR) of 17 nm, a switching voltage of 5 V, and response times of 70/140 ps, and the crosstalk under cross and bar states are about -28.8 and -39.9 dB, respectively. Using 2 × 2 switching elements, 4 × 4, 8 × 8, 16 × 16, and 32 × 32 RSAs are presented, under all routing paths, their maximum insertion losses are 2.57, 5.19, 5.99 and 7.59 dB, respectively, and their maximum crosstalk are - 28.7, -28.7, - 26.27 and -25.07 dB, respectively. Universal structure, routing scheme, electrical/optical responses, and dynamic power consumption (PC) of N × N RSA are then demonstrated, and dependence relations between routing performances and the RSA size N are achieved through data fitting. Comparisons with other reported passive/active routers/switches confirm that, due to superiority on fewer rings, picosecond faster response speed, zero static PC, and lower insertion loss and crosstalk, this polymer-based routing scheme can be a good candidate in on-chip optical systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical switches', 'Electrooptical waveguides', 'Routing', 'Polymers']

abstracts: A novel bandpass microwave photonic filter based on injected semiconductor laser with carrier-suppressed single sideband modulation is proposed and verified by a proof-of-concept experiment. The experimental results show that the proposed MPF provides a novel solution to the advancement of MPF in terms of wide-band tunability and reconfigurability.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical feedback', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Distributed feedback devices', 'Masers', 'Optical attenuators', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical modulation']

abstracts: The incorporation of multiplexing techniques used in microwave photonics to quantum key distribution (QKD) systems brings important advantages by enabling the simultaneous and parallel delivery of multiple keys between a central station and different end-users in the context of multipoint access and metropolitan networks, or by providing higher key distribution rates in point to point links by suitably linking the parallel distributed keys. It also allows the coexistence of classical information and QKD channels over a single optical fiber infrastructure. In this paper, we show, for the first time to our knowledge, the successful operation of a two-domain (subcarrier and wavelength division) multiplexed strong reference BB84 QKD system. A four-independent channel QKD system featuring a sifted key rate of 10 kb/s/channel over an 11-km link with quantum bit error rate (QBER)<2% is reported. These results open the way for multi-QKD over optical fiber networks.
ieee_keywords: ['Multiplexing', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Optical transmitters', 'Modulation', 'Optical attenuators', 'Microwave photonics']

abstracts: 1. The scheme realizes the generation of the millimeter-wave signal with tunable frequency multiplication factor (FMF). Millimeter-wave signals with FMFs of 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 can be obtained in this work. 2. The UFBG-based acousto-optic tunable filter is applied in the RoF system. 3. This sch0eme is a simple and cost-effective one. 4. After the link data transmitting through SMF of 25km, the corresponding power penalty is relatively small.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical filters', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical reflection', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Optical modulation']

abstracts: The spot size at which the electric field distribution for higher-order modes in few-mode fibers (FMFs) is approximated by a higher-order Gaussian profile is useful for estimating various transmission characteristics. Although several methods for measuring the field extent of higher-order modes in FMFs have been proposed, there are no reports on how to obtain the spot size. This paper clarifies for the first time how the higher-order Gaussian spot size in FMFs can be obtained.
ieee_keywords: ['Shape', 'Gaussian approximation', 'Numerical simulation', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Chromatic dispersion', 'Backscatter', 'Azimuthal angle']

abstracts: Hybrid AlGaInAs/InP microring lasers with sloped sidewalls coupled to a silicon waveguide are investigated numerically and experimentally. The mode field distribution deviations for the microring resonator with the sloped sidewalls at different tilting angles are simulated by a 3-D finite-difference time-domain technique. Obvious enhancements of output coupling to the silicon waveguide and the active region optical confinement factor can be expected as the microresonator has a trapezoidal shape. A hybrid microring laser with a radius of 19 μm and a width of 2 μm is fabricated with the laser wafer bonded on a silicon-on-insulator wafer using the divinylsiloxane-benzocyclobutene (DVS-BCB) adhesive bonding technique. Continuous-wave electrically injected operation is realized at a tilting angle of -6° with the threshold currents of 7.8 and 9 mA at 12 °C and 22 °C. In addition, for a hybrid microring laser with a radius of 29 μm and a ring width of 2.5 μm, continuous-wave electrical operation up to 50 °C is achieved.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Optical resonators', 'Silicon', 'Couplings', 'Waveguide lasers', 'Threshold current', 'Q-factor']

abstracts: We present a rigorous electrical and optical analysis of a strained and graded base SiGe Heterojunction Bipolar Transistor (HBT) electrooptic (EO) modulator. In this paper, we propose a 2-D model for a graded base SiGe HBT structure that is capable of operating at a data bit rate of 80 Gbit/s or higher. In this structure, apart from a polysilicon/monosilicon emitter(Width=0.12 μm)and a strained SiGe graded base(Depth=40 nm), a selectively implanted collector (SIC)(Depth=0.6 μm)is introduced. Furthermore, the terminal characteristics of this new device modeled using MEDICI are closely compared with the SiGe HBT in the IBM production line, suggesting the possibility of fast deployment of the EO modulator using established commercial processing. At a subcollector depth of 0.4μmand at a base-emitter swing of 0 to 1.1 V, this model predicts a rise time of 5.1 ps and a fall time of 3.6 ps. Optical simulations predict aπphase shift length(Lπ)of 240.8μmwith an extinction ratio of 7.5 dB at a wavelength of 1.55μm. Additionally, the tradeoff between the switching speed,Lπand propagation loss with a thinner subcollector is analyzed and reported.

author_keywords: ['Semiconductor device modeling', 'integrated optics', 'optical modulation', 'plasma dispersion effect', 'SiGe', 'Heterojunction Bipolar Transistors (HBTs)']

abstracts: We theoretically demonstrate that planar rectangular dielectric waveguides can support in-plane transmission of optical vortex modes, carrying orbital angular momentum. As compared with the existing works, in our manuscript this problem is investigated for the general case of the azimuthal order of the mode. We believe that our results will broaden the current understanding of the problem and can pave the way towards novel applications of optical vortices based on photonic integrated circuits.

abstracts: A set of rate equations is proposed to describe the diffraction efficiency of PQ-PMMA VBG recorded by a 532 nm laser. This work provides methods to obtain demanded parameters of a homemade reflective-type PQ-PMMA VBG, and a series of experiments validated that the diffraction efficiency of reflective-type PQ-PMMA VBG can be predicted. Based on the model, an intermittent exposure method is proposed to reach higher diffraction efficiency and has been successfully confirmed by the experiment.

abstracts: We propose a graph-based modulation format identification (MFI) scheme, which utilizes a uniform grid to capture the trajectory of the adjacent received symbols for establishing the adjacent matrix in the two-dimensional Stokes plane. The eigenvector associated with the largest eigenvalue of the corresponding adjacent matrix is selected as the discriminated-feature to identify different modulation formats. The proposed MFI scheme only need one time training process previously or real-time.
ieee_keywords: ['Modulation', 'Licenses', 'Optical transmitters', 'Frequency modulation', 'Trajectory', 'Timing', 'Quadrature amplitude modulation']

abstracts: We propose a continuous-variable quantum key distribution (CVQKD) scheme at terahertz (THz) bands based on multicarrier multiplexing (MCM) technology. In this scheme, multiple Gaussian modulated subcarriers are coupled to transmit multipath superposed thermal Gaussian states. At the receiver, optical discrete Fourier transform (ODFT) is used to demultiplex the received subcarriers, and the keys can be generated in parallel by homodyne detection and post processing. We analyze the security of the scheme against the optimal collective Gaussian attack under indoor environment and in inter-satellite links respectively. Results indicate that by using MCM technology, each subchannel may be affected by crosstalk, resulting in slight shortening of the maximal transmission distance while the total secret key rate can be greatly increased. We also verify the feasibility of higher key rate and longer distance THz-QKD by using MCM technology in inter-satellite links communication. We expect this work will provide an efficient path to build a global quantum communication network.
ieee_keywords: ['Security', 'Optical receivers', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Quantum key distribution', 'Protocols', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical fiber communication']
author_keywords: ['Multicarrier multiplexing', 'continuous variable', 'quantum key distribution', 'terahertz', 'optical discrete Fourier transform']

abstracts: A new signal transmission technique is proposed and investigated, which introduces a new information-carrying dimension to enable the technique to carry more information bits. The proposed technique outperforms all previously published techniques encoded using similar signal modulation formats.

Multiple-image encryption method based on Hadamard basis patterns and RSA public key cryptography is proposed, which solves the problem of low quality of traditional random illumination patterns and increases the security of the system. In the case of reducing the data storage space, the encryption scheme sets a plurality of light paths to achieve multiple-image encryption

abstracts: Imaging of ocular anterior vasculature over a wide range of depth is very important for the diagnosis of ophthalmic diseases, but challenges remain with existing methods. We propose a vascular enhancement algorithm for OR-PAM, which not only enhances vasculature signals, suppresses noise, but also achieves ~7 times enhancement of the system's imaging depth. With this technique, both morphologic and functional 3D images of the whole rat ocular anterior vasculature were achieved with high quality

(4) Fast scrambling and diffusion methods with NCMM signals c

abstracts: Numerical modeling of multiorder cascaded fluoride glass Raman fiber laser (RFL) employing fiber Bragg gratings (FBGs) is presented. Calculations were compared with the recently reported results, and good agreement was achieved. The model was also used to optimize a fourth-order fluoride glass RFL pumped at 1.9 , which can generate a mid-infrared emission up to 3.36. The influences of launched pump power, fiber length, output coupling, fiber background loss, and insertion loss of FBG on laser performance were investigated. The fiber length of 53.1-85.5 m and reflectivity of output coupler of 0.34-0.51 were recommended to obtain a relative large output power. The calculated maximum output power of 2.96 W with slope efficiency of 19.2% and threshold of 24.7 W was obtained at launched pump power of 40 W. In addition, the strong effects of fiber background loss and insertion losses of FBGs on laser output performance emphasized the importance of development of high quality fiber and fluoride FBG writing technique.

abstracts: Previous works on wireless links on chip regarded channels without elements, while our analysis involves a channel with a waveguide as an obstacle. We show a good agreement between experiments and simulations. Also, we demonstrate that an accurate positioning of both the crossing waveguide and the receiver allows to reduce losses or even to improve the level of the received power. Thus, the use of suitable maps, obtained by our parametric analysis, allows for optimized topological choices.

abstracts: In this paper, we propose the orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing-interleaved division multiplexing access (OFDM-IDMA) technique for passive optical networks (PONs). We evaluate the performance of such systems and compare it with the already proposed OFDM-Access (OFDMA) technique by means of the bit error rate versus received power for two different coding schemes and different number of iterations. Results show that OFDM-IDMA technique with an unequal power allocation distribution among the different optical network units (ONUs) offers similar performance to OFDMA when used with a simple convolutional code at an aggregated rate of 4 and 8 Gbits/s. Dynamic bandwidth allocation can be easily implemented with this technique.

The proposed technique enables not only to determine material properties in order to improve the device performance, but also for extending applications to different wavelengths.

abstracts: A novel scheme has been proposed to generate optical frequency comb (OFC) based on a dual-polarization IQ modulator (DPIQM) with double recirculating frequency shifting loops. The most novelty of this scheme is the unique feature of the polarization orthogonalized carrier output of the two loops. Besides, this OFC generator (OFCG) has the advantages of good feasibility, tunability and flexibility which cannot be easily achieved by other methods.

abstracts: Four types of high-Q optical microcavities—disk, 1-D photonic crystal nanobeam, 2-D photonic crystal slab, and 3-D photonic crystal optical microresonators—clad by low-optical-loss electrode media such as indium tin oxide are designed and evaluated by the perturbation theory and 3-D finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) method. The quality (Q) factor is obtained via perturbation theory in which the imaginary part of the cladding material is regarded as a perturbation and confirmed to agree with results from the 3-D FDTD method. Although the studied designs preserve the high-Q factor, they provide the placement of low-loss conductive electrode material proximate to high-Q microcavity modes. Further enhancement of the Q factor is possible by a reduction of the electrode volume. Microlasers based on this study would provide an excellent heat sink and efficient carrier injection into a microcavity mode, thereby resulting in the realization of continuous-wave, room-temperature microlasers with low threshold.
ieee_keywords: ['Q factor', 'Microcavities', 'Indium tin oxide', 'Photonic crystals', 'Materials', 'Permittivity']

However, up to now, multi-context scrubbing method has never been proposed. If the multi-context scrubbing becomes possible, while doing scrubbing operation, function change becomes possible. Space system's performance can be increased drastically. This paper presents a proposal of the world-first multi-context scrubbing. As described in this p

abstracts: In this work, we have demonstrated, for the first time to our knowledge, the fabrication and characterization of ridge waveguides in magneto-optical glasses (Tb3+-doped aluminum borosilicate glasses) by a combination of femtosecond laser ablation and ion implantation. The waveguides have shown good guiding properties, which implies strong potential application for waveguide isolators.

Both quantitative and qualitative comparisons to specialized state-of-art algorithms demonstrate its superiority.

abstracts: This paper is a comprehensive theoretical analysis of the impact of a fiber bend on an OAM mode propagation using the rigorous technique of perturbation theory, illustrated with application to a step-index fiber. The analysis provides deeper insight leading to explicit expressions for bend-induced crosstalk, a critical limiting factor in OAM mode transmissions. Prior work, without such expressions, has depended heavily upon time-consuming numerical techniques like the finite-element solver.

abstracts: The recently proposed digital coherent combining (DCC) technique can provide exceptionally high sensitivity, and thus are of particular interest in the photon-starving free space optical communication (FSOC) systems. In this paper we propose a method to minimize the phase alignment algorithm complexity of the equal gain combining based DCC technique according to the prescribed combining loss. This work is important for the realization of the real time DCC and long reach FSOC system.

abstracts: It is one important topic to generate high quality optical vector millimeter-wave signal by using a simple architecture. We propose and experimentally demonstrate one novel scheme to improve the performance of the vector millimeter-wave signal generated by intensity modulator based on optical carrier suppression. We optimize the phase factor at the transmitter side and make the phase distribution of the Quadrature Phase Shift Keying signal to be symmetrical at the receiver.

abstracts: Photometric optimization for maximizing limited luminous efficacy (LLE) of CCT tunable QD-WLED is developed under CRI and CQS. We show that CCT tunable (2700 K to 6500 K) QD-WLEDs with CRI = 95 and CQS = 93 should use three narrow emission QDs. We show that QD-WLEDs using three real CdTe QDs can realize CCT tunable (2700 K to 6500 K) white-lights with CRIs of 95-96, CQSs of 93-94, and LLEs of 256-272 lm/W. LEs of both QD-WLED and pc-W LED are estimated. The requirements of the overall efficiency of QD film is present if the CCT tunable QD-WLEDs are competitive to the CCT tunable pc-W LEDs.
ieee_keywords: ['Color', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Optimization', 'Image color analysis', 'Rendering (computer graphics)', 'Energy loss', 'Quantum dots']

abstracts: We present an analysis of the recognition performance of 3-D objects reconstructed from digital holograms recorded under photon counting conditions. The digital holograms are computed by applying four-step phase-shifting techniques to interferograms recorded with weak coherent light. Recognition capability is analyzed as a function of the total number of photons by using a maximum-likelihood approach adapted to one-class classification problems. The likelihood is modeled assuming a Gaussian distribution, whose centroid corresponds to the highest value in a mixture of two Gaussian values. The recognition capability is studied both in terms of the axial distance and the lateral position of the reconstructed 3-D object.
ieee_keywords: ['Photonics', 'Object recognition', 'Holography', 'Image reconstruction', 'Phase shifting interferometry', 'Charge coupled devices']
author_keywords: ['Digital holography', 'pattern recognition', 'photon counting imaging', 'three-dimensional image processing']

abstracts: We report a fiber optical parametric amplifier (FOPA) based on a photonic crystal fiber (PCF) with optimized dispersion and nonlinear properties pumped by a mode-locked ytterbium-doped fiber laser. Wavelength-tunable parametric gain bands can be obtained by adjusting the pump wavelength from the anomalous to the normal dispersion regime. By utilizing the PCF-based FOPA, weak signals located in the parametric gain bands can be amplified. Wavelength-tunable picosecond pulses can be generated at the signal and idler wavelengths. A 58-dB maximum gain and a wide gain bandwidth from 999 to 1139 nm have been achieved by pumping near the zero-dispersion wavelength. When the FOPA is pumped at 1062.5 nm in the normal dispersion regime of the PCF, the 974-nm weak continuous-wave signal is significantly amplified, and the idler pulse is generated at 1168 nm.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical amplifiers']

abstracts: The paper describes a scheme that could simultaneously generate multi-frequency phase-coded microwave signal, which can be used in synthetic aperture radar and MIMO radar. The key advantage of the proposed scheme is that it can reduce the complexity of the transmitter and improve the flexibility of the system (i.e. single phase modulator without using any electrical or optical filters).
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'Optical polarization', 'Encoding', 'Phase modulation', 'Masers']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'radar', 'multicarrier phase coding', 'analog optical signal processing.']

abstracts: We propose a novel scheme to realize an instantaneous frequency measurement (IFM) system. Generally for an IFM system, there is a trade-off between measurement bandwidth and measurement resolution. Compared to existing solutions, the proposed IFM in the manuscript can achieve both high resolution and large measurement bandwidth. It is likely to be used in the front end of modern radar warning receivers and electronic warfare systems.

abstracts: We propose a digital chaotic method for physical layer security enhancement based on space-division multiplexing in fiber-optic systems. It enhances the system security by combining the error spreading within space dimension and mode dependent loss which is caused by bending-induced fiber tapping. The eavesdropper cannot recover the original information with the part of the keys or part of the transmitted signals other than taping out a portion of the optical signal in single mode transmission.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Cryptography', 'Chaotic communication', 'Optical fiber networks']

abstracts: Research on free-space optical communications (FSO) is a burgeoning area and physical-layer security of an FSO system is one important aspect. Using beams that carry orbital angular momentum to transmit data through a turbulence channel can both increase reliability and provide a security advantage over eavesdropping. If these beams can be generated with high quality they can potentially increase the security of a FSO system. This paper contributes results to realize secure communications.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Optical receivers', 'Security', 'Optical beams', 'Optical transmitters', 'Zinc', 'Adaptive optics']

abstracts: CO-OFDM has been studied for flexible bandwidth data transmissions for increased network capacities and spectral efficiency (SE). Effect of laser phase noise (PN) on CO-OFDM can be detrimental to the performance. Pilot aided schemes are traditionally used for PN correction but suffer loss of SE. We show improved SE and reach for 16QAM COOFDM transmission over single and multi-channel by proposing pilot-free scheme and demonstrating both numerically and experimentally.

abstracts: A 2-μm-wavelength-band femtosecond pulse laser inscription FBG was experimentally tested. First-order FBG was the inscribed through the polyimide using the Point-by-Point method by focusing the femtosecond laser. A femtosecond paralleled-FBG was inscribed in single-mode fiber through point-by-point method.

abstracts: In most full-duplex radio-over-fiber systems, the RAUs are polarization-sensitive. Thus polarization tracking systems and alignment processes are necessary as the proposed systems are used in practice. This increases the cost of the RAUs and the system latency. In this paper, we solve the polarization-sensitive issue of RAU for RoF systems by reusing polarization-orthogonal light waves for upstream link. Hence, our proposed architecture highly reduces the complexity and the cost of the RAU.

abstracts: The main contribution of our paper is the demonstration of a polarization-diversity 4×4 Si-wire optical switch that does not require any polarization rotators. We believe that this contribution is theoretically and practically relevant because characteristics such as the on-chip loss, PDL, and DGD can be improved by further optimizing the design based on the structural parameters discrepancy between the design and the fabricated devices.

abstracts: We investigated the pulse dynamics in an all normal dispersion Yb-doped fiber laser through the topological insulators (TIs). Through the dark and light Bi2Se3/PVA films with low and high transmittance, the Q-switched pulses and mode-locked pulses were produced, respectively. Besides, the Bi2Se 3 compatible fiber, produced by optical deposition of the nanoplatelets on the end facet of the fiber, can generate more stabilized mode-locked pulses with lower pump threshold.

abstracts: We design a QPSK-TS for monitoring both OSNR and CD in DWDM systems.With the QPSK-TS design, it is allowed to calculate both OSNR and CD from the same set of data samples, which will reduce the sampling data types and save our sampling time.Moreover, if we use the QPSK-TS as time domain pilot signal, the proposed method can be well applied to modern dynamically reconfigurable optical networks.

abstracts: After the general aspects of InAs/InP (100) quantum dots (QDs) regarding the formation of QDs versus quantum dashes, wavelength tuning from telecom to mid-infrared region, and device applications, we discuss our recent progress on the lateral ordering, position, and number control of QDs. Single-layer and stacked linear InAs QD arrays are formed by self-organized anisotropic strain engineering of an InAs/InGaAsP superlattice template on InP (100) with emission wavelength at room temperature in the important 1.55-\mu \hbox{m}telecom wavelength region. Guided and directed self-organized anisotropic strain engineering is demonstrated on shallow- and deep-patterned GaAs (311)B for the formation of complex InGaAs QD arrays and absolute QD position control. The lateral position, distribution, and number control of InAs QDs, down to a single QD, are demonstrated on truncated InP (100) pyramids by selective-area growth with sharp emission at 1.55 \mu\hbox{m}. Submicrometer-scale active–passive integration is established by the lateral regrowth of InP around the pyramids for planarization. Such control over QD formation is the key to future quantum functional nanophotonic devices and integrated circuits operating at the single- and multiple-electron and photon level with controlled interactions.
ieee_keywords: ['Quantum dots', 'Nanoscale devices', 'Indium phosphide', 'Telecommunication control', 'Anisotropic magnetoresistance', 'Capacitive sensors', 'Optical control', 'Photonic integrated circuits', 'Superlattices', 'Temperature']

abstracts: In this paper, an in-band full-duplex (IBFD) wireless communication link based on the radio over fiber (RoF) is proposed. By constructing the Sagnac loop and dual-phase modulation structure, the self-interference signals are eliminated by polarization control.

abstracts: We demonstrate RF arbitrary waveform generation based on microwave photonic filtering. We use four-wave mixing in a silicon nanowire to increase the number of taps in an N-tap microwave photonic filter (MPF). Using a programmable optical filter, we can control the tap weights and, hence, the MPF response and corresponding generated waveform. We show uniform and apodized waveforms with four taps and seven taps with tunable central frequencies.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Optical filters', 'Optical fibers', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical pulses', 'Microwave filters']

abstracts: A simple and cost-effective demultiplexing approach for a subcarrier multiplexed radio-over-fiber (RoF) system is proposed, analyzed, and experimentally demonstrated. A microwave photonic filter based on multiple optical sources is integrated into the RoF system, and by simply controlling the time delay in the remote antenna unit, the subcarrier with desirable frequency can be filtered out, and undesirable ones are suppressed. An experimental demonstration has been carried out by implementing a two-optical-source-based microwave photonic filter in an RoF downlink transmitting a 2.5-GHz subcarrier modulated with 150-Mb/s on-off keying (OOK) data, showing that it works well as a subcarrier demultiplexer. The proposed demultiplexing approach enjoys high flexibility, tunability, and cost-effectiveness and has good potential applications in the multiplexed RoF systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave filters', 'Microwave photonics', 'Optical fiber filters', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Radio-over-fiber (RoF) systems', 'microwave photonic filter', 'subcarrier demultiplex', 'multiple optical sources']

abstracts: Polarization imaging has the advantage of detecting artificial targets based on their intrinsic characteristics. However, with the development of camouflage materials and camouflage shielding performance, the anti-optical detection technology for camouflaged targets continues to improve. In this paper, we combine the advantages of polarization imaging and deep learning to achieve rapid detection of artificial targets camouflaged in natural scenes. Firstly, we propose a Stokes-vector-based parameter image to show the polarization specificity of the camouflaged artificial targets. Then, a detection method is proposed, which uses an Otsu segmentation algorithm and morphological operations to extract polarization signatures of the target from the proposed parameter image, and utilizes the extracted polarization signatures to highlight the camouflaged artificial targets. Finally, we improve a self-supervised deep learning network to enhance the low-light images, extending the application of our method into low illumination environment target detection. Experimental results demonstrate that our method can effectively detect the camouflaged artificial targets with a detection rate better than 80%, which has potential application value in the fields of military target detection, security monitoring, and remote sensing.
ieee_keywords: ['Imaging', 'Deep learning', 'Object detection', 'Lighting', 'Image color analysis', 'Cameras', 'Training']
author_keywords: ['Camouflaged artificial target', 'deep learning', 'image processing', 'polarization imaging', 'target detection']

abstracts: This work presents a broad look at a characteristion technique allowing for real-time, single shot characterisation of the complex electric field of a swept laser source. Applied to a state-of-the-art VCSEL, we demonstrate the power of this technique, as well as a measurement of the parameters of the laser directly relevant to OCT. This technique can be readily adapted to many swept sources for direct characterisation, providing improved design and more informed optimisation for future devices.
ieee_keywords: ['Imaging', 'Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Real-time systems', 'Semiconductor device measurement', 'Frequency measurement']

abstracts: Distributed feedback lasers are widely used in wavelength modulation spectroscopy (WMS) for measurement of gas concentration, pressure, and temperature from absorption lineshapes. However, the wavelength modulation characteristics of lasers vary considerably and may result in severe distortion of the raw harmonic signals obtained with WMS. Here, we demonstrate how to measure and correct for these effects, allowing accurate recovery of lineshapes with a variety of laser sources.
ieee_keywords: ['Frequency modulation', 'Mathematical model', 'Phase modulation', 'Absorption', 'Current measurement', 'Shape']
author_keywords: ['Diode laser spectroscopy', 'absorption line-shape recovery', 'laser modulation', 'wavelength modulation spectroscopy', 'optical gas sensors']

abstracts: 1. Resonant excitation analysis on asymmetrical lateral leakage of light in the finite ZCG mirror is demonstrated. 2. Dispersion equation of slab waveguide for TM mode is proposed to evaluate the resonant condition of ZCG mirror. 3. Two leaky channels are excited where BICs turn into quasi-BICs. 4. Reflection reciprocity of the finite ZCG mirror is broken due to asymmetrical loss of the lateral leakage of light.

abstracts: Dammann gratings for UV wavelengths are rarely reported to our knowledge. Enabling UV Dammann gratings needs appropriate and tractable UV optical materials. As an excellent and frequently-used optical material, sapphire is endowed with high thermal and chemical stabilities, hardness and light transparency. In this work, sapphire-based Dammann gratings fabricated by femtosecond laser direct writing and wet etching for UV beam splitting have been demonstrated.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Gratings', 'Wet etching', 'Optical surface waves', 'Laser ablation']

abstracts: This is the first demonstration of CuNWs as a saturable absorber forPr3+-switching operation in 635 nm fiber laser. TheQ- switched red fiber laser has a pulse repetition rate range ofsim70 kHz, a pulse duration of 394 ns and the maximum output power of 9.6 mW.
ieee_keywords: ['Nanoparticles', 'Copper', 'Plasmons', 'Pump lasers', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers']

abstracts: Previous demonstrations on the mode exchanger (references [22]-[27]) mainly discussed the mode exchanger between two modes. To increase the capacity of mode division multiplexing (MDM) links, it is essential to increase the number of modes. The inverse design method is introduced into mode exchanger designing. The fabrication imperfection tolerance, insertion loss (IL), and crosstalk performance are optimized simultaneously. Both two mode and three-mode ME are designed to show the scalability.
ieee_keywords: ['Licenses', 'Optimization', 'Silicon', 'Crosstalk', 'Robustness', 'Multiplexing', 'Manufacturing']

abstracts: In this paper, the physical layer security (PLS) challenges for a decode and forward (DF) based dual hop mixed free space optical (FSO) / radio frequency (RF) communication system in the presence of multiple eavesdroppers has been investigated. In order to improve the PLS of the energy efficient co-operative communication system, diversity combining techniques have been introduced at the destination node. In addition to this, collusion and non collusion eavesdropper scenarios are considered to make the system more practical. The FSO and RF links are assumed to experience independent Málaga (M) and Nakagami-mfading distributions, respectively. Additionally, the FSO link model considers the impact of boresigt and non-zero boresight pointing errors and type of optical demodulation scheme. To investigate the security performance, the lower bound for the secrecy outage probability (SOP) and effective secrecy throughput (EST) have been obtained in terms of Meijer’s G function. Thereafter, asymptotic expressions have been derived for the considered system and the numerical results have been verified by the Monte-Carlo simulation method. Finally, we have analyzed the secrecy energy efficiency (SEE) based on secrecy rate (Rs) of the considered system to provide practical insights into the effect of major parameters on the energy efficient secure transmission design.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Laser beams', 'Eavesdropping', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Measurement', 'Fading channels', 'Wireless communication']
author_keywords: ['Physical layer security (PLS)', 'mixed FSO/RF', 'Málaga ( $\\mathcal {M}$ ) distribution', 'secrecy outage probability (SOP)', 'effective secrecy throughput (EST)', 'secrecy energy efficient (SEE)']

abstracts: An integrated fiber-optic sensor is proposed for simultaneous temperature and strain sensing, although the technology about fiber Bragg grating (FBG) is mature. Compared with the existing cascaded configuration, the structure of spheroidal-cavity-overlapped FBG is smaller. In addition, due to the high-quality smooth surface, the concave shape also helps increase the visibility of the reflected spectrum to 7 dB compared with the other manufacture method. The temperature sensitivity of a Fabry–Pérot interferometer is 0.67 pm/°C under the range of −70 °C–20 °C, and its strain sensitivity is 3.76pm/μεunder the range of 0–500με, while the corresponding values of the FBG part are 8.4 pm/°C and 1.4pm/με, respectively. The difference of the sensitivity makes the simultaneous measurement of temperature and strain possible.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature measurement', 'Strain', 'Fiber gratings', 'Temperature sensors', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Cavity resonators']
author_keywords: ['Fiber optics sensor', 'Fabry-Perot', 'FBG', 'temperature and strain simultaneous measurement']

abstracts: We analytically investigate and derive equations for the empirical moments of asynchronously sampled signal amplitudes as functions of signal power, noise power, and accumulated chromatic dispersion (CD) of a transmission link. The solutions of these equations enable low-cost, simultaneous and independent monitoring of in-band optical signal-to-noise ratio (OSNR) and CD of the fiber link for various modulation formats and data rates. Numerical simulations are performed to validate the proposed technique and the results demonstrate independent OSNR and CD monitoring with good accuracy and large monitoring ranges. The influence of first-order polarization-mode dispersion (PMD) on the accuracy of the proposed monitoring technique is also investigated.
ieee_keywords: ['Monitoring', 'Optical noise', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical fiber amplifiers']
author_keywords: ['Optical performance monitoring (OPM)', 'optical signal-to-noise ratio (OSNR) monitoring', 'chromatic dispersion monitoring', 'multi-impairment monitoring', 'fiber-optic communications', 'empirical moments', 'asynchronous sampling']

abstracts: Despite various bound solitons found in many fiber lasers, the exact role of cavity parameters like saturable absorption in properties of generated bound states is unclear. Here we address it by studying the unique impact of nonlinear absorption in both experiment and simulation. Our work provides clear evidence that initial conditions affect the characteristic parameters of bound solitons, while saturable absorber plays no role in the phase relationship.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Laser mode locking', 'Cavity resonators', 'Optical solitons', 'Optical pulses', 'Absorption']

abstracts: we propose a specular highlight image enhancement algorithm based on a dark channel prior to solve the problem of information loss in specular highlight images in real scenes.A weighted function based on the local pixel color difference is introduced to solve the halo artifacts in the image. The brightness of the image is adjusted by the CLAHE algorithm to enhance the local details of the image.
ieee_keywords: ['Licenses', 'Image enhancement', 'Image color analysis']
author_keywords: ['Image enhancement', 'specular highlight image', 'dark channel prior', 'CLAHE', 'guided filtering']

abstracts: We systematically investigate the spin-dependent splitting by considering spin Hall effect of light and in-plane spin separation of light simultaneously when a Gaussian beam reflected from an air-glass interface. We find there exhibits a spin-dependent splitting rotation with the increase of the polarization angle, and its speed and direction can be controlled by the incident angle. The general laws of splitting rotation and its causes have been demonstrated and analyzed by instances.
ieee_keywords: ['Zirconium', 'Hall effect', 'Optical polarization', 'Atmospheric modeling', 'Polarization', 'Photonics']
author_keywords: ['Spin Hall effect of light', 'in-plane spin separation of light', 'splitting rotation']

abstracts: The use of phase modulators monolithically integrated with diode lasers for Pound-Drever-Hall (PDH) locking is evaluated with respect to their residual amplitude modulation. We present measurements on the RAM of integrated InP-based electro-refractive modulators and small-signal steady state analysis of their effect on the PDH locking. We show that by operating the modulators at their optimum operation point the residual amplitude modulation can be minimized.
ieee_keywords: ['Phase modulation', 'Frequency modulation', 'Random access memory', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Laser stability', 'Laser tuning', 'Voltage measurement']

abstracts: Based on few-mode fiber (FMF) and photonic crystal fiber (PCF), a new temperature sensor with a FMF-PCF-FMF hybrid construction has been developed. Furthermore, the sensor has a longitudinally symmetrical structure that makes it have a flexible sensor head, which enhances the practical performance. Simulated results show that there are three resonant peaks with extinction ratio above 18 dB in the wavelength from 1630 nm to 1720 nm, and the temperature can be measured by calculating wavelength shift of resonant peaks. The experimental results show that the temperature sensitivity of the proposed sensor is as high as 38.6 pm/°C when the temperature ranges from 20°C to 80°C. Meanwhile, the strain sensitivity of the proposed sensor is as low as −0.457 pm/μϵ when strain ranges from 0 to 3000 μϵ. The high temperature sensitivity and ultralow strain sensitivity indicate that the proposed sensor can effectively eliminate the cross-sensitive issue of temperature and strain. In addition to excellent sensing performances, simple and compact structure make the proposed sensor be potential in practical applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature sensors', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Temperature measurement', 'Strain', 'Optical fibers', 'Sensitivity', 'Refractive index']

abstracts: In this paper, we propose a method based on Helmholtz equation to determine the coupling length of the light propagating in concentrically curved waveguides by the conformal transformation. After the transformation, the concentrically curved waveguides are regarded as straight directional couplers, and the coupling length can be obtained rapidly by using this method. We also calculate the coupling length by the finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) method to compare with the result obtained by our method. The results show a good agreement between the coupling length obtained by the conformal transformation and the FDTD method.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplings', 'Optical waveguides', 'Indexes', 'Refractive index', 'Waveguide transitions', 'Time domain analysis', 'Finite difference methods']

abstracts: We for the first time report on the study of the effect of the double Rayleigh scattering noise by using the narrow line-width laser on the radio frequency transfer system. Our results provide evidence that the conventional RF transfer technique with the telecommunications-grade lasers, in which the chromatic dispersion effect in the single-mode fiber is compensated by dispersion compensation fibers (DCFs), could be the better choice for high-performance RF transfer.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Phase noise', 'Laser noise', 'Phase locked loops', 'Optical noise', 'RF signals', 'Optical imaging']
author_keywords: ['Double rayleigh backscattering', 'laser phase noise', 'phase-locked loop', 'radio frequency transfer']

abstracts: We report, in the 2-μm wavelength region, the first comprehensive experimental and numerical investigation of subsideband generation around the Gordon-Kelly sidebands in soliton fiber lasers operating. In the present paper, we mainly correlate the observations of subsideband generation to the appearance of period-N pulsations. We discuss the possible origin of these subsidebands, showing that their origin does not match with a simple modulation instability analysis.
ieee_keywords: ['Amplitude modulation', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Solitons', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Instabilities and chaos', 'mode-locked fiber lasers', 'pulse propagation and solitons']

abstracts: Superconducting nanowire single-photon detectors (SNSPDs) are capable of detecting visible and near-infrared single photons with high system detection efficiency (SDE). However, these capabilities place stringent design demands on the cavity and nanowire structures. We optimized the SDE of SNSPDs fabricated on 1-D photonic crystals for quantum information applications. We obtained an SDE of 83.6 ± 3.7%, which is the highest value reported for NbN SNSPDs at 940-nm wavelength.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber devices', 'Optical fibers', 'Detectors', 'Filling', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Photonics', 'Optical polarization']
author_keywords: ['Niobium nitride (NbN)', 'superconducting nanowire single-photon detectors (SNSPDs)', 'system detection efficiency', 'quantum information']

abstracts: Solution processed perovskite films tend to have voids and pin-holes between the crystals, which is cited as very detrimental to device performance. We have demonstrated passivation of the perovskite film by employing small molecule infiltration. As a result, the power conversion efficiency for solution-processed planar heterojunction solar cells has been enhanced from 9.96% for contrastive perovskite solar cells to 13.6% for passivated perovskite solar cells.
ieee_keywords: ['Films', 'Photovoltaic cells', 'Absorption', 'Passivation', 'Surface morphology', 'Morphology']
author_keywords: ['Charge carrier lifetime', 'organic inorganic hybrid materials', 'photovoltaic cells', 'semiconductor devices.']

abstracts: We propose a surface plasmon interferometer based on a wedge metal waveguide. Working principles of the device are introduced through theoretical analyses. The interference performances are investigated by finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) method. Because of the special wedge geometry, the interferometer shows an extremely low coupling loss in comparison with the previous reports. An interesting surface plasmon polariton (SPP) coupling and splitting phenomenon is found at the wedge section. It is then split into two surface plasmon modes in two interference arms. Refractive index sensing applications of this interferometer are also discussed, which shows sensitivity as high as 6 × 10 3 nm/RIU.
ieee_keywords: ['Sensors', 'Interference', 'Couplings', 'Gold', 'Refractive index', 'Plasmons', 'Propagation constant']

abstracts: We propose a novel sensor. Guided wave in the ring-zone with toroidal arrangement of air holes leadd to more uniform distribution of electric field. Simulative results indicate that we can achieve excellent sensing performances. Narrowest full width at half maximum 2.58 nm can be achieved which is far lower than previous reports. It contributes to high value of figure of merit. We believe our sensor is potentially a competitive candidate in the application of sensing.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Couplings', 'Optical surface waves', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber sensors']

abstracts: The four-mode fiber was used in a TDFL by us for the first time. Because the clear free spectral range (FSR) of the FMF-SL filter is only 0.75??nm, the number of the multi-wavelength operation states are rather high, and the covered wavelength range is wider than that of most reported multi-wavelength TDFLs. The OSNRs of obtained for the proposed TDFL was larger than 40??dB. Furthermore, our laser also has the advantages of a simpler structure and greater operational flexibility.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Optical switches', 'Sagnac interferometers', 'Optical fiber filters']

abstracts: 1. An ultra-thin-phase metasurface structures based on complementary square-split-ring (SSR) nanoantennas have been proposed to achieve THz optical metalenses with multi-dimensionality and multifocusing. 2. The principle of beam propagation and efficient transmission can be effectively explained through the Fabry-Pérot resonance mode. 3. we apply the concept of a partitioned-phase mode to realize a double-focusing metalens to achieve the desired focusing properties easily.

abstracts: Rotational symmetry diffuse reflector can enhance the lighting performance of LED arrays, but it has a high demand on the LED arrays, therefore, this paper proposed an off-axis method that can satisfy more LED arrays and reduce the requirement of the LED array. The results show that the uniformity and efficiency are improved compared with traditional methods. In particular, the rotational symmetry can be interpreted as a special case of the off-axis method for the circular LED array.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Lighting', 'Reflection', 'Mathematical model', 'Energy conservation', 'Optical surface waves', 'Design methodology']

abstracts: Novel organic solar cells (OSCs) incorporated short-pitch metallic grating into the conventional OSCs as the back electrode is presented. The optical and electrical properties of OSCs are investigated by applying the finite-difference frequency-domain method. It is found that the light absorption at 400-650 nm in the active layer is strongly improved, as compared with the standard structure without metallic grating. The underlying physical mechanism is presented.

abstracts: The paper presents a throughout study on the lasing threshold of Rhodamine B in glycerol aqueous solution.The glycerol aqueous solution offers advantageous features compared to the popular mixed solution of ethanol and ethylene glycol, such as a larger refractive index adjustment range, and a lower lasing threshold.

abstracts: Automatic subsea operations using real-time underwater optical wireless sensor networks are mooted as a new paradigm of underwater Internet of Things in this paper. To this end, we develop an underwater optical wireless sensor network prototype called AquaE-net, which consists of an optical hub and two sensor nodes with temperature, salinity, conductivity, and pH sensing capabilities. Clock synchronization is realized in AquaE-net, which paves the way for future underwater positioning and navigation. Moreover, real-time and bi-directional network communication with 100% packet success rates has been realized by AquaE-net in free space and turbid water in the harbor of the Red Sea at King Abdullah University of Science and Technology. This is the first step toward future effective marine environmental monitoring and marine resources exploration.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical sensors', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Real-time systems', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical filters', 'Optical amplifiers']
author_keywords: ['Automatic subsea operations', 'marine environmental monitoring', 'underwater optical wireless sensor networks', 'underwater Internet of Things']

abstracts: A novel method to estimate CD based on training sequence is proposed. Compared with FrFT-based blind CD estimation method, it can be used for ultra-low sampling rate. And the feasibility and robustness of the method is demonstrated by simulations and experiments.
ieee_keywords: ['Estimation', 'Training', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Adaptive optics', 'Chromatic dispersion', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Phase shift keying']

abstracts: The transient ultraviolet (UV) and visible luminescent dynamics of the metal-oxide-semiconductor light-emitting diodes (MOSLEDs) made on Si-rich SiO x with its O/Si composition ratio detuning from 0.75 to 1.62 are investigated. The size and luminescent wavelength of the buried Si quantum dots (Si-QDs) are controlled by adjusting the O/Si composition ratio of the Si-rich SiO x . Time-resolved photoluminescence shows a lifetime decaying from 11.5 μs to 67 ns with the Si-QD size reducing from 4.5 to >; 1.7 nm. The shorter lifetime for smaller Si-QDs is due to the increased nonphonon-assisted carrier recombination rate in smaller Si-QDs. The Si-QD size shrinkage is obtained by enlarging the O/Si composition ratio via the increase in the N 2 O/SiH 4 fluence ratio during synthesis, which makes the SiO x matrix approaching a standard dioxide with a higher turn-on threshold field under Fowler-Nordheim tunneling. By increasing the O/Si composition ratio from 1.15 to 1.54, the obtained EL pattern changes its color from red to blue, which is associated with the turn-on voltage increasing from 40 to 175 V. Decreasing the Si-QD size to 1.7 nm inevitably attenuates the EL power to 100 nW and reduces the P/I slope to 0.63 mW/A. The UV EL patterns of MOSLEDs made on the SiO 1.62 film are demonstrated with an EL power of 40 nW, and the decay of ITO transmittance to <; 30% at an EL wavelength of <; 375 nm also contributes to the power attenuation.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Films', 'Substrates', 'Annealing', 'Plasma temperature', 'Radiative recombination', 'Light emitting diodes']
author_keywords: ['Silicon nanophotonics', 'quantum dots and single molecules', 'light-emitting diodes']

abstracts: We present transmission-efficient bent and crossing silicon slot waveguides for compact silicon slot waveguide-based circuits. To begin with, using the 3-D vector finite-element method, we investigate the transmission characteristics of a bent silicon slot waveguide with an asymmetric slot that is connected to straight waveguides. Numerical results show that the transmission efficiency can be improved by optimizing a taper structure that is introduced between the bend of an asymmetric slot waveguide and its straight input/output waveguides. Next, we investigate the transmission characteristics of a 3-D crossing silicon slot waveguide that has a vertical coupler. Numerical results show that our crossing structure can achieve a high transmission efficiency compared with conventional structures.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Optical waveguides', 'Refractive index', 'Propagation losses', 'Couplings', 'Geometry']

abstracts: We demonstrate for the first time the tunable multi-wavelength bright-dark and dark-bright pulse pairs in a Yb-doped fiber laser. The comb filter provides by the tapered fiber, and facilitated to the formation of the multi-wavelength pulses. The experimental results provide a direction for better understanding the dynamics of pulse pairs and it can enhance the laser applications in optical communication and optical fiber sensors.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical pumping', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Optical solitons']

abstracts: A tunable multichannel filter in the finite photonic crystal (PC) containing photonic quantum well (PQW) as a defect is proposed. The symmetric structure (AB) P (CD) Q ( BA) P and the asymmetric structure (AB) P (CD) Q (AB) P are considered in this work. Here, the host PC of (AB) P is made of Si for layer A and of SiO 2 for layer B. In the PQW, (CD) Q , C also is Si, but D is an extrinsic semiconductor, n -type silicon ( n -Si). With the use of n -Si, it is found that both structures can function as a tunable multichannel filter in the infrared region. The number of channels is equal to Q + 1 in the symmetric structure, whereas it is Q for the asymmetric one. The positions of multiple resonant peaks can be tuned by the variation in the impurity concentration of n -Si. The proposed filter could be used to design the wavelength division multiplexer filter that is of technical use in optical communications.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Resonator filters', 'Superconducting filters', 'Permittivity', 'Silicon', 'Photonics', 'Impurities']

abstracts: A tunable triple-band absorber based on bulk-Dirac-semimetal (BDS) metasurface is proposed in the terahertz (THz) range. The design is comprised of a BDS film with a pattern of dual ring slots and a dielectric layer stacked on a fully reflective gold ground. And the electric or magnetic resonances result in the incident plane waves at different frequencies to be effectively absorbed by the BDS film, which leads to the high absorption at 1.56 THz, 3.28 THz, and 3.95 THz resonant frequencies. The tunability of the resonant frequencies depends on various Fermi levels. Moreover, the physical mechanisms of the absorber with good stability over wide incident angles and polarization insensitivity are expounded. The proposed BDS-based absorber has great potentials in sensors, thermal emitters, and energy harvesting, etc.
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Dielectrics', 'Mirrors', 'Metasurfaces', 'Gold', 'Conductivity', 'Wireless communication']

abstracts: By increasing the degree of freedom from 2D to 2.5D for plasmonic metasurfaces, a new method for an omnidirectional and broadband large-area plasmonic absorber is presented. Here, using the silk fibroin as mediated layer in nanoimprint technology (SML-NIL), we fabricate a perfect absorber that can realize the absorption efficiency to a maximum of 99% over the entire visible spectrum for angles up to 70° from normal. In addition, it also exhibits excellent bidirectional absorptive characteristic.
ieee_keywords: ['Compounds', 'Absorption', 'Broadband communication', 'Surface treatment', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical polarization', 'Fabrication']

abstracts: In this paper, we proposed an ultrafast 3-D imaging system based on phase-shifting method and a hybrid dispersion scanning technique. The imaging system is capable of acquiring the 3-D shape of the object at an ultrafast scan rate. A theoretical model is built to describe the operation principle of the imaging system and to analyze the performance of the system. In the demonstration, the imaging system is designed with practical devices and components. The system has a scan rate of 25 MHz and a frame rate of 100 kHz. The field of view is 50 μm × 50 μm, and the number of pixels of one frame is 260 pixel × 1000 pixel. The reconstructed 3-D image has the peak signal-to-noise ratio (PSNR) of 30.11 dB. The performance of the imaging system is investigated by analyzing the influence of the input beam size and the resolution of the digitizer. The input collimated light with large beam size is preferred for high image quality. Moreover, the depth resolution can be improved by using high-resolution digital signal processing.
ieee_keywords: ['Three-dimensional displays', 'Image reconstruction', 'Optical pulses', 'Optical imaging', 'Dispersion', 'Optical reflection']

abstracts: We show that ultra-high spatial resolution of optical reflactometry can be achieved based on linear optical sampling technique
ieee_keywords: ['Optical pulses', 'Optical reflection', 'Optical fibers', 'Spatial resolution', 'Optical fiber sensors']

abstracts: High-resolution fiber-optic sensors reported so far are all based on specialized fiber structures and lasers. Long, high-finesse fiber Fabry-Perot interferometers (FFPI) can potentially reach very high resolutions but are very difficult to realize. Here, we address both challenges by reporting the first demonstration of ultrahigh-resolution sensing based on meter-long, high finesse FFPIs. All the components in our system are off-the-shelf and the diode laser is directly locked to a 1-m FFPI.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Cavity resonators', 'Resonant frequency', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Strain', 'Bragg gratings']

abstracts: Multi-gigahertz ultrafast lasers have attracted increasing attention in many applications. However, to achieve the saturation condition, cavity design using a tightly focused SA is unavoidable, leading to SA damage. Therefore, new saturable absorption material system with nature of low saturation intensity is critical for ultrafast optoelectronics. In this paper, ultralow saturation intensity topological insulator SA was used in GHz solid-state laser for the first time.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser mode locking', 'Solid lasers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Laser excitation', 'Fiber lasers', 'Mirrors']

abstracts: Nanowires light-emitting diodes grown on silicon substrate offer the advantage of implementing high crystal quality AlGaN/GaN on lattice-mismatched, low cost and scalable substrate. Investigations based on structural optimization, device simulation, and soft stress test aimed to shed light on the potential for eventual high power conversion efficiency ultraviolet light emitters.
ieee_keywords: ['Aluminum gallium nitride', 'Wide band gap semiconductors', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Radiative recombination', 'Gallium nitride', 'Degradation', 'Substrates']
