abstracts: We propose and demonstrate a viewing-angle-enhanced integral imaging display (VAEIID) system that uses a time-multiplexed, two-directional sequential projection (TTSP) scheme and a directional elemental image generation and resizing (DEIGR) algorithm. The main idea behind the method is sharing the same image screen to display two-directional elemental image (DEI) sets with a time-multiplexed sequential projection scheme. The proposed system consists of three processes: acquisition of depth and color information of a real object using the Microsoft Kinect sensor, generation of two DEI sets considering two different angular perspectives using a DEIGR algorithm, and projection of two sets of DEIs using the TTSP scheme. Due to the two-directional projections, each elemental lens of the lens array collects two-directional illuminations from the two sets of elemental images (EIs) projected in a time-multiplexed sequential manner by using the TTSP scheme; this produces two point light sources (PLSs) at different positions on the focal plane of the lens array. The positions of the PLSs are predefined and are determined in terms of projection angle. In this case, the viewing angle comprises the combination of two diverging ray bundles emerging from the two DEI sets projected from two angular directions. As a result, the viewing angle of the proposed VAEIID system is enhanced by almost twice that of the conventional method.
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'Arrays', 'Image color analysis', 'Three-dimensional displays', 'Optical imaging', 'Data mining']
author_keywords: ['Integral imaging', 'VAEIID system', 'TTSP scheme', 'DEIGR algorithm', 'directional elemental image (DEI)']

abstracts: An image multi-scale decomposition method based on a gradient domain guided filter is proposed.The proposed method can better extract image details.Image boundary problems were eliminated using a new weighted sparse representation.
ieee_keywords: ['Image edge detection', 'Image fusion', 'Dynamic range', 'Transforms', 'Night vision', 'Cameras']
author_keywords: ['Weighted sparse representation', 'gradient domain guided filter', 'image fusion', 'high dynamic range.']

abstracts: Plasmonics plays a fundamental role in the realization of many useful photonic devices for many applications such as solar energy, sensing, ICT, etc., but existing modeling techniques of plasmonics seriously lack accuracy and often yield wrong results. We examine the reasons behind the failure of the existing techniques and suggest powerful remedies keeping the computational effort minimum and almost independent of the size of the structure.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Optical waveguides', 'Eigenvalues and eigenfunctions', 'Transmission line matrix methods', 'Waveguide discontinuities', 'Dielectrics', 'Couplers']
author_keywords: ['Bidirectional Beam Propagation Method (BiBPM)', 'blocked schur', 'dielectric waveguides', 'high-index-contrast discontinuity', 'plasmonic coupler', 'plasmonic waveguides', 'plasmonics modeling.']

abstracts: IBFD wireless communication doubles the efficiency of TDD or FDD, and makes spectrum usage flexible. Optical self-interference cancellation (OSIC) systems have been widely researched for IBFD. But existing OSIC bandwidth is restrained under over-the-air condition, which limits the practicability. The proposed scheme broadens OSIC band from traditional relatively narrow band to the whole antenna band. It has the impact of huge capacity and efficiency improvement of IBFD for future application.
ieee_keywords: ['Bandwidth', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical filters', 'Radio frequency', 'Baseband', 'Interference']

abstracts: We demonstrate a laser system with watt-level output power on single-frequency operation and wide wavelength tunability at 2000 nm. The architecture of the laser system is based on a Tm-doped fiber ring laser integrated with an amplifier, which is an all-in-one configuration working on a single pump laser diode source. The output mode of the laser system is analyzed by using a home-made all-fiber scanning ring resonator.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical ring resonators', 'Optical pumping', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical feedback']

abstracts: This is the first demonstration of a zeroth- and first-order-convertible fiber interleaving filter based on a polarization-diversity loop that consists of two polarization-maintaining fiber (PMF) segments and three half-wave plates (HWPs). The HWP between two PMF segments could allow the filter to operate in the zeroth- or first-order transmission mode by adjusting angular difference between the principal axes of two PMF segments, which could not be realized in previous first-order comb filters.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber filters', 'Microwave filters', 'Channel spacing', 'Information filtering']

abstracts: In this work, (InxGa1-x)2O3 photodetectors with better performances, such as the improved photocurrent and responsivity, have been fabricated on the sapphire by PLD, which would be widely used in military and civil applications. What's more, we have studied the properties of (InxGa1-x)2O3 films and photodetectors with different In composition.
ieee_keywords: ['Photodetectors', 'Films', 'Fitting', 'Photonic band gap', 'Substrates', 'Licenses', 'Extinction coefficients']

abstracts: This manuscript describes the first report of mode-locked lasers with integrated optical feedback cavities fabricated in the JePPIX-Oclaro monolithic InP platform. We report the spectral, autocorrelation, and noise characteristics of the mode-locked lasers and demonstrate that noise reduction is possible with an integrated feedback cavity. This work is useful to the photonics community interested in accessing and using the Oclaro InP platform, which is amongst the newest InP foundry platforms.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Optical feedback', 'Radio frequency', 'Laser feedback', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Optical pulses', 'Laser mode locking']

abstracts: A compact fiber cascaded structure for simultaneous measurement of curvature and temperature based on Fabry-Perot (FP) interference and anti-resonant (AR) mechanism is designed and experimentally demonstrated. The proposed structure is manufactured by sandwiching a segment of hollow core fiber (HCF) with large inner diameter and suitable length between two segments of single mode fibers (SMFs). Three sample sensors were fabricated with different HCF lengths. With theoretical analysis and experimental verifications, an HCF length of 1197 μ m was selected for curvature and temperature experiments. The reflection fringes based on FP interference and transmission envelopes based on AR mechanism can be monitored to measure curvature and temperature variations at the same time. From experimental results, the sensitivities of curvature based on AR mechanism and FP interference are 0.2345 nm/m −1 and -0.1021 nm/m −1 , and those of sensitivities of temperature are 0.0172 nm/°C and 0.0017 nm/°C, respectively. Therefore, the different responses in curvature and temperature based on two mechanisms enable the proposed structure to simultaneously measure curvature and temperature.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature measurement', 'Temperature sensors', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Interference', 'Sensors', 'Optical fibers', 'Reflection']

abstracts: A compact laser feedback interferometry imaging system for concurrent reflectance confocal microscopy and laser Doppler flowmetry is proposed. Both confocal reflectance and Doppler flowmetry signals are obtained using a simple confocal architecture to image a dynamic turbid medium with higher contrast than a system operating in either modality. Such a system is capable of providing information from not only the optical properties of the sample but from the movement of the particles as well.
ieee_keywords: ['Doppler effect', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical scattering', 'Biomedical optical imaging', 'Laser beams', 'Laser feedback']
author_keywords: ['Confocal reflectance microscopy', 'laser doppler velocimetry', 'laser feedback interferometry', 'near-infrared laser imaging']

abstracts: We present a low-loss, compact, polarization insensitive 3-dB optical power-splitter for submicron silicon waveguides. The splitter is optimized over a broad wavelength span ranging from 1300 to 1700 nm through finite difference time domain simulations. The splitter junction footprint is only 1.8 × 1.3 μm, which is smaller than previously reported broadband multimode junction splitters. Furthermore, the demonstrated device overcomes the fabrication limitations of previous splitters while maintaining a compact size without any sharp angles. The device was fabricated using electron beam lithography. The experimental results show a small insertion loss of less than 0.3 dB for both the TE and TM polarizations.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Junctions', 'Couplers', 'Reflection', 'Performance evaluation', 'Photonics', 'Finite difference methods']

abstracts: As described by Neil et al., Booth, or Ghebremichael et al., the concept of a holography based modal wavefront sensor is widely understood. Up to now, most articles concern the principal function of the sensing in simulation and basic measurements. Our paper contains a different design, simulation, and fabrication method as well as a more complex application for the detector. The use of modes others than Zernike polynomials has never been investigated.
ieee_keywords: ['Diffraction', 'Mirrors', 'Ions', 'Detectors', 'Holography', 'Light sources']

abstracts: A novel large-scale three-layer-ring optical fiber sensor network is proposed to provide large-scale sensing region as hybrid star-ring architecture and to provide robust self-healing function to deal with large amount of fiber-link failures as mesh architecture. According to simulation results, the observed optical spectra of the received optical sensing signals in CO are roughly identical when the proposed architecture has no fiber-link failure or has up to four breakpoints.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical switches', 'Fiber gratings']
author_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensor', 'fiber Bragg grating (FBG)', 'reconfigurable routing path function', 'self-healing']

abstracts: A new method to fabricate the multiwavelength DFB semiconductor laser array (MLA) is proposed for the first time based on sampled grating and s-bent waveguide. According to the detailed precision analysis, the lasing wavelength accuracy of the proposed structure is significantly improved. Because the common holography exposure and micrometer photolithography are used to fabricate the sampled grating and the bent waveguide in this method, the fabrication cost is very low. Therefore, it offers a suitable method for massive fabrication.
ieee_keywords: ['Gratings', 'Arrays', 'Waveguide lasers', 'Fabrication', 'Arrayed waveguide gratings', 'Semiconductor laser arrays']

abstracts: The traditional head-up display (HUD) system has the disadvantages of a small area and a single display plane, here we propose and design an augmented reality (AR) HUD system with multi-plane, large area, high diffraction efficiency and a single picture generation unit (PGU) based on holographic optical elements (HOEs). Since volume HOEs have excellent angle selectivity and wavelength selectivity, HOEs of different wavelengths can be designed to display images in different planes. Experimental and simulated results verify the feasibility of this method. Experimental results show that the diffraction efficiencies of the red, green and blue HOEs are 75.2%, 73.1% and 67.5%. And the size of HOEs is 20 cm × 15 cm. Moreover, the three HOEs of red, green and blue display images at different depths of 150 cm, 500 cm and 1000 cm, respectively. In addition, the field of view (FOV) and eye-box (EB) of the system are 12° × 10° and 9.5 cm × 11.2 cm. Furthermore, the light transmittance of the system has reached 60%. It is believed that this technique can be applied to the augmented reality navigation display of vehicles and aviation.
ieee_keywords: ['Imaging', 'Licenses', 'Image reconstruction', 'Diffraction', 'Multiplexing', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Navigation']

abstracts: We proposed a new scheme to generated multi-frequency mm-wave signals base on cascaded PM and I/Q modulator.The PM modulates the ECL and generates multi-frequency optical carriers.The I/Q modulator modulates baseband signal to the carriers and achieve independent-sideband modulation.The output of I/Q modulator is combined with several optical sidebands and the optical carriers are suppressed. With a WSS two optical side-bands are selected and beaten in the PD,thus mm-wave signal is generated.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical transmitters', 'Radio frequency', 'Optical filters']

abstracts: A novel optical compression-encryption method based on single-pixel imaging (SPI) is proposed. Base on the SPI setup, the plaintext is encrypted and compressed simultaneously by using random down sampling. Meanwhile, the decrypted results could achieve a high quality by leveraging compressive sensing technique. Moreover, the compression operator in encryption and the nonlinear reconstruction in decryption processes make it difficult for cryptanalysis.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical imaging', 'Optical sensors', 'Encryption', 'Adaptive optics', 'Optical diffraction', 'Ultrafast optics']

abstracts: A novel scheme of a highly stable dual-wavelength short optical pulse source (SOPS) based on a dual-loop optoelectronic oscillator (OEO) with two wavelengths is demonstrated. The structure of the dual-loop OEO with two wavelengths can suppress the random beating noise effectively and generate the microwave signal with low phase noise (-122.4 dBc/Hz at 10 kHz) . It consists of two directly modulated lasers and a phase modulator (PM) . The light that is directly modulated by the large signal generated from the OEO is injected into the PM to achieve remarkable chirp. Then, by optimizing the length of the dispersion compensating fiber, the optical pulses are further compressed. In the experiment, the SOPS with dual wavelengths is generated simultaneously. The repetition rate, pulse width, and timing jitter of the SOPS are 10 GHz, 2.9 ps, and 12.5 fs, respectively. In particular, the loop drift of the OEO is effectively compensated by fiber stretchers using phase-locked-loop technology. The frequency drift of the microwave signal is less than ±73.3 mHz for a long-term measurement with a duration of 1 h. Therefore, the long-term stability of SOPS is guaranteed.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical pulses', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical polarization', 'Microwave oscillators', 'Laser stability', 'Masers']
author_keywords: ['High stability', 'dual-wavelength', 'short optical pulse source (SOPS)', 'dual-loop optoelectronic oscillator with two wavelengths']

abstracts: In this paper, a novel spectral-efficient coherent radio-over-fiber (RoF) link with linear digital phase demodulation is proposed and experimentally demonstrated. Our scheme can preserve the linearity of the phase-modulated RoF optical link from the transmitter end to the receiver end by using a simple and linear phase demodulation algorithm. Meanwhile, the spectral efficiency is raised by using an intensity-modulated optical reference signal instead of an un-modulated one.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical transmitters', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical sensors', 'Optical signal processing', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: In the paper, a hybrid Mach-Zehnder interferometer (MZI) and Rayleigh backscattering (RB) injection is designed and applied in the erbium-doped fiber (EDF) ring laser configuration. The MZI scheme and RB-induced signal can accomplish the single-longitudinal-mode (SLM) oscillation and narrow the linewidth to kHz target for each generated wavelength over the available wavelength-tuning bandwidth. In the measurement, the output power, optical signal to noise ratio (OSNR) and wavelength linewidth of the designed fiber laser are also executed and discussed.
ieee_keywords: ['Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Wavelength measurement', 'Ring lasers', 'Optical noise', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fiber amplifiers']

abstracts: This article put forwards a simple microwave photonics measurement method for microwave doppler frequency shift (DFS) and angle of arrival (AOA), which obtains the information conveniently and precisely by comparing the frequency and phase shift between two channels signals. The DFS direction can be judged more intuitively thanks to the introduction of the reference signal. The system uses two parallel dual parallel Mach-Zehnder modulators (DPMZMs) for carrier suppression single-sideband (CS-SSB) modulation. A proof-of-concept experiment was taken, showing that during ±100 kHz, the DFS measurement error is <±0.1 Hz over a 40 GHz frequency range as well as power sensitivity is down to −50 dBm. What is more, the measurement error of AOA is < ±1° from 0° to 90°. This simple system acquits excellent width band performance without the optical filter, providing a reliable and more conducive to human-computer interaction solution for future measurement and sensing applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Frequency measurement', 'Optical variables measurement', 'Phase measurement', 'Microwave measurement', 'Optical filters', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical modulation']

abstracts: The silicon photomultiplier (SiPM) based orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) system is a promising solution to realize both the longer distance and higher data rate in visible light communication (VLC). However, it suffers from nonlinear distortions induced by SiPM. The Volterra nonlinear equalization (VNLE) is commonly used at the receiver to compensate for the nonlinear distortions, but it has a huge implementation complexity. As an alternative, the memory polynomial based equalization (MPE) offers significantly reduced complexity but at the cost of degrading BER performance. In this paper, we propose and demonstrate a promising simplified VNLE equalizer for SiPM based OFDM-VLC systems according to SiPM's characteristics. Results show that the proposed equalizer outperforms the MPE in terms of BER and significantly reduces the computational complexity of the conventional VNLE. With the proposed equalization scheme, a data rate of 1.35Gbps has been achieved. To the best of the author's knowledge, this is the highest data rate achieved using SiPM in VLC with optical OFDM.
ieee_keywords: ['Single-photon avalanche diodes', 'Photonics', 'Nonlinear distortion', 'OFDM', 'Visible light communication', 'Optical distortion', 'Optical receivers']

abstracts: In this paper, photonic cavities made of point defects in 2-D photonic crystals are modeled by finite-size transmission lines terminated at both ends by appropriate scalar impedances. The proposed model forms a simple transmission line resonator and is demonstrated to be quite beneficial in fast extraction of resonant frequency, quality factor, and mode profile of such photonic cavities. In this manner, an approximate yet quite accurate approach is introduced to characterize the electromagnetic properties of photonic crystal cavities. This method is successfully applied to different structures for both major polarizations and is shown to be as accurate as rigorous numerical methods, viz. the finite-element method.
ieee_keywords: ['Transmission lines', 'Electromagnetic modeling', 'Photonic crystals', 'Resonant frequency', 'Impedance', 'Optical resonators', 'Q factor', 'Resonance', 'Electromagnetic waveguides', 'Finite difference methods']

abstracts: We propose a strategy to enhance absorption in the black phosphorus layer. Numerical and analytical analysis revealed that the optical absorption of the active layer with a porous silver layer can be enhanced by 50% and 396% at the resonant wavelength for p-polarized and s-polarized incidences, respectively, when compared to that without a silver layer. Moreover, the peak value of JSC was 18 mA/cm2.
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Phosphorus', 'Silver', 'Optical reflection', 'Photovoltaic cells', 'Aluminum oxide', 'Plasmons']

abstracts: An adaptive coupling method for optical communication system based on coarse-fine laser nutation technique was presented. The scanning strategy and algorithm were set up and experimentally examined. The experimental results demonstrate that the coarse-fine laser nutation technique is capable of achieving a good coupling efficiency even the beam spot and the SMF do not coincide with each other at the start.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplings', 'Laser beams', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber theory', 'Laser modes']
author_keywords: ['Free space optical communication', 'single-mode fiber coupling', 'coarse-fine laser nutation', 'offset compensation']

abstracts: Recently, it is still highly desirable to realize on-chip energy-efficient optical diodes with high nonreciprocal transmission ratios (NTRs). By utilizing cascaded opto-mechanical microring resonators, a silicon passive optical diode with high NTRs of 41.8 dB has been experimentally realized. More importantly, the required optical power is as low as -4.2 dBm. The compact optical diode with low-power consumption and high NTRs has many significant applications for on-chip signal processing.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical signal processing', 'Optical resonators', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Force', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Silicon optical diode', 'low-power consumption', 'high nonreciprocal transmission ratio', 'opto-mechanical effect']

abstracts: Optical signal-to-noise ratio (OSNR) monitoring is essential for control and management of dynamic optical networks. Small footprint, low cost, and less power consumption are always desirable for such monitoring system. In this paper, we demonstrate an integrated dispersion-insensitive in-band OSNR monitor based on a compact silicon microdisk resonator (MDR) with only 5-μm radius. The MDR (Q ~ 54 000) functions as an ultranarrow bandpass filter in the measurement of the OSNR. The monitoring performance is evaluated in a 10-Gb/s return-to-zero differential phase-shift keying (RZ-DPSK) system and is shown to be insensitive to chromatic dispersion from 0 to 850 ps/nm. The input power requirement of the monitor is also studied, which is consistent with the desire for low-power operation. Finally, we analyze the sensitivity of this technique for various Q factors of the MDRs. The results indicate that the sensitivity of this scheme can be improved with higher Q factors.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical noise', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical filters', 'Monitoring', 'Optical resonators', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: Dual-wavelength pulses operate at different mode-locked states. One is the single pulse mode-locking operation, the other one is the bound-soliton states. However, bound-soliton states cannot be stable for a long time. The numerical results demonstrate that the separations of bound pulses have small variation and the different phase of bound pulses appear jumping change ofπ. The experimental results are helpful for further understanding of the mechanism and characteristics of bound pulse
ieee_keywords: ['Laser mode locking', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Solitons', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber communication']

abstracts: Low-loss coupling of subwavelength core hybrid optical fibers (HOFs) is significantly important for their applications and also very challenging. We have introduced an inverse tapering technique to solve this problem, and considered many critical points, specifically, the core fabrication errors and misalignment tolerances are discussed. Our detailed analysis of the coupling loss will benefit all-fiber integration of HOFs and promote their application in wide-ranging areas.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplings', 'Optical fibers', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Reflection']

abstracts: Efficient red-emitting LEDs have not yet been demonstrated in the InGaN materials system due to limitations deriving primarily from the quantum confined Stark Effect. Here, we present a novel quantum well (QW) which utilizes a delta-InN layer and an InGaN growth substrate to significantly enhance the wavefunction overlap, Rsp, and IQE in the red regime of wavelengths > 600 nm. Our analysis shows up to 7x enhanced Rsp, which makes our QW design a promising candidate for red LEDs and lasers.
ieee_keywords: ['Substrates', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Gallium nitride', 'Lattices', 'Electric fields', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Strain']

abstracts: A detailed theoretical analysis is presented to investigate the orbital angular momentum (OAM) mode purity of integrated vortex emitters. The influences of optical loss and grating imperfection are studied, and possible method to improve the OAM mode purity in each case is discussed. This work presents a general model for the analysis of OAM mode purity, and is believed to provide an efficient guide for the design of integrated vortex beam emitters with high OAM mode purity.
ieee_keywords: ['Gratings', 'Optical vortices', 'Optical losses', 'Finite element analysis', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical beams', 'Optical scattering']

abstracts: This paper presents a novel application of the continuous-wave cavity ring-down spectroscopic technique to make sensitive absorption measurements in a laminar flame. The technique shows promise to allow, in the future, sensitive concentration measurements of trace and weakly absorbing species to be made which can be used in the validation of combustion models.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Spectroscopy', 'Absorption', 'Diode lasers', 'Semiconductor device measurement', 'Optical variables measurement', 'Mirrors']

abstracts: The dielectric mirror is an important optical component for optoelectronic devices, passive photonic devices, and solar cells. Unfortunately, the reflection bandwidth of distributed Bragg reflectors (DBRs) and high-index contrast mirrors (HCGs) are limited by the index contrast of the material system used. Here, an aperiodic design for dielectric mirrors is proposed, and it is shown that for a fixed index contrast, the bandwidth of the reflection band can be arbitrarily widened by simply incorporating more dielectric layers. This is pronouncedly different from the fixed bandwidth of HCGs and DBRs. The physics behind the broadband reflection for the aperiodic stacking is identified as the photonic bandgap widening due to the annihilation of the quasi-guided modes in nonperiodic structures. This observation applies very well to aperiodic auto-cloned 3-D photonic crystal reflectors, to aperiodic DBRs, and even to diffuse dielectric mirrors that have recently emerged to be very promising for solar cells due to their zero plasmonic absorption nature. Experimentally, the white paint diffuse medium reflectors are applied to SiGe solar cells to confirm their high reflectance and the feasibility of enhancing solar cell efficiency.
ieee_keywords: ['Dielectrics', 'Reflection', 'Reflectivity', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Photovoltaic cells', 'Bandwidth']

abstracts: An auto-split laser lift-off (LLO) method for fabrication of vertical-injection GaN-based green light-emitting diodes (ASV-LEDs) is demonstrated. The ASV-LEDs exhibited a significant improvement in the light output and thermal dissipation, as compared with that of conventional LEDs on sapphire. The intrinsic physical mechanism of the auto-split LLO technique is studied by a Frank-Read dislocation clustering model. The laser energy density and mesa spacing are shown to be key factors in the auto-split LLO method. It is believed that this method offers an alternative way to fabricate high-performance GaN-based thin-film LEDs.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Gallium nitride', 'Films', 'Fabrication', 'Substrates', 'Surface emitting lasers']

abstracts: Superconducting Nanowire Single Photon Detector (SNSPD) is a key sub-system in Deep Space Optical Communication (DSOC). We first propose an accuracy BER expression which based on SNSPD, pulse position modulation and Double Generalized Gamma distribution. The simulation results show that the expression can be applied to DSOC. According to the BER analysis, one can get a more accurate link budget of photon numbers.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber communication', 'Photonics', 'Detectors', 'Modulation', 'Atmospheric modeling', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Bit error rate']
author_keywords: ['Deep space optical communication', 'bit error rate (BER)', 'pulse position modulation (PPM)', 'superconducting nanowire single photon detector (SNSPD)']

abstracts: We propose and numerically demonstrate a novel simple method to produce optical Nyquist pulses based on pulse shaping in a passively mode-locked fiber laser with an in-cavity flat-top spectral filter. The proposed scheme takes advantage of the nonlinear in-cavity dynamics of the laser and offers the possibility to generate high-quality sinc-shaped pulses with widely tunable bandwidth directly from the laser oscillator. We also show that the use of a filter with a corrective convex profile relaxes the need for large nonlinear phase accumulation in the cavity by offsetting the concavity of the nonlinearly broadened pulse spectrum.
ieee_keywords: ['Bandwidth', 'Cavity resonators', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical pulse shaping', 'Adaptive optics', 'Fiber nonlinear optics']
author_keywords: ['Mode-locked fiber lasers', 'pulse shaping', 'frequency filtering', 'nonlinear fiber optics']

abstracts: The solid-state dewetting phenomenon was used to obtain submicron- and micron-sized SiGe particle arrays by the Ge deposition on Si(100) substrates. Their transmission and reflection spectra were measured and numerically modeled by the FDTD method. They exhibit resonance effects in broad infrared spectral ranges, depending on the particle size. The broadband antireflection property is associated with wide particle size distributions and the influence of a high-index substrate. The results show that the dewetting phenomenon provides the natural formation of arrays of particles shaped as close to a sphere segment, and they turned out to be effective as antireflection coatings.
ieee_keywords: ['Germanium', 'Substrates', 'Silicon germanium', 'Silicon', 'Reflection', 'Temperature measurement', 'Particle measurements']
author_keywords: ['Thin film coatings', 'optical properties of photonic materials', 'metamaterials', 'fabrication and characterization', 'numerical simulation', 'FDTD method']

abstracts: We propose a noval emulator of laser Doppler frequency shift for satellite laser communication based on cascaded frequency shifting in the opposite direction. The DFS from -14GHz to +14GHz with a varying rate of 323MHz/s is accurately implemented. Besides, the side mode suppression ratio of laser signals with DFS are all over 52.3dB. The proposed approach can meet the emulation requirement of DFS signal due to large enough SMSR, wide frequency shift range from zero and high DFS varying rate.
ieee_keywords: ['Frequency modulation', 'Satellites', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Doppler frequency shift', 'electro-optic cascaded frequency shifting', 'satellite laser communication.']

abstracts: A comprehensive study on the transient response of fiber-grating Fabry-Perot (FGFP) laser is numerically conducted. Fiber Bragg grating (FBG) is used as a wavelength selective element to control the external optical feedback (OFB) level. In addition to the external OFB level, the effect of other external cavity parameters such as temperature, injection current, dc-bias level, coupling coefficient, and gain compression factor on transient response characteristics of the laser are investigated. The temperature dependence (TD) of response characteristics is calculated according to TD of laser parameters instead of well-known Pankove relationship. Results show that, by increasing the laser injection current, the relaxation oscillation's amplitude, frequency, and damping rate are increased, while the laser turn-on time delay is reduced. In addition to the injection current and dc-bias level, the turn-on time delay can be reduced by increasing OFB reflectivity. It is shown that the optimum external fiber length (L ext ) is 3.1 cm and the optimum range of working temperature for FGFP laser is within ±2°C from the FBG reference temperature (T o ). Also, it is shown that antireflection (AR) coating facet reflectivity value of 1 ×10 -2 is sufficient for the laser to operate at good response characteristics with low fabrication complexity.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser modes', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Fiber lasers', 'Bragg gratings', 'Transient response', 'Fiber gratings']
author_keywords: ['External cavity semiconductor lasers', 'fiber Bragg grating (FBG)', 'transient response']

abstracts: We demonstrate the dynamics of the chirped Airy pulse propagation in a fiber close to its zero-dispersion point and find that the chirped airy pulse is focused and subsequently forms a channel with several dispersion lengths after tight focusing. The channel can be controlled by adjusting the chirp parameters of the input Airy pulse. These findings create new opportunities for all-optical switching and fiber optics sensing.
ieee_keywords: ['Chirp', 'Dispersion', 'Shape', 'Optical diffraction', 'Optical pulses', 'Acceleration', 'Nonlinear optics']

abstracts: We present a 150 mm cladding light stripper (CLS) for kW-level operation with high attenuation and low temperature rising by unique structure design. When the stripped power was 1.01 kW, the CLS achieved an attenuation of 39 dB and the maximum temperature of 78.5 !f with an average stripped power density of 7.156W106 W/m2. To the best of our knowledge, the CLS reported here has the highest average stripped power density and attenuation coefficient without compromising temperature performance.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber devices', 'Etching', 'Chemicals', 'Attenuation', 'Scattering', 'Fiber lasers']
author_keywords: ['Fiber laser component', 'cladding light stripper', 'double cladding fiber', 'high power fiber laser.']

abstracts: This paper demonstrates optical coherence from coupled vertical cavity laser arrays can be achieved reproducibly and with high yield by resonance tuning. Specifically, this work is the first application of resonance tuning to substrate emitting arrays, and to arrays with more than two elements. We show the generality of resonance tuning to achieve coherent arrays with several experimental examples.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Substrates', 'Optical arrays', 'Photonic crystals', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical reflection']
author_keywords: ['Coherent arrays', 'semiconductor laser arrays', 'vertical cavity surface emitting lasers']

abstracts: In order to reduce the chromatic dispersion induced BGS distortion, frequency pre-shift induced system complexities increase and I/Q demodulator induced measurement time increase, coherent BOTDA sensor with probe light based on SSB-IM, with local light by utilizing laser source light directly and with BGS demodulation by employing logarithmic detector has been proposed.
ieee_keywords: ['Frequency modulation', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Scattering', 'Probes', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Coherent BOTDA', 'distributed fiber sensing', 'double-sideband modulation', 'single-sideband modulation', 'chromatic dispersion']

abstracts: We demonstrate a compact (367×67μm2) four-channel wavelength division multiplexer using an arrayed waveguide grating based on multimode interference couplers, and built on a monolithic silicon photonics platform. The design is particularly attractive due to the thin device layer. A semi-numerical approach was used for device design and simulation. Optical measurements were found to be consistent with simulation results. The device channel spacing, 3-dB bandwidth and crosstalk were measured to be 97 GHz, 87 GHz and 9.6 dB, respectively, for the designed wavelength of operation near 1310 nm.
ieee_keywords: ['Arrayed waveguide gratings', 'Optical waveguides', 'Couplers', 'Silicon', 'Phased arrays', 'Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Photonics']
author_keywords: ['Arrayed waveguide grating', 'multimode interference coupler', 'monolithic platform', 'silicon-on-insulator', 'silicon photonics']

abstracts: Connecting grating coupler with nano waveguides require the lateral dimension to be tapered down from micro scale to nano scale which often causes large footprint in photonic integrated circuits. We proposed an ultra-compact grating coupler based on dual-taper partially overlay spot-size converter (SSC) which downsizes the effective length of the SSC to 60 μm, while reducing the lateral height and width to 220 and 320 nm respectively by maintaining reasonable values for CE and CBW.
ieee_keywords: ['Gratings', 'Silicon', 'Couplings', 'Couplers', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Fiber gratings']

abstracts: The role of temporal property of pump laser in single-frequency RFA is investigated. Results show that co-pumped RFA could provide a well platform to reflect the intensity stability of the pump laser, and the conversion efficiency (CE) varies with the intensity stability of the pump laser. However, the CE of the counter-pumped RFA is independent of the intensity stability of the pump laser. The results also reveal that low noise RFA could be achieved by using intensity stable pumping.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Pump lasers', 'Oscillators', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Power generation', 'Optical pumping']

abstracts: This work comprehensively studies the random distributed feedback fiber laser based on Ytterbium-doped fiber and single mode fiber. The numercial model is established based on the rate equations of Yb3+-doped fiber laser and modified to simulate the performance of the proposed YRFLs. This work broadens the operation wavelengh to 1053nm and potential applicaton fields to high energy large scale laser facility of RFL.
ieee_keywords: ['Distributed feedback devices', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Laser feedback']
author_keywords: ['Random fiber laser', 'random distributed feedback', 'ytterbium-doped fiber', 'Rayleigh scattering.']

abstracts: Various MgO:PPLN-OPOs pumped by 1.064 μm laser source can be produced using 1.57 μm and 3.84 μm lasers and proficient results can be obtained. However, the dual-wavelength laser generation corresponding to two OPO processes, so that the use of single MgO:PPLN cannot simultaneously phase match both of them. In this paper, for the first time, a synchronized 1.57 μm and 3.84 μm laser has been realized using single MgO:APLN crystal.
ieee_keywords: ['Crystals', 'Laser beams', 'Pump lasers', 'Power generation', 'Optical pumping', 'Nonlinear optics']
author_keywords: ['Multiple optical parametric oscillator', 'aperiodically poled lithium niobate', '1.57 μm and 3.84 μm lasers.']

abstracts: An optical approach to generating continuously tunable chirped microwave waveforms using a tilted fiber Bragg grating (TFBG) written in an erbium/ytterbium (Er/Yb) codoped fiber is proposed. By pumping the TFBG, the magnitude and group delay responses of the cladding mode resonances are changed, which can be used to implement a photonic microwave delay-line filter with increasing or decreasing tap spacing. If an ultranarrow pulse is sent to the photonic microwave delay-line filter, a pulse burst with increasing or decreasing pulse spacing is generated. The photodetection of the pulse burst would lead to the generation of a chirped microwave waveform. The proposed technique is demonstrated by an experiment in which a chirped microwave waveform with a tunable chirp rate from 1.8 to 7 GHz/ns is generated.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave filters', 'Microwave photonics', 'Chirp', 'Delay effects', 'Optical fiber filters']
author_keywords: ['Chirped waveform generation', 'microwave photonics', 'tilted fiber Bragg grating', 'tunable time delay']

abstracts: A core-mode-cladding-supermode modal interferometer with all-solid photonic bandgap fiber (AS-PBF) is constructed, and a reflective Michelson-type high-temperature sensor is fabricated. Such a fiber sensor is constituted by a small segment of AS-PBF and a leading single-mode fiber. The splice region of the two fibers is weakly tapered to excite the cladding supermode. Both the interference spectra and the near-field infrared CCD images verify that the LP01 cladding supermode is effectively excited and interferes with the LP01 core mode, which agrees well with theoretical results. Benefiting from a large effective thermooptic coefficient between the two modes, temperature sensitivity up to 0.111 nm/°C at 500 ° C is obtained in experiment. The proposed sensor is compact and easy to fabricate, which makes it very attractive for high-temperature sensing applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature sensors', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Temperature measurement', 'Sensitivity', 'Interference', 'Optical interferometry']

abstracts: The originality of our work is the realization of a novel source for Brillouin fiber based sensor (BFS). The article describes the realization of this source, which is a dual-frequency VECSEL emitting at 1550 nm with a frequency difference close to 11 GHz (the scattered Brillouin frequency in single mode fibers). Special attention has been paid to the effect of the intracavity etalon transmission bandwidth and free spectral range to achieve a stable dual frequency emission essential for BFS.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical mixing', 'Optical pumping', 'Optical scattering']
author_keywords: ['Semiconductor lasers', 'diode-pumped lasers', 'dual-frequency lasers', 'Brillouin scattering', 'optical fiber sensors.']

abstracts: This work realizes 130-GHz and 150-GHz D-band mm-wave generation based on two cascaded intensity modulators. 2 An optical frequency comb is employed for frequency multiplication and improving the flexibility of multiple frequencies generation. 3 SSB modulation is used to reduce the impairment caused by fiber dispersion and improve the bandwidth efficiency. 4 Complicated precoding process is omitted to simplify DSP process in the transmitter end and improve the system performance.
ieee_keywords: ['Amplitude modulation', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical modulation', 'Radio frequency', 'Optical harmonic generation']
author_keywords: ['Optical frequency comb', 'single-sideband modulation', 'intensity modulator', 'radio-over-fiber and millimeter-wave generation.']

abstracts: We propose and demonstrate a 100 Gbit/s SiPh coherent Rx with advanced DSP for DP-QPSK transmission. It employs integrated 2D 2D-GCs, modified hybrid mixers and high speed SiGe PDs. The 2D-GC replaces the polarization beam splitters and rotators. Besides, our modified hybrid mixers allow outputs of in-phase (I) and quadrature-phase (Q) channels at X and Y polarizations located side-by-side. The Rx was fabricated based on the latest IMEC run, with SiGe PD > 50 GHz.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical polarization', 'Mixers', 'Silicon germanium', 'Optical signal processing', 'Optical device fabrication', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Adaptive optics']

abstracts: We present a deeply etched pit reflector that overcomes the slot depth sensitivity and eliminate the need to use wet etching. The pit reflector does not require high resolution lithography such as holography, E-beam or complicated fabrication techniques such as focused ion beam etching (FIBE) as required by typical single mode lasers. Finally, a laser cavity with multiple pits is presented to demonstrate that the pit can be used to fabricate tunable and narrow linewidth single mode lasers.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser modes', 'Laser tuning', 'Cavity resonators', 'Waveguide lasers', 'Fabrication', 'Distributed feedback devices']

abstracts: We investigate dielectric-loaded surface plasmon-polariton waveguides (DLSPPWs) fabricated by two-photon polymerization direct laser writing and nanoimprinting at the telecom wavelength of 1550 nm. We examine several types of structures such as lines and bends as individual plasmonic components. Racetrack resonators are presented as a potential application of this technology. These plasmonic components can be investigated at 1550-nm wavelength by leakage radiation microscopy using an InGaAs camera. The experimentally observed behavior of these components in a leakage radiation microscope matches the theoretical expectations. The results demonstrate the practical feasibility of laser-fabricated DLSPPW components at telecom wavelength.
ieee_keywords: ['Telecommunications', 'Waveguide lasers', 'Plasmons', 'Microscopy', 'Dielectrics', 'Surface waves', 'Surface emitting lasers', 'Polymers', 'Writing', 'Indium gallium arsenide']

abstracts: We proposed a new, fully-integrated LED driver chip to increase the modulation bandwidth of VLC system. The -3dB bandwidth of phosphorescent white LED transmitters can be extended from 3 MHz to 80 MHz by our chip. The data-rate of our VLC link is 112Mbit/s. To the best of our knowledge, this is the highest data rate ever achieved by phosphorescent white LED and integrated circuit based VLC systems at common indoor distance.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Integrated circuit modeling', 'Bandwidth', 'Wireless communication', 'Switches', 'Driver circuits', 'Modulation']
author_keywords: ['Wireless optical communication', 'white light-emitting-diode (LED)', 'free-space optical communication', 'integrated optoelectronic circuits.']

abstracts: A SOI-compatible plasmonic modulator based on an n-p-n type Al/p-Si hybrid structure is investigated. The highly doped p-Si shows metal-like properties, which could support surface plasmon polariton waves. This hybrid plasmonic modulator not only depends on propagation loss due to absorption but also makes use of coupling loss caused by modal mismatch, owning high modulation efficiency. It shows great promise in application in silicon integrated optical circuits.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Optical waveguides', 'Plasmons', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical refraction', 'Optical variables control']

abstracts: We report design and implementation of a novel 2.5 Gb/s Optical Wireless Communication (OWC) system, intended for High Energy Physics experiments. The OWC system consists of off-the-shelf VCSEL and PIN photodiode with suitable ball lens. Its main feature is the passive tolerance to misalignment range of +/-1mm (at BER of 1e-12), suitable for particle detectors mechanical tolerances. All the optical devices are tested under X-rays up till 238 Mrad (Si) dose, showing no degradation.
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Holography', 'Holographic optical components', 'Optical imaging', 'Photodiodes', 'Prototypes']

abstracts: A single-pixel imaging (SPI) system is often applied to a specific scenario. The target object images may belong to a specific category and have some common features. Fourier or Hadamard illumination patterns can be sub-optimal since they are fixed and non-adaptive. We propose a novel scheme for designing and optimizing the illumination patterns adaptively from an image dictionary by extracting the common features using principal component analysis (PCA), with enhanced imaging efficiency.
ieee_keywords: ['Lighting', 'Imaging', 'Dictionaries', 'Transforms', 'Principal component analysis', 'Image reconstruction', 'Training']

abstracts: We present a rigorous electrical and optical analysis of a highly scaled, graded-base, SiGe heterojunction bipolar transistor (HBT) electrooptic (EO) modulator. In this study, we propose a 2-D electrical model and a 3-D optical model for a graded-base SiGe HBT structure that is capable of operating at a data bit rate of 250 Gbit/s or higher. In this structure, apart from a polysilicon/low doped emitter(width=90 nm)and a strained SiGe graded base(depth=8.5 nm), a selectively implanted collector (SIC)(depth=26 nm)is introduced. Furthermore, at a base-emitter swing of 0 to 1.0 V, this model predicts a rise time of 3.48 ps and a fall time of 0.55 ps. Optical simulations predict aπphase shift length(Lπ)of 204μm, with an extinction ratio of 13.2 dB at a wavelength of 1.55μm.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon germanium', 'Heterojunction bipolar transistors', 'Electrooptic modulators', 'Mathematical model', 'Doping']
author_keywords: ['Semiconductor device modeling', 'integrated optics', 'optical modulation', 'plasma dispersion effect', 'SiGe', 'heterojunction bipolar transistors']

abstracts: It is the first paper to use the correlation map method and the low cost thin film pressure sensor to systematically study the depth resolved optical attenuation coefficients in different layers of in-vivo human skin under different contact pressures, while monitoring the structural change of some skin layers with the OCT data. We believe that our proposed method and the obtained experimental data are useful for noninvasive diagnostic measurements.
ieee_keywords: ['Attenuation', 'Monitoring', 'Optical scattering', 'Correlation', 'Optical attenuators', 'Dermis']

abstracts: 1. The efficient SCFDM-based dimming control systems including AHO-SCFDM and DCO-SCFDM are first proposed for VLC. 2. Due to low PAPR and resistance to high-frequency distortion, AHO-SCFDM and DCO-SCFDM dimming control schemes can effectively support the wide dimming range for different illumination requirements. 3. 24.8% and 31.3% gains of average spectral efficiency can be achieved under the same dimming range compared with their counterparts, respectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Control systems', 'OFDM', 'Encoding', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Optical distortion', 'Lighting', 'Optical transmitters']
author_keywords: ['Visible light communication', 'light emitting diode', 'dimming control', 'orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing', 'single-carrier frequency-division multiplexing']

abstracts: Hybrid radio frequency (RF) and visible light communication (VLC) networks can provide high throughput and energy efficiency with VLC access points (APs) while ensuring ubiquitous coverage with RF APs. Due to dynamic channel conditions and limited resources, the hybrid RF/VLC networks’ resource allocation problem is complex and challenging. Conventional resource allocation techniques fail to overcome these challenges. Heuristic methods can solve high complexity problems; however, they are not robust against changes such as dynamic channel conditions or alternating user requirements. Heuristic methods require centralized control for stability which adds communication overhead between APs. Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) based solutions can solve high complexity, dynamic channel conditions, and alternating user requirements while not requiring centralized control. In this paper, we formulate a distributed downlink power allocation problem to optimize the transmit power for users to reach target data rates in hybrid RF/VLC networks. Then, we propose a distributed DRL-based algorithm Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient (DDPG), to solve the formulated computationally-intensive problem. We implement a simulation environment to benchmark the proposed distributed DRL-based method against other methods such as Q-Learning (QL) and Deep Q-Networks (DQN), and centralized heuristic power allocation algorithms. Our simulation results show that the distributed DDPG-based algorithm learns to adapt against changes in the channel or user requirements, while centralized Genetic Algorithm and Particle Swarm Optimization-based algorithms fail to endure against these changes even with coordination between APs. Additionally, we quantify the performance of the DDPG-based algorithm to prevail amid DRL-based algorithms at the expense of higher implementation complexity.
ieee_keywords: ['Resource management', 'Heuristic algorithms', 'Quality of service', 'Optimization', 'Hybrid power systems', 'Radio frequency', 'Optical filters']

abstracts: We experimentally demonstrate a novel scheme which has potential in realizing high-capacity logic operations with a single nonlinear device by exploiting spatial dimension (i.e. using mode-division multiplexing technique) in conventional ones, and has never been reported so far on the SOI integrated platform. Applications in advanced logic functions can also be expected based on it. We believe this proof-of-concept work would have broad impact on all-optical signal processing etc.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Silicon', 'Multiplexing', 'Dispersion', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Directional couplers']

abstracts: One of technical challenges in laser inter-satellite link (ISL) is the mitigation of performance degradation caused by pointing errors and angle-of-arrival (AoA) fluctuations arising unavoidably from satellite movements and vibrations. In this paper, we propose the dynamic adaptive beam control (ABC) technique implementable by using variable focus lenses (VFLs) at both the transmitter and receiver. In this technique, we monitor the instantaneous pointing error and AoA fluctuation induced by satellite vibrations and then provide feedback corrections to the VFL-based ABC system. The VFLs at the transmitter and receiver adjust their focal lengths adaptively to the amount of pointing error and AoA fluctuation, respectively, to minimize the link loss. VFLs operated by electro-wetting or electromagnetic actuator are fast enough to respond to the vibrations. We design the proposed dynamic ABC system for laser ISL by using the double-lens configuration and VFLs. An exemplary system design is presented when commercially available VFLs are utilized. Our simulation study shows that the proposed dynamic ABC technique offers improved transmission performance, compared to the static and the dynamic ABC technique applied to either the transmitter or receiver.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Optical transmitters', 'Vibrations', 'Receivers', 'Optical beams', 'Fluctuations', 'Apertures']
author_keywords: ['Adaptive beam control', 'free space optical communications', 'inter-satellite communications']

abstracts: Nonlinear dynamics of a 1550-nm vertical-cavity surface-emitting laser with positive optoelectronic feedback are studied both numerically and experimentally. A mapping of dynamical states is presented in the parameter space of feedback delay time and feedback strength, where different states are identified and shown. A bifurcation diagram of the extrema of output peak series versus the feedback delay time is plotted. Various nonlinear dynamical behaviors, including regular pulsing, quasi-periodic pulsing, and chaotic pulsing, have been numerically and experimentally observed. Both numerical simulation and experimental observation indicate that the laser enters a chaotic pulsing state at certain delay times of the feedback loop through a quasi-periodic route.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Delays', 'Nonlinear dynamical systems', 'Mathematical model', 'Laser feedback', 'Optical feedback']
author_keywords: ['1550 nm vertical-cavity surface emitting laser (1550nm VCSEL)', 'nonlinear dynamics', 'positive optoelectronic feedback (POEF)']

abstracts: In my paper we numerically show that dark cavity soliton exist in normal GVD regime when we consider the third-order dispersion, which would be a great achievement because the cavity soliton in normal GVD regime is really difficult to get. And we demonstrate that we could adjust the shape of the cavity soliton by changing the curve of the dispersion.
ieee_keywords: ['Dispersion', 'Solitons', 'Cavity resonators', 'Microcavities', 'Resonant frequency', 'Steady-state', 'Frequency-domain analysis']

abstracts: The optical guiding in a VCSEL plays an important role in improving the efficiency. In this work, we fabricated and comparatively studied GaN-based VCSELs with and without lateral optical confinement (LOC) structure. We believe this study will provide a better understanding of the optical and thermal property of GaN-based VCSELs with such a typical structure and is useful in optimizing the structure design and improving the device performance.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Standards', 'Cavity resonators', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Optical pumping', 'Optical diffraction']
author_keywords: ['Semiconductor lasers', 'vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'lateral optical confinement.']

abstracts: The focus of this manuscript is on a robust blind constant modulus scheme. The proposed novel scheme for CFO estimation offers a superior performance as compared to existing constant modulus schemes. The proposed scheme, unlike the existing constant modulus-based schemes, ensures a better, robust and efficient performance under fiber impairments. The proposed cost-function can be adapted for phase noise and channel estimation by following our derivation.
ieee_keywords: ['Estimation', 'OFDM', 'Cost function', 'Covariance matrices', 'Frequency division multiplexing', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: Soliton fusion is a wave phenomenon that is observed in optical fiber due to the interaction between co-propagating soliton shape pulses. One of the mechanisms to generate optical rogue waves is recognized as soliton fusion. In previous works, authors mentioned that the soliton parameters directly affect the soliton fusion and they have not evaluated those parameters. Therefore, we evaluate the soliton parameters for soliton fusion by using solitons eigenvalues for the first time.
ieee_keywords: ['Eigenvalues and eigenfunctions', 'Shape', 'Optical solitons', 'Optical pulses', 'Dispersion', 'Nonlinear optics']

abstracts: The presented electro-absorption optical modulator (EOM) is based on graphene-buried polymer waveguides by burying the graphene layers in the center of polymer waveguide core. Calculations show that the proposed EOM can realize 29 dB extinction ratio and 42 GHz bandwidth with an 800 μm-long active region. The proposed modulator can remedy the lack of high-speed optical modulator on the passive polymer waveguide and have a potential application for polymer-based PICs.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Polymers', 'Optical modulation', 'Conductivity', 'Electrooptical waveguides']

abstracts: An energy-efficient and survivable optical access network scheme is proposed. In this scheme, multiple paths are available for an ONU to access an OLT, which not only ensures the survivability of ONU-OLT connections, but also achieves energy saving by aggregating more traffic under low load. Simulation results indicate that the scheme shows great advantages on power saving, network survivability, as well as flexibility, and more energy can be saved by further resource scheduling.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical switches', 'Energy efficiency', 'Optical network units', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: The mismatch between multiple transmitters? power is a common phenomenon, which leads to unequal spacing between each adjacent level and damages the performance. We study and analyze the mismatch between the two transmitters. A DBSCAN method is employed to get actual center of each cluster and distinguish each level of PAM7 signals. A new decision curve substitutes traditional standard straight line as a constellation discrimination method. A 1.22Gb/s PAM7 MISO UVLC system is achieved.
ieee_keywords: ['MISO communication', 'Transmitters', 'Modulation', 'Machine learning algorithms', 'Visible light communication', 'Machine learning', 'OFDM']

abstracts: This paper gives a solution to one of the fundamental limitations of silicon-photonics based ultrasound detectors: the low photo-elastic response of silicon and silica. By using a BCB over-cladding, 5-fold increase in the acoustic sensitivity is achieved. We additionally provide a detailed analysis of the sensing mechanism, quantifying the different effects that contribute to the enhanced sensitivity.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Silicon', 'Ultrasonic imaging', 'Sensitivity', 'Optical sensors', 'Optical device fabrication']

abstracts: Power scaling of continuous-wave, narrow-linewidth fiber lasers are limited by the onset of stimulated Brillouin scattering (SBS) which manifests at threshold as potentially damaging, peak power, backward propagating pulses. While several SBS mitigation techniques exist, optical linewidth broadening through external phase modulation using white noise is predominantly used for its simplicity. But the broadened line-shape is non-ideal and has a slow roll-off resulting in increased SBS seeding from reflections and hence limited power scaling. With better line-shape control, higher output powers can be achieved. In this work, we propose a simple and effective technique to improve the SBS suppression of these high power, narrow linewidth, noise broadened systems, by the addition of a sinusoidal modulation in cascade. The dual modulation results in an improved line-shape with a relatively flat topped-center and fast roll-off when compared to pure noise modulation at similar root-mean-square (RMS) linewidths. Using a multi-stage fully polarization maintaining, kW-class amplifier, we demonstrate >2.3X enhancement in SBS limited output power when compared to the pure noise modulated case at ∼7.3 GHz and >1.029 kW output power at ∼10.4 GHz RMS linewidth.
ieee_keywords: ['Scattering', 'Modulation', 'Power generation', 'Phase modulation', 'Power amplifiers', 'Power lasers', 'Optical fiber polarization']
author_keywords: ['Stimulated Brillouin scattering', 'phase modulation', 'white noise source', 'sinusoidal modulation', 'high power fiber lasers', 'narrow linewidth', 'power scaling', 'kilo-watt class']

abstracts: Electro-optic entanglement is vital to combine the two worlds of superconducting and photonic quantum systems. However, achieving tunable and wideband electro-optic entanglement is still an unresolved challenge. In this work, a novel approach for tunable microwave and optical fields entanglement is proposed using an electrical capacitor loaded with graphene plasmonic waveguide.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical resonators', 'Microwave photonics', 'Microwave imaging', 'Holography', 'Holographic optical components', 'Optical imaging', 'Graphene']

abstracts: The main contribution of this paper is a diagram that describes the vision effects caused by cirtopic, scotopic, and photopic photoreceptors. The established diagram, i.e., a mathematical tool, can be used to calculate and predict cirtopic, scotopic, and photopic vision effects and to optimize light sources to induce these effects, which helps the spectrum optimization of smart light-emitting diode (LED) lighting. This paper is of particular interest to lighting/LED researchers and workers.
ieee_keywords: ['Light sources', 'Lighting', 'Color', 'Sensitivity', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Optimization', 'Photoreceptors']
author_keywords: ['Circadian effect', 'mesopic vision effect', 'vision effect diagram', 'spectral optimization', 'smart light-emitting diode (LED) lighting']

abstracts: We experimentally investigate the performances of an optical reservoir computing (RC) system based on two parallel time-delay reservoirs composed of two semiconductor lasers (SLs) subject to optical feedback. In such a system, the information being processed is split into two parts to send into two reservoirs through directly modulating the pump currents of two SLs, and the temporal output of the two SLs are sampled and taken as the virtual node states for training and testing. Via Santa Fe time series prediction task and multi-waveform recognition task, the performances of the proposed RC system are investigated and compared with those of the system based on one reservoir. The results show that the system based on two parallel reservoirs behaves better performance and stronger parameter robustness than that based on one reservoir. Moreover, through analyzing the dependence of the system performances on the number of virtual node states actually used for readout, the potential data processing rate (DPR) of the system is evaluated. For processing a prediction task under guaranteeing the normalized mean square error below 0.1 and a recognition task under guaranteeing the signal error rate below 0.005, the potential DPR of the proposed RC system can achieve 200 MSa/s, which is twice the DPR of the system with only one reservoir.
ieee_keywords: ['Reservoirs', 'Task analysis', 'Optical feedback', 'Feedback loop', 'Optical pumping', 'Training', 'Time series analysis']
author_keywords: ['Reservoir computing (RC)', 'semiconductor laser (SL)', 'time-delay reservoirs', 'chaotic time series prediction', 'multi-waveform recognition']

abstracts: (1).It is firstly demonstrated that TMI and IM-FWM can be suppressed simultaneously by increasing the bending diameter. (2)It is firstly observed that the thresholds of TMI and IM-FWM can be very close to each other in experiment. (3)The fact that the thresholds are close to each other is independent of the pumping scheme, while it cannot be maintained with the variation of the bending diameter. (4)The counter-pumping scheme is beneficial to suppress both of two effects.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Power generation', 'Fiber lasers', 'Power amplifiers', 'Laser beams', 'Laser modes']

abstracts: We study the characteristic of the generalized VLC channel based on the theoretical analysis and experiments. It shows that the position of the receiver is major contributing factor in the scaling scalar instead of the shape of frequency response. Depending on it, a predefined VLC system with a new channel feedback method is described. Compared with the conventional feedback method, both the complexity and time cost of feedback can greatly reduce through the proposed channel feedback method.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Optical distortion', 'Wireless communication', 'Shape', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical feedback', 'Optical transmitters']
author_keywords: ['VLC', 'generalized VLC channel', 'response mask invariant characteristic', 'channel feedback']

abstracts: We studied the transverse mode instability (TMI) characteristics of few-mode fiber laser amplifier employing ytterbium-doped fiber (YDF) with core/cladding diameter of 30/400 μm under different bending diameters. The gain fiber is coiled in ellipse shape with minimum bending diameter changed from 9 cm, 10 cm, 11 cm to 12 cm in the bending part, and the experimental results show an anomaly characteristic of TMI. The TMI threshold improved from 772 W, 1149 W and 1458 W to 1641 W when the bending diameter of YDF increase from 9 cm, 10 cm, 11 cm to 12 cm, accompanied by the deterioration of beam quality from 1.60, 1.67, 1.87 to 1.95. This is mainly because tightly bending in few-mode fiber will promote the overlap between modes and lead to mode coupling, which may trigger TMI. Besides, the bending losses of HOMs decrease while bending diameter increasing, so that there is higher output efficiency and deteriorated beam quality when bending diameter increase. Although the phenomenon is not agreed with common TMI with near single-mode fiber laser, the result will be helpful for the design and power scaling of few-mode fiber lasers.
ieee_keywords: ['Bending', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber devices', 'Laser beams', 'Optical fiber theory']
author_keywords: ['High power fiber lasers', 'transverse mode instability', 'bending diameters', 'few-mode fibers']

abstracts: High-quality epitaxial layers of heavily dopedYb:KLu(WO4)2grown onKLu(WO4)2substrates by liquid phase epitaxy were characterized in terms of lattice mismatch and refractive indexes of the layer and the substrate. The effective refractive indexes of the guided modes that these structures can support were modeled and measured experimentally for the transverse electric (TE) and transverse magnetic (TM) mode excitation by dark m-lines spectroscopy. The upper limit for optical losses in these waveguides corresponding only to scattering processes was estimated to be∼1.5 dB/cm atλ=632.8 nm. These results show that, apart for highly efficient thin-disk laser applications, these epilayers can be used as waveguide devices at wavelengths different from those used to exciteYb3+.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Substrates', 'Refractive index', 'Laser excitation', 'Optical scattering', 'Epitaxial layers', 'Epitaxial growth', 'Lattices', 'Semiconductor process modeling', 'Electric variables measurement']

abstracts: This study demonstrated the photonic and electronic results of ultra-violet micro-LEDs. We are the first paper to report the temperature-dependent electrical characteristics of 5 micro-meter-size LED chips. The effect of sidewall on the leakage current can greatly affect the light emitting capability of the small devices. This study can pave the way to enhance the device performance in the future.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Current-voltage characteristics', 'Leakage currents', 'Gallium nitride']
author_keywords: ['GaN', 'micro LEDs', 'Ultra-violet emission', 'leakage current', 'Arrhenius plot', 'low temperature current-voltage characterization']

abstracts: High-precision positioning of two underwater mobile robots based on laser beams alignment is one of the most challenging problems. In this paper, we addressed the laser beams alignment to maintain the position of the receiver robot aligned with the transmitter robot despite the effects of noise and active disturbances. In this paper also, a new state space model is proposed comparing to a paper in the literature which helped in the performance of the controller.
ieee_keywords: ['Wireless communication', 'Underwater communication', 'Robustness', 'Kalman filters', 'Control design']
author_keywords: ['Control design', 'extended kalman filter (EKF)', 'linear quadratic regulator (LQR)', 'underwater wireless optical communication (UWOC)']

abstracts: We have demonstrated a passive detection and tracking methodology for CamCom receivers in intelligent transport systems that can maintain a BER of 1.9 × 10−4 while passively detecting and tracking the moving transmitter undergoing worst-case road vibration of 30.6 mm/s. Our method is also independent of the size and shape of the transmitter and thus finds promising applications in intelligent transport systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Receivers', 'Visible light communication', 'Vibrations', 'Optical transmitters', 'Tracking', 'Roads']
author_keywords: ['Visible light communication', 'moving transceivers', 'target detection and tracking', 'vibrations']

abstracts: Orbital angular momentum (OAM) in optical vortex (OV) beams has recently been shown to dramatically increase the data transmission rate in optical communication systems. In this work, we demonstrate a robust and flexible optical routing mechanism. With special designed OV gratings, our experiments demonstrate for the first time simultaneous multiple OAM channels (49 OAM channels, 1.37Tbit/s data capacity) routing with microsecond level switching speeds in parallel.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical interconnections', 'Optical vortices', 'Optical switches', 'Gratings', 'Diffraction', 'Optical polarization', 'Diffraction gratings']

abstracts: This article deals with cascadable plasmonic full adder and presents a configuration of the plasmonic logic circuits. The full adder was composed of single- and multi-mode waveguides. The logic operations were obtained by interference of plasmonic signals and confirmed with 3-dimensional electromagnetic field analyses and experimentally demonstrated for some input signal patterns using scanning near-field optical spectroscopy. This brings high impact to researchers in photonics.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Adders', 'Optical waveguides', 'Logic circuits', 'Interference']

abstracts: A new symmetrical GIMF-SIMF-GIMF SA was designed. Its advantages include high stability, all-fiber structure, low cost, etc. A femtosecond fiber laser based on this SA was proved. The duration of soliton is 364 fs, repetition rate is tunable from 10.29 to 763.36 MHz, and mode-locking threshold is 20 mW. Compared to other fiber laser, its performances are significantly improved, such as better stability, narrower pulse-width, higher repetition rate, and lower mode-locking threshold.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber devices', 'Solitons', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Laser mode locking', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Ultrafast optics']
author_keywords: ['Femtosecond soliton', 'mode-locked fiber lasers', 'nonlinear multimode interference', 'ultrafast fiber lasers.']

abstracts: We designed and fabricated an ytterbium/cerium co-doped aluminosilicate fiber.We tested this fiber for over 500 minutes radiated by multi-kW pump light, directly justifying its strong photodarkening resistance. To date, no one has demonstrated Ce ions to effectively suppress photodarkening of Yb/Ce-AS fiber at 2kW-level, although Yb/Ce-AS fiber presented nearly 5kW-level in other report.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Ions', 'Laser excitation', 'Pump lasers', 'Power lasers']
author_keywords: ['Fiber design and fabrication', 'lasers', 'fiber', 'fiber optics amplifiers and oscillators.']

abstracts: In this paper, an optimized detection based on log-maximum a posteriori estimation with the fixed number of surviving states (fixed-state Log-MAP) is proposed cooperating with equalizers to deal with spectral distortions for intensity-modulation and direct-detection (IM/DD) optical transmission systems. The equalizers compensate the spectral distortions caused by limited bandwidth and chromatic dispersion, and the optimized detection decodes the useful bits from equalized symbols with severe colored in-band noise. To more accurately extract the bits, the optimized detection with larger memory length is required. However, the classical optimized detection based on maximum likelihood-sequence estimation (MLSE) requires exponential-growing computational complexity and storage space with the increase of memory length. The fixed-state Log-MAP detection can decrease the computational complexity and storage space from the exponential order to linear order. Therefore, the fixed-state Log-MAP detection can support larger memory length to more accurately extract bits with less logic gate resources and storage resources compared to MLSE. We experimentally verified the fixed-state Log-MAP detection in a C-band 64Gbit/s IM/DD on-off keying optical system over a 100km dispersion-uncompensated link. The fixed-state Log-MAP detection not only improves the receiver sensitivity of 2dB, but also reduces the computational complexity and storage space by three orders of magnitude.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical distortion', 'Computational complexity', 'Maximum likelihood estimation', 'Probability', 'Optical receivers', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Optical sensors']
author_keywords: ['Fixed-state Log-MAP detection', 'intensity-modulation and direct-detection', 'chromatic dispersion', 'spectral distortions']

abstracts: In C-RAN, traffic migration is discussed in optical fronthaul to help realize BBU aggregation. However, these schemes are based on a TDM way and are not suitable for multi-IF over WDM fronthaul. In this paper, we propose a reconfigurable multi-IF over WDM fronthaul to support BBU aggregation. Based on IF traffic migration and optical path reconfiguration, traffic of multiple cell sites can be routed to one BBU to achieve BBU aggregation. Experiments are demonstrated to verify the feasibility.
ieee_keywords: ['Computer architecture', 'Microprocessors', 'Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Uplink', 'Optical attenuators', 'Downlink', 'Receivers']
author_keywords: ['Baseband unit aggregation', 'multi-IF over WDM fronthaul', 'optical path reconfiguration.']

abstracts: We show a detailed frequency noise analysis of a 1.5-um modelocked laser with a high repetition rate of 25 GHz. Using a dedicated setup we separately characterized the noise of the repetition rate and carrier-envelope offset showing their correlation and partial compensation in an optical line. This work provides a better understanding of the noise properties of such lasers, e.g. for application in coherent telecommunication. This topic is fully relevant to IEEE Photonics Journal in our opinion.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser noise', 'Laser modes', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Optical interferometry', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Frequency measurement', 'Nonlinear optics']

abstracts: Differentially encoding and frequency offset compensating for a 16-quadrature amplitude modulation (16-QAM) vector signal in 60-GHz millimeter-wave radio-over-fiber (RoF) systems are experimentally investigated. The fourfold phase ambiguity issue in a non-data-aided signal communication transmission system with conventional square 16-QAM constellations is successfully tackled based on the differentially encoding scheme. Experimental results show that frequency offset compensation and carrier phase recovery are simultaneously achieved by utilizing the decision-directed carrier phase recovery algorithm. Up to∼±1.3×10−3frequency offset times symbol rate productΔf⋅Tsis well compensated at the given bit-error-ratio (BER) value of∼10−3.
ieee_keywords: ['Vectors', 'Optical fibers', 'Bit error rate', 'Optical receivers', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical filters']

abstracts: This is a comparative study of a single-pass SHG of ultrafast laser in 5-mm-long BBO and BIBO crystals. For comparable values of temporal and spatial walk-off parameters, the spatial walk-off highly influences the optimum focusing condition of SHG. The Boyd & Kleinman theory for SHG of cw and long pulse lasers is also valid for ultrafast lasers. We show the effect of focusing on spectral, temporal, spatial characteristics, and acceptance bandwidth for SHG process under different temporal and spatial walk-off parameters.
ieee_keywords: ['Crystals', 'Focusing', 'Frequency conversion', 'Laser excitation', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Laser theory', 'Pump lasers']
author_keywords: ['Harmonic generation and mixing', 'nonlinear optics', 'materials', 'ultrafast lasers', 'fiber lasers', 'upconversion', 'visible lasers']

abstracts: This paper describes and demonstrates a single-shot, full-field (amplitude and phase) optical waveform measurement technique that utilizes interferometry, frequency-to-time mapping, and four-quadrature coherent detection. This generalized frequency-to-time-mapping technique and associated reconstruction algorithm does not need to satisfy the usual far-field (Fraunhofer) requirement for performing an optical Fourier transform (OFT), and therefore, it provides significant improvements in fidelity and record length compared with previous OFT-based methods. Different implementations of the method demonstrate polarization-diversified, real-time, single-shot measurements with optical bandwidths in excess of 560 GHz, signal powers as small as 25 μW, and extend record lengths to more than 3 μs.
