Results show the measurement of complex waveforms with time-bandwidth products in excess of 1 million.

An 870-nm-band wavelength tunable edge-emitting semiconductor laser based on V-coupled cavities in a GaAs/AlGaAs material system is presented. It does not involve any grating or epitaxial regrowth. Using a single electrode control, 31-channel wavelength tuning with a channel spacing of about 0.38 nm is achieved, with a tuning range of 11.4 nm. By additionally varying the temperature from 8°C to 50°C, wavelength tuning of 60 channels over 22.4 nm is demonstrated. At lower tuning current and with a temperature variation of 18°C, wavelength switching by carrier plasma effect is achieved with a tuning range of 8.2 nm. The simple and compact 870-nm-band edge-emitting tunable laser is suitable for multifunctional photonic integration for optical interconnect and biomedical applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Laser tuning', 'Electrodes', 'Gallium arsenide']

abstracts: A kind of photonic low phase-noise (PN) frequency-sextupled signal generation based on based on multimode optoelectronic oscillator and two cascaded Mach–Zehnder modulators is realized by the scheme. The generated frequency-doubled and frequency-sextupled signal has lower PN. Compared with the 4-GHz drive signal, the PN of the generated 24-GHz frequency-sextupled signal has a 14.6-dB reduction at a 10-kHz frequency offset.
ieee_keywords: ['Amplitude modulation', 'Microwave oscillators', 'Optical variables measurement', 'Microwave photonics', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: Currently the WiFi can only provide megabit-per-second service. Higher carrier frequency is needed to provide more bandwidth and mm-wave frequency will be necessary in the future. Mm-wave wireless WiFi devices should provide multiple-frequency service to meet different requirements. We propose a new scheme to generate multiple-frequency optical mm-wave signal without optical filter at the transmitter. 40, 80 and 120GHz multiple-frequency optical mm-wave signals are generated in our experiment.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical filters', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical transmitters']

abstracts: Photonic microwave has wide applications in radio-over-fiber communications, radar, signal processing etc., where photonic microwave generation based on optoelectronic oscillator (OEO) scheme has received much attention in recent years. In this work, we propose and experimentally demonstrate a novel OEO structure for the generation of widely tunable narrow-linewidth photonic microwave by using an optical injection semiconductor laser under optical feedback as active microwave photonic filter.
ieee_keywords: ['Masers', 'Optical feedback', 'Optical attenuators', 'Microwave filters', 'Optical filters', 'Microwave oscillators', 'Microwave photonics']
author_keywords: ['Photonic microwave', 'distributed feedback semiconductor laser (DFB-SL)', 'optoelectronic oscillator (OEO)', 'microwave photonic filter (MPF)', 'optical injection', 'optical feedback', 'linewidth', 'phase variance']

abstracts: We investigate the giant tunable Goos-Hänchen shifts in prism/graphene structure. It is found that large positive and negative lateral Goos-Hänchen shifts can be easily controlled by adjusting the chemical potential of the graphene, which is modulated by the external applied electric field. By using the stationary-phase method, we theoretically analyze the effect of the external applied electric field on Goos-Hänchen shifts of the proposed prism/graphene structure. Our theoretical study shows that the magnitude of the Goos-Hänchen shift is more than 200 times that of the operating terahertz wavelength. Numerical calculation results further indicate that the present structure has the potential application for the terahertz-wave switch.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Electric fields', 'Permittivity', 'Conductivity']

abstracts: (1)A simple and analytical model to describe the properties of CPPs has been derived through classical electromagnetic theory.(2)We theoretically demonstrate the existence of two types of CPPs in THz range: one we refer to as Fabry-Pérot-like modes (FPLMs) and the other as, surface-plasmon-like modes (SPLMs).(3)To resolve the main shortcomings of metal electrodes used in electric doping, we propose a scheme to modulate the THz CPP properties via optical modulation.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Cavity resonators', 'Plasmons', 'Dispersion', 'Photonics', 'Optical pumping', 'Optical modulation']

abstracts: Fiber gratings are central components in fiber lasers and sensor systems alike. While grating fabrication in silica fibres is a mature and established technology, grating fabrication in fluoride fibres that can be used in the crucial mid-infrared spectral region, is still subject to active research. This manuscript provides a comprehensive review of this field.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber gratings', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Glass', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Optical fiber networks']
author_keywords: ['Fiber gratings', 'fiber Bragg gratings', 'Long period gratings', 'femtosecond laser fabrication', 'fluoride fibers', 'mid-infrared.']

abstracts: This manuscript describes a fundamental work on understanding the dynamics of surface scattering. We make use of a phase-sensitive setup to study the backscattering in a microresonator. We introduce analysis methods based on phase measurements that enlarge the sensitivity of the characterization. We show that the interplay between the stochastic roughness and the inter-modal dissipative coupling could originate a collective non-symmetrical behavior introducing asymmetrical reflectance spectra.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplings', 'Microcavities', 'Optical surface waves', 'Rough surfaces', 'Surface roughness', 'Optical sensors']

abstracts: In fiber lasers, operating in Normal Dispersion(ND) is a key to scale pulse energy but commercial Thulium(Tm)-Fiber(TF) are anomalous at 2μm, hindering the progress of high pulse energy mode-locked Tm fiber lasers. We report our NDTF and demonstrate all-fiber amplified pulses with pulse energy of ∼525nJ, ∼10x higher than previous reported 50nJ from all-fiber Tm laser. This paves the way to generate high energy ultrashort pulses in Tm all-fiber lasers, allowing unique materials processing at 2μm
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Indexes', 'Refractive index', 'Fiber lasers', 'Absorption']

abstracts: The DBR mirrors deposited at the backside of optoelectronics devices are also demonstrated to remain a high reflectivity at wide incident angles, which improves the emission efficiency of LEDs and light absorption efficiency of InGaN/GaN photoelectrochemical cell (PEC).
ieee_keywords: ['Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Reflectivity', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Silicon compounds', 'Optical reflection', 'Substrates', 'Performance evaluation']

abstracts: In this paper, wavelength diversity technology is utilized in Φ-OTDR system to improve the SNR and reduce signal fading simultaneously. The differential vector aggregation method is proposed to reduce the phase differences between multi-wavelength so that it can aggregate the multi-wavelength signals effectively. This aggregation method has universal applicability in various diversity technologies, which is better than the rotated-vector-sum method (RVSM) in the particular case.
ieee_keywords: ['Vibrations', 'Rayleigh scattering', 'Frequency diversity', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Reflectometry']

abstracts: We propose a terahertz plasmonic biosensor based on Goos-Hnchen effect in graphene. The maximum sensitivity coefficient can reach 2.5 104 um/RIU, which is much higher than terahertz Fano resonance biosensor (5.7 104 nm/RIU). The high sensitivity enables this biosensor to detect biomoleculars more accurately and conveniently. The structure of the biosensor is very simple. The study may be attractive for those who study terahertz biosensors and 2D Van der Waals materials.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Biosensors', 'Refractive index', 'Sensitivity', 'Plasmons', 'Dielectrics']

abstracts: In this paper, the length setting is optimized according to the light field distribution characteristics of the micro-ring photodetector. According to the design principles we proposed, the shorter photodetector has better characteristics than the longer one. This principle has a certain heuristic effect on the optimization of the optical field distribution of photodetectors of other structures. This article has both theoretical novelty and practicality.
ieee_keywords: ['Photodetectors', 'Absorption', 'Germanium', 'Silicon', 'Optical waveguides', 'Bandwidth']

abstracts: This paper presented a high-power master oscillator power amplifier laser directly pumped by a wavelength-locked 878.6-nm laser diode. The maximal pulse energy of 4.85 mJ and the shortest pulsewidth of 15 ns are achieved at the repetition rate of 20 kHz, with a near diffraction limited output. The temporal and thermal stability is very good due to the application of wavelength-locked 878.6-nm laser diode, simplifying the temperature control and lowering the cost of the laser system.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser excitation', 'Crystals', 'Power amplifiers', 'Oscillators', 'Power generation', 'Thermal stability', 'Diode lasers']

abstracts: Chiroptical signals (generally very weak) play significant roles in chiral discrimination that bring great benefits in biochemistry, pharmacy, chemical, and so on. But, high-precise chiroptical detection is still a challenge. In this paper, a high-precise measurement of optical rotatory dispersion (ORD) based on weak value amplification (WVA) is presented. We proposed ORD detection method with parameter separation: by introducing complex coupling strength and dimensionless parameter “intensitiy contrast ratio” pointer, the ORD is only associated with the imaginary part of the weak value while circular dichroism (CD) is only associated with the real part. By designing a suitable WVA scheme, the ORD and CD can be measured separately. In the experiment, the reliability of the parameter separation method for ORD measurement is verified, and the precision reach the order of10−6rad. This method has a broad application prospect in biomedical sensing, medicine, chemical analysis and other fields.
ieee_keywords: ['Biomedical optical imaging', 'Stimulated emission', 'Biomedical measurement', 'Optical variables measurement', 'Reliability theory', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical coupling']

abstracts: We propose a single-fiber bidirectional-transmission unidirectional optical amplifier (SFBT-UOA), which features the guarantee of bidirectional delay symmetry, the achievement of lower timing jitter, and the compatible capability of telecom network services. A 6000 km fiber-optic time transfer is demonstrated. To our knowledge, this is the longest experimental demonstration of fiber-optic time transfer up to now.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical switches']

abstracts: We propose a low-complexity and high-precision symbol synchronization algorithm based on dual-threshold amplitude decision for FPGA-based real-time IMDD OFDM-PON system with a new criterion to judge symbol synchronization accuracy which is proposed firstly based on Bipolar NRZ codes in time domain.Good SFO tolerance and wide transmission range have also been verified for the algorithm in the case of the low computational complexity and hardware resource consumption.
ieee_keywords: ['Synchronization', 'OFDM', 'Real-time systems', 'Passive optical networks', 'Adaptive optics', 'Optical signal processing', 'High-speed optical techniques']
author_keywords: ['Symbol synchronization', 'real-time IMDD OFDM-PON and amplitude decision']

abstracts: A high-stability wavelength-tunable single-frequency (SF) ytterbium-doped all-fiber compound ring laser has been demonstrated experimentally. The SF fiber laser achieves a wide-band tunability from 1030 to 1090 nm with maximum output slope efficiency of 7.95%. The power instability over 2 h gives standard deviation value of 1.34%. The average linewidth is 8.8 kHz, and the relaxation oscillation frequency is at 62 kHz.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber couplers', 'Cavity resonators', 'Fiber lasers', 'Laser stability', 'Laser modes', 'Laser tuning']
author_keywords: ['Single frequency fiber laser', 'wavelength-tunable', 'high-finesse ring filter', 'loop mirror filter.']

abstracts: In this work, we discuss a new property of second-order sideband in a double-oscillator optomechanical system, in which the single-second-order sideband will split into double second-order sideband due to the Coulomb interactions. Our scheme provides a highly advantageous in precision measurements of coulomb coupling strength based on nonlinear optomechanical interactions under the weak driving fields.
ieee_keywords: ['Amplitude modulation', 'Couplings', 'Cavity resonators', 'Oscillators', 'Probes', 'Ultraviolet sources', 'Imaging']

abstracts: Hollow core antiresonant fiber design is a hot topic these years, for its exclusive capacity to deal with large-energy ultrashort laser pulses. Low transmission loss and high-order mode suppression are two important research respects. This work proposes a novel design with cladding consisting of a single layer of nodeless radially asymmetric tubes. It has advantages of more excellent broadband low-loss property and robust single-mode guidance over circular claddings and elliptical claddings.
ieee_keywords: ['Electron tubes', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Shape', 'Periodic structures', 'Frequency conversion', 'Silicon compounds', 'Frequency modulation']

abstracts: Hybrid metamaterials comprising split-ring resonator (SRR) structures with different gap dimensions are fabricated on polyethylene naphthalate (PEN) films by parallel laser micro-lens array (MLA) lithography and a liftoff process. The unit cell of hybrid metamaterials consists of four SRRs with the same SRR core side length but different gap sizes. The different-gap-size SRRs in each unit cell correspond to different but successive resonance dips, which are coupled to form a significantly broader band with enhanced resonance. The hybrid SRRs design is numerically and experimentally demonstrated, showing a much broader bandwidth to cover all narrowband induced by each SRR and enhanced resonance as compared with a uniform SRR design.
ieee_keywords: ['Metamaterials', 'Magnetic materials', 'Resonant frequency', 'Films', 'Bandwidth', 'Couplings', 'Broadband communication']

abstracts: With distinguished advantages over radio frequency communication, visible light communication (VLC) has been considered as one of the potential and promising wireless communication technologies. However, the densely deployed light emitting diode (LED) lamps introduce severe inter channel interference (ICI), which drastically deteriorates the VLC network performance. In addition, the limited wireless access capabilities of heterogeneous LED lamps, as well as the different data transmission requirements of varied user equipments (UEs), will bring new challenges to the VLC network in real-life applications. To mitigate the ICI and improve the VLC network performance, the hypergraph theory is introduced in detail. Effective data links between one UE and all of its available LED access points (APs) are taken as a hyperedge to form an amorphous cell for each UE. Considering the UE satisfaction performance, as well as the spectrum efficiency and service fairness, the non-layered resource allocation (RA) algorithm based on carrier aggregation and the directly overlapped RA algorithm based on carrier aggregation and cooperative transmission are proposed. Numeric results show that the proposed RA algorithms outperform the classic Dsatur RA algorithm in terms of the UE satisfaction, spectrum efficiency and service fairness.
ieee_keywords: ['Visible light communication', 'Interference', 'LED lamps', 'Detectors', 'Resource management', 'Lighting', 'Integrated optics']

abstracts: In this job, we deduce a damage evaluation equation for traditional Chinese paintings painted with organic pigments through experiment and deduction, which was not obtained before. And we make a method to obtain the ideal light sources satisfying damage effect and color quality at the same time. The lowest damage four-primary LEDs for illuminating the paintings with good color quality in different correlated color temperatures are obtained as examples of the application of our method.
ieee_keywords: ['Pigments', 'Light sources', 'Lighting', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Image color analysis', 'Painting']

abstracts: Digital pre-emphasis is employed in communication systems to compensate for the high frequency roll-off of bandwidth-limited optical transceivers. But, it trades off the magnitude of signals, low frequency components for flat frequency response, resulting in reduced SNR. To mitigate this, we show a simple and low cost analog pre-emphasis filter that compensates for the frequency roll-off, 1.1 dB increase of receiver sensitivities for both 64-Gb/s and 128-Gb/s direct-detected PAM4 signals.
ieee_keywords: ['Signal to noise ratio', 'Transceivers', 'Radio frequency', 'Frequency response', 'Microwave filters', 'Modulation', 'Optical transmitters']
author_keywords: ['Optical transmitter', 'data center interconnection', 'directly-modulated laser (DML)', 'dxternally-modulated laser (EML)', 'digital signal processing (DSP)', 'pulse amplitude modulation (PAM)', 'digital pre-emphasis', 'RF equalization']

abstracts: Mode degeneration caused by the interaction between guided lasing modes and parasitic “ghost” modes in a terahertz (THz) quantum cascade laser (QCL) waveguide has been investigated and is reported here. It is shown that such interactions can degrade the performance of a QCL by causing abrupt rises (by as much as tenfold the normal value) in the gain threshold of the fundamental lasing mode. The impact of such interaction on the performance of a GaSb/AlGaSb THz QCL operating at 3.0 THz is elucidated here through the results of a rigorous numerical simulation. An optimized design is also proposed to suppress such undesirable intermodal interactions and, thus, to enhance the performance of the QCL.
ieee_keywords: ['Quantum cascade lasers', 'Optical waveguides', 'Indexes', 'Plasmons', 'Doping', 'Semiconductor waveguides']
author_keywords: ['Finite element method (FEM)', 'quantum cascade lasers (QCLs)', 'surface plasmon', 'terahertz waveguides']

abstracts: This article first reported that the enhanced light output efficiency of passive-matrix μ-LED display was achieved by employing the tapered sidewalls and DBR passivation structure. As increasing the number of DBR stacking from 3.5 to 5.5 pairs, the reflectance increased obviously from 81.4% to 98.0% at the wavelength of 450 nm. As the μ-LED display with DBR structure, the output power of 1.07 mW under 1 mA, the EQE of 42% under 0.2 mA, and the luminance of 435 nits were obtained.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Passivation', 'Distributed Bragg reflectors', 'Resists', 'Metals', 'Etching', 'Planarization']

abstracts: We bring together two areas of terahertz (THz) technology that have benefited from recent advancements in research, i.e., graphene, a material that has plasmonic resonances in the THz frequency, and quantum cascade lasers (QCLs), a compact electrically driven unipolar source of THz radiation. We demonstrate the use of single-layer large-area graphene to indirectly modulate a THz QCL operating at 2.0 THz. By tuning the Fermi level of the graphene via a capacitively coupled backgate voltage, the optical conductivity and, hence, the THz transmission can be varied. We show that, by changing the pulsing frequency of the backgate, the THz transmission can be altered. We also show that, by varying the pulsing frequency of the backgate from tens of Hz to a few kHz, the amplitude-modulated THz signal can be switched by 15% from a “low” state to a “high” state.
ieee_keywords: ['Quantum cascade lasers', 'Frequency modulation', 'Logic gates', 'Conductivity', 'Silicon']

abstracts: In this manuscript, we proposed and demonstrated a millimeter-wave frequency divider based on a novel photonic approach. By using an optical frequency generator in an optoelectronic oscillator, we divided a millimeter wave from 45 GHz into the 7.5 GHz with the injection locked mechanism. The corresponding division ratio is 6. To the best of our knowledge, this is the largest division ratio reported so far via the photonic methods.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical frequency conversion', 'Frequency modulation', 'Millimeter wave technology', 'Optical filters', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: A systematic investigation to reveal the relationship between sidewall morphology and light extraction efficiency was conducted in this article. Experimental and simulation results demonstrated that the prism structures on the sidewall can effectively improve the light extraction from sidewall and the homogenous prism structures was better at coupling light out from the sidewall than the inhomogeneous prism structures.
ieee_keywords: ['Etching', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Morphology', 'Surface morphology', 'Computational modeling', 'Semiconductor process modeling', 'Photonics']
