abstracts: We proposed a fiber sensor for simultaneous measurement of acoustic wave and lateral pressure based on intensity demodulation. By monitoring the DC and AC components the two parameters can be measured simultaneously. Compared to the conventional technique, the method we proposed can realize the dual-parameters sensing for dynamic measurands such as acoustic wave and vibration
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Silicon', 'Acoustic waves', 'Acoustic measurements', 'Optical fiber couplers']
author_keywords: ['Long period fiber grating (LPFG)', 'Sagnac interferometer (SI)', 'dual-parameters sensing', 'acoustic wave', 'lateral pressure.']

abstracts: With phase-sensitive optical time-domain reflectometry (Φ-OTDR), an optic fiber can be used as a distributed vibration sensor to perceive the external disturbance along the fiber through the phase variation of the Rayleigh backscatter light. However, due to the inevitable interference fading phenomenon, the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) of Rayleigh backscatter light at certain points is insufficient, thus affecting the fidelity of vibration sensing. In this paper, we propose the spectrum extraction and the rotated-vector-sum (SERVS) method to suppress the interference fading in the pulse-intensity-coding Φ-OTDR, which applies Golay complementary sequence through acousto-optic modulator (AOM). Benefited from the easier implementation, the experimental results demonstrate that the percentage of fading points can be reduced from 2.98% to 0.33% significantly and the standard deviation of differential phase is also decreased from 0.6556 rad to 0.2901 rad. Also the minimum level of averaged power spectral density (PSD) of the differential phase at whole locations along the fiber is reduced about 6 dB/Hz effectively. For the demodulated disturbance signal, no influence on the SNR is observed thus it maintains a SNR improvement of 8.6 dB compared to the traditional single pulse Φ-OTDR system, achieving a noise floor of 2.38 pϵ/√Hz.
ieee_keywords: ['Fading channels', 'Interference', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Encoding', 'Optical pulses']
author_keywords: ['Distributed optical fiber sensing', 'phase-sensitive optical time-domain reflectometry', 'pulse coding', 'interference fading']

abstracts: Owing to the lack of strong physical mechanisms capable of elaborately balancing a large number of longitudinal modes created in a self-seeded passive optical network (PON), the resulting coherent-like optical signals are vulnerable to frequency-dependent optical phenomena such as chromatic dispersion (CD). In this paper, based on our recently reported real-time dual-reflective semiconductor optical amplifier (RSOA)based self-seeded adaptive optical orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (OOFDM) transmitters, detailed experimental explorations are undertaken, for the first time, of the impacts of intra-cavity CD on 10-Gb/s OOFDM transmissions over 25-km self-seeded PON systems. The cavity length-dependent intra-cavity CD effect is identified to be one of the most prominent physical mechanisms determining the practically achievable performance of such PON systems. In comparison with a 10-m-long dual-RSOA self-seeded fiber cavity, the accumulated intra-cavity CD effect associated with a 1-km-long dual-RSOA self-seeded fiber cavity not only considerably broadens the optical spectral width of the self-seeding-created coherent-like optical signal but increases the signal relative intensity noise (RIN) by 4.8 dB (at a 2-GHz signal spectral region) as well. In addition, a further 1.1-dB signal RIN growth is also measured after the 25-km single-mode fiber (SMF) PON system transmissions. As a direct result, the dual-RSOA self-seeded PON with a 1-km-long fiber cavity suffers from a 2.2-dB power penalty degradation for 10 Gb/s over 25-km SMF intensity modulation and direct detection OOFDM transmissions.
ieee_keywords: ['Passive optical networks', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical transmitters', 'Cavity resonators', 'Optical filters', 'Optical attenuators']
author_keywords: ['Self-seeded RSOAs', 'intra-cavity chromatic dispersion', 'fiber optics systems and orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM)']

abstracts: By exploiting the in-house finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) program, the optical properties of a designated 2-D array of U- to H-shaped holes perforated on a metallic film are analyzed. Some specific near-field features are found to be associated with the three mechanisms underlying the transmission spectral profiles, namely, excitation of surface electromagnetic (EM) modes, Wood's anomalies (WAs), and shape resonances (SRs), thus providing a way to reveal the physical nature of the enhanced transmission phenomenon.
ieee_keywords: ['Arrays', 'Silicon', 'Apertures', 'Shape', 'Surface waves', 'Metals', 'Educational institutions']

abstracts: A tunable single-bandpass microwave photonic filter (MPF) with a narrow and flat-top shape operating in high frequency range is proposed and experimentally demonstrated, using a specially designed multi-phase-shift fiber Bragg grating (FBG) cascaded with a programmable optical filter (POF). The key device in the proposed MPF is the multi-phase-shift FBG, providing a flat-top passband with a narrow 3-dB bandwidth of 813 MHz in transmission. Consequently, in the MPF, a single passband with a 3- and 20-dB bandwidths of 840 MHz and 2.43 GHz is achieved, respectively. Moreover, an operating frequency range from 27.1 to 38.1 GHz is realized by tuning the wavelength of the optical carrier and adjusting the transfer function of the POF. To the best of our knowledge, this proposed filter provides the highest tunable frequency coverage in Ka-band ever reported for MPFs with a single narrow and flat-top passband.
ieee_keywords: ['Passband', 'Optical fibers', 'Microwave filters', 'Fiber gratings', 'Optical filters', 'Microwave photonics']

abstracts: To solve the matching problems caused by the large intensity difference between the multi-source images and the nonlinear radiation distortion, we present a multi-source image matching approach that considers the orientation of the phase sharpness. First, the scale-space of the image pyramid was constructed, and the phase consistency of the image frequency domain was solved to obtain the maximum moment feature, and the KAZE operator is used to extract the feature points. Next, the Log-Gabor even symmetric filter was used to perform Fourier transform, and the improved local phase sharpness feature and phase orientation feature were constructed respectively to replace the gradient amplitude and gradient direction feature of the image. A descriptor of local phase sharpness orientation (LPSO) was established through the log-polar description template, and finally the Euclidean distance was used to measure the similarity to obtain the corresponding points. Multiple sets of typical multi-source images were used as data sources, and the LPSO algorithm was compared with SIFT, LGHD, RIFT and HAPCG algorithms in datasets. Evaluation of the algorithm performances indicates that the proposed method is more accurate and robust in the task of multi-source image matching.
ieee_keywords: ['Feature extraction', 'Image matching', 'Robustness', 'Optimization', 'Transforms', 'Licenses', 'Image sensors']
author_keywords: ['Multi-source image', 'phase congruency model', 'extended phase sharpness feature', 'LPSO', 'image matching']

abstracts: This paper proposes and compares the Gerchberg-Saxton algorithm, direct binary search and genetic algorithm enabled light field optimization for adapting photovoltaic cells in different geometric arrangements. This is the first work in our best knowledge to use light field optimization for optical wireless power transfer. Photoelectric conversion efficiency can reach 33.14% through optimizing light field using Gerchberg-Saxton algorithm, almost 200% improvement over Gaussian beams.
ieee_keywords: ['Optimization', 'Wireless power transfer', 'Heuristic algorithms', 'Optical polarization', 'Laser beams', 'Optical feedback', 'Light fields']
author_keywords: ['Optical wireless power transfer', 'light field manipulation', 'genetic algorithm', 'Gerchberg-Saxton algorithm']

abstracts: We demonstrated a promising CO 2 laser irradiation system based on an improved 2-D scanning technique. Such a system could be used to inscribe high-quality long period fiber gratings (LPFGs) with good reproducibility of grating inscription, which attributes to the fact that our system includes a CO 2 laser with an excellent power stability of less than ±2% and a 3-D ultraprecision motorized translation stages with an excellent bidirectional repeatability value of 80 nm. Moreover, a control program with an easy-to-use operation interface was developed in our system so that a high-quality LPFG could be achieved as soon as grating parameters, such as grating pitch and number of grating periods, are entered, which has a widespread commercial value and prospects for development. Additionally, near mode fields of the CO 2 -laser-induced LPFG were observed and simulated to investigate mode coupling in the gratings.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Fiber lasers', 'Gratings', 'Optical fibers', 'Laser stability', 'Laser modes', 'Fiber gratings']
author_keywords: ['Long period fiber gratings (LPFGs)', 'optical fiber sensors', '$\\hbox{CO}_{2}$ laser', '2-D scanning', 'fiber optics components']

abstracts: In this paper, we proposed and demonstrated an F-P sensor based on HCF-SMF structure with long sensing length for strain measurement, the sensing length of the sensor can be controlled to a few centimeters or even tens of centimeters in order to meet the requirement of a large strain distribution. With the advantage of easy fabricating, low cost and long sensing length, the proposed sensor is very suitable for the strain measurement with a large distribution.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Strain', 'Strain measurement', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Capacitive sensors', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: The insertion loss of silicon ring resonators and photonic molecules can become a problem when many of these components are concatenated on complex photonic chips. We propose and demonstrate a method for reducing the attenuation in these devices, by employing Er-doped Al2O3 claddings. Whith this, we were able to experimentally achieve a loss reduction of 3 dB, without occupying additional chip area, with minimum post processing. For filters with higher Q factors, this reduction can reach 15 dB.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Optical losses', 'Photonics', 'Silicon', 'Optical ring resonators', 'Couplings', 'Gain']

abstracts: It is desirable to minimize DMGD and increase effective area in order to reduce computation complexity and nonlinear effect in MDM system.We report the design of 12-LP-mode (21-spatial-mode) fiber with low DMGD(less than 0.106 ps/m), large effective area (150~485 μ2) and low bending loss that is adapted to mode-division-multiplexing (MDM) system over the C+L band.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber networks', 'Dispersion', 'Refractive index', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Delays']
author_keywords: ['Low differential mode group delay (low DMGD)', 'few-mode fiber (FMF)', 'low bending loss', 'large effective area.']

abstracts: We solve the problem of the graded index of the Maxwell fisheye via graded photonic crystals. The Maxwell fisheye is an absolute instrument and finds many applications. It has remarkable optical properties, but its radial index profile is difficult to fabricate. The designed graded photonic crystal exhibits these properties. The graded index optics component is at the scale of the wavelength and its focusing spot is less than the wavelength. It applies to integrated photonics and lens-antennas.
ieee_keywords: ['Indexes', 'Photonic crystals', 'Refractive index', 'Dispersion', 'Optical refraction', 'Optical variables control']
author_keywords: ['Maxwell fish-eye', 'half-Maxwell fish-eye', 'gradient-index optics', 'photonic crystals', 'optical coupling components', 'lens-antennas.']

abstracts: With the compare of existing understanding of phenomenon we obtained experimentally a spin splitting up to 83 μm, which is much bigger than the 10.2 μm and 6.4 μm before. Actually, it is the largest spin dependent shift ever achieved without any amplification method. Moreover, we obtained an angular spin splitting up to 8.72 × 10-4 rad. Our research will have a significant impact on the design of spin-photonic devices and the optical sensing.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Polarization', 'Zirconium', 'Refractive index', 'Optical retarders', 'Metamaterials', 'Lenses']

abstracts: OAM-carrying beams have attracted much attention and are widely used in many fields. Measuring the orbital angular momentum is a foundation for the application of OAM light, and many methods have already been proposed and demonstrated, but most of them are made by using bulk components and suffer from weight, instability and cost. We present a flexible scheme to detect OAM by means of a plasmonic metasurface. When a linearly polarized OAM light illuminates the metasurface, an identical OAM beam is passed through the metasurface. Simultaneously, two extraordinary cross-polarized OAM beams, which carry the same OAM as the incident beam, are scattered by the metasurface and form the interferogram in the near field. Therefore, the value of the topological charge of the incident light can be obtained stably from the interferogram.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Scattering', 'Antenna measurements', 'Gold', 'Time-domain analysis', 'Linear antenna arrays']

abstracts: We propose a novel privacy amplification scheme with an optimal hash function. The hardware storage resources can then be drastically saved and the time consuming will be only about half of that without using this method. Moreover, it provides an improving approach in the aspect of algorithm and it can be combined with other methods and then the speed of privacy amplification might be further accelerated
ieee_keywords: ['Privacy', 'Matrices', 'Cryptography', 'Linear feedback shift registers', 'Algorithm design and analysis']
author_keywords: ['Privacy amplification', 'linear feedback shift register', 'Toeplitz matrix', 'quantum key distribution.']

abstracts: In a classical metasurface-based holographic display system, a clear holographic reconstruction image can be obtained only in the back-focal-plane of the lens. However, when the receiving plane deviates from the focal plane, the reconstructed holographic image suffers from degradations that limit the quality of the images. Hence, we propose a novel metasurface-based holographic display to realize clearly continuous imaging within the specified position range by superimposing the meta-axilens phase. It can effectively relieve the alignment requirements of the imaging system. Firstly, the parameters and properties of all-dielectric meta-atom is analyzed. Then we compare and demonstrate two sets of metasurface-based optical elements (meta-axicon, meta-lens, and meta-axilens), made by silicon meta-atoms working at 610 nm. Furthermore, we show that the metasurface hologram with the axilens phase can form a series of the relatively clear holographic images away from the focal plane. Our proposal suggests a method to reconstruct holographic wavefront in different planes simultaneously, and one can find their application domain, such as 3D biological imaging, spectroscopy, optical information storage, and encryption.
ieee_keywords: ['Metasurfaces', 'Optical imaging', 'Lenses', 'Holography', 'Holographic optical components', 'Optical sensors', 'Optical diffraction']

abstracts: We demonstrated a midinfrared spectral intensity enhanced supercontinuum (SC) generation from ZBLAN fiber pumped by a mode-locked nanosecond thulium-doped fiber laser. The spectral region covered from 1930 to 3500 nm with output power of 5.23 W. The average power ratio of the output SC for the wavelength >2200 and >2500 nm was 91.81% and 74.29% with respect to the total output power, respectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Power generation', 'Optical fiber devices', 'Power amplifiers', 'Nonlinear optics']

abstracts: The well-know efficiency-droop effect in GaN-based laser diode is successfully mitigate from 20.3% to 9.7% at the high current of 2000 mA by using a novel GaN/InAlN/GaN lower quantum barrier in an asymmetric structure LD due to the suppressed hole overflow from the active region. And the electric properties are effectively improved, obtaining higher wall-plug effciency, lower threshold current and larger output power, which provides a new approach for further improvement of GaN-based devices.
ieee_keywords: ['Gallium nitride', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Radiative recombination', 'Substrates', 'Rough surfaces', 'Surface roughness', 'Surface morphology']

abstracts: The trade-off between the resolution and imaging efficiency of computational ghost imaging remains a key issue to be resolved. Inspired by a retina structure, we propose a retina-like 3D computational ghost imaging method to obtain high resolution while retaining high imaging efficiency.The proposed models not only have the scaling and rotation invariances, but also have higher efficiency than the traditional computational ghost imaging method with respect to utilizing effective pixels.
ieee_keywords: ['Imaging', 'Computational modeling', 'Spatial resolution', 'Manganese', 'Three-dimensional displays', 'Image reconstruction']

abstracts: A numerical study of As 2 S 3 Raman fiber lasers is carried out to show their potential for the entire coverage of the 3-4-μm spectral band. Experimental results are first obtained from such a laser operated under controlled conditions in order to set the fiber parameters (i.e., gain and attenuation coefficients) to be used in the numerical model. An exhaustive numerical analysis is then performed to establish the conditions for optimum lasing performances over the entire 3-4-μm spectral band.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber couplers', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Pump lasers', 'Laser modes', 'Fiber gratings', 'Reflectivity']

abstracts: We introduce for the first time a model describing a CMOS camera as a Real-Time Oscilloscope (RTO) detecting optical signals. By means of this approach, we can now characterize the camera with parameters commonly used for RTO that allow to maximize the OCC transmission performance with an optimal selection of the camera settings.
ieee_keywords: ['Cameras', 'Optical sensors', 'Optical distortion', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical receivers']

abstracts: We present an InP-based, monolithically integrated, multi-wavelength DBR laser with weak optical feedback, which realizes broad single-mode operation range, damped relaxation oscillation and reduced linewidth (400 kHz). The linewidth is almost insensitive to the feedback phase and maintained to around 400 KHz which indicates great potential for use in WDM systems for high bit rate communications.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser feedback', 'Optical feedback', 'Arrayed waveguide gratings', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Pump lasers', 'Laser modes']
author_keywords: ['Semiconductor laser', 'arrayed waveguide grating', 'distributed Bragg reflector', 'single-mode', 'optical feedback', 'relaxation oscillation', 'linewidth']

abstracts: Speckle correlation is a typical method for simultaneous target tracking and imaging through scattering media.However, this method fails to achieve high-accuracy target tracking in multidimensional motion and requires a high-resolution speckle pattren to retrieve the phase of a target. Here, a method based on speckle-difference-combined bispectrum analysis (SDCBA) is presented to simultaneously track and image targets, it requires no high-resolution pattern, nor numerous iterations.
ieee_keywords: ['Speckle', 'Target tracking', 'Correlation', 'Imaging', 'Scattering', 'Media']
author_keywords: ['Imaging through turbid media', 'speckle imaging', 'computation imaging', 'turbid media.']

abstracts: From Shanon's theory, we know that information capacity is a logarithmic function of signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) but a linear function of the number of dimensions. By increasing the number of dimensions D , we can dramatically improve the spectral efficiency. At the same time, in D -dimensional space (D\ >\ 2) , for the same average symbol energy, we can increase the Euclidean distance between signal constellation points compared with the conventional in-phase (I)/quadrature (Q) 2-D signal space. The 4-D space, with two phase coordinates per polarization, has already been intensively studied. To satisfy the ever-increasing bandwidth demands, in this paper, we propose the D -dimensional signaling (D\ >\ 4) by employing all available degrees of freedom for transmission over a single carrier including amplitude, phase, polarization, and orbital angular momentum (OAM). The proposed modulation scheme can be called hybrid D -dimensional modulation as it employs all available degrees of freedom. The proposed hybrid 8-D coded-modulation scheme outperforms its 4-D counterpart by 3.97 dB at a bit error rate (BER) of 10^{-8} while outperforming its corresponding polarization-division-multiplexed (PDM) iterative polar quantization (IPQ)-based counterpart by even a larger margin of 6.41 dB (at the same BER). The improvement of the proposed scheme for two amplitude levels per dimension and D = 8 over conventional PDM 64-quadrature amplitude modulation (QAM) is indeed a striking 8.28 dB at a BER of 2 \times 10^{-8} .

Due to countless orthogonal eigenstates, light beams with orbital angular momentum(OAM) have a large potential information capacity. Recently, deep learning has been extensively applied in recognition of OAM mode. However, previous deep learning methods require a constant distance between laser and receiver. The accuracy will drop quickly if the distance of testing set deviates from the training set. Previous deep learning methods also have difficulty distinguishing OAM modes with positive and negative topological charges. In order to further exploit the huge potential of the countless dimension of state space, we proposed multidimensional information assisted deep learning flexible recognition (MIADLFR) method to make use of both intensity and angular spectrum information for the first time to achieve recognition of OAM modes unlimited by the sign of TC and distance with high accuracy. Also, MIADLFR can reduce the computational complexity significantly and requires much smaller training set.
ieee_keywords: ['Training', 'Deep learning', 'Laser beams', 'Testing', 'Atmospheric modeling', 'Feature extraction', 'Convolutional neural networks']

abstracts: We firstly propose a design method for FM-EDF with multi-ring-core (MRC) structures of both refractive index and Erbium doping, which has high compatibility with transmission MRC-FMF and low DMG with simple pump injection requirement. By sharing the boundaries of ring areas for refractive index and Erbium doping, the design method also helps to reduce the complexity of preform fabrication. Based on the proposed method, a 6 and 10-mode weakly-coupled MRC-EDFs with gain equalization are designed.
ieee_keywords: ['Indexes', 'Erbium', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Optical fiber cables', 'Fabrication', 'Crosstalk']

abstracts: In order to reduce the quantization noise of low-resolution DAC, we study a noise shaping technique that can reshape the white quantization noise to an irregular spectrum, in which the noise in the data subcarrier band is almost transformed into the null subcarrier band. Both in simulation and experiment, we verify the effectiveness of the investigated scheme in 25 GHz 16-QAM/32-QAM/64-QAM DMT transmission systems. The experimental results show that the noise shaping technique can enhance the receiver sensitivity of 4-bit quantized 16-QAM DMT and 5-bit quantized 32-QAM DMT by 4.3 dB and 2.5 dB respectively, at BER of hard decision forward error correction (HD-FEC) threshold (3.8 × 10 −3 ). In addition, with the aid of noise shaping, the performance of 4-bit quantization 16-QAM DMT system is the same as the 8-bit quantization 16-QAM DMT system at the HD-FEC threshold. The experimental results reveal that the proposed noise shaping scheme is a good solution for high-speed, low-cost short reach intra-DCI with low-resolution DAC in future 6G networks evolved from 5G mobile networks.
ieee_keywords: ['Quantization (signal)', 'Noise shaping', 'Modulation', 'Finite impulse response filters', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Quadrature amplitude modulation', 'Peak to average power ratio']
author_keywords: ['Noise shaping technique', 'low-bit resolution system', 'quantization noise suppression', 'intra data center interconnects (intra-DCI)', 'intensity modulation and direct detection (IM/DD)', 'discrete multitone (DMT)']

abstracts: We demonstrate the possibility of nonbinary LDPC-coded mode-multiplexed coherent optical OFDM 1.28-Tbit/s 16-QAM signal transmission over 2000 km of few-mode fiber (FMF) with mode-dependent loss (MDL) by using an advanced mode-coupling compensation scheme. The performance of proposed coded-modulation scheme is evaluated for different number of spatial modes. The simulation results indicate that the MDL is the predominant effect in the long-haul optical transmission based on FMFs. Different pilot-aided OFDM based compensation methods are studied, and it has been found that minimum mean-square estimation with linear interpolation method is the most robust against mode coupling and MDL. We also show that the nonbinary LDPC-coded modulation provides about 1 dB improvement over binary LDPC-coded modulation (16 QAM OFDM and MDL of 25 dB). Finally, we study the degradation of increasing the number of modes and investigate the proposed scheme for different MDL values in both fourand eight-mode fibers.
ieee_keywords: ['Parity check codes', 'OFDM', 'Optical fibers', 'Channel estimation', 'Bit error rate', 'Optical transmitters']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics signal processing', 'nonbinary LDPC-coded modulation', 'orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (OFDM)', 'few-mode fiber (FMF) communications', 'multi-Tb/s optical transport']

abstracts: Through our efforts in this paper, we want to provide a new perspective for NLOS UV communication by taking the step toward mobile UV connection and the multiplexing UV system design with linear complexity detection method which perhaps has significance to NLOS UV communication. Large datasets of numerical results in 2x2 cases and 4x4 cases are collected to show the channel independence produced by this system geometry and feasibility of the MIMO signal detection algorithm.
ieee_keywords: ['MIMO', 'Mobile communication', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Mobile computing', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Signal detection', 'Multiplexing']

abstracts: This paper describes a novel AR-HUD system that can combine screen data with real-life information to increase the safety of a driver in a vehicle. The differences between off-axis reflective optical systems are analyzed, and a free-form surface was designed to serve as asymmetric aberration corrector. The optical system was designed for a virtual distance of 2.8m. The distortion near the center field of view is below 2%, the maximum distortion at the edge of the field of view is below 4%.

In this paper, novel measures for thermal management of silicon photonic optical phased arrays are presented. The proposed methods consist on the use of through oxide thermal vias to improve heat dissipation of heat sources integrated on top of the photonic IC and on the use of heat shield to protect temperature sensitive photonic components from waste heat, which could lead to temperature gradients. To the best of our knowledge, none of these methods have been previously used in photonic IC.
ieee_keywords: ['Thermal resistance', 'Photonics', 'Phased arrays', 'Silicon', 'Heating systems', 'Optical arrays']
author_keywords: ['Optical beam steering', 'optical phased arrays (OPAs)', 'photonic integrated circuits (PIC)', 'silicon photonics', 'thermal management']

abstracts: In this paper, the accurate and numerically efficient finite element (FE)-based beam propagation method (BPM) has been employed to investigate second harmonic generation (SHG) in highly nonlinear soft glass (SF57) equiangular spiral photonic crystal fibers (ES-PCFs) for the first time. It is shown here that the SHG output power in highly nonlinear SF57 soft glass PCF exploiting the ES design is significantly higher compared with that of silica PCF with hexagonal air-hole arrangements. The effects of fabrication tolerances on the coherence length and the modal properties of ES-PCF are also illustrated. Moreover, phase matching between the fundamental and the second harmonic modes is discussed through the use of the quasi-phase matching technique. Furthermore, the ultralow bending loss in the SF57 ES-PCF design has been successfully analyzed.
ieee_keywords: ['Harmonic analysis', 'Glass', 'Finite element methods', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Frequency conversion', 'Silicon compounds', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Second harmonic generation (SHG)', 'photonic crystal fibers (PCFs)', 'finite element method (FEM)']

abstracts: We design and numerically evaluate a new type of III-nitride n-i-p solar cells whose p- and n-type regions with equal carrier concentration of 3 × 10 18 cm -3 are not generated by extrinsic impurity doping but by the so-called polarization-induced doping, which is induced by the graded In x Ga 1-x N layers of linearly increasing (from x= 0% to 30%) and decreasing (from x= 30% to 0%) indium composition to construct the conductive p- and n-type regions, respectively. Because of the identical and uniform polarization charges within each unit cell, a smooth spatial variation of the potential profile of the device is, hence, expected, which mitigates the energy band discontinuities at heterointerfaces and facilitates transportation and collection of photogenerated carriers with high efficiency. Most importantly, as the conductive n- and p-type regions are formed by electrostatic field ionization but not by the thermal activation, the concentration of field-induced carriers is independent of thermal freeze-out effects. Thus, the polarization-induced doping III-nitride n-i-p solar cells can provide stable power conversion efficiency, even when operated at low temperatures.
ieee_keywords: ['Doping', 'Photovoltaic cells', 'Absorption', 'Gallium nitride', 'Indium', 'Electric fields', 'Materials']

abstracts: This paper presents a study of the physical layer security performance of a mixed radio frequency-free space optical (RF-FSO) system with a wireless-powered friendly jammer. The RF links undergo the Nakagami-m fading, and the FSO link experiences the Exponentiated Weibull (EW) distribution. A two-hop decode-and-forward (DF) relay is present in the system. A single-antenna eavesdropper located on the RF link attempts to eavesdrop on the channel transmission information. There is a nearby multi-antenna jammer that can be charged wirelessly, and a save-then-transmit (ST) protocol is introduced in the jammer. The closed expressions for the secrecy outage probability (SOP) and the average secrecy capacity (ASC) of the mixed RF-FSO system are derived, and the correctness of the expressions is verified using the Monte-Carlo method. The influence of various key factors on the secrecy performance of the system is analyzed by simulations. The results show that increasing the average interference noise ratio, the number of interferer antennas, the time block allocation factor, and the size of the receiving aperture has a significant effect on the secrecy performance. This study provides a new system structure and a good theoretical basis for evaluating the physical layer security performance of mixed RF-FSO systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Jamming', 'Radio frequency', 'Interference', 'Wireless communication', 'Protocols', 'Relays', 'Energy harvesting']

abstracts: We propose and realize a wavelength and bandwidth-tunable optical filter with high tuning efficiency based on double opto-mechanical microring resonators assisted Mach-Zehnder interferometer structure. With maintaining a high extinction ratio of 38 dB and a small passband ripple of 1 dB, the tuning efficiencies of the filters 3 dB-bandwidth and wavelength could realize up to 0.325??nm/mW and 0.277??nm/mW respectively, which has significant applications in on-chip optical energy-efficient systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Optical waveguides', 'Force', 'Tuning', 'Optical signal processing', 'Optical ring resonators', 'Optical coupling']
author_keywords: ['All-optical tunable filter', 'opto-mechanical microring resonators', 'high-tuning efficiency', 'high extinction ratio']

abstracts: This paper demonstrates a Raman-erbium hybrid random fiber laser that is able to control the dual-wavelength laser simply via the manipulation of pump power. This is achieved through Raman-erbium amplified Rayleigh distributed feedback mechanism without any assistance of tuning components or physical reflectors. The findings from this paper highlights the versatility of the proposed hybrid scheme as a means to simplify existing long distance conventional fiber laser applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Pump lasers', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Distributed feedback devices', 'Laser feedback', 'Stimulated emission']

abstracts: We report the first in situ time-resolved observation of formation and propagation of discrete failures in VCSELs during aging, from which we study failure modalities. This contrasts with the usual post-stress characterization of cumulative damage. Due to the rising prevalence of VCSELs in many applications, this work will appeal to many working in the field. Our observations have important implications for device design and reliability, and therefore warrants publication in IEEE Photonics.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Apertures', 'Stress', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Microscopy', 'Optical filters']
author_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'optical beam induced current', 'electroluminescence.']

abstracts: We experimentally demonstrated a photoelectric nonlinear compensation scheme of optical phase conjugation (OPC) with complex-valued deep neural network (CVDNN) to mitigate fiber nonlinearity in wavelength division multiplexing (WDM) 64-QAM coherent optical transmission system. The factors to affect the performance of OPC and CVDNN are comprehensively considered. OPC in WDM system is experimentally optimized to alleviate the deployment requirements of strict symmetrical distributed power and chromatic dispersion. The performance penalty caused by the simplification of the OPC is further compensated by the CVDNN. The selections of the input neurons’ number and the optimization algorithm are also considered to design a simple two-hidden-layer-structure CVDNN. The proposed method is experimentally verified and evaluated in a 12.5-GBd 4-channel WDM 64-QAM 160-km standard single-mode fiber (SSMF) transmission system with channel spacing of 50-GHz. The experimental results show that the proposed nonlinear equalizer based on the OPC with CDVNN has a strong robustness to the input signal power and wavelength, which can not only improve the Q factor of the signal by 1.5-dB, but also greatly increase the total launched signal power.
ieee_keywords: ['Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Fiber nonlinear optics', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical wavelength conversion', 'Optical polarization']
author_keywords: ['Fiber nonlinearity', 'optical phase conjugation', 'complex-valued neural networks', 'machine learning', 'nonlinear equalization']

abstracts: A unified system, where self-interference cancellation and frequency down-conversion can be realized simultaneously, will greatly reduce the cost of the system and simplify the structure. The operational frequency band and cancellation depth are confined by electronic devices in the reported papers. We use cascade modulators to achieve higher operational frequency, not limited by electronic devices. The LO signal and RF signal are separately sent to two MZMs, leading to a high LO-RF isolation.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Optical attenuators', 'Frequency modulation', 'Interference cancellation', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical modulation', 'RF signals']

abstracts: Using epsilon-near-zero (ENZ) subwavelength optical multilayer materials with simple structure and thin total thickness to achieve target characteristics is extremely important and beneficial for the realization of on-chip integration and large-scale application of optical devices. Combining with the enhanced genetic algorithm (EGA), this work breaks the limitation of the periodicity of traditional ENZ multilayer structures, and investigates the aperiodic ENZ transparent conducting oxide (TCO)-dielectric multilayer structures. It is realized that under the given conditions, an optimal structure can possess a maximum peak absorption and the broadest absorption bandwidth near the communication wavelength. In the 6-layer structure with a total thickness of 600 nm studied in this work, EGA can optimize the peak absorption from 0.91 to 0.95. Additionally, the absorption bandwidth is optimized from 120 nm to 227 nm, which is enhanced more than 180%. The absorption performance of this optimized structure is comparable to that of a more complex structure with the same total thickness but more layers, or a structure with the same number of layers but a larger total thickness. Conclusively, the proposed EGA optimization method can simplify the structure of the multilayer system, reduce the total thickness of the required ENZ material, and thus greatly simplify the production process and reduce the production cost.
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Nonhomogeneous media', 'Indium tin oxide', 'Bandwidth', 'Genetic algorithms', 'Permittivity', 'Optical device fabrication']
author_keywords: ['Enhanced genetic algorithm', 'ENZ material', 'indium tin oxide', 'light absorption', 'multilayer']

abstracts: We demonstrate a method of optimizing the illumination performance of a tri-chromatic WLED that consists of a blue LED, CdSe/ZnS QDs, and YAG phosphors. This method allows us to easily determine the proper QD and phosphor concentrations for the achievement of optimal illumination performance, i.e., maximum CRI and R9 values, at a specified CCT. In addition, we are able to accurately predict the frequency response of the illumination-optimized WLED from the frequency responses of this WLED.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Phosphors', 'Lighting', 'Optimization', 'Absorption', 'Modulation', 'Optical variables measurement']

abstracts: BOTDA has attracted increasing research attentions. Here, three optimized algorithms are utilized to modify the parameters of SVM for accuracy improvement of the temperature extraction in SVM assisted BOTDA. Compared with conventional SVM, all optimized algorithms improve the measurement accuracy. The processing speed improves over 20 times in comparison with the curve fitting. That makes the optimized algorithms become a promising candidate for high performance BOTDA sensors in the future.
ieee_keywords: ['Support vector machines', 'Signal processing algorithms', 'Temperature measurement', 'Optimization', 'Classification algorithms', 'Genetic algorithms', 'Sociology']
author_keywords: ['Brillouin optical time domain analyzer', 'fiber optics sensors', 'support vector machine', 'optimized algorithms.']

abstracts: In this letter, we prepared successfully high-quality MoS2 and WS2-based SAs and investigated their optical characteristics. More importantly, the PQS Er:LuAG laser performance at 1.6 μm was demonstrated in details for the first time, and the shortest pulse width of 1.1 μs with the pulse repetition frequency of 41.6 kHz was generated. The results also show that the atomic-layered transition-metal dichalcogenides could be the promising candidate for pulsed 1.6 μm laser.
ieee_keywords: ['Molybdenum', 'Sulfur', 'Laser excitation', 'Pump lasers', 'Power lasers', 'Crystals', 'Absorption']

abstracts: This paper presents an analysis on the performance of an optical wireless power transfer system in which optical transceivers made from a perovskite are used. Experiments are performed under different settings, whose resulted data reveal interesting findings. First, system performance is only matched with the existing theory when no collimating lens is employed. Hence, a data-driven mathematical model is proposed and verified when a collimating lens is used. Second, a collimating lens helps increase the amount of wirelessly transferred power and the transfer distance if perfect alignment between optical transceivers is guaranteed, but substantially limits the sliding distance between them otherwise.
ieee_keywords: ['Perovskites', 'Transceivers', 'Optical transmitters', 'Optical receivers', 'Lenses', 'Absorption', 'Photovoltaic cells']
author_keywords: ['Bidirectional wireless power transfer', 'data-driven mathematical modeling', 'optical transceiver', 'optical wireless power transfer', 'perovskite light-emitting diodes', 'perovskite solar cells']

abstracts: The number of light emitting diodes (LED) used in a variety of applications is increasing rapidly. However, LEDs have Lambertian light radiation patterns that need to be modified if they are to provide uniform illumination. This can be achieved with the use of a secondary optic. In this paper two secondary optics were designed and compared their performances. These include freeform lenses and CDTIRO. Both lenses can produce uniformity over 95% within an illuminated area.
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'Lighting', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Ultraviolet sources', 'Imaging']

abstracts: This paper proposed a novel phase calibration method of on-chip optical phased arrays using an interference technique. Compared to convential calibration algorithms, the proposed method can avoid the local optima and reduce the reqiurements on the feedback sensitivity. Related experiments have been completed to verify its feasibility. The interference-based calibration method can be utilized as a supplement of conventional calibration algorithms to achieve accurate OPA phase calibration.

Uplink radar arrays (URAs) require stable phase transfers of pulsed radio frequency (RF) signals in bidirectional optical fiber link, all the existing methods based on passive frequency mixing only demonstrated their capabilities to support stable phase transfers of continue-wave RF signals in unidirectional optical fiber link. In the manuscript, a scheme based passive frequency mixing is proposed to satisfy the requirements of URAs with more than 20 times phase stability improvement.
ieee_keywords: ['Uplink', 'Optical fibers', 'Downlink', 'RF signals', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Frequency modulation', 'Fluctuations']
author_keywords: ['Time/frequency dissemination', 'radio over fiber', 'uplink radar array', 'downlink radar array', 'clock synchronization']

abstracts: We present a new phase retrieval method for DHM based on three defocused holograms. The defocused holograms can be obtained by an ETL-based 4f system without manual operation. Compared with the traditional phase retrieval method in DHM, this technique eliminates the requirements for not only the iterative process, complex spectrum selection in off-axis DHM or additional phase-shifting devices in on-axis DHM but also the assumption of specimen or previous knowledge of system.
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'Image reconstruction', 'Microscopy', 'Mathematical model', 'Proposals', 'Phase measurement']

abstracts: We demonstrate a novel technique for photonic generation of few-cycle millimeter-wave (MMW) pulse using a WR-10 waveguide and near-ballistic unitraveling carrier photodiode (NBUTC-PD)-based photonic-transmitter-mixer (PTM). A 2.5-cycle MMW pulse is generated by simultaneously exciting the PTM optical port with ~100-GHz optical MMW sinusoidal signal and the intermediate-frequency (IF) port with a 25-ps electrical short pulse, respectively. Compared to results using femtosecond optical short pulses to directly excite the PTM (without E-O signal mixing), our approach is capable of providing much less signal distortion, eliminating the ringing oscillation in the tail of response, a much shorter pulse duration, and a higher peak power.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical pulses', 'Optical waveguides', 'Optical distortion', 'Photonics', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Optical mixing', 'Modulation']

abstracts: We present a photonic microwave filter based on SBS with enhanced out-of-band rejection. Experiments show that the filter slope goes up to 17.26 dB/oct compared to 3.89 dB/oct of the natural Lorentzian response of SBS. The technique relies on the interaction of phase modulation with three pumping signals and requires only low power pumps, making it suitable for integration in a nonlinear microwave photonic processing chip.
ieee_keywords: ['Scattering', 'Microwave filters', 'Microwave photonics', 'Radio frequency', 'Optical fiber filters', 'Amplitude modulation']

abstracts: Not applicable: This submission does not include human or animal research.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'Microwave theory and techniques', 'Microwave filters', 'Microwave oscillators', 'Microwave circuits', 'Baseband', 'RF signals']

abstracts: We propose a photonics-assisted no-scanning high-accuracy multiple frequency measurement scheme based on optical beating between DSB-CS signal and a detuning optical frequency comb using low-speed components. This scheme can simultaneously obtain large measuring range, high measuring speed and high measuring accuracy. It is a promising solution for achieving an extensible measurement range and improving various RF signal frequency measurement applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Photonics', 'RF signals', 'Bandwidth', 'Universal Serial Bus', 'Frequency modulation', 'Frequency estimation']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'fiber optics systems', 'microwave photonics signal processing']

abstracts: A microwave photonic phase shifter based on a special dual-parallel Mach Zehnder modulator, which only requires two DC bias voltages, is presented. The proposed phase shifter can realize an ultrafast phase shift for beamforming, and has the advantages of simple structure, low insertion loss and insensitive to wavelength change. Experimental results demonstrate a continuous phase tuning from 0° to 360° with very small magnitude and phase variations in a decade bandwidth from 2.5 to 25 GHz.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'Radio frequency', 'Tuning', 'Phase shifters', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Radio frequency photonics', 'fiber optic links and subsystems', 'analog optical signal processing', 'wideband phase shifters']

abstracts: The polarimetric calculation method of global pixel can obtain better restoration results with better effect of detail recovery, higher contrast and higher signal to noise ratio compared with previous researches. It will help to promote its applications in underwater target detection. Further, the global calculation strategy is help to further improve the visual effect of the reconstructed image, which is more beneficial to subsequent visual applications such as image recognition.
ieee_keywords: ['Scattering', 'Imaging', 'Image restoration', 'Lighting', 'Licenses', 'Water resources', 'Reflectivity']
author_keywords: ['Polarimetric imaging', 'underwater image restoration', 'polarimetric calculation of global pixel', 'the degree of polarization of the target']

abstracts: The dynamics of interplay between the singular points of polarization and vortex during propagation in a strongly nonlocal nonlinear (SNN) medium leads to novel phenomena. The linear-circular polarization conversion occurs and can be controlled in the center or the periphery of a vector vortex optical field depending on the topological charge numbers of the vortex and polarization, due to the coherent superposition of the different polarization components during propagation in a SNN medium.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical vortices', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Diffraction', 'Optical propagation', 'Method of moments', 'Stokes parameters']

abstracts: We propose a compact method to realize polarization-independent filter under oblique incidence, which is implemented on 2D crossed grating in the telecommunication region. Since the existing polarization-insensitive filters based on 2D grating are mostly under normal incidence. However, in filtering optical devices, the normal incidence regime is usually avoided because it requires the use of beam separators which yields a loss of efficiency.
ieee_keywords: ['Two dimensional displays', 'Gratings', 'Optical filters', 'Reflectivity', 'Diffraction', 'Diffraction gratings', 'Polarization']
author_keywords: ['Guided mode resonant filter (GMRF)', '2-D grating', 'rigorous coupled wave analysis (RCWA)', 'polarization-independent filter.']

abstracts: The two-, three-, and four-channel mapping multiplexing technique (MMT) is demonstrated to increase the data capacity of multilevel intensity-modulated transmission formats to 2, 3, and 4 bits/symbol with a substantial reduction in power penalty. This paper outlines the N-channel MMT design metric consideration influence on the performance enhancement of higher order amplitude modulated systems in terms of power penalty, receiver sensitivity, and spectral efficiency. The signal space model has been developed for N-channel MMT, where the average electrical and optical power expressions are derived. Transmission of 2, 3, and 4 bits/symbol using MMT system shows better performance in terms of the average optical power penalty, in comparison with pulse amplitude modulation (M-PAM) formats, with respect to the information capacity. The proposed scheme can be considered as an alternative to M-PAM systems with enhanced power efficiency.
ieee_keywords: ['Modulation', 'Multiplexing', 'Receivers', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'High-speed optical techniques']
author_keywords: ['Optical fiber communication systems', 'optical interconnects', 'mapping multiplexing technique', 'electro‐optical systems']

abstracts: In this paper, we propose an illumination alignment method termed brightfield localization for FPM. We utilize the spatial relationship between the LED elements and the sample plane to locate the LED array. Besides, PSO and RANSAC methods are applied to improve the accuracy and speed. Both simulations and experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of our method. The paper should be of interest to readers of your journal in the areas of super-resolution, phase imaging and microscopy.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Image reconstruction', 'Microscopy', 'Lighting', 'Apertures', 'Ultraviolet sources']

abstracts: Precise time delay sensing combined with stable frequency dissemination on an arbitrary intermediate point along a fiber-optic loop link is presented. Based on λ-dispersion-induced radio-frequency (RF) phase locking, the whole loop time delay and phase shift are first stabilized. The time and frequency signals are carried on the same optical carrier and are delivered to both the clockwise and anticlockwise directions. On the intermediate point, the instantaneous time delay from the central station to that point can be acquired by measuring the delay difference. The stable frequency standard with twice the angular frequency of the RF reference can be recovered on the intermediate point by mixing the RFs in the two directions. In the 45-km fiber loop experiment, the variation of the sensed time delay is limited in ±50-ps range, and the time deviation of the sensed time delay is measured to be 19.79 ps after 1-s averaging and 0.896 ps after 103-s averaging, as compared to the real delay value. The overlapping Allan deviation of the recovered 2.42-GHz frequency reaches 2.04 × 10 13 and 1.71 × 10 16 at 1 s and 10 4 s, respectively. The loop delay tunable range is in proportion to the fiber length, giving the potential of constructing a long-distance fiber loop link.
ieee_keywords: ['Delay effects', 'Delays', 'Radio frequency', 'Time-frequency analysis', 'Optical sensors']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'Fiber optics links and subsystems', 'Time and frequency delivery']

abstracts: A simple phase-shifted fiber Bragg grating (PS-FBG) is proposed to implement the optical differentiator and optical integrator at the same time, while the fiber platform based solutions that have been proposed previously all focus on separate functionality. We can also use the concatenation of such PS-FBGs to implement the high-order differentiators and integrators simultaneously.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Optical signal processing', 'Integrated optics', 'Bragg gratings', 'Optical reflection', 'Ultrafast optics']

abstracts: We present real-time waveform characterization of ultrashort pulses by the use of a pulse-front tilt in frequency-resolved optical gating capable of carrier-envelope phase determination. Simultaneous measurement of cross-correlation frequency-resolved optical gating and electro-optic sampling signals has been realized without scanning any delays. Complete waveform characterization of single-cycle infrared pulses in real time has been demonstrated. The method has been also applied for characterization of more complex pulses, namely, a strongly chirped pulse after passing through a solid crystal or a distorted pulse due to the absorption of ambient air.
ieee_keywords: ['Real-time systems', 'Imaging', 'Delays', 'Pulse measurements', 'Earth Observing System', 'Ultraviolet sources', 'Optical distortion']

abstracts: Photon-counting detectors can increase the range of underwater optical wireless communication (UWOC) by enhancing the detection sensitivity and have thus become an active research area in recent years. However, system performance still needs to be improved in the reported underwater photon-counting communication (UPCC) experiments. In this study, a real-time, high-speed UPCC system was designed and experimentally validated based on a single-photon avalanche diode (SPAD). A reliable symbol synchronization method based on pulse-position modulation (PPM) was developed. This method achieved slot synchronization by using a narrow-pulse-width laser and a simple matched filter and realizes frame synchronization through an improved synchronization sequence. In addition, channel errors were corrected by serially concatenated convolutionally coded PPM (SCPPM), and digital signals were processed in real time based on field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). Finally, desktop communication experiments were completed at a slot frequency of 25 MHz and a communication rate of 6.21 Mbps. The system exhibited a bit error rate (BER) of less than 10 –7 , a received optical power of only −84.3 dBm, and an efficiency of 1.35 photons per bit.
ieee_keywords: ['Single-photon avalanche diodes', 'Photonics', 'Synchronization', 'Detectors', 'Optical attenuators', 'Field programmable gate arrays', 'Sensitivity']
author_keywords: ['Underwater optical wireless communication', 'single photon avalanche diode', 'pulse-position modulation', 'slot synchronization']

abstracts: We present a novel scheme to realize an IFM system. Compared to existing solutions, the proposed IFM is easy to be reconfigured with adjustable measurement range and resolution. In addition, the upper and lower frequency bound of the measurement range can be adjusted independently. It has the potential to be used in the front ends of modern radar warning receivers and electronic warfare systems, especially for channelized frequency measurement.
ieee_keywords: ['Frequency measurement', 'Microwave measurement', 'Fading channels', 'Mach-Zehnder interferometers', 'Frequency modulation', 'Microwave photonics', 'Wavelength measurement']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'instantaneous frequency measurement (IFM)', 'dual-polarization dual-drive Mach-Zehnder modulator (DPol-DMZM)']

abstracts: On the one hand, the low shape factor shows that the transmission response is more rectangular than the multi-ring structure, which is the commonly-used structure. On the other hand, the proposed lattice filter shows a stable rectangular filter response, with consistent insertion loss, shape factor, and extinction ratio, during the bandwidth configuration. These two important advantages make the proposed structure more attractive in reconfigurable analog optical signal processing.
ieee_keywords: ['Bandwidth', 'Lattices', 'Optical filters', 'Optical resonators', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Poles and zeros', 'Optical distortion']

abstracts: We propose and experimentally demonstrate a reconfigurable ultrawideband (UWB) pulse generation scheme by using a dual-drive Mach-Zehnder modulator (DDMZM). In the proposed method, two phase modulators of the DDMZM are respectively driven by properly designed electrical signals. By carefully setting the parameters of the two electrical signals and the bias voltage of the DDMZM, different UWB pulses can be achieved at the interference output of the DDMZM. A proof-of-concept experiment verifies the feasibility of the proposed method. Photonic generations of UWB monocycle, doublet, triplet, and quintuple pulses have been successfully demonstrated, with central frequencies of 4.69, 4.69, 5.47, and 6.25 GHz and fractional bandwidths of 150%, 133%, 186%, and 75%, respectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Pulse generation', 'Photonics', 'Ultra wideband technology', 'Optical filters', 'Shape', 'Bandwidth', 'Optical pulse shaping']

abstracts: Traditional diffuse reflective LED lighting systems can only produce a circular spot, in this paper, we designed a diffuse reflective off-axis surface for rectangular illumination, which not only can produce a rectangular lighting spot, but also can enhance illumination uniformity slightly and system efficiency multiply.
ieee_keywords: ['Lighting', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Mathematical model', 'Lenses', 'Shape', 'Surface treatment']

abstracts: This research work evaluates experimentally the degeneration of Ag coatings on different polished surfaces of SPFs, and the inhibition effect of Au plating. We firstly establish the relationship between polished surface topography and the SPF SPR performance. More importantly,we use the Au plating to eliminate the influence of surface topography on the resonance wavelength and bandwidth, and obtain stable Ag SPR sensor.
ieee_keywords: ['Surface topography', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Surface treatment', 'Optical surface waves', 'Coatings', 'Films']
author_keywords: ['Side-polished fiber (SPF)', 'surface plasmon resonance (SPR)', 'silver coating', 'silver–gold compound coating', 'degeneration.']

abstracts: High-fidelity photodetection enables the transfer of the low noise inherent to optical oscillators to the microwave domain. However, when photodetecting optical signals of the highest timing stability, photodiode flicker (1/f) noise can dominate the resulting timing jitter at timescales longer than ~1 ms. With the goal of improving femtosecond-level timing fidelity when transferring from the optical to microwave domain, we vary the duty cycle of a train of optical pulses and show that the photodetector flicker phase noise on a photonically generated 1 GHz microwave signal can be reduced by ~10 dB under ultrashort pulse illumination, reaching as low as -140/f dBc/Hz. In addition, a strong correlation between amplitude and phase flicker noise is found, implying a single baseband noise source can modulate both quadratures of the microwave carrier. These findings expand the limits of the ultimate timing stability that can be transferred from optics to electronics.
ieee_keywords: ['1f noise', 'Phase noise', 'Optical pulses', 'Microwave photonics', 'Microwave oscillators', 'Ultrafast optics', 'Microwave theory and techniques']

abstracts: We investigate the restorative effect of the self-image applied to the lithography of gratings with rough lines. This paper is applied to characterize a Talbot lithography experiment implemented in the extreme ultraviolet. With the self-imaging technique, a mask with grid patterns having bumps randomly placed along the line edges reproduces a grid pattern with smoothed line edges. Simulation explores the approach further for the cases of sub-100-nm pitch grids.
ieee_keywords: ['Lithography', 'Ultraviolet sources', 'Image edge detection', 'Resists', 'Gratings', 'Lighting', 'Image restoration']

abstracts: Persistent efforts on developing advanced and complex data algorithms to enable the vertical-cavity surface-emitting lasers (VCSELs) for data beyond 100-Gbit/s has been reviewed in this paper. This endeavor not only elevates the bit rate of the IEEE802.3 standards for data center applications but also to initiate the unification of data format for wired and wireless network coverage. To date, the highest allowable data rates of the single-VCSEL-based optical link are 80 Gbit/s for the NRZ-OOK format under back-to-back (BtB) transmission 168 Gbit/s for the PAM-4 format over 150-m OM5 MMF, and the 224 Gbit/s for the QAM-OFDM format at BtB case. For the high-level complex data-format transmission with rigorous demand on the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), this work demonstrates the most up-to-date 32-ray quadrature amplitude modulation generalized frequency division multiplexing (32-QAM GFDM) data algorithm with optimized amplitude and K value for encoding the multimode (MM) VCSEL. To achieve the higher spectral-usage efficiency based on the SNR spectrum for maximal transmission data rate, the bit-loading discrete multi-tone (DMT) technique is implemented by rearranging each subcarrier to the appropriate QAM levels. By utilizing 32-QAM GFDM and bit-loading DMT, the maximal data rate in the BtB case could respectively achieve 119.5 Gbit/s and 130 Gbit/s when operating the MM VCSEL at 55 °C. The transmission capacity of the VCSEL operated at 55 °C would decrease to 93.8 Gbit/s for 32-QAM GFDM and 83 Gbit/s for bit-loading DMT after propagating through OM5 MMF with modal dispersion.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Data communication', 'Modulation', 'Bandwidth', 'Optical fibers', 'Standards', 'Optical fiber networks']
author_keywords: ['Vertical-cavity surface-emitting laser (VCSEL', 'multimode fiber (MMF)', 'non-to-zero on-off keying (NRZ-OOK)', '4-level pulse amplitude modulation (PAM-4)', 'quadrature amplitude modulation orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (QAM-OFDM)', 'quadrature amplitude modulation generalized frequency division multiplexing (QAM-GFDM)', 'bit-loading', 'discrete multi-tone (DMT)']

abstracts: 1. This paper proposes a robust remote heart rate measurement method. Our method AZIPPG overcomes the shortcomings of the existing methods that cannot be measured under long-distance exercise it can accurately measure the heart rate of the subject during long-distance movement. 2. We verified theoretically and experimentally that imaging defocus blur did not affect the extraction of pulse signal. 3. We perform better HR monitoring than state-of-the-art methods.

abstracts: Toroidal multipoles, together with electric and magnetic multipoles, provide a complete description of electromagnetic responses of matter. The fundamental toroidal resonance has been extensively achieved and investigated in nanooptics, showing great ability to increase light absorption and light force. In this paper, we obtained plasmonic toroidal dipole resonance in core-shell (dielectric-core/gold-shell) nanodisk and demonstrated an enhanced second harmonic generation (SHG) from this resonance. It was shown that the toroidal dipole resonance based SHG depends on the refractive index of dielectric-core. For large refractive index cases, head-to-tail magnetic dipole pairs form a close loop, which is a signature of toroidal dipole and results in the enhancement of SHG. In addition, the frequency of this SHG red shifts as the refractive index of dielectric-core increases. We also investigated the cases in which the dielectric-core is filled with several common materials. Moreover, the toroidal resonance based SHG depends on both inner and outer radius of the core-shell nanodisk. Such results may serve for the developments of nonlinear nanooptics and their applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Toroidal magnetic fields', 'Magnetic resonance', 'Absorption', 'Refractive index', 'Electric fields', 'Plasmons', 'Magnetic cores']

abstracts: We proposed a fiber sensor for simultaneous measurement of strain and temperature based on a Z-shape structure. The structure is fabricated by simply exposing a single mode fiber to focused CO2 laser. By monitoring the wavelength shifts the two parameters, strain and temperature, can be simultaneously measured. Compared to the conventional sensors, the structure we demonstrated obtains much higher sensitivity and can realize dual-parameter sensing.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Strain', 'Temperature measurement', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical fibers', 'Laser beams', 'Semiconductor lasers']

abstracts: A new configuration of the dual-parameter sensor is proposed and its measurement principle is demonstrated. Compared to the previous configuration which using the same fibers symmetrically attaching on the substrate, the use of two types of fibers with different sensitivities provides more information and realizes the decoupling of shape and temperature. The experiment results shows that the maximum measurement errors are 12mm in position and 0.45oC in temperature.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Temperature measurement', 'Substrates', 'Temperature sensors', 'Sensors']

abstracts: We present a novel technique to effectively obtain single mode in reflection from a fiber Bragg grating (FBG) written in multimode microfibers. The capability of designing FBG in microfibers reflecting just the fundamental mode instead of multiple modes, simplifying demultiplexing and demodulation, is highly desirable. We demonstrate that the taper length of a microfiber can be effectively used to control the mode recoupling conditions. The reflection spectra from FBGs written in microfibers with different lengths are investigated.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber gratings', 'Reflection', 'Couplings', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Heating']

abstracts: In the reconstruction of cylindrical phase-only hologram (POH), speckle noise caused by the addition of random phase is rarely discussed. Although some speckle noise suppression algorithms have been proposed for planar POH, it does not work well if they are directly applied to cylindrical POH. The proposed method can suppress the speckle noise of cylindrical POH significantly. It also outperforms conventional algorithms, which work well in planar POH and are directly applied to cylindrical POH.
ieee_keywords: ['Speckle', 'Image reconstruction', 'Diffraction', 'Mathematical model', 'Geometry', 'Convolution', 'Transfer functions']
author_keywords: ['Holography', 'cylindrical phase-only hologram', 'speckle noise suppress', 'cylindrical self-diffraction iteration']

abstracts: We report on an NbN single photon detector with a compact Gifford–McMahon cryocooler that is suitable for wavelengths up to 2000 nm. The detection effieiciency at 2000 nm was 2.5 times that of the best previously proposed device. This device is expected to be readily applicable to practical applications involving long-wavelength single-photon detection including molecular science and earth meteorology.

abstracts: 1. The performance of InGaN based LDs is improved by using InGaN/InGaN MQW active region due to the better confinement effect on optical field and carriers. 2. Different from the conventional opinion, the leakage of carriers increases when the AlGaN is used as the barrier layer instead of (In)GaN. It is attributed to the increased piezoelectric polarization field in InGaN/AlGaN MQW region.

abstracts: We present a plasmonic nanostructure design, integrated both of the metallic triangular grating and dielectric antireflection coatings, for ultrathin crystalline silicon solar cells. Considering both polarizations, the current improvement of the optimized structure can reach 76.8% under air mass 1.5 global illuminations. The mode analysis confirms that the enhanced optical absorption is attributed to improved coupling to both guided modes and localized modes. The absorption enhancement of such architecture is a little sensitive to the angle of incidence. The enhancement is still as high as 50% at 60 degrees of incidence.

abstracts: We proposed a graphene based metasurface, which can realize the function of polarization selective THz wave manipulation simply by turning ON and OFF the two graphene layers without reconfiguring the Fermi energy distribution of graphene ribbons. The proposed metasurface can be switched between two working states to selectively manipulate the x- and y- polarized incident waves. The proposed structure provides an advanced method to manipulate THz wavefront compared with previous reports.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Reflection', 'Optical switches', 'Focusing', 'Finite difference methods', 'Time-domain analysis']

abstracts: A new method has been demonstrated for fabricating a symmetric step-apodized DFB fiber laser with improved efficiency and a narrow linewidth. This design could increase the effective cavity length and simplify the design process significantly due to the symmetry in laser cavity. The proposed symmetric step-apodized DFB fiber laser could potentially be used as high-performance light source for fiber-optic sensors or coherent optical communication systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Fiber gratings', 'Cavity resonators', 'Pump lasers']

abstracts: Optical phased arrays allow fabrication of solid-state beam steering systems. Due to the large thermo-optic coefficient of silicon, silicon photonic OPAs are sensitive towards temperature. Different kinds of OPAs have been demonstrated; however, no investigations of the influence of thermal distortions on the OPA response have been performed. This work provides expressions describing the T-dependence of the steering angles, expanding the understanding of the temperature sensitivity of OPAs.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical distortion', 'Optical refraction', 'Optical variables control', 'Integrated optics', 'Optical sensors', 'Temperature dependence', 'Phased arrays']

abstracts: Distributed optics-fiber sensors exploit specific optical effects along the sensing fiber to obtain a spatially distributed physics profile. However, the temperature and structure's crack information cannot be simultaneously measured by using the existing fiber-sensors. We propose and experimentally demonstrate a distributed optic-fiber sensor based on the Raman loop configuration and fiber loss characteristic for detecting the temperature and structure's crack.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature measurement', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Temperature sensors', 'Scattering', 'Optical fiber polarization']

abstracts: Our present DAST/Si hybrid structure provides a practicable route to achieve effective signal modulation for terahertz communication system.A dynamic amplitude modulation at 0.25THz carrier wave show that the our modulator provides a modulation speed of 1.26 MHz with a depth of up to 53% at a external pump laser irradiance of 3.5W/cm2.

abstracts: The high birefringence (~0.047) of slotted structure can increase the difference of coupling length of two polarizations. By comparing polarization splitters (PS) with similar parameters, it is shown that partial coupling is better than total coupling in aspect of bandwidth and extinction ratio (ER). The two types of PS have shorter splitting lengths of about 1 cm and lower transmission losses of 0.4 dB. The values of ERs for Splitter-1 are better than the Ref. [23, 24].
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Polymers', 'Optical fiber devices', 'Absorption', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Couplings']

abstracts: Terahertz (THz) propagation in periodic structures has attracted great attention because of its captivating electrical and optical properties. However, the created THz band gaps are usually considered to be caused by Bragg resonances. Here, we theoretically and numerically investigate THz resonances and their related band gap properties in a periodically corrugated plate waveguide with arbitrary wall profiles. It has been found that the corrugated structure can cause not only the interaction between the same transverse modes, called the Bragg resonance, but also the strong interference between different transverse standing wave modes, which occurs in a higher frequency range with quite different features. Unlike the well-known Bragg resonance, the excited resonances between different transverse modes can produce the stronger energy attenuation and wider frequency band gap. The dispersion diagram is depicted to clearly describe the relationship between these resonances and waveguide geometries. Using this method, we can properly estimate the band gap structure of THz waveguides, which has been confirmed by the simulated results. In addition, these two resonances can be easily manipulated by changing the symmetry of waveguide structures. These findings on THz propagation in periodic waveguides could be applicable in high performance devices, such as filters, modulators and switches.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Dispersion', 'Resonant frequency', 'Photonic band gap', 'Waveguide theory', 'Harmonic analysis', 'Scattering']

abstracts: Optical frequency comb combined with single push-pull MZM can realize high-frequency radio signal generation. The THz carriers with high-frequency stability and low phase noise, are generated by photonic heterodyne mixing of optical coherent wavelengths from the optical frequency combs. It is vital to investigate whether optical frequency comb combined with one single push-pull MZM can generate high quality vector THz-wave signal.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical mixing', 'Optical harmonic generation', 'Optical attenuators', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical receivers', 'High-speed optical techniques']

abstracts: We demonstrate an enhancement in the terahertz radiation characteristics of photoconductive antennas by fabricating a micro-structured photoconductive antenna based on the combination of SRR and dipole photoconductive antenna. We simulated the carrier dynamics in the proposed antenna and the near-to-far-field transformation in the multilayer media. The effects of SRR width and length, antenna gap width, and SRR gap width on the terahertz radiation characteristics were numerically investigated.
ieee_keywords: ['Dipole antennas', 'Terahertz radiation', 'Semiconductor materials', 'Equivalent circuits', 'Integrated circuit modeling', 'Numerical models']

abstracts: The deviation of previous estimation models were eventually not fall within the acceptable range for FSO link budget analysis. We established an accurate link attenuation model based on MC simulation and Kim formula. Our model took the influence of multiple scattering and receiving parameters into consideration, which improved the estimation deviation to RMSE<1. It can be used to strengthen the link budget analysis and guide the parameter design of FSO communication system under fog channel.
