abstracts: We fabricate a novel InGaN/AlInGaN multiple quantum wells (SL-MQWs) structure with lattice-matched AlGaN/InGaN superlattices barrier. The misfit strain and piezoelectric electric field in the MQWs is greatly eliminated. The defect density of the SL-MQWs reduce to 4.7x10^5 cm^-2, which is three orders of magnitude less than that of the InGaN/GaN MQWs. In the photoluminescence measurement, the efficiency of SL-MQWs decrease slightly even the carrier density reaches 10^20 cm^-3.
ieee_keywords: ['Charge carrier density', 'Quantum well devices', 'Superlattices', 'Aluminum gallium nitride', 'Wide band gap semiconductors', 'Radiative recombination', 'Electric fields']

abstracts: We theoretically investigate the propagation of surface plasmon polaritons (SPPs) for the metal-dielectric-metal slot waveguide coupled to a disk cavity filled with gain material. The transmission and reflection characteristics of the resonant structure are numerically analyzed based on coupled-mode theory. The influence of structure parameters on the spectra of transmission is investigated using a finite-element method. In addition, the incorporation of gain medium can compensate for the loss from metal and, thus, enable the loss-negligible SPP propagation in near-infrared wavelengths, which makes a novel approach of optical switches and lasers based on SPPs possible in the planar optoelectronic compact integration.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Optical waveguides', 'Metals', 'Waveguide theory', 'Plasmons', 'Propagation losses']

abstracts: Yttria-alumino-silicate fibers heavily doped with bismuth (BI) are investigated for fluorescence temperature sensing within the interval 25°C...500°C at 750-nm (LED) excitation. High doping with Bi which resulted in a high concentration of Bi active (fluorescing) centers, is shown to permit the use of short pieces of the fibers as “point” sensors, which is advantageous for applications. Theoretical backgrounds of three commonly utilized sensing techniques, based on measuring fluorescence intensity ratio, fluorescence lifetime, and frequency-domain referencing, are developed and compared, aiming for effective temperature sensing using these fibers.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature measurement', 'Temperature sensors', 'Temperature', 'Absorption', 'Finite impulse response filters']
author_keywords: ['Fiber temperature sensor', 'Bismuth-doped fiber', 'homogeneous up-conversion', 'fluorescenceintensity ratio', 'time-domain fluorescence lifetime', 'frequency-domain lifetime referencing']

abstracts: This paper proposes a simple and practical method to amplify signals for space-multiplexed optical transmission. In this amplification technique, the output facet of the multicore or multimode fiber is mapped back to the same type of fiber after passing through an imaging and bulk amplifying region. Simulations are carried out for a seven-core multicore fiber with the signal lasers amplified by a bulk erbium-ytterbium-doped phosphate glass amplifier. Amplifier gain of ~20 dB is achieved at an input power of 6 mW for each individual core with an optical power conversion efficiency of 32.5%. The proposed amplifier technique does not have a core or mode count limit for multicore and multimode fibers.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Laser beams', 'Optical fiber cables', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Multicore processing', 'Imaging']

abstracts: In this paper, we present a new method based on PS and three pitches heterodyne phase unwrapping algorithms for rigid moving objects on automated transmission line. This method preprocesses the fringe patterns of moving objects in 3D space, instead of complex phase compensation. The captured fringes are similar to that of static objects, so it inherits the high accuracy and robustness of PS and TPHPU algorithms.
ieee_keywords: ['Transmission line measurements', 'Three-dimensional displays', 'Shape', 'Power transmission lines', 'Image reconstruction', 'Shape measurement', 'Robustness']

abstracts: In recent years, there has been an explosive growth of data traffic in data-center interconnections. A significant amount of the installations within data centers are graded-index multimode fibers (GI-MMFs). These fibers enable the use of mode-division multiplexing to increase the fiber's capacity. The heart of such a multiplexing scheme is a spatial multiplexer. In this paper, we propose a simple tilted Gaussian beam multiplexer for GI-MMF using low-cost commercially available lenses. We derive an analytical expression for the power coupling coefficients using a tilted Gaussian beam launch into a GI-MMF. We use the analytical expression to perform an optimization algorithm for tilted Gaussian beams as a spatial multiplexer with GI-MMF. The optimization was performed for 3 × 3, 4 × 4, and 5 × 5 multiple-input-multiple-output (MIMO) systems. Typical power coupling matrices exhibit maximum crosstalk of -12.5 dB with strong coupling efficiency that is greater than -0.6 dB.
ieee_keywords: ['Multiplexing', 'Couplings', 'Refractive index', 'Optical coupling', 'Propagation constant', 'Optimization', 'MIMO']

abstracts: We systematically investigate the enhancement of TMI threshold in a monolithic high-power Yb-doped fiber laser system by optimizing pump distribution as well as adapting seed power during operation. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first systematical study on the enhancement of TMI threshold in monolithic high-power fiber amplifier by these two TMI mitigation strategies in both experiment and theory scopes, and meanwhile good agreements are achieved between them.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber theory', 'Laser excitation', 'Fiber lasers', 'Pump lasers', 'Laser modes', 'Laser theory']
author_keywords: ['Monolithic', 'Yb-doped fiber amplifier', 'transverse mode instability', 'pump distribution', 'seed power']

abstracts: We fabricate a grahpene-based component which could be simultaneously used as an saturable absorber and tunable filter in a tunable Q-switched fiber laser. Up until now, all of the reported graphene tunable Q-switched fiber lasers need additional tuning elements such as tunable bandpass filter or tunable fiber Bragg grating, which increase the complexity of the laser system. The multifunctional device solves this problem effectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Laser tuning', 'Temperature measurement', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber polarization']

abstracts: A two-way mixed RF/FSO relaying system with co-channel interferences (CCIs) is proposed in this paper. As far as we know, this is the first time bringing CCIs in a two-way full duplex relaying system. Our research shows the potential of the considered two-way relaying system for being a strong candidate for future wireless networks that require high data rate and high reliability links. It also indicates that CCIs are quite important factor which cannot be ignored in system design.
ieee_keywords: ['Relays', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Radio frequency', 'Bit error rate', 'System performance', 'Interchannel interference']

abstracts: In this manuscript, we investigated a compact optical zoom system as a built-in optical zoom camera module for the potential usage in cell phone in the future. A 3X optical zoom system with a size of 25mm(width)-25mm(length)-6mm(height) was developed. It is the first optical zoom camera module based on freeform lenses. The prototype exhibits a promising future for space-constrained application such as mobile phone camera module, wearable imaging system and endoscopic system.
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical refraction', 'Optical sensors']

abstracts: An ultrabroadband silicon wire polarization beam combiner/splitter (PBCS) based on a wavelength-insensitive coupler is proposed. The proposed PBCS consists of three identical directional couplers and two identical delay lines. We design the PBCS using the 3-D finite element method. Numerical simulations show that the proposed PBCS can achieve the transmittance of more than 90% over a wide wavelength range from 1450 to 1650 nm for both TE and TM polarized modes.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplers', 'Delay lines', 'Couplings', 'Optical waveguides', 'Silicon', 'Extinction ratio', 'Power generation']

abstracts: In previous works, broadband optical directional couplers (DCs) for arbitrary splitting ratio can achieves ~100nm bandwidth. This paper optimizes a DC with five segments (three symmetric coupling segments and dual asymmetric segments) using particle swarm optimization algorithm and achieves ultra-wide bandwidth with ±2% fluctuation over ~300 nm spectrum for arbitrary splitting ratio. We also offer a general strategy to enhance fabrication tolerance for such DCs with asymmetric phase shifters.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Couplings', 'Couplers', 'Optical coupling', 'Optical device fabrication']

abstracts: Single-molecule surface-enhanced Raman scattering (SERS) has been extensively studied over the past decade. In this paper, we propose a novel method to obtain ultrahigh enhancement of local electric fields by using a silver nanoshell with a gain core above a silver substrate. Numerical results show that an ultrahigh enhancement factor of the local electric field on the order of 10 5 -10 6 and a SERS enhancement factor on the order of 10 20 -10 25 can be obtained with the present system. The SERS enhancement factor is five orders of magnitude greater than the highest theoretical value reported for SERS applications at the single-molecule level. In addition, we use the finite-element method to analyze in detail the influences of the gain coefficient of the gain core and the other structure parameters on the enhancement factor.
ieee_keywords: ['Electric fields', 'Silver', 'Substrates', 'Plasmons', 'Refractive index', 'Bandwidth', 'Raman scattering']

abstracts: The manuscript reports on a TM pass polarizer for high-density silicon photonic integrated circuits with a record value of insertion loss, only 0.05 dB, significantly improving the state-of-the-art. The device exhibits ER = 38 dB and bandwidth = 200 nm, covering the S, C, and L bands. The back-reflection of the rejected TE mode is avoided by proper technical solutions. The design is compatible to all open-access silicon photonics platforms.
ieee_keywords: ['Silicon', 'Strips', 'Photonics', 'Erbium', 'Rails', 'Biosensors', 'Insertion loss']

abstracts: One of the two basic limitations in long-haul fiber-optic frequency transfer systems is distance limitation set by SNR. Previous solutions utilize cascaded systems. We demonstrate ultrastable RF transfer via 1007 km fiber with one stage system. Dual phase locked loops configuration is designed. The PLL located at remote site improves short-term instability of the transmission system. It will contribute to establishing continental-scale radio antenna array systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Frequency conversion', 'Optical mixing', 'Optical imaging', 'Holography', 'Holographic optical components']

abstracts: In this paper,We propose a novel “N” to “N” ultrastable radio-frequency dissemination scheme. It is fantastic that frequency references from different clock stations are allowed to inject anywhere along a ring-like fiber link and can be jointly recovered without using any extra noise suppression actuator.
ieee_keywords: ['Clocks', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber networks', 'Optical filters']

abstracts: The proposed method is applicable to generate uniform irradiance distribution on nonplanar surfaces with high efficiency, and the lighting quality of the lenses designed has better performance than that by traditional method. The method is capable to generate a tailored-uniform illumination, which is useful to reduce the number of street lamps, improve the efficiency and simplify the lighting system. The research will broaden the outlook of uniform illumination in practical applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Lighting', 'Lenses', 'Mathematical model', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Shape', 'Roads']

abstracts: We demonstrate measurement results of the light emission of vertical-cavity surface-emitting lasers (VCSELs) with chiral liquid crystal (CLC) overlay (CLC-VCSEL). Two different CLC materials with different chiral-phase temperature range are presented and compared. The CLC layer acts as an external cavity for the VCSEL for one circular polarization state that results in complex polarization behavior inside the VCSEL cavity. We find that the emission of the device is purely circularly polarized with a degree of circular polarization higher than the degree of linear polarization of the stand-alone VCSEL. The threshold current of the CLC-VCSEL is decreased, and the emission wavelength of the CLC-VCSEL can be temperature tuned over a larger range compared with that of the stand-alone VCSEL. Numerical results reveal that the small reflection at the top CLC has a much larger influence on the laser dynamics than the stand-alone configuration.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Temperature measurement', 'Polarization', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical reflection', 'Stimulated emission']
author_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting laser', 'chiral liquid crystal']

abstracts: Today, even in access networks, data traffic is enormously increasing, a trend that causes existing passive optical network (PON) infrastructures to become bottlenecks in a tele- and data-communication infrastructure, which is aimed to be both broadband and seamless. Thus, two major objectives are considered for next-generation PONs (NG-PONs), i.e., first, bandwidth increase, and second, reach extension to reduce deployment costs. Here, we describe a new reach extension scheme that at the same time allows increasing the number of subscribers in the network. The amplification technique is based on a bidirectional semiconductor optical amplifier (SOA). It is shown that the extender configuration not only meets the bandwidth and budget requirements for NG-PONs but also remarkably improves them. Differential (quadrature) phase-shift keying (D(Q)PSK) signals are investigated in this paper. Hybrid wavelength-division multiplexing/time-division multiplexing (WDM/TDM) transmission up to 120-Gb/s downstream and 40-Gb/s upstream are experimentally demonstrated. The access budget of 33.4 dB is achieved at 10 Gb/s on every WDM channel in case of DPSK enabling a splitting ratio of 1:512 per wavelength. Furthermore, optical power budget of 40 dB is obtained when DQPSK is used, where a splitting ratio of 1024 per wavelength can be supported. Additionally, a cost-efficient chirped managed directly modulated laser scheme is proposed for DPSK signal generation in U.S. scenario enabling a high-power budget performance low-cost transmitter configuration, which appears suitable for NG-PON application. The proposed technique also alleviates nonlinear impairments [specifically, cross-phase modulation (XPM)], which appear in dense WDM transmission.
ieee_keywords: ['Passive optical networks', 'Optical transmitters', 'Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Semiconductor optical amplifiers', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical network units', 'Time division multiplexing']
author_keywords: ['Next-generation passive optical network (NG-PON)', 'access networks', 'wavelength-division multiplexing (WDM)', 'time-division multiplexing (TDM)', 'semiconductor optical amplifier (SOA)', 'differentially phase-shift keying (DPSK)']

abstracts: A dual-wavelength DSR mode-locked thulium-doped fiber laser with wavelength-spacing adjustability and central-wavelength tunability has been demonstrated with the NOLM for mode-locking. The wavelength-spacing adjustability and central-wavelength tunability are attributed to the inherent characteristics of the birefringent fiber filter. Meanwhile, switchable single-wavelength DSR mode-locked pulses can be generated at the two central wavelengths of the dual-wavelength pulse.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser mode locking', 'Laser theory', 'Laser excitation', 'Laser radar', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Optical solitons']

abstracts: We propose a band-stop filter in Mid-infrared region based on periodic structure of bilayer graphene nanoribbons. In this structure, HfAlOx is used as an effective high -κ dielectric between the upper and lower graphene layers. Compared with the previous narrowband band-stop filters in Mid-infrared region, our proposed filter has unique properties such as wide tunable range, extremely narrow 3 dB bandwidth (40 nm), good robustness to the incident angles, and good fabrication error tolerance.
ieee_keywords: ['Pricing', 'Games', 'Analytical models', 'Agriculture', 'Forestry']

abstracts: We have reported for the first time the generation of 1.61-1.85 um tunable femtosecond pulses based on the SSFS of a phosphor-doped fiber. Stable Raman solitons were achieved with the shortest pulse width of 800 fs. The experimental results reveal that the phosphor-doped fiber could be a promising solution for extending the SSFS to >1.8 um wavelength, which could be used as a low-cost, compact ultrafast laser source for biomedical microscopy and imaging.
ieee_keywords: ['Stimulated emission', 'Optical pumping', 'Optical solitons', 'Optical pulses', 'Silicon compounds', 'Ultrafast optics']

abstracts: In the scenario of downstream Passive Optical Networks (PON), we analyze through simulations and experiments a 100 Gbps/λ link using digital signal processing (DSP) over up to 50 km single mode fiber (SMF) in C-band. In particular, we propose chromatic dispersion digital pre-compensation (CD-DPC) and quaternary pulse amplitude modulation (PAM-4) levels optimization at the transmitter side (TX), and simple non-linear compensation (NLC) in combination with adaptive equalization (AEQ) at the receiver side (RX). Regarding NLC, we compare two approaches: a quadratic polynomial function and a square-root-like function respectively. In this paper, we analyze in detail the performances of four proposed options, namely equispaced PAM-4 levels without NLC (baseline case), equispaced PAM-4 levels in combination with NLC, optimized PAM-4 levels without NLC, and optimized PAM-4 levels in combination with NLC. We demonstrate through simulations and experiments that optimized PAM-4 levels can only offer limited enhancement when NLC is applied, and up to 3.3 dB sensitivity gain can be obtained thanks to NLC at RX when setting the optimum parameters, with respect to the baseline case.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical transmitters', 'Passive optical networks', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical losses', 'Fiber nonlinear optics', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical distortion']

abstracts: A 20-km/60-Gb/s two-way passive optical network (PON) based on directly modulated two-stage injection-locked 1.55-μm vertical-cavity surface-emitting laser (VCSEL) transmitters and negative dispersion fibers (NDFs) is proposed and demonstrated. A one-stage injection-locked technique has been confirmed as an effective approach for increasing the frequency response of a VCSEL. A two-stage injection-locked technique, which can further increase the frequency response of a VCSEL, is thereby expected to have excellent transmission performance in a two-way PON. To be the first to employ directly modulated two-stage injection-locked 1.55-μm VCSEL transmitters in a two-way PON, brilliant bit-error-rate performance and a clear eye diagram are obtained over a 20-km NDF transport. A directly modulated VCSEL has a positive chirp, whereas an NDF has a negative dispersion property in the transmission fiber; this negative dispersion property compensates the laser positive chirp and results in systems with better transmission performance. Such an innovative two-way PON provides the advantage of a communication link for high data rates, which is an attractive feature that is useful for broadband network applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Vertical cavity surface emitting lasers', 'Optical transmitters', 'Passive optical networks', 'Dispersion', 'Frequency response', 'Bit error rate']
author_keywords: ['Negative dispersion fiber', 'Passive optical network', 'Two-stage injection-locked', 'Vertical-cavity surface-emitting laser']

abstracts: This paper concerns the high precision laser tracking control in quantum communications electro-optical systems. Traditional control method could not avoid the contradiction between error attenuation capacity and systems stable margin. This paper has introduced a novel fractional order control method to balance the systems error attenuation capacity and the phase margin.
ieee_keywords: ['Control systems', 'Attenuation', 'Delay effects', 'Stability criteria', 'Electrooptic effects', 'Quantum communication']
author_keywords: ['Fractional order control', 'performance confliction', 'error attenuation capacity', 'stable margin', 'global optimization.']

abstracts: A novel dual-slot silicon electro-optic modulator based on indium tin oxide (ITO) is proposed with high modulation efficiency, low loss and broadband operation leveraging the epsilon-near-zero (ENZ) effect. By combining the confinement of the dual-slot waveguide structure and the ENZ effect, we can obtain a high modulation efficiency of 1.44 dB/μm at 1.55 μm. The proposed modulator exhibits a low insertion loss and a high extinction ratio when the modulation region length is only 10 μm.
ieee_keywords: ['Indium tin oxide', 'Silicon', 'Electrooptical waveguides', 'Electrooptic modulators']

abstracts: A high-speed (400 Gb/s) and long-reach (180 m) PAM4 OWC system with MZM-OEO BLS and doublet lenses is proposed. The transmission rate is significantly increased by PAM4 modulation and MZM-OEO BLS with multiple wavelengths, and the free-space link is greatly enhanced by doublet lenses. Such proposed PAM4 OWC system is a prominent one for achieving high transmission rate and long free-space link.
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Stimulated emission']

abstracts: The PDMS encapsulated MKR was proposed and experimentally demonstrated as a temperature probe with a high sensitivity of -nm/°C. This compact and miniature temperature-probe is a promising candidate for wearable devices for monitoring the tiny temperature fluctuation in some special applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature sensors', 'Sensitivity', 'Temperature measurement', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Refractive index', 'Optical resonators', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: At present, the fabrication method of quantum dots(QDs) optical fiber sensor is filling the QDs solution into hollow fiber or making QDs fiber preforms. The consistency of sensor size and the high temperature are both problems. The theory that using the printing technology to make QDs fiber sensor we propose not only does not have the above problems, but also considering the controllability and repeatability, it may be a good candidate for fabricating optical elements with arbitrary structure.
ieee_keywords: ['Temperature sensors', 'Printing', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Quantum dots', 'Optical fibers', 'Temperature measurement']

abstracts: Distributed fiber sensing technology based on a Brillouin optical time domain reflectometer is widely applied for health monitoring in engineering. However, it cannot perceive quick external interference. In this paper, we propose to use polynomial fitting on the inverse of an incomplete Brillouin spectrum and find the peak frequency by statistical analysis. Simulation results show that the peak frequency obtained by our method is only 1.096 MHz higher than that by using the Lorenz fitting method on a whole discrete Brillouin spectrum. The method has high accuracy, good repetitiveness, and high stability and is helpful in health monitoring for situations with interference that lasts for a short time.
ieee_keywords: ['Scattering', 'Optical fibers', 'Strain', 'Frequency measurement', 'Monitoring', 'Optical fiber sensors']

abstracts: The relation between the output wavelengths of a laser array and the injection currents of all the channels is experimentally investigated and is found to be approximately linear. Based on this, the authors propose an optimization method of adjusting the wavelength distribution of the laser array by tuning the injection currents. In the proof-of-concept experiment, the linear wavelength residual is significantly reduced.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser tuning', 'Semiconductor laser arrays', 'Distributed feedback devices', 'Equations', 'Laser feedback']

abstracts: We propose and experimentally demonstrate a novel multi-channel multi-bit programmable photonic beamformer, which consists of multiple parallel photonic true-time delay (PTTD) subnetworks based on cascaded DWDMs. Each PTTD subnetwork can provide multi-bit true-time delays (TTDs) for a multi-channel modulated RF signal of a phased array antenna (PAA) and operate over a wide RF range from 10 MHz to 12 GHz. The RF signal is modulated to a spectrally separated laser array combined by a DWDM to form a multi-channel spatially separated PAA. The multi-bit TTDs for scanning PAA angles are rapidly programmed by means of a control circuit of optical switches in the PTTD subnetwork. By using an optical splitter, multiple parallel PTTD subnetworks can be topologically configured out for a PAA with a large number of elements. The obtained radiation patterns demonstrate that the proof-of-concept experimental result agrees well with the theoretical analysis, verifying the feasibility of the proposed photonic beamformer.
ieee_keywords: ['Wavelength division multiplexing', 'Radio frequency', 'Photonics', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical switches', 'Delays']
author_keywords: ['Microwave photonics', 'photonic beamformer', 'true-time delay', 'dense wavelength division multiplexer', 'radiation pattern', 'phased array antenna']

abstracts: We consider a MISO VLC system with an LED lamp at the transmitter and only one PD at the receiver. A multiple LED collaborated signal model for MISO VLC systems is presented. Using the additive unique factorization technique, all signals can be detected uniquely. All LED chips adopt OOK modulation so the influence of PAPR and clipping are reduced significantly. Simulation results show the proposed scheme obtains significant performance gains over DCO-OFDM scheme.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Signal design', 'Optical transmitters', 'Modulation', 'Receivers', 'Additives', 'MISO']
author_keywords: ['Additive unique factorization', 'amplitude-phase superposition', 'light-emitting diode (LED)', 'multi-input single-output (MISO)', 'visible light communication (VLC).']

abstracts: A novel multi-level constellation compression modulation (MCCM) is proposed and applied for GFDM-PON. The proposed MCCM technology is a special application form of probabilistic shaping (PS), which compresses constellation by reducing the number of points. Hence, MCCM features PS, including lower emission power and higher transmission capacity. Moreover, the feasibility and flexibility of the proposed system has been experimentally demonstrated.
ieee_keywords: ['Constellation diagram', 'Optical network units', 'Passive optical networks', 'Optical filters', 'Probability distribution', 'Probabilistic logic']

abstracts: In this paper, we proposed a novel optical frequency-hopping scheme based on flexible structure for secure optical communications. In the proposed scheme, data of critical users are divided into a lot of segments and transmitted by different optical wavelengths in time domain.And a flexible structure was demonstrated and used in optical frequency-hopping system to simplify the structure and decrease the cost of security system.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical transmitters', 'Adaptive optics', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical modulation']
author_keywords: ['Optical frequency hopping', 'communication system security', 'optical communication networks']

abstracts: A temporal and spatial simulation and design of nanoplasmonic laser based on a semiconductor nanodisk is presented in this paper. A body-of-revolution finite-difference-time-domain (BOR-FDTD) simulation incorporated with a semiclassical multilevel model for the semiconductor gain medium and Drude-Lorentz model for the metal is developed for an efficient simulation of disk/ring plasmonic laser. A nanodisk semiconductor-plasmonic laser with a radius of 35 nm is designed, and the spatial and temporal lasing performance is demonstrated numerically.
ieee_keywords: ['Semiconductor lasers', 'Numerical models', 'Metals', 'Plasmons', 'Laser modes', 'Finite difference methods']

abstracts: A simple and novel erbium-based triple-fiber-ring (TFR) laser architecture to achieve a wavelength tunability of 1519 to 1583 nm and single-longitudinal-mode (SLM) oscillation based on C-band erbium-gain is demonstrated. The designed TFR scheme is developed acting as a mode-filter to suppress multi-longitudinal-mode (MLM) and expand the tuning range covering C- to part of L-bands.
ieee_keywords: ['Wavelength measurement', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Optical noise', 'Signal to noise ratio']

abstracts: Resolution limitation-free 3D visualization method for IIM display using a high-quality 3D model generation based on a CNN-based depth estimation algorithm. The estimated depth data is converted into the 3D point cloud model, while a pre-taken high-resolution 2D image supports the quality, color, and texture. The final high-quality 3D model is visualized with various functions (e.g., rotation along three axes and zoom-in/zoom-out).
ieee_keywords: ['Image resolution', 'Estimation', 'Lenses', 'Image reconstruction', 'Three-dimensional displays', 'Microscopy']
author_keywords: ['Integral imaging microscopy', 'resolution enhancement', 'high-quality reconstruction', 'fully convolutional depth estimation network']

abstracts: Considerable research has been devoted to the development of imaging apparatus capable of high-resolution imaging beyond the diffraction limit. Innovative subdiffraction imaging systems have been proposed and successfully demonstrated. These systems either focus the electromagnetic near-field more tightly than a Hertzian dipole or resolve the electromagnetic far-field beyond Abbe's diffraction limit and, hence, can be termed subdiffraction imaging systems. This paper reviews major advances in the field of subdiffraction imaging in the year 2011, along the research fronts of superlenses, hyperlenses, meta- screens, and superoscillations.

The proposed high-Q air-mode bowtie-hole photonic crystal micro-ring resonator can provide both eminent spatial and temporal enhancement for light-matter interactions, which are critical for sensing, modulating, switching and so on. With this advantage, the sensing sensitivity of the device has been doubled compared with that of the reported photonic crystal micro-ring resonator. This work offers a promising way of extreme light concentration and manipulation for integrated photonic systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Q-factor', 'Photonic crystals', 'Dielectrics', 'Optical waveguides', 'Sensors', 'Silicon', 'Refractive index']

abstracts: By changing the symmetry of a photonic crystal (PC) with a rectangular lattice to straighten one of the isofrequency contours, the PC shows an all-angle quasi-self-collimation (quasi-SC) effect. To investigate the straightness of the isofrequency contour and the quasi-SC effect, we propose a straightness factor L based on the method of least squares. With L ≤ L 0 (L 0 = 0.01 is the critical value), the isofrequency contour is sufficiently straight to induce the quasi-SC effect with the beam quasi-collimating in the structure. Furthermore, the efficiency of light coupling to the quasi-SC PC is studied and can be greatly improved by applying a carefully designed antireflection structure. This quasi-SC effect of the PC and the coupling structure may see applications in novel optical devices and photonic circuits.
ieee_keywords: ['Lattices', 'Couplings', 'Photonic crystals', 'Silicon', 'Optical devices', 'Photonics', 'Diffraction']

abstracts: This work presents a broad look at a characteristion technique allowing for real-time, single shot characterisation of the complex electric field of a swept laser source. Applied to a state-of-the-art VCSEL, we demonstrate the power of this technique, as well as a measurement of the parameters of the laser directly relevant to OCT. This technique can be readily adapted to many swept sources for direct characterisation, providing improved design and more informed optimisation for future devices.
ieee_keywords: ['Fiber lasers', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Laser mode locking', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Cavity resonators']

abstracts: Our proposed device can perfectly block transmitting the backward input lightwave toward the input port for any input wavelength (namely, extreme broadband) both in the linear and nonlinear regime. Its principle is theoretically and numerically verified in the paper and had never been reported. A novel key point is that the nonreciprocity is exploited by the nonlinear change of the phase of the reflection coefficient instead of the conventional nonlinear shift of the transmission spectrum peak.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Reflection coefficient', 'Power dividers', 'Optical resonators', 'Directional couplers', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Reflection']

abstracts: We demonstrated all-optical intensity modulator based on polarization-dependent graphene covered microfiber (GMF) waveguide. By employing 980 nm pump light and 1550 nm signal light in continuous wave, the strong light-graphene interaction enables a maximum modulation depth of ∼20.86 dB, and by pumping 980 nm wave pulses, we obtained the temporal response characteristics of signal light with modulation rate of 5.13 kHz.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical pumping']

abstracts: We demonstrate an all-optical low-power 2R regenerator of 10-Gb/s non-return-to-zero data based on a 10- μm-diameter electrically pumped microdisk laser, which is heterogeneously integrated onto the silicon-on-insulator platform and processed in a CMOS pilot line. The scheme results in BER improvement 8and works for submilliwatt-level input signals. The laser operates in the continuous-wave regime, and it is single mode at room temperature and consumes 6 mW of electrical power. Its regeneration capability is investigated in simulations and experimentally demonstrated.
ieee_keywords: ['Waveguide lasers', 'Optical waveguides', 'Laser modes', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Optical pulses', 'Fiber lasers', 'Optical switches']
author_keywords: ['Silicon photonics', 'heterogeneous III-V integration', 'microdisk lasers', 'bonding', 'regeneration', 'all-optical signal processing']

abstracts: In this paper, an accurately theoretical analysis for high uniformity illumination distribution of indirect lighting LED on the ceiling based on the super-positions is proposed and performed. The results of this work will be a general guideline for designing the high uniform LED indoor lighting systems as well as being valuable materials for the LED lighting manufacturing industry. This is significant because this paper is new. Given the interdisciplinary nature of our results on the interdisci
ieee_keywords: ['Lighting', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Light sources', 'Lenses', 'Licenses', 'Guidelines', 'Manufacturing industries']

abstracts: Augmented reality (AR) devices attract much attention nowadays since it can provide a mixture of real space and virtual images. However, most of current AR device is based on a two-dimensional (2D) floating system and does not present realistic scenes. For resolving that bottleneck, we proposed a bi-focal integral floating display using a geometric phase lens to provide switchable integrated spaces.

abstracts: “1. An analytical model of the measurement matrix for the photonic compressive sensing (CS) schemes with pulse stretch and compression is presented for the first time.2. We prove the equivalence between the peak value of the compressed pulse in the physical process and the integral value of the mixed signal in the CS model, which was never clarified previously.3. We present an extensive study to evaluate the influence of the PD bandwidth on the the performance of signal reconstruction.

abstracts: We fabricate honeycomb and related photonic lattices in a nonlinear crystal with a simple method that is based on the optical Fourier transformation through an amplitude mask (six-hole aperture) superimposed with a phase mask (three tilted glass plates). Compared with using the spatial light modulator, our method is cost-effective and easy to control for almost every one. Numerically, we use the transmittance function to describe the amplitude mask instead of treating each hole as a simple point source and give out the field distribution function of the honeycomb lattice beam. Experimentally, the induced lattice structure is examined by the Brillouin zone spectroscopy and the far-field diffraction pattern, as well as by monitoring the linear and nonlinear propagation of a probe beam. In addition to the honeycomb, vortex, and Kagome lattices, we illustrate the phase conditions for optical induction of molybdenum disulfide-like photonic lattices for the first time. Our approach can be easily extended to generate more complex microstructures by designing the amplitude and phase mask properly, promising a convenient way to establish a photonic platform for various applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Lattices', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Photonics', 'Optical diffraction', 'Glass', 'Lenses', 'Optical vortices']

abstracts: In the paper, we mainly presented the beam evolution in entire fiber laser from a more qualitative perspective based on tandem-pumping configuration for the first time. We built a B-R model based on BPM with PML boundary conditions and rate equations. The simulations confirmed the superiority on beam transmission of tandem-pumping configuration. Further, a recent result of a 5.4 kW tandem-pumping fiber amplifier was shown, and verified a rationality of the model.
ieee_keywords: ['Manganese', 'Nickel', 'Refractive index']

abstracts: In previous works carried out under the scope of EU funded FP7 FOX-C project, we presented results extracted from either a single-layer optical transmission tool developed and used by AIT or a multilayer network simulator developed and used by Orange Labs. This paper compares for the first time these two separate studies under common assumptions (in particular, using the same cost model) and verifies the compatibility of the results.

abstracts: We provide a general solution to bit-to-symbol mapping in high-dimensional modulation format. As a probability optimization scheme with no need of decision and demapping, our approach gives full consideration to the impact of minimum Euclidean distance and total number of nearest neighbors at that distance on the performance of high-dimensional mapping. Simulation results show that the proposed mapping has better bit error rate performance and lower computational complexity.
ieee_keywords: ['Bit error rate', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Optical noise', 'Euclidean distance', 'Constellation diagram', 'Minimization']

abstracts: In contrast to the mode-locked Yb-doped fiber lasers, bound dissipative-soliton from single-mode Yb-doped fiber lasers using nonlinear polarization rotation technique is seldom reported in all-normal dispersion region. In this work, we experimentally investigate the generated dissipative solitons for the first time, to the best of our knowledge. This would significantly help us explore the fundamental physic of dissipative solitons dynamics.

abstracts: The processing of organic substances by vacuum deposition is opening new possibilities for the properties of optical surfaces. Organic small molecules can be evaporated and deposited like optical thin films. Plasma etching, which has been successfully applied to generate nanostructures on polymer substrates, is now used for obtaining antireflective nanostructures on top of interference stacks on glass. The latest results in achieving excellent antireflective properties for a wide range of light incidence angles were accomplished through multiple etching of polymer substrates and organic layers.

abstracts: Label-free biomolecular sensing is by far the most common and successful application area in the emerging field of nanoplasmonics. This review paper highlights the latest progress and achievements made in this area. Key aspects of the nanoplasmonic sensor development, including performance enhancement, efforts to increase multiplexing capacity, and the progress in sensor integration and miniaturization, are discussed.

abstracts: We have investigated the characteristics of Brillouin backscattering light generated by chaotic laser in fiber. The Brillouin backscattering light still has the chaotic properties, and the position of the chaotic anti-Stokes frequency appears a dip which is due to the self-similarity of chaos in the SBS process. Moreover, we have studied the differences of Brillouin backscattering light between chaotic laser and narrow-linewidth laser, and analyzed their interacted optical spectra.

abstracts: 1. Numerical simulations are also implemented to confirm the pulse distributions inside soliton molecules.

abstracts: In this paper, a broadband and filterless photonic microwave IRM is proposed and demonstrated based on a dual-channel polarization-modulated photonic microwave phase shifter. Since no optical filter or electrical filter is adopted, the IRM features large operation bandwidth and good frequency tunability. In addition, due to the good phase tunability of the polarization-based phase shifter, the phase variation introduced by the electrical 90 degree hybrids can be properly compensated.

abstracts: Cognitive Radio (CR) is an astute technology implemented for the opportunistic usage of idle spectrum resource dynamically. This paper focuses on sensing of the vacant channels, and it is pre-owned for the transmission of encrypted DICOM information. The proposed algorithm involves encryption schemes like RC5, LSIC, DNA, DGT to render confusion, diffusion and permutation operations and Result validated the biomedical data transactions after sensing the unused spectrum.

abstracts: Ultrafast thin-disk laser oscillators (TDLs) are a staple of ultrafast science. The carrier-envelope offset stabilization method here presented, due to its simplicity, allows the creation of an efficient and cost effective frequency comb from TDLs. As high peak and average powers are available from these lasers, through nonlinear conversion, extension of the frequency comb to the mid-IR or UV regions is enabled. This work paves the way for high-power frequency combs in exotic frequencies.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser beams', 'Modulation', 'Power lasers', 'Measurement by laser beam', 'Laser mode locking', 'Laser excitation', 'Pump lasers']

abstracts: Tandem microlens arrays are commonly used in many applications for the beam shaping of an arbitrary input intensity distribution into a top hat. Because of the periodic structure of the regular arrays, the output intensity distribution is modulated by equidistantly located sharp intensity peaks, which reduces the homogeneity of the beam. A new concept is proposed in this paper for tandem microlens arrays incorporating a center off-axis microlens array for the generation of an intensity far-field distribution with improved homogeneity under coherent illumination with the envelope of a top hat. The geometric centers of the sub-apertures are randomly offset by the light axis of the sub-lens in the array to break the periodicity. The influences of the various off-axis amounts on the homogeneity are discussed. The center off-axis microlens array has been fabricated, and the corresponding laser beam homogenizing experiment has been carried out. The results verify that a high homogeneity output intensity distribution can be achieved based on the presented method.
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'Laser beams', 'Microoptics', 'Laser fusion', 'Optical arrays', 'Indexes', 'Periodic structures']

abstracts: A localized nanoplasmonic induced absorption enhancement in silicon nitride (Si 3 N 4 ) dielectric material using a nanoscale novel checkerboard gold (Au) structure is demonstrated. The checkerboard structure is fabricated on a Si 3 N 4 layer using electron-beam lithography and sputter deposition techniques. The plasmonic electric field and optical absorption enhancement are measured using scanning near-field optical microscopy. Finite-difference time-domain simulations are utilized to characterize the absorption spectral response enhancement together with its dependence on incidence angle and polarization. The checkerboard shows a broadband average spectral absorption enhancement of 63.2% over the wavelength range 8-12 μm with a maximum enhancement of 107% at 8 μm and a minimum enhancement of 24.8% at 12 μm. The degradation of enhanced absorption with incidence angle variation (00-60ο) is less than 1.6% at 10.6-μm wavelength. The checkerboard device shows polarization-independent absorption enhancement with incidence angles.
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Plasmons', 'Gold', 'Optical polarization', 'Electric fields', 'Scanning electron microscopy', 'Optical surface waves']

abstracts: The collimation of monochromatic light in optical metrology is of great importance for its determination of the accuracy of physical measurement. This paper proposes a novel collimation testing method with the differential grating (DG) characterized by its high sensitivity. In the process of measurement, the monochromatic light is incident upon a linear grating and is then projected onto a DG to create two sets of linear moiré fringes. By analyzing the relationship between the phase of moiré fringes and the divergence or convergence angle, the collimation of monochromatic light can be easily measured. Compared with the traditional collimation methods, this method is more accurate with an experimental accuracy of 10 -7 rad , which is in good agreement with the theoretical prediction.
ieee_keywords: ['Gratings', 'Testing', 'Convergence', 'Lenses', 'Standards', 'Optical interferometry', 'Optical sensors']

abstracts: A few silicon slot waveguide intersections have been studied but they have large footprints. Thus it is very important to develop a compact silicon slot waveguide intersection. This paper reports such an intersection which consists of mode transformers and a multimode strip waveguide crossing connected to them. The footprint of our intersection is much smaller than those of the previous intersections. Also, the properties of our intersection are superior to those of the previous intersections.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Silicon photonics', 'Optical interconnections', 'Electric fields', 'Photonic integrated circuits']

abstracts: We have several novel breakthroughs comparing with the previously reported blue HEMT-LEDs owning the lateral device layout: 1. Controllable green light emission. Due to the "green gap" and difficulty of monolithic integration, we are the first report on the green HEMT-LED. 2. A novel circular device layout adopted to improve the reported lateral layout, so that the device can spread current much better for overgrown LED and finally get a uniform light emission for the first time.

abstracts: Evaluating the filtering process of the digital speckle pattern interferometry (DSPI) of a single image by the traditional methods can result in under- or over-filtering. To solve this problem, this paper proposes an image-filtering evaluation method based on the Sobel operator and image entropy. First, the Sobel operator is introduced to convolute a filtered image to obtain a gradient image of a DSPI. Then, by analyzing the gradient image, image entropy is calculated according to the characteristics of the gradient map. Finally, the proposed method is verified by experiments. The experimental results show that the proposed method can quantitatively evaluate the filtering process of the DSPI.
ieee_keywords: ['Filtering', 'Entropy', 'Image edge detection', 'Speckle', 'Gray-scale', 'Maximum likelihood detection', 'Random variables']
author_keywords: ['Digital speckle pattern interferometry', 'continuous filtering process', 'image entropy', 'sobel operator']

abstracts: Very high negative ultra-flattened chromatic dispersion of two new square structure PCF designs (P-1 made of SiO2 and P-2 made of SF57) are proposed for the application of polarization maintaining residual dispersion compensation. At best from our literature review, both the P-1 and P-2 designs confirm ultra-flattened chromatic dispersion with highest amplitude of all reported previous designs. In addition, SF57 made PCF performs better than SiO2 made PCF based on a same structure in all respects.

abstracts: Mid-infrared ultra pulse urgently requires dispersion compensators (DCs). However, the common DCs in other waveband such as grating pairs, chirped fiber Bragg grating and high NA step-index fiber has the disadvantage of bulk structure, high cost and high loss in the mid-IR, respectively. We design a novel ZBLAN photonic crystal fiber (PCF) with large normal dispersion and low confinement loss, and theoretical confirm the designed PCF can be used as a DC to compress the pulse duration.

abstracts: We demonstrate a detailed theoretical and experimental analysis of the deterministic timing jitter induced on intensity-modulated optical pulse streams when propagating through a SOA. The mathematical analysis reveals an approximate linear relationship between jitter and pulse intensity modulation when the SOA gain recovery time is shorter than the pulse period. The theoretical results have been confirmed by experimental deterministic timing jitter measurements for intensity modulation levels up to 8 dB, showing good agreement between theory and experiment.

A delta-sigma modulation has been proposed for OFDM-PON to enable transmission by cost-effective binary IM-DD channel, in which neither ADC/DAC nor linear RF driver and modulator/detector were used. The proposed scheme offers excellent robustness against noises and nonlinearity distortions by using the 10-Gbps binary optics/electronics. Experimental demonstrations show that around 4-dB improvement in receiver sensitivity is achieved by the proposed scheme, with the 20% average EVM.

abstracts: We study the enhanced inhomogeneity across the InAs quantum-dash (Qdash) layers by incorporating a chirped AlGaInAs barrier thickness in the InAs/InP laser structure. The lasing operation is investigated via Fabry-Pérot ridge-waveguide laser characterization, which shows a peculiar behavior under quasi-continuous-wave (QCW) operation. Continuous energy transfer between different dash ensembles initiated quenching of lasing action among certain dash groups, causing a reduced intensity gap in the lasing spectra. We discuss these characteristics in terms of the quasi-zero-dimensional density of states (DOS) of dashes and the active region inhomogeneity.

abstracts: The development of techniques to overcome the limitations of excessive nonlinear phase shifts on transform-limited pulse generation around 1.55 M-5m is still an active area. Using a divided-pulse amplification (DPA) scheme with 32 pulse replicas to mitigate nonlinear effects, pulse energy has been scaled to 20 nJ within 126-fs temporal duration at 80-MHz repetition rate. The question about the recombination process where significant nonlinear phase is accumulated is discussed.

abstracts: This paper proposes an efficient domain-decomposition (DD) Crank-Nicolson finite-difference time-domain (CN-FDTD) method to analyze the extraordinary optical transmission phenomenon of periodic metallic gratings. The standard unsplit-field perfectly matched layer is derived as the absorbing boundary condition based on auxiliary differential equations. Compared with FDTD and CN-FDTD, the proposed method shows its accuracy and efficiency for the dispersive nanostructures.

abstracts: A modulated circular Airy beam may be morphed into conventional Air pattern or Bessel-like pattern under the action of quadratic phase modulation. For Airy pattern, it exhibits a dual abruptly focus where there is one focus behind the image plane, and another one in front of it. However, for Bessel-like pattern, the induced dual abruptly foci are simultaneously observed behind or in front of the image plane, thus leading to the formation of an elegant optical bottle with paraboloidal shape.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical beams', 'Laser beams', 'Trajectory', 'Optical diffraction', 'Transforms', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical imaging']

abstracts: A novel compact optical filter based on a new asymmetrical dual-core photonic crystal fiber which possesses all circular air holes is proposed. The length of the optical filter is dramatically shortened to 1.83mm, and it possesses a bandwidth of ∼58nm and small side-lobes. Moreover, when the input port and output port are different cores, it can act as a band-pass filter; otherwise it can act as a band-stop filter.

abstracts: We develop high-repetition-rate EDFLs operated in the normal-dispersion regime. The proposed EDFLs with innovative designs are twofold, motivated for both exploring unusual dynamics of DSs and improving practical applications. By adopting a transmitted SESA and a WDM/ISO/Tap hybrid module, the repetition rate could be scaled up to more than 400 MHz. Multiple-state DSs are demonstrated for the first time, which greatly enrich our understanding toward the dynamics of DSs.

abstracts: In this paper, we have demonstrated birefringence modification in regenerated grating in polarization maintaining fiber (RGPMF) by using a CO 2 laser annealing technique. After conducting an isothermal annealing procedure followed by a slow cooling process, the birefringence of the RGPMF has been increased. This phenomenon can be explained by the changes in the thermal expansion coefficient and glass transition temperature of the stress applying part at different cooling rates. This process was reversible by reannealing with a subsequent fast cooling process. In our observation, the birefringence exponentially increases with a decreasing cooling rate. The highest and lowest records in the birefringence throughout the annealing process are 4.72 × 10 -4 and 3.46 × 10 -4 , respectively (a difference of 1.26 × 10 -4 ). This finding is useful for the study of the birefringence modification, measurement range, sensitivity, and accuracy of PMF or PMF-related devices.
ieee_keywords: ['Annealing', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Cooling', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Stress', 'Gratings', 'Temperature sensors']
author_keywords: ['Fiber optics and optical communications', 'Fiber Bragg gratings', 'All-optical devices']

abstracts: This paper researched on the effect of the viewpoints received by a single human eye on the accommodation response in integral imaging 3D display. The viewpoint distribution of integral imaging 3D display was firstly analyzed, and the viewpoint quantity received by a single human eye was deduced. The completion of this study would improve the visual comfort evaluation of integral imaging 3D display, and provide the theoretical guidance for developing a comfortable integral imaging 3D display.
ieee_keywords: ['Three-dimensional displays', 'Imaging', 'Lenses', 'Image reconstruction', 'Spatial resolution', 'Visualization']

abstracts: We describe stimulated Brillouin scattering process in a fiber system with light field phase modulated by lowpass filtered and amplified pseudo random bit sequence (PRBS) using localized nonfluctuating source model. The effective Brillouin gain spectra and the ratio of normalized Stimulated Brillouin Scattering (SBS) threshold to RMS optical linewidth is used to characterize the SBS suppression capability of the PRBS phase modulation. The normalized effective Brillouin gain spectra for different modulation parameters are calculated to exhibit the Brillouin gain broadening process. Based on the theoretical model, we find that the SBS threshold reaches a maximum for the ratio of cutoff frequency to clock rate rc = 0.53 and RMS modulation depth krms = 0.55 π for PRBS9. An effective Brillouin gain spectrum measurement setup is established, and the theoretical predictions are verified by the experiment.
ieee_keywords: ['Scattering', 'Phase modulation', 'Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber filters', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Cutoff frequency']

abstracts: We investigated the effects of rapid thermal annealing (RTA) on the dynamic characteristics of the InAs/GaAs ten-layer quantum dot (QD) laser. Improvements in the temperature stability of bandwidth have been demonstrated upon annealing. We attribute the improvements to the following factors: 1) increase in internal quantum efficiency and 2) reduction in temperature dependency of differential gain. The increase in bandwidth at high temperature from the annealed QDs could be due to a reduction in the relaxation time on the order of 0.1 ps. More importantly, the RTA process resulted in better temperature stability in the differential gain and gain compression. This is beneficial for the development of uncooled high-speed QD lasers.
ieee_keywords: ['Quantum dot lasers', 'Gallium arsenide', 'Temperature', 'Rapid thermal annealing', 'Semiconductor lasers', 'Thermal engineering', 'Quantum computing', 'Photonics', 'Stability', 'Bandwidth']

abstracts: In this paper, a two-dimensional true time delay optical beamforming network (OBFN) has been proposed with sub partitioning capability for 3X3 phased array antenna (PAA) with operating frequency in X-Band. The architecture is based on raised cosine apodised chirp fiber Bragg grating (CFBG) and Mach-Zehnder delay interferometer (MZDI). Compared to unapodised CFBG, raised cosine apodization drastically reduces the ripple as well as sidelobes and gives a flat response in the passband of reflection spectrum. Multiwavelength optical signals with a wavelength difference of 0.3 nm are used to steer 10 GHz RF signal in elevation and azimuth direction. Further, broad angular control of beam radiation due to sub partitioned PAA is also demonstrated. The RF signal beam is steered in elevation at -62.2,-31.9, and-10.8 degrees, and in azimuth at 123.6 and 55.9 degrees. Theoretical analysis of the OBFN has been presented and validated with the experimental results. At the best of our knowledge, delay characteristics of raised cosine apodised CFBG have been theoretically explored for the first time with mathematical formulation and a comparative discussion is given with the measured data.
ieee_keywords: ['Delays', 'Radio frequency', 'Optical interferometry', 'Optical beams', 'Optical sensors', 'Fiber gratings', 'Optical fiber networks']
author_keywords: ['Chirped fiber Bragg grating', 'Mach-Zehnder interferometer', 'optical beamforming network', 'true-time delay', 'two dimensional angular control']

abstracts: We report an enhancement of coupling efficiency between an optical fiber and graphene photonic device integrated on a silicon photonics platform. The design and optimization of selective spot-size converters (SSSCs) enables low coupling losses of 1.4 dB/facet for TE and 2.4 dB/facet for TM modes without causing damage to the graphene. In order to maximize the potential of the perfect wavelength independent response in the graphene, ultra-broad-bandwidth coupling from O- to U-bands (1300-1650 nm) is characterized. The bandwidth is over 300 nm (at 3-dB roll off) in both polarization modes. We integrated the SSSCs with a partially graphene integrated silicon-ring resonator to substantiate the wavelength response improvement by a pico-meter-order high-resolution spectroscopy.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Couplings', 'Silicon', 'Optical fibers', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: A novel bi-direction chaotic secur e communication scheme is demonstrated by numerical simulation,where random digital sequence as secret key is utilized to modulate external feedback delay.In this way,chaotic delay signature is eliminated and key space is also enlarged significantly.The proposed scheme provides a better theoretical basis for practical operation of chaotic secure communication.
