abstracts: Multiuser diversity free-space optical system with Nth best user selection scheme is studied in detail. The analytical expressions for average bit error rate (ABER) and capacity are obtained and then investigated. Results show that the mitigation effect of aperture averaging for the ABER degradation is more significant in moderate turbulence regime. The average capacity benefits from strong turbulence condition and it can be further increased by large receiver aperture.
ieee_keywords: ['Apertures', 'Fading channels', 'Optical receivers', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Adaptive optics', 'Atmospheric modeling']
author_keywords: ['Exponentiated Weibull distribution', 'Free-space optical communication', 'multiuser diversity', 'performance analysis']

abstracts: We present the first compressive-sensing on-chip spectrometer to directly downsample its interferogram before detection and signal processing. We demonstrate spectral retrieval, despite undersampling the interferogram by a factor of four relative to the Nyquist criterion. In addition, we describe and demonstrate an algorithm for compressive-sensing retrieval of sparse spectra contaminated by non-sparse background light\a traditional stumbling block for compressive sensing systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'System-on-chip', 'Bandwidth', 'Compressed sensing', 'Integrated optics', 'Optical sensors', 'Transmission line matrix methods']
author_keywords: ['Compressed sensing', 'fourier-transform spectroscopy', 'integrated optics', 'photonic integrated circuits', 'spectroscopy', 'microlens arrays']

abstracts: An approach to optimize the sensitivity and the limit of detection of on-chip refractive index sensor is proposed and demonstrated based on sub-wavelength grating racetrack microring resonator and Vernier effect. The sub-wavelength grating waveguide can reduce the structure limitation of the light field, which is beneficial to enhancing the interaction between the photon and analyte. By optimizing the parameters of the sub-wavelength grating racetrack microring resonator, the sensitivity of the sensor could be significantly improved to 664 nm/RIU. Subsequently, capitalizing the Vernier effect, a two cascaded microring-based refractive index sensor is designed. Owing to the Vernier effect, the wavelength spacings among the overlapped peaks could be effectively amplified more than ten times, leading to a high performance. The results demonstrate that an ultra-high sensitivity of 7061 nm/RIU and a low limit of detection of 1.74 × 10 −5 RIU. With the advantages of ultra-high sensitivity and low limit of detection, the integrated device has important value in the fields of environmental monitoring and biosensors.
ieee_keywords: ['Sensitivity', 'Refractive index', 'Optical waveguides', 'Resonators', 'Q-factor', 'Gratings', 'Claddings']
author_keywords: ['On-chip optical sensors', 'sub-wavelength grating microring', 'vernier effect', 'ultra-high sensitivity', 'low detection limit']

abstracts: Topological photonic devices provide a powerful platform to control the flow of light because their topologically protected edge states can be immune to backscattering and be robust to impurities, disorders, and defects. As one of the topological photonic systems, valley photonic crystals have attracted great attention because they can achieve a large bandgap and be easily combined with modern micro-nano fabrication technology. Terahertz photonic devices are of enormous interest in next-generation communications. Here, we design a valley photonic crystal consisting of a triangular lattice with three metal rod scatterers. By rotating the three metal rods in opposite directions to break the inversion symmetry, we achieve a bandgap width of up to 70% and observe the transport of the edge states in the terahertz region. By replacing part of the structure with phase change material VO 2 , on/off switching of the terahertz photonic topological edge states is realized, and the attenuation can be also modeled by adjusting the size of the VO 2 region. The proposed regime has potential applications in sensing and 6G communications.
ieee_keywords: ['Photonics', 'Photonic band gap', 'Switches', 'Metals', 'Phase change materials', 'Lattices', 'Topology']

abstracts: The proposed photonic crystal ring resonator only support one-way rotating waves and the rotation direction is determined by the externally applied magnetic field. In addition, the one-way rotation are immune to scattering from disorder ensures that the design is tolerant of fabrication imperfections. This unique unidirectional feature results in the realization of an extremely high Q factor of 3200000, more than one order of magnitude higher than the cavity with the same ring size.
ieee_keywords: ['Magnetic fields', 'Electromagnetic waveguides', 'Q-factor', 'Photonic crystals', 'Cavity resonators', 'Resonant frequency', 'Optical ring resonators']
author_keywords: ['Photonic crystal ring resonator', 'one-way rotating', 'high quality factor']

abstracts: We present an algorithm for jointly designing two binary amplitude masks (BAMs) that allow for secure authentication. Compared with previously proposed authentication algorithms using phase-only masks, it is much a simpler matter to provide high compression for the authenticable data for data storage capacity and transmission reasons. The security of two BAMs is guaranteed since no information can be visually observed from the two BAMs and their respective diffraction patterns.
ieee_keywords: ['Image reconstruction', 'Authentication', 'Optical diffraction', 'Optical imaging', 'Image coding', 'Adaptive optics', 'Holography']

abstracts: In multi-color visible light communications, optical filter designs for separating different colors usually do not consider the center wavelength (CWL) shift, leading to performance degradation at non-normal incidence. To address this issue, we propose the novel concept of optical filter bank, which can effectively collect the useful signal power and eliminate the interferences as the CWL shifts. The proposed optical filter bank achieves high performance at both normal and non-normal incidence.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Degradation', 'Precoding', 'Color', 'Transceivers', 'Channel models', 'Visible light communication']
author_keywords: ['Center wavelength (CWL) shift', 'linear transceiver design', 'optical filter bank', 'precoder', 'visible light communication']

abstracts: This is the first report of using polarization-maintaining fiber taper (PMFT) for tunable multi-wavelength laser generation in a fiber ring cavity.Optical and thermal properties of the PMFT are investigated theoretically and experimentally. As combined with a polarization dependent isolator, tunable multi-wavelength fiber laser operation is achieved by controlling of polarization-dependent loss in the fiber ring cavity.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Interference', 'Measurement by laser beam']

abstracts: In order to suppress the effect of reflected light in a single-wavelength bi-directional transmission scheme, various types of transceivers have been proposed. Our proposal can be realized by simply modifying the digital signal processing block in a conventional digital coherent transceiver. In other words, it is possible to introduce the single-wavelength bidirectional transmission scheme with minimal hardware modifications to the current system.

abstracts: We proposed a method for driving metal nanoparticles in the focal field by cylindrical metalens with phase gradient, and we demonstrated the optical trapping and separation of metal nanoparticles with different sizes or materials. The induced driving force has an approximately linear relationship with the phase gradient. This kind of planar thin structure can be combined with a microfluidic chip to form a miniaturized system for label-free and non-contact sorting particles or biological cells.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical refraction', 'Optical variables control', 'Optical scattering', 'Nanoparticles', 'Metals', 'Force', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: We demonstrate a new method with TOD-precompensation in an FCPA system that can enhance the pulse quality and support a wide tunable range of high pulse energy theoretically and experimentally. With this method, we develop a robust and compact femtosecond fiber laser amplifier system generating high quality femtosecond laser pulses with more than 10 pulse energy. The output pulse duration of amplifier can be compressed back to that of seed pulse perfectly, showing high pulse quality.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Gratings', 'Fiber lasers', 'Chirp', 'Numerical simulation']

abstracts: Optofluidics experienced significant developments in the past few years and is still proving to be a dynamic field of research with a particular focus on biological and chemical sensing applications. This paper reviews a selection of 2011 achievements concerning different aspects of the on-chip integration of photonics and microfluidics and, in particular, highlighting how the versatility and simple reconfigurability of the optofluidic approach can represent an added value in biophotonic applications.

This paper investigates optical orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (O-OFDM) systems with index modulation (IM) based on discrete Hartley transform (DHT) for visible light communications (VLC). An interesting trade-off between spectral efficiency (SE), energy efficiency, peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR) and bit error rate (BER) performance can be made by using the IM technique. And the DHT-based O-OFDM-IM systems can achieve higher SE compared with the DFT (discrete Fourier transform)-based counterparts. Employing DHT instead of DFT enables the removal of the Hermitian symmetry requirement, which contributes to transmitting more index bits and results in SE improvement. To acquire the same SE, the proposed systems can significantly lower the constellation order leading to better BER performance by contrast with the DFT-based counterparts. We employ DC (direct current) biasing and AC (Asymmetrically clipped) techniques to investigate the O-OFDM-IM systems in this paper. Simulation results indicate that SNR gains can be obtained by the DHT-based DCO/ACO-IM in comparison to the DFT-based counterparts. We also propose a novel reduced-complexity ML (maximum likelihood) detector specifically applicable to VLC. The new detector exhibits the same BER performance as the ML detector and performs better than the LLR (log-likelihood ratio) detector with reduced computational complexity.
ieee_keywords: ['Indexes', 'Symbols', 'Modulation', 'Discrete Fourier transforms', 'Computational complexity', 'Visible light communication', 'Transforms']
author_keywords: ['Discrete Hartley transform', 'index modulation', 'optical OFDM', 'spectral efficiency', 'visible light communications']

abstracts: In comparison with the traditional panda-type polarization maintenance single mode fiber (PM-SMF), both the efficient use of stress rods and the cost reduction can be realized with the proposed panda type four-core fiber.
ieee_keywords: ['Stress', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber cables', 'Optical crosstalk']

abstracts: Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) based on free-space optical (FSO) systems combine the benefits of both the high data rate of the FSO and the mobility of UAV. However, cumulative effects of laser beam divergence and turbulence-induced fading on the received irradiance in the FSO link might allow an external eavesdropper located near the authorized receiver to break the transmission under certain conditions. Quantum key distribution (QKD) is a technique of secure communication that employs quantum mechanics-based cryptography principles. A combination of a continuous-variable quantum key distribution (CV-QKD) and Gaussian modulation of quantum coherent states (GMCS) enables a relatively secure communication system against collective attacks over FSO transmission links. However, the performance is restricted and degraded due to the influence of atmospheric turbulence and excess noise. This paper aims to evaluate the performance of a secured UAV-based FSO system utilizing prepare and measure CV-QKD protocol based on GMCS under collective attack in terms of quantum bit error rate (QBER), outage probability, and secret key rate (SKR) considering the impairments of the FSO channel, link budget, deviations in the position and attitude angles of the UAV, channel fluctuating transmittance, and excess noise. The system parameters, including transmit power, receiver’s field-of-view, and beam divergence angle, are optimized to satisfy the system’s design criteria of threshold-QBER=10−3and threshold outage probability=10−2. The proposed system tolerates boresight displacement up to 7 cm with the optimized values. The Closed-form expressions and analytical results are confirmed by Monte-Carlo simulations.
ieee_keywords: ['Protocols', 'Autonomous aerial vehicles', 'Optical receivers', 'Drones', 'Power system reliability', 'Optical fibers', 'Bit error rate']
author_keywords: ['Continuous-variable quantum key distribution (CV-QKD)', 'dual polarization quadrature phase shift keying (DP-QPSK)', 'free-space optical (FSO)', 'quantum coherent states (GMCS)', 'performance evaluation', 'unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV)']

abstracts: The problem of automatic modulation format identification (MFI) is one of the main challenges in adaptive optical systems. In this work, we investigate MFI in super-channel optical networks. The investigation is conducted by considering the classification of seven multiplexed channels of 20 Gbaud, each with six commonly used modulation formats, including polarization division multiplexing (PDM)-BPSK, PDM-QPSK, and PDM-MQAM with (M = 8, 16, 32, 64). The classification performance is assessed under different values of optical signal-to-noise ratio (OSNR) and in the presence of channel interference, channel chromatic dispersion, phase noise, and1stpolarization mode dispersion (PMD). Furthermore, the effect of fiber nonlinearity on the MFI accuracy is investigated. A well-established machine learning algorithm based on histogram features and a convolutional neural network has been used in this investigation. Results indicate that accurate identification accuracy can be achieved within the OSNR range of practical systems and that the MFI accuracy of side subcarriers outperforms that of middle subcarriers at a fixed value of OSNR. The results also show that the MFI accuracy of PDM-16QAM and PDM-64QAM are affected more by channel interference than the other modulation formats, especially when the ratio of the subcarrier bandwidth to subcarriers spacing is≥1.4. Finally, laboratory experiments have been conducted for validation purposes. The experimental results were found in good agreement with those achieved by simulation.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber networks', 'Modulation', 'Optical fiber dispersion', 'Fiber optics', 'Optical noise', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical modulation']

abstracts: Optical networks-on-chips (ONoCs) are burgeoning structures of communication that can give a solution to the bandwidth and latency for multiprocessor systems-on-chips. Furthermore, photonic devices are widely used in ONoCs but suffer from crosstalk noise. Therefore, crosstalk noise is the critical factor that affects signal transmission and limits the network scale of ONoCs. To reduce the crosstalk noise sharply, an angle optimization that uses the cross angle of 60° or 120° instead of the conventional angle of 90° is proposed to optimize the Crux router. Furthermore, we present a signal transmission system simulation model for the mesh-based ONoC. For different routers applied to the mesh-based ONoC, the simulation model can present the time-domain waveform, eye diagram, and bit-error-rate (BER) curve clearly. On the basis of the analytical model, the results show that the minimum signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) of a 7 × 7 mesh-based ONoC is 20.9 dB when using optimized Crux routers, and the injection power is equal to 0 dBm, which is 2.1 dB better than using Crux routers. Therefore, the application of angle optimization to the Crux router and mesh network can minimize crosstalk noise and improve the scalability of mesh-based ONoCs.
ieee_keywords: ['Crosstalk', 'Optical crosstalk', 'Optical noise', 'Optical switches', 'Optical waveguides', 'Signal to noise ratio', 'Bit error rate']
author_keywords: ['Angle optimization', 'crosstalk noise', 'signal-to-noise ratio (SNR)', 'bit error rate (BER)', 'optical router', 'mesh-based ONoCs']

abstracts: Phase sensitive amplifiers (PSA) has recently attracted a lot of attention in applications such a low noise amplification and signal regeneration. PSAs are usually based on fibers which are few hundreds of meters long. In this paper we discuss using silicon waveguides for PSAs. We explain the parametric amplification process in silicon and show that a real gain in silicon could be possible.

abstracts: The EL and the microscopic-PL reveal two-colors emissions of the THP LED. However, the THP LED still has a low CRI because the spectrum does not completely cover the range of visible light. Thus, after adding QDs, the emission peaks can be broadened to increase the CRI and the white emission can be realized. Moreover, the CRI of the THPQD LED is high in comparison to the white LED with QDs and the phoshors-based white LED, so that could be used as a white LED to replace the incandescent lamp.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Quantum well devices', 'Gallium nitride', 'Three-dimensional displays', 'Indexes', 'Phosphors', 'Color']
author_keywords: ['Three-dimensional structures', 'quantum dots', 'phosphor-free', 'hybrid white LED', 'truncated-hexagonal-pyramid structures', 'light extraction efficiency', 'high color rendering index']

abstracts: A photonic method to simultaneously generate several binary digitally modulated RF signals by using a PDM-MZM is proposed and experimentally demonstrated. The modulation formats can be fast switched by directly controlling two digital signals. Moreover, a wireless transmission system is built to investigate the performances of the generated signals. The BER curves are measured. The proposed signal generator is of great potential in future dynamic communication networks.
ieee_keywords: ['Frequency shift keying', 'Phase shift keying', 'Amplitude shift keying', 'Switches', 'RF signals']

abstracts: Fields containing ‘photonic wheels’ are usually generated in a strongly focused field by tailoring the polarization distribution of the incident wave. Here we show that only tailoring its amplitude can also obtain purely transverse spin density, and the ‘photonic wheels’ can exist in three mutually perpendicular planes. Especially, we also examine the ‘photonic wheels’ from the view of topology and find that the typical topological events also occur for these ‘photonic wheels’.
ieee_keywords: ['Photonics', 'Wheels', 'Polarization', 'Three-dimensional displays', 'Apertures', 'Focusing', 'Shape']

abstracts: A new photosensitivity physical model for Ge-doped silica preforms based on color-center photoreactions is presented. Simulation results are in close agreement with experimental results obtained by several condensed matter physics research groups working in this field, suggesting that the photoreactions of this model may, indeed, describe the physical processes involved in Ge-doped silica preform photosensitivity. The proposed photosensitivity model is defined by two differential equations that describe the temporal evolution of a set of color-center concentrations. The first is a modification of a very fast reversible reaction previously proposed by Fujimaki , where the reaction precursor has a different chemical structure (it is a neutral oxygen divacancy NODV unrelated to the previously proposed germanium lone pair center GLPC). The chemical structure of this precursor defect explains the generation of nonintrinsic neutral oxygen monovacancy (NOMV) color centers. These centers are transformed into GeE ' defects by means of a second nonlinear reaction. This justifies the slow increase in the absorption peak experimentally measured at 6.3 eV, which had no satisfactory explanation.
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Preforms', 'Silicon compounds', 'Chemicals', 'Photonics', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical device fabrication']

abstracts: To the best of our knowledge, the first harmonic signal as the best choice in photothermal interferometry spectroscopy is demonstrated for the first time. Theoretical and experimental results confirm that the first harmonic signal has largest peak-to-peak amplitude in all harmonica signals while it has the same noise level as the second order signal. As a result, the system noise equivalent concentration (NEC) is optimized with 30% by just only changing the 2f signal to 1f signal.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser excitation', 'Harmonic analysis', 'Pump lasers', 'Gas lasers', 'Probes', '1/f noise', 'Absorption']

abstracts: We report on an integrated fiber-coupled bi-linear micro-light-emitting diode array, serving as a portable microdisplay system. The fiber bundle transforms the bi-linearly arranged optical signals from the emissive array into a 6-by-8 pixel microdisplay, offering a crisp and clear optical output. The pixel-to-pixel coupling arrangement ensures optical coupling efficiency. Due to the narrow acceptance cones of optical fibers, individual pixels can be well resolved with minimal crosstalk. The performance and functionality of this optical system is fully evaluated. A model to determine the fiber-coupling efficiency was constructed; it was found that the simulated results compare well with the measured data.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fibers', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Microdisplays', 'Biomedical optical imaging', 'Optical crosstalk', 'Optical arrays', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical fiber devices', 'Optical coupling', 'Photonics']

abstracts: Optimization of four different types of plasmonic structure integrated superconducting nanowire single-photon detectors has been performed by setting criteria regarding the maximal tilting. The optimized nanocavity-double-deflector-integrated P-SNSPDs are proposed for polarization-coding QIP applications, which exhibit ~10^13 polarization contrast, maintain high ~70% p-polarized light absorptance as well as ensure short reset time due to the wavelength-scaled integrated periodic pattern.

author_keywords: ['Theory and design', 'optical properties of photonic materials', 'plasmonics', 'integrated nanophotonic systems.']

abstracts: Due to different models of three-dimensional laser scanning equipment, thermal expansion of the objects being scanned, and differences in the types of objects being scanned, point clouds may have different scaling ratios in different scaling ratios in different directions. many existing algorithms may not be suitable to register this type point clouds.Therefore, weproposes a multidirectional affine registration (MDAR) algorithm to solve the problem.

abstracts: We report the first experimental study of PMI generation in ANDi MOFs with long pump pulses. ANDi MOFs arose great interest for the generation of coherent SC light. We show that widely spaced sidebands can be obtained by this nonlinear mechanism. The results reported here can have an impact on the development of light sources based on nonlinear effects. Furthermore, this work points out the need for pump polarization control in SC generation experiments using ANDi fibers with quasi-CW pump.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber dispersion', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Laser excitation', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Optical fiber theory']
author_keywords: ['Microstructured optical fibers', 'Chromatic dispersion', 'Fiber nonlinear optics', 'Four-wave mixing', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: The efficient use of optical nonlinearities in silicon is crucial for the implementation of silicon-based photonic devises. In this paper, we present an approximate analytical study of nonlinear polarization rotation in silicon-on-insulator (SOI) waveguides; the rotation is predominantly caused by the effects of self-phase modulation and cross-phase modulation, stemming from the anisotropic Kerr nonlinearity. In the first part of the paper, we analyze the transmittance of the Kerr shutter in the continuous-wave regime and address the problem of its optimization. It is essential for the generality of our conclusions that both free-carrier effects and two-photon absorption are properly accounted for in this study. We specifically show that the signal transmittance may be optimized by adjusting the waveguide length, the pump power, and the incident linear polarizations of pump and signal beams. In the second part of the paper, we examine the problem of power equalization with SOI waveguides. We validate the derived analytical solutions by comparing their predictions with the data from numerical simulations and illustrate the solutions by the examples of practical interest. The results of our work may prove useful for the design and optimization of SOI-based Kerr shutters, all-optical switches, and power equalizers.
ieee_keywords: ['Analytical models', 'Optical waveguides', 'Optical polarization', 'Geometrical optics', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical pumping', 'Cause effect analysis', 'Silicon on insulator technology', 'Anisotropic magnetoresistance']
author_keywords: ['Silicon nanophotonics', 'nonlinear optical effects in silicon', 'nonlinear integrated optics', 'Kerr effect', 'waveguide devices']

abstracts: We experimentally and numerically propose a deep ultraviolet light-emitting diode (DUV LED) possessing the quantum barriers (QBs) with the gradually reduced Al composition along the [0001] orientation. The induced negative polarization bulk charges in the graded QBs can screen the positive polarization sheet charges at the QB/quantum well (QW) interface, i.e., generating the polarization self-screening effect, which weakens the electric field in the QWs. The polarization self-screened feature is important in enhancing the overlap level of the electron and hole wave functions within the active region and increasing the hole injection, thus improving the electroluminescence intensity and the optical power.
ieee_keywords: ['Radiative recombination', 'Wide band gap semiconductors', 'Optical polarization', 'Light emitting diodes', 'Aluminum gallium nitride', 'Licenses', 'Optical variables measurement']
author_keywords: ['DUV LED', 'polarization self-screening effect', 'polarization bulk charge', 'hole injection']

abstracts: A polarization-independent wavelength-tunable first-order fiber comb filter was demonstrated using a polarization-diversified loop composed of two high birefringent fiber (HBF) segments. This is the first demonstration of the first-order comb filter that has continuous wavelength tunability irrespective of HBF angular orientation. The formation of the first-order comb spectra and their wavelength tuning were interpreted from the viewpoint of output polarization evolution on the Poincare sphere.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber filters', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Tuning', 'Optical fiber communication', 'Microwave filters']
author_keywords: ['Polarization', 'optical fiber communication', 'optical fiber filters', 'high birefringence fiber']

abstracts: Wideband and polarization-insensitive operation are key issues for electro-optic modulators. An electro-absorption modulator based on graphene-silicon nitride hybrid waveguide has been proposed. Geometric parameters are investigated through finite element method to enhance the interaction between the optical mode and the graphene. For a 200-μm-long hybrid waveguide, a modulation depth (MD) of 20 dB can be obtained when Femi level varies from 0.2 to 0.6 eV. The MD difference between the transversal electric polarization and transversal magnetic polarization (ΔMD) can be restrained to 4 × 10 -3 dB at 1550 nm. A low average ΔMD of 0.2 dB within the wavelength range from 1100 to 1645 nm can be obtained. The 3 dB-bandwidth of 53 GHz and a power consumption is 0.687 pJ/bit can be obtained. The proposed modulator has potentials for on-chip signal processing.
ieee_keywords: ['Graphene', 'Silicon compounds', 'Optical polarization', 'Electrooptical waveguides', 'Optical signal processing', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Electrooptic modulators']

abstracts: We propose a 2×2 power splitter with polarization-insensitivity and broadband tunability while other optical power splitters (e.g. MMI coupler, Y-branch, tapered waveguide, and directional coupler) disable to achieve these performances in a scheme. PDL is of 0.001~0.089 dB and the splitting ratio for the TE and TM modes can be equally controlled over a wavelength range of 1541~1604 nm. Our splitter can be used in on-chip optical device, programmable photonic signal processor and so on.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Broadband communication', 'Optical polarization', 'Optical refraction', 'Optical variables control', 'Directional couplers', 'Couplings']

abstracts: A simple polarization-multiplexed (PM) discrete multitone (DMT) system with intensity modulation and direct detection (IM-DD) is proposed for short-reach optical communications. Only four photodetectors (PDs) are required at the receiver, and no extra 90° hybrid and balanced detection is necessary. Novel digital signal processing (DSP) algorithms are proposed for state-of-polarization (SOP) estimation and subsequent mixed polarization beat interference (MPBI) elimination. These enable polarization demultiplexing and channel estimation to be implemented by a simple 2 × 2 multiple-input and multiple-output (MIMO) frequency-domain equalizer. The feasibility of the proposed PM-DMT-DD system and the effectiveness of the novel DSP algorithms are investigated via theoretical and simulation studies.
ieee_keywords: ['Estimation', 'Digital signal processing', 'Optical transmitters', 'OFDM', 'Receivers', 'MIMO', 'Optical polarization']

abstracts: In this paper, an attocell with the PEADO-OFDM scheme is proposed to eliminate the mutual interference, including both CCI and ICI. Specifically, CCI is avoided by an novel optical attocell network which consists of two LED clusters using two different modulation schemes, while ICI can be eliminated by the proposed PEADO-OFDM, in which the demodulation of ACO-OFDM and DCO-OFDM parts can be performed independently, leading to greatly reduced complexity and latency.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Integrated optics', 'Adaptive optics', 'Optical receivers', 'Interference', 'Optical modulation']

abstracts: We show that turbid medium can be manipulated and designed for multifunctional optical elements beyond traditional design. The programmable, multifunctional optical field transformation characteristics makes this system an integrated and intelligent strategy, where novel optical field transformation effect that cannot be achieve using the traditional optics can be realized. The results show importance for designed light manipulation and guiding of light for imaging through scattering medium.
ieee_keywords: ['Focusing', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical scattering', 'Adaptive optics', 'Media']
author_keywords: ['Wavefront control', 'optical achromatic element', 'multiple scattering', 'scattering media', 'transmission matrix.']

abstracts: A projection-type dynamic multiview holographic 3D display using a single SLM and a directional diffractive device is proposed and implemented by separating the phase information and the refreshable amplitude information, where the directional diffractive device is used to effectively extend the observation range that is severely limited in the SLM-based holographic display. The proposed system shows a promising potential for the real-time multiview holographic 3D projectors.
ieee_keywords: ['Three-dimensional displays', 'Image reconstruction', 'Holography', 'Diffraction gratings', 'Gratings', 'Holographic optical components', 'Optical imaging']
author_keywords: ['Three-dimensional display', 'holographic display', 'computer holography', 'spatial light modulator', 'diffraction grating.']

abstracts: A high-accuracy unsupervised classification model is developed in a multimode self-interference microring resonator (SIMRR). For the SIMRR, there are many whispering gallery modes (WGMs) present. Each of these resonance modes supported by the SIMRR has a different response to different target parameters, so that the SIMRR-based sensor has the super capability to distinguish between multiple components. In the classification model, principal component analysis (PCA) is firstly used to reduce the dimensionality of this multimode sensing information from the SIMRR-based sensor. When the original higher-dimensional data points are projected onto the lower-dimensional data with only the first few principal components, they can be easily categorized into several different types by using density-based spatial clustering of application with noise (DBSCAN) algorithm. As an example, the unsupervised classification method is numerically validated based on a designed three-gas SIMRR-based sensor. The numerical results prove that the classification model can achieve an ultra high classification accuracy for the designed three-gas sensor with more than 60 dB in signal-to-noise ratio.
ieee_keywords: ['Sensors', 'Principal component analysis', 'Microcavities', 'Optical waveguides', 'Sensor arrays', 'Gases', 'Optical sensors']

abstracts: We propose a novel architecture to generate a single-sideband superchannel of complex modulation formats, based on a quantum-dot mode-locked laser. The system is tailored to solve multiple problems in the typical generation of multiple SSB channels in a superchannel. The architecture presented is suitable for photonic lightwave circuits with current technologies, which makes it of a positive impact on the development of cost-effective and energy-efficient systems with direct detection schemes.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical transmitters', 'Amplitude modulation', 'Optical modulation', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: External modulation combined with photonic frequency multiplication can realize high-frequency radio signal generation. In order to attain electrical QPSK/QAM vector mm-wave signal, the RF vector signal need to be phase and/or amplitude precoding before driving the modulator. Phase precoding reduces system performance. So it is important to investigate whether photonic frequency multiplication without phase precoding can generation high quality vector mm-wave signal.
ieee_keywords: ['Phase shift keying', 'Frequency modulation', 'Precoding', 'Optical harmonic generation', 'Frequency conversion', 'Optical transmitters', 'Radio frequency']
author_keywords: ['Millimeter wave', 'quadrature phase-shift keying', 'odd frequency multiplication', 'without precoding']

abstracts: In this manuscript, we investigate the radio-frequency (RF) up-conversion and waveform generation properties of an optical frequency-shifting amplifying loop. Frequency up-conversion is studied with respect to the gain parameter and the different waveforms are produced when varying the loop length or the frequency shift. The application to Doppler velocimetry of this source is conducted. The measurement demonstrates that the up-converted RF improved velocity resolution especially at low speeds.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Radio frequency', 'Fiber lasers', 'Harmonic analysis', 'Laser mode locking']
author_keywords: ['Radio frequency photonics', 'fiber optics links and subsystems.']

abstracts: We demonstrate rational harmonic mode-locking of a fiber optical parametric oscillator (FOPO) in which the parametric gain serves as an all-optical mode-locker. A pulse train with a repetition rate from 10 to 30 GHz is generated using a 10-GHz optical clock signal. The generated pulses have a pulsewidth of ~ 9 ps, a root-mean-square (RMS) timing jitter of ~ 300 fs, and a wavelength tunable to more than 20 nm.
ieee_keywords: ['Cavity resonators', 'Harmonic analysis', 'Frequency modulation', 'Optical pulses', 'Resonant frequency', 'Timing jitter', 'Nonlinear optics']

abstracts: An optimized thermo-optic five-port optical switch based on the Spank-Beneš structure on SOI platform for 2D Mesh NoC is proposed and experimentally demonstrated. It consists of eight Mach-Zehnder optical switches (MZSs), which is optimized by substituting two optical waveguide crossings for two 2×2 Mach-Zehnder optical switches of a typical five-port Spank-Beneš switch. Dual-arm driving is exploited for phase shifting to reduce the operating power consumption of the whole switch.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical switches', 'Optical waveguides', 'Optical interferometry', 'Optical network units', 'Optical crosstalk', 'Optical device fabrication']

abstracts: We numerically demonstrate a scheme of optofluidic sorting of nanoparticles on a weakly coupled directional coupler, by tuning the input power ratio. It is the first time that it offers a ultracompact scheme for the reconfigurable and multilevel optofluidic sorting of nanoparticles on an integrated chip with a high degree of automation. It makes the chip dynamically configurable and scalable, which is very critical and opens a new horizon for the large-scale optofluidic integration system.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Sorting', 'Nanoparticles', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical surface waves', 'Silicon', 'Resonators']
author_keywords: ['Integrated optics devices', 'nanofluidics', 'silicon photonics', 'optical tweezers or optical manipulation.']

abstracts: In this paper, a rectifier integrated Luneburg lens is designed at K band for wireless power transfer (WPT) applications. The lens consists of two metallic layers with a gap of 0.3 mm between them and has been made by employing the glide symmetry technique. A flare is tailored to match the outer impedance of the lens to the free space impedance. Five microstrip tapers are used at intervals of180at the periphery of the lens to collect the energy from it. The rectifying circuits are co-designed and are integrated with these five tapered launchers so as to make the entire structure suitable for capturing the transmitted power from the solar power satellite wirelessly, and to convert it to the equivalent voltage. Finally, all the ports are connected with a common load for DC power combining, and the overall performance of the lens integrated rectifier as an energy harvesting system is reported in terms of its power conversion efficiency (PCE).
ieee_keywords: ['Lenses', 'Refractive index', 'Dielectrics', 'Dispersion', 'Dipole antennas', 'Antenna arrays', 'Wireless power transfer']

abstracts: Dear associate editor, This submission is an edited version of a previous submission with minor revisions.
ieee_keywords: ['Diffraction', 'Refractive index', 'Sensors', 'Laser beams', 'Sensitivity', 'Dispersion', 'Silicon']

abstracts: A new method for remote wideband microwave frequency measurement utilizing a single-passband microwave photonic filter is proposed, theoretically analyzed, and experimentally demonstrated. The frequencies of the input microwave signals can be measured by monitoring the maximum output microwave power while scanning the central frequency of the single-passband microwave photonic filter. The parameters of the filter have also been analyzed to optimize the frequency measurement performance. The proposed frequency measurement technique is easy to implement, capable of measuring frequencies of multiple microwave signals.
ieee_keywords: ['Microwave filters', 'Frequency measurement', 'Microwave measurements', 'Optical fiber filters', 'Microwave photonics', 'Microwave amplifiers']

abstracts: We have developed a model of repeater E/O efficiency for submarine systems with pump sharing, by analyzing the physical repeater structure including electrical circuits and optical components. The repeater E/O efficiency model facilitates submarine system design, such as accurate estimation of maximum number of fiber pairs under fixed electrical power supply.
ieee_keywords: ['Repeaters', 'Optical fiber cables', 'Pump lasers', 'Optical pumping', 'Power lasers', 'Underwater vehicles', 'Power conversion']

abstracts: The nonlinear distortions induced by the E/O and O/E conversion degrade the linearity performance of the analog photonic link (APL). In the paper, a method based on the corporation of push-pull manner and DSP algorithm is proposed to suppress IMD2, HD2, IMD3 and XMD simultaneously in the directly-Modulated APL. This work has potential applications in guiding low-cost and high-linearity optical transceiver design to realize high performance radio over fiber transmission systems.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Power generation', 'Power amplifiers', 'Laser excitation', 'Laser mode locking', 'Pump lasers', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers']

abstracts: We develop a procedure to analyze charged nanoparticle (NP) surface modes. Using the resonance condition derived by Rosenkrantz and Arnon, we obtain frequencies at which the electromagnetic (EM) radiation stimulates resonance over a wide range of modes. Our results confirm that the relation between the resonance frequencies and the excess surface charge can be described by a monotonically increasing function. Taking the derivative of this function, it is evident that the lower surface potentials have a greater influence on the resonance frequency. This effect decreases as the surface potential increases. Surface modes contribute to the surface energy of charged NPs, and for this reason, they can modify charged NP optical properties. We found that there is a strong dependence of the resonance frequencies on the electrically charged NP refractive index and surface potential. This dependence can play an important role in nonmetallic nanotechnological devices, such as attenuators and modulators in optical communication and optical detectors in biomedical sensors.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical surface waves', 'Resonant frequency', 'Surface waves', 'Refractive index', 'Polynomials', 'Scattering']

abstracts: The microfiber knot-type ring resonator is widely used in sensing, and the resonant mode is an essential concern. In this paper, resonant mode characteristics of microfiber knot-type ring resonator are studied theoretically. Results show that resonant mode split occurs when the deviation angle is large enough under the condition that the input is linearly or elliptically polarized light. Moreover, in the case that the input is partially polarized light, the resonant peak positions of split modes are identical with those in the case of inputting linearly or elliptically polarized light under the same deviation angle. The split mode characteristic is further studied by salinity sensing simulation and experiment. The split modes have the same free spectral range, and their resonant peak shifts have the same response to salinity changing. The experimental split mode characteristic is in good agreement with theoretical simulating, which demonstrates the resonant mode split theory of the microfiber knot-type ring resonator. The analysis on resonant mode presented here may offer useful references for sensing applications.
ieee_keywords: ['Couplers', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical ring resonators', 'Optical fiber couplers', 'Optical fiber polarization']

abstracts: In this work, we propose novel learning-based depth-variant (DV) deconvolution, termed LB-DVD, to restore out-of-focus fluorescence microscopy images, for the first time to our knowledge. Specifically, DV point spread function was predicted by convolutional neural network and used for subsequent DV deconvolution. The results show that the proposed LB-DVD is powerful to restore out-of-focus images. Further, LB-DVD may be useful to contribute to the development of a smart microscope.
ieee_keywords: ['Deconvolution', 'Microscopy', 'Image restoration', 'Two dimensional displays', 'Convolution', 'Training']

abstracts: In this paper, we investigate the uplink transmission in a satellite-aerial-terrestrial network (SATN), where an aerial platform acts as an amplify-and-forward relay assisting the communication between multiple users and satellite. The users send messages to the aerial relay via radio frequency (RF) links, which are then forwarded to the satellite through a free-space optical (FSO) link. By assuming that the angle-of-arrival based imperfect channel state information of each user is known at the aerial platform, we propose a beamforming scheme to maximize the minimum average signal-to-interference-plus-noise ratio of the users. Due to the mathematical intractability, we design an iterative algorithm to obtain the optimal beamforming vector for the RF link. Furthermore, by considering that the FSO link experiences the Málaga fading with non-zero boresight pointing error and the RF links follow Nakagami-mfading, we derive an analytical expression for the outage probability of the considered SATN. Finally, computer simulation is conducted to validate our theoretical analysis. It is shown that the proposed algorithm can improve the system performance and robustness compared to existing works.
ieee_keywords: ['Radio frequency', 'Fading channels', 'Relays', 'Uplink', 'Satellites', 'Satellite broadcasting', 'Array signal processing']
author_keywords: ['Mixed RF-FSO channels', 'uplink transmission', 'outage probability', 'robust beamforming', 'satellite-aerial-terrestrial network']

abstracts: We propose a generalized filter bank multicarrier optical access system, which has higher spectral efficiency due to the absence of CP and shown more robustness against frequency offset. The paper should be of interest to readers in the area of optical access systems. The cyclic redundancy check combined polar code is adopted for the access signal. It can improve power budget by providing excellent code gain with low computational time.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical filters', 'Optical network units', 'Adaptive optics', 'Decoding', 'Filter banks', 'Bandwidth', 'Optical transmitters']
author_keywords: ['Optical communications', 'optical access system', 'generalized filter bank multi-carrier.']

abstracts: The potential for visible light communications with SU-8 planarized InGaN light-emitting diodes (LEDs) is investigated experimentally. For large-size LEDs, current crowding occurring near the n-contact is addressed by shrinking the dimensions of the emitters/pixels, along with the use of parallel-connected schemes to achieve multipixel emissions. Through improved heat dissipation, current uniformity, and light extraction efficiency, the resulting LED matrices fabricated with 6×6 pixels outperform conventional LEDs in terms of light output power and current-induced spectral shift. It was also found that good control of the SU-8 planarization process and optimizing the number of pixels facilitates the fabrication of high-efficiency LED matrices. In addition, the presence of large junction capacitance caused by the parallel connection of the individual pixels prevents these LED matrices with 6×6 pixels from operating at high speed. After eliminating the slow-responding phosphorescent components emitting from the phosphor-converted white LEDs, an open eye diagram at 80 Mb/s is demonstrated over a distance of 100 cm in directed line-of-sight optical links.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Proximity effects', 'Power generation', 'Resistance', 'Indium tin oxide', 'Current density', 'Data communication']

abstracts: We design a parametric optical frequency comb (OFC) generator using an electroabsorption modulated laser based optoelectronic oscillator (OEO). Compared with the existing generators, no external RF signal source is needed. This OEO has advantages of easy integration, low optical loss and compact structure. A 10-GHz RF signal with a SMSR of 47dB and a phase noise of -109.89dBc/Hz is experimentally obtained. When the pump power is 28dBm, a 10-tone parametric OFC with a 5-dB flatness is generated.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber amplifiers', 'Frequency modulation', 'Phase noise', 'Phase modulation']
author_keywords: ['Parametric optical frequency comb', 'electroabsorption modulated laser', 'optoelectronic oscillator']

abstracts: A close-to-the-theoretically-largest TM resonant reflection of a free-space wave from a free-standing undulated gold layer immersed in a liquid host medium is demonstrated experimentally. It is mediated by the grating-excited long-range plasmon mode propagating along the continuous metal film with particularly low loss.
ieee_keywords: ['Reflection', 'Plasmons', 'Films', 'Gratings', 'Gold', 'Propagation losses']

abstracts: 1. Ultrathin solar cell with nanostructure inherited from self-growth AAO was studied 2. Three representative sidewall profiles were compared for light trapping abilities 3. Nanostructured solar cells (NSC) obtained Jph enhancements as high as more than 33% 4. The resonance modes were found to enhance the light absorption of NSC 5. This study serves as a way for the practical design and application of NSC
ieee_keywords: ['Nanostructures', 'Light trapping', 'Absorption', 'Silicon', 'Time-domain analysis', 'Finite difference methods']

abstracts: We propose and demonstrate an XOR and XNOR directed optical logic circuit in this paper. No waveguide crossings exist in the circuit, which is very useful to improve the signal quality and reduce the insertion loss. In addition, numerical simulation results indicate that the length difference between W1 and W2 can change the output spectrum characteristics of the device.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical resonators', 'Optical waveguides', 'Optical device fabrication', 'Optical pulses', 'High-speed optical techniques', 'Optical interferometry', 'Optical switches']
author_keywords: ['Integrated optics', 'optical switching devices', 'optical logic devices', 'resonators', 'photonic integrated circuits']

abstracts: We propose and experimentally demonstrate, for the first time, a microwave-photonic technique for measuring DMGD and CD of few-mode fibers simultaneously. Due to the orthogonality of spatial modes, we can extract these dispersion parameters for each mode without inter-coupling when a free-space PD is used. Meanwhile, the proposed scheme is scalable to measuring fibers with large number of modes.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber dispersion', 'Radio frequency', 'Microwave measurement', 'Microwave photonics', 'Wavelength measurement', 'Optical fibers']

abstracts: An on-chip gas sensor based on cascaded waveguides is proposed for simultaneously mid-infrared (MIR) absorption and near-infrared (NIR) upconversion detection. In this scheme, both the high absorption at MIR and high performance photodetection at NIR are utilized to enhance the sensing performance. The impacts of intrinsic loss, pump power, waveguide length, and phase mismatch on the detection limit are analyzed in detail. It is demonstrated that the proposed device can reduce the absorption le
ieee_keywords: ['Absorption', 'Frequency conversion', 'System-on-chip', 'Photonics', 'Sensitivity', 'Detectors']

abstracts: The optical-phased array (OPA) has gained special interest in recent years as a high-speed and compact imaging device. While large-scale OPAs have been demonstrated in single-pixel imaging, the complexity of the driver circuit is becoming a crucial problem as the number of phase shifters increases. Here, we investigate the phase shift requirement of OPA for single-pixel imaging and demonstrate, for the first time, that full 2π phase shifts are not mandatory to generate a set of illumination patterns with a sufficient degree of randomness required to reconstruct the image. Using a silicon photonic OPA chip with 128 carrier-depletion-based phase shifters, we experimentally confirm this property by successfully retrieving an image under a maximum phase shift of only ∼1.5π without affecting the quality of the image. Consequently, the input voltage can be reduced significantly. Since the carrier-depletion phase shifters generally require high driving voltages, this finding paves the way to high-speed OPA-based imaging with a minimum device requirement.
ieee_keywords: ['Imaging', 'Lighting', 'Phase shifters', 'Optical imaging', 'Voltage', 'Optical amplifiers', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Optical imaging', 'optical phased array', 'photonic integrated circuits', 'single-pixel imaging']

abstracts: The novelty of the manuscript was in realizing single-tone optical frequency shifting and non-magnetic optical isolation using the RF-driving conditions on the polarization converting LiNbO3 device described in the manuscript. we implement the frequency shift with side-band suppression larger than 20 dB at a frequency shift at 2 GHz. We also demonstrate optical isolation with 18.5 dB extinction ratio with the same device.
ieee_keywords: ['Holography', 'Holographic optical components', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical polarization', 'Lithium niobate', 'Optical retarders', 'Frequency modulation']

abstracts: Spatial Multiplexing MIMO-VLC is proved to perform better than other MIMO schemes over low-correlated channels. However, as communications devices tend to be small, how to attain multiplexing gains with highly correlated channels is important. In this paper, a spatial multiplexing MIMO-VLC with densely distributed LEDs and PDs is proposed for the first time. Numerical results suggest that the proposed scheme outperforms the traditional RC scheme.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Multiplexing', 'Receivers', 'Optical transmitters', 'MIMO communication', 'Correlation', 'Switched mode power supplies']
author_keywords: ['Multiple-input multiple-output visible light communications (MIMO-VLC)', 'spatial multiplexing (SMP)', 'optimal signal vectors', 'densely distributed LEDs and PDs']

abstracts: Conventional radiative cooling devices are white or silver in color to achieve high reflectance in the solar spectral range. However, a versatile color that can be applied to the radiative cooler is required for practical application. To determine the boundary between coloration and cooling performance, the reflectance in the visible range should be fine-tuned. Here, this paper presents a spatially-segmented colored radiative cooler (SSCRC), which is a 2-dimensional micro-patterning of colored areas, with angle-robustness. By using the metal-insulator-metal (MIM) optical resonator incorporating high refractive index dielectric ( i.e., TiO 2 ), the SSCRC shows consistent coloration in a wide-angle ranging up to 70°. In addition, the spatial segmentation introduced in the colored radiative cooler coordinates the relationship between solar absorption and vivid coloration. We perform the systematic designs in terms of spectrum, thermal analyses, and color coordinates. Finally, experimental demonstrations confirm the theoretical results on the coloration/cooling performance of SSCRC during the daytime.
ieee_keywords: ['Cooling', 'Reflectivity', 'Image color analysis', 'Optical resonators', 'Temperature measurement', 'Scanning electron microscopy', 'Reflection coefficient']

abstracts: Continuous-wave (CW) broadband in the C- and L-band wavelength regions is demonstrated by introducing a highly nonlinear fiber (HNLF) in an erbium-doped fiber ring laser (EDFRL). A broadband spectrum of ~ 39 nm in the L-band and ~ 21 nm in the C-band were obtained at pump powers as low as ~ 200 mW with appropriate optimizations. Demultiplexed output from the broadband generated in the C-band region is tested for wavelength and power stability for consideration as a suitable source for various applications. The wavelength and power fluctuations have been observed to be at most ~ 0.02 nm and ~ 0.3 dBm, respectively.
ieee_keywords: ['Laser stability', 'Erbium-doped fiber lasers', 'Ring lasers', 'Optical fiber testing', 'Fiber nonlinear optics', 'Optical noise', 'Biomedical optical imaging', 'Optical filters', 'Optical interferometry', 'Optical pumping']

abstracts: We proposed a stacked encapsulation structure for DQDA to improve the lifetime and keep the optical performance stable for LCD backlight applications. This encapsulation structure provides an effective solution for discretely distributed QD devices. This method also has potential to widely used for discrete structures in other device applications due to its easy fabrication process, high reliability, and low manufacturing costs.
ieee_keywords: ['Encapsulation', 'Calcium', 'Moisture', 'Glass', 'Corrosion', 'Quantum dots', 'Slurries']

abstracts: One-dimensional photonic crystal coupled resonator optical waveguide (1-D PC-CROW) based on mode-gap confinement has a possibility to reduce leakage losses compared with conventional 1-D PC-CROW constructed by placing defects periodically. However, transmission characteristics of 1-D PC-CROW based on mode-gap confinement have not been investigated so far. In this paper, we evaluate structural dependence of group velocity and leakage losses of 1-D PC-CROW by using the 3-D vector finite element method for periodic waveguide analysis. We show that such 1-D PC-CROW can realize small group velocity and low leakage losses simultaneously by investigating dispersion relationships of 1-D PC-CROW.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Optical resonators', 'Optical losses', 'Delay', 'Photonic crystals', 'Dispersion']

abstracts: This study reveals the effect of nanoscale ITO transmission gratings on light emission from the top, sides, and bottom of a GaN light-emitting diode (LED), based on the substrate standing wave analysis. First, we show that sapphire substrate thickness affects the standing wave pattern in the LED and find the best- and worst-case sapphire thicknesses. Second, we find that adding nanoscale ITO transmission gratings can improve light extraction by 222% or 253%, depending on the reference chosen. Third, we observe that maximizing top light emission with the nano-grating can significantly reduce bottom and side light emissions. Finally, we study grating performance over different wavelengths and generate the LED spectrum.
ieee_keywords: ['Light emitting diodes', 'Indium tin oxide', 'Gratings', 'Gallium nitride', 'Substrates', 'Finite difference methods', 'Time-domain analysis']

abstracts: 1.This paper creatively proposes the study of the connectivity of moving ultraviolet nodes in an arbitrary polygon area. 2.This paper studies the effect of different transceiver elevation angles on connectivity in non-line-of-sight communication mode. 3.The physical parameters studied in this model are comprehensive, including node density, transmission rate, and transmit power. 4.We compare the connectivity in an arbitrary polygonal area with a circular area and analyze the results.
ieee_keywords: ['Transceivers', 'Optical losses', 'Ad hoc networks', 'Analytical models', 'Communication networks', 'Mathematical model', 'Solid modeling']

abstracts: We show that the saturation characteristic of microwave-photonic gain is “super-homogeneous” such that the gain of a weaker tone saturates more rapidly than that of a stronger tone when both signals are transmitted over an intensity-modulated optical link. Using this gain model, we simulate the effect of nonlinear gain saturation on the performance of a slab-coupled optical waveguide (SCOW)-based optoelectronic oscillator (OEO). We verify our simulations with experimental measurements and show that low sidemode levels (<; -110 dBc) can be achieved even when multiple modes can oscillate within the passband of the OEO loop filter.
ieee_keywords: ['Modulation', 'Microwave filters', 'Optical filters', 'Microwave oscillators', 'Radio frequency', 'Photodiodes', 'Gain']

abstracts: MMF coupled SNSPD often suffers from large DCR of several kHz, which significantly degrades signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) of the receiving system. Herein, by introducing a cryogenic MMF filter bench with narrow passband (1550 +/- 12.5 nm), wide blocking range (500-6000 nm), and low insertion loss (<1 dB), an MMF coupled SNSPD with 50%-in-diameter active area demonstrated an SDE of 51% at DCR of 100 Hz and wavelength of 1550 nm. The SNR was improved by about 160 times.

A near eye display optical system based on novel surface micro reflector array optical waveguide is proposed to improve the image quality and eliminate ghost image to improve the image quality. The whole optical system is simple in structure, easy to implement, high in precision and low in cost. At the same time, the micro reflector array is arranged on the surface of optical flat waveguide, which has high structural strength and significantly improves the using safety of human eye.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical waveguides', 'Optical imaging', 'Optical surface waves', 'Surface waves', 'Optical polarization', 'Geometrical optics', 'Augmented reality']

abstracts: Surface plasmon polaritons (SPPs) originate from resonance coupling between surface-bound electrons and photons on interfaces with specific material properties. Unfortunately, owing to the existence of SPPs on an interface, its reach is plagued by intrinsic dissipative losses in the materials making up the interface, severely restricting the application domain. One way to reduce the propagation losses is to use distributed electrical injection across the interface to create a population inversion to provide energy to the decaying SPP wave. A promising technique is to use a Schottky junction formed between a semiconductor and a metal because such an interface can sustain a population inversion under electrical injection. We previously analyzed the plasmonic dispersion relation for such a device when biased. Here, we extend that analysis to consider the influence of the inversion layer when minority carriers are injected from an external electrical source. In particular, we derive analytical expressions for the loss reduction and associated gain spectrum broadening, taking into account the doping concentration in the semiconductor and the externally applied voltage across the junction. Our analysis gives vital information for the design and utilization of Schottky junction interfaces as active waveguides for routing SPPs in integrated circuitry.
ieee_keywords: ['Plasmons', 'Junctions', 'Stimulated emission', 'Electric potential', 'Electric fields', 'Metals']

abstracts: we report our numerical investigation on the photoionization of hydrogen by two orthogonally elliptically polarized and time delayed attosecond pulses, we found that the momentum distributions exhibit helical structure. The spectral patterns were obtained by making use of the strong field approximation theory, and analyzed in terms of the irregularity of the overlapped fields.
ieee_keywords: ['Ionization', 'Hydrogen', 'Delay effects', 'Atomic beams', 'Spirals', 'Electric fields', 'Laser theory']
author_keywords: ['Helical structure', 'orthogonal elliptically polarized', 'strong field approximation theory.']

abstracts: We demonstrated bi-directional and symmetrical emission of transparent OLED by using an ultra-thin (~6 nm) Ag electrode on both top and bottom electrodes. The pretreatment of the surface of glass by O2 plasma before deposition of the Ag layer was effective to get continuous Ag film, leading to a high transmittance (85.6 %) and a low sheet resistance (9.3). The design of a micro-cavity structure with the Ag electrodes reduced waveguide modes and increased out-coupling of light from TOLED.
ieee_keywords: ['Glass', 'Plasmas', 'Substrates', 'Electrodes', 'Indium tin oxide', 'Resistance', 'Plasma measurements']

abstracts: A phase-shifted fiber Bragg grating (PS-FBG) with a taper induced by femtosecond laser micromachining is presented. The degree of phase shift produced by this device can be adjusted by introducing axial strain, with a sensitivity of 4.59 pm/μe. An equivalent model for the taper is developed to theoretically study the taper strain response, These calculated results are in excellent agreement with experiment.
ieee_keywords: ['Strain', 'Optical fiber sensors', 'Sensitivity', 'Fiber gratings', 'Ultrafast optics']

abstracts: The main contribution and novelty of this paper is to address the depolarization effect in a polarization optical time-domain reflectometry (POTDR) system and demonstrate the importance of the degree of polarization (DOP) for achieving sufficient system dynamic range, which is not comprehensively studied in literature. A temporal depolarization suppressed POTDR system is proposed by introducing quasi-distributed Fresnel reflections.
ieee_keywords: ['Optical fiber sensors', 'Optical fiber polarization', 'Optical pulses', 'Optical polarization']
author_keywords: ['polarization optical time domain reflectometry', 'optical fiber sensor', 'temporal depolarization']

abstracts: Obtaining and manipulating ultrashort pulses (down to single cycle) at different frequencies is a goal of future optical technology. It has been theoretically proposed recently that solitons can be shortened by allowing copropagation with weak radiation of different frequencies. However, in experimental setups, the presence of chirp is unavoidable. In this paper, we study the influence of the chirp in the input pulse to the compression behavior in the extreme single-cycle regime.
ieee_keywords: ['Dispersion', 'Chirp', 'Nonlinear optics', 'Optical solitons', 'Optical pulse compression', 'Ultrafast optics']

abstracts: We compare the irradiation effects of Nd:GdVO4 crystal irradiated by different kind of ions with similar displacement per atom and different fluences with same kind of ion. The fabricated waveguide structures, as promising candidate for integrated optical devices, have superior application prospect in multimedia and internet. Therefore, a reasonable choice of the irradiation ion, energy and fluence can effectively achieve changes in the related optical properties for the Nd:GdVO4 crystal.
ieee_keywords: ['Ions', 'Radiation effects', 'Crystals', 'Optical waveguides', 'Lattices', 'Optical refraction', 'Particle beam optics']

abstracts: In the research of FOFDM, training sequences is OFDM signal, and using it to synchronize FOFDM and estimate channel response. Due to the different characteristics of OFDM and FOFDM, the technology applied in the OFDM may not be suitable in the FOFDM. we employ interpolation technology, and these technologies such as training sequence, which is OFDM signal applied in OFDM system as synchronization and channel estimation, can be also used in FOFDM.
ieee_keywords: ['OFDM', 'Training', 'Synchronization', 'Channel estimation', 'Passive optical networks', 'Adaptive optics', 'Discrete cosine transforms']
author_keywords: ['Discrete cosine transform (DCT)', 'fast orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (FOFDM)', 'intensity modulation and direct detection (IMDD)', 'training sequence', 'interpolation']

abstracts: Blue viologen-based electrochromic devices on glass substrates were constructed with different internal active layer thickness by means of a thermoplastic spacer (DuPontTM surlyn1702). Optical measurements, chronoamperometry, and cyclic voltammetry (CV) were the techniques used for characterization. Coloration properties such as switching times for coloring and bleaching processes, coloration efficiency, and effective charge density, previously studied for a single device, are now obtained for several devices with different thicknesses. Dependence on thickness in the response times and in voltage-dependent parameters of device equivalent electric circuit model was studied in previous works. In this paper, some of those parameters, such as Warburg diffusion, double-layer capacitance, and charge transfer resistance, obtained with electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, are related with the coloration properties and their dependence on the thickness obtained by the aforementioned chronoamperometric and CV characterization.
ieee_keywords: ['Color', 'Glass', 'Optical variables measurement', 'Voltage measurement', 'Current measurement', 'Wavelength measurement']

abstracts: In this work, we proposed a 3-D adaptive loading algorithm (ALA) for DDO-OFDM, which can allocate modulation formats, power levels, and FEC codes for each subcarrier to fully utilize the channel capacity under the non-ideal channel state. Compared with traditional ALA, the proposed ALA introduces a new degree of freedom, FEC code. Meanwhile, the look-up table operations are introduced to ensure low complexity and rapid allocation without performance degradation.
ieee_keywords: ['Signal to noise ratio', 'Modulation', 'Forward error correction', 'Loading', 'Resource management', 'OFDM', 'Optical fibers']
author_keywords: ['Adaptive loading algorithm (ALA)', 'adaptive modulation and coding (AMC)', 'optical orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (O-OFDM)']

abstracts: A new electronic system to realize time reversal (TR) of electromagnetic waves is proposed in this paper. By utilizing the dispersion compensation approach, the system mainly contains a chirped pulse generator, a wideband multiplier, and a chirped delay line (CDL). The TR transformation is achieved by dispersing the modulated chirped pulse through a single microwave CDL. The chirped electromagnetic band gap structure with a reflected group delay slope is fabricated and used to be the CDL. It has been demonstrated by experiments that TR of triangular-wave signals in the microwave regime can be obtained through the proposed system.
ieee_keywords: ['Chirp', 'Microwave photonics', 'Microwave communication', 'Electromagnetic scattering', 'Optical pulses', 'Dispersion']

abstracts: The time-domain surface impedance for a plane-wave incidence on a half-space with conductive and plasmonic properties is theoretically investigated. This paper provides closed-form time-domain expressions of time-domain surface impedance values that can be readily evaluated numerically within any prescribed accuracy. Based on the surface impedance concept, time-domain responses of conductive and plasmonic half-spaces are analyzed and discussed. In this respect, changes in incident pulse shapes upon transmission and reflection against plasmonic boundaries are predicted. Numerical results for practically used metallic materials are presented.
ieee_keywords: ['Time domain analysis', 'Plasmons', 'Surface impedance', 'Optical surface waves', 'Impedance', 'Dispersion', 'Materials']

abstracts: Duo-binary is the most promising modulation in NG-EPON with 25Gb/s per channel. But the timing algorithm for Duo-binary has not been further studied. This paper amend several traditional non-linear function based timing algorithms to apply Duo-binary. Results show that absolute-law timing has minimum jitter and lowest complexity, and achieving a receiver sensitivity of -25.6dBm with MLSE. The impact of non-ideal bandwidth of commercial 10G optics on timing jitter have also been investigated.
ieee_keywords: ['Bandwidth', 'Timing', 'Optical filters', 'Optical receivers', 'Optical sensors', 'Timing jitter']

abstracts: We have supplied an impact statement earlier.
